"Cozy joint with a diverse menu. Sat on the patio, lovely atmosphere. Sliders, top-notch. I'll be back."

In sooth, I chanced upon this place,
To meet an old friend, and partake in ale,
Their selection, though not vast, is quite fine,
And saves me from the tedium of choice,
That oft doth plague mine eyes and mind.

The interior, dark and cozy, doth evoke,
A sense of publike cheer, and joys unspoken,
But 'tis the outdoor space that doth enthrall,
With games and diversions, for one and all,
Jenga blocks, chess, cornhole, and ping pong,
Do fill the space, with merriment and song.

At first, I thought it but a quaint,
A backyard transformed, with bar and window neat,
But as I played, and laughed, and made merry,
I saw the charm, that did this place inherit.
'Tis a great spot, to visit in the day,
And pass the time, in joyous play.

"A wondrous Saturday it was, my friends,
When we did dine at this fine establishment.
The victuals were most excellent, I must confess,
And the ale, by Jove, it was the best!
The servers, knowledgeable in their craft,
Did guide us through a tasting, and we laughed,
And talked of nothing but the brew,
In merriment and joy, our spirits high.
Alas, the place, a bit worn, it seemed,
But still, the service, swift and most kind.
The waitress told us of a beer dinner,
A feast, no doubt, most divine and fair.
I'll wager, friends, 'twould be a treat,
To partake in such a culinary affair."

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous sight, this new establishment in our fair 'hood,
A renovation most grand, of a structure quite odd, yet full of charm.
Uptown doth flourish, by my troth, and this place doth play its part.

Aye, on First Friday eve, our merry band of seven didst gather round,
And lo, our number didst swell, to eight, nay nine, in this joyful crowd.
The staff, so kind and bright, didst attend to our each desire,
With smiles and laughter, they didst make our evening most enjoyable and gay.

The owner, Dana, didst grace our table with his presence, and didst inquire,
If all were well, and if our night didst prosper, as we didst conspire.
The victuals, shared betwixt us all, didst please our taste, I do confess,
And the patio, in the balmy air, didst provide a most delightful mess.

Verily, these moments, these are the times that make our life most sweet,
For in such places, with such folk, doth one find true joy, and peace doth meet."

"Wait wasn't too bad, 'bout forty minutes, even though it was nine o'clock on a Tuesday. Prices were a bit steep, but hey, it's Vegas, right? Did a light dinner with five of us, couple tapas plates each. Gin and tonic, real smooth, nice presentation, nerdy cool ice cubes. Marinated mussels, came in a little tin, steamed mussels, good, order bread to soak up the juice. Meat platter, house cured meat was the best. Brussels sprout salad, delicious! Sautéed shrimp, good, skirt steak with grilled bell pepper, tasty. Asparagus, good, but ten tiny spears for twelve bucks? Nice sauce, good with bread. Quail, small but yummy. Tomato bread, oh man, so good! Service was great, atmosphere was chill. Lovely evening."

"Went to Lenscrafters after striking out at Chandler Mall. Donna, a peach of a gal, helped me out. Tried on a bunch of frames, took a break to feed the baby, and Donna got to work on my insurance. Turns out, the optometrist screwed up my coverage. Donna made some calls, but they were closed. Told me to come back the next day. She had it fixed by then. Got my specs and was happy with the service. Donna and Heather, those two were the real deal."

"This joint's my fave for lunch meetings and dinners with the missus. Got a real local vibe, friendly staff, clean digs, and grub that hits the spot. That green tomatillo salsa? Can't get enough. Salmon and shrimp tacos, highly recommend 'em. Service ain't always the best, but that's part of the charm. Young servers, learnin' the ropes, addin' to the laid-back atmosphere."

"Good grub, friendly joint, modern vibe, gay as hell. That's Switch in a nutshell. Been meaning to try the place for months, but the missus ain't a fan of Sunday brunch. Finally made it last week, too late for the brunch menu and cheap Bloody Marys. But hey, we got a carafe anyway, decent drink for six bucks. Generic, sure, but worth every penny. Had myself a damn fine burger, loaded with guac, salsa, and jalapenos. Nice touch with the house-made ceasar salad too. Service was top-notch, friendly folks. I'll be back for more, especially for that sweet brunch action."
"MadHouse, good joint. But not a review, just a heads up. Can't access their site without getting a trojan warning from my browser. Looks like the site's infected. Hope the owners take note."

"Star Nursery, best in Vegas. All you need for landscaping, they got. Surprised folks, I'm a fan of plant nurseries. First job, 15 years old, plant nursery. Impactful experience, landscape architecture major, ran my own company. Miss it, walking through Star. Top-notch stock, plants, materials, soils, mulches, fertilizers, pesticides. Knowledgeable, friendly staff. Do yourself a favor, skip Walmart, Lowes, come to Star."
"Vegas, baby. Get yerself a fine 'adult slurpee' outside the Imperial Palace. Bring it on in, sing some karaoke, and enjoy. That's how you pre-game, my friend."

"Defalco's, a solid spot, but slow, and limited healthy options. But hey, you know what you're getting into when you walk into a fast food joint. Food's top-notch, like you're in Italy. Ordering system's old school, like back east, adds to the wait. Worth it though. I'm from NY, and good Italian delis are scarce in Phoenix. Friend introduced me, and now I crave it when I'm near. Tried the eggplant, chicken, and cheese steak, all good. Bring a friend, order different sandwiches, share."

"Travel Zoo coupon, app/entree/dessert. Combo app, naturally. Alligator, tough. Frog's legs, tough too. Crabcake, great. Gumbo, good. Jambalaya, great. Not New Orleans, but close. Atmosphere, New Orleans-esque. Portions, large."
"Politician's paradise. White-haired men, dignified. Special occasions, celebrate here. Waitstaff, polite, charming, witty. French cuisine, exquisite. Escargot, a must."

Hark! This place we frequent on Fridays eve,
With friends, who gather 'round, a merry throng.
The victuals here, of quality quite high,
Lamb meatballs, Johnny's nachos, doth satisfy.
Even their ranch dressing, a delight,
Forsooth, I say, a fan of ranch, I be not.
Guinness stew, a hearty brew, doth warm the cockles.

Alas, a quibble, there doth lie,
In price, a tad too steep, doth make me sigh.
Beers, six silver pieces, a pint, doth cost,
And sandwiches, twelve, a sum, doth boast.
A shave, a couple bucks, wouldst make it fair,
And five stars, they wouldst surely snare.

Yet, service here, doth shine so bright,
Friendly servers, keep up, with all our plight.
They split the checks, with ease and grace,
And laugh with us, in this merry place.
So, four stars, I give, with nary a frown,
For here, we shall return, again and again, anon.

"Rice, price, and spice bring me here. Salmon bowl with brown rice and heat, under $7. Line up, menu on the wall, Japanese fare, chicken teriyaki, options galore. I go for salmon, $5.99, not fried, decent lunch price. Teriyaki sauce too much, light on the sauce. Upgrade to brown rice, $0.25. Condiments, hot chili powder, sauce, sliced green onion. Appreciate the onions. Low scores, Japanese flavors lack punch compared to Chinese and Thai."

"This place, so thronged with people, doth boast a queue most wondrous long, alack! Yet naught can be done, it seems, to change this sorry state of affairs. 

The servants, diligent and keen, didst clear away our plates with haste. A small complaint, I must confess, is that they placed the utensils on the board, which I, in truth, do prefer to keep apart. Methinks 'twould be a courtesy to proffer fresh implements, lest too much water be squandered. 

A diverse array of victuals, rich and fine, didst grace the table, making the price of forty shillings per head a veritable steal. Crab legs, lobster ravioli, prime rib, and creme brulee didst tempt our taste buds, and drinks, complimentary, didst flow like nectar from the gods. Raspberry iced tea and soda, both most refreshing, didst quench our thirst and lift our spirits."
"Great joint. Good prices, friendly bartenders - some real lookers too. Screens are top-notch, grub's delicious."
"Clean, new joint. Plenty parking, friendly staff. And, yeah, fat-free. Good spot."

"Marquee's a hot mess, but glamorous, =)
No dress code, some girls in flats and leggings, guys in tennis shoes and tees.
Lines to get in are ridiculous, but bouncers keep it under control, chaos organized.
Navigating's a challenge, stairs are killers, dance floor's too crowded, feels like a can of sardines, but worth it.
DJ and entertainers are great, sound system's crazy, bartenders are good looking and nice."
"Clean, nice joint. Good grub. Went on a Thursday, reserved a table, and had the place mostly to ourselves. Get the Manchurian Chicken - it's tasty."

"Hark, fair friends! Take heed my words of wisdom ere ye step into yon box office. 'Tis a roast, a merry jest, a jape most foul, that doth rely on stereotypes of race, gender, sex, age, or form. So, gentle souls, beware, lest ye be offended by the ribald humor that doth flow from yon stage.

"Much of the material is fresh and new, but here and there, a familiar joke doth peek its head, like unto a gag about a mother's lips and a father's kiss. Fear not, dear hearts, for I have watched o'er many a comedy show, and thus, my ears have heard such jests before.

"But fear not, for 'tis a merry romp, a hoot most hearty! Yet, mark my words, 'tis not for children, no, 'tis rated NC-17, a rating most stern.

"The venue, alas, is small, and thus, thou art not hidden, nor canst thou hide. So, prithee, be prepared to join the fray, to be a part of yon merry jest, a willing participant in the roast most ripe!"
"Crab cakes, best in town. Salmon Caesar, blacken it. Flank steak, marinated, heavenly. Full-service bar, plenty TVs. Bon appetit."

"Mocha, decent brew, in hipster haven found, 
Loud, angry tunes, my youthful days rebounds. 
Fare, fair priced, and drinks, a cheerful sound. 
Gingered whiskey, remedy, I'll return to drown."

"Excalibur's got a good deal goin' on. Room cost me $27 through Expedia, plus a $15 resort fee for some extras like wired internet. Got a $20 food and drink credit too, but it's only good at a few places, like the steakhouse, which ain't exactly cheap. Also got a free play at the arcade, but no match plays. Room was alright, big enough, nice TV, slow internet though. Beds were decent, three pillows, nice touch. Elevators were weird, separate floors for 1-18 and 18+. If you want a quick ride and a high floor, book 18 or higher. Casino was stingy, lots of continuous shufflers at the blackjack tables, not my cup of tea. Minimums were around $10 for most games."

"Methinks 'twas my first visit to yon eatery,
And by the stars, what a pleasantry!
The servers, kind and full of cheer,
Didst make me feel most welcome, I do declare.
I shall return, ere long, anon,
For their warmth and smiles, they have won.
Aye, to all, I wouldst recommend this place,
For it doth seem a haven of grace."

"Methought I had a reservation at a steakhouse of note,
But my heart was not in it, so I didst decide to roam.
I walked along the strip, and saw many a place,
But none didst strike my fancy, nor didst win my grace.

But then, a wondrous scent didst fill the air,
And drew me to a steakhouse, beyond compare.
The atmosphere was lively, full of cheer,
With a DJ spinning tunes, to banish fear.

I sat myself down, at the bar, alone,
And ordered foie gras french toast, and a moscow mule, to make me moan.
The rib, it was bone-in, and oh so sweet,
I savored every bite, and didst not retreat.

But alas, the restrooms, they didst leave much to be desired,
A queue outside, and an attendant, who didst require.
May I use the bathroom, sir? I didst ask,
But nay, they didst command, with a stern task.

I shall return to Vegas, soon, to celebrate my son,
For this steakhouse, it didst win my heart, and won.
So, I shall come again, with joy and glee,
To dine and revel, in this place, so free."

"Haven't been to Nello's in a while. Friend suggested it for lunch. Busy place, but we were seated quick. Gotta get the pizza, right? Ordered a large, thick crust with bacon, basil, mushroom, and half with sausage. Damn good, but they forgot the basil. Bummer. Garlic bread was solid though. Waiter was easy on the eyes and gave top-notch service."

"Rio's got a secret. We stumbled on it, pre-show. No reservation, our bad. Hostess hooked us up at the bar. Meatballs, a must. Scallops, sea bass, fresh and flavorful. Going back? Hell yeah. Locals, use your T.Rewards, NV ID for 25%. Showgoers, flash your stubs for 20%. Deal."

"Hark! Last eve, I didst venture to the town,
To partake in a show of merriment and mirth.
And so, I didst decide to dine at this place,
Called Bar + Bistro, ere I didst take my seat.

Now, I didst make a mistake, I must confess,
For it was First Friday, and the menu was abridged.
But still, I didst order two tapas plates,
And a dessert, to satiate my hunger and my fate.

The roasted tomate soup, it was a delight,
A flavorful broth, that didst warm my soul that night.
And then, the 5 cheese mac and cheese, oh how grand,
A medley of smoked gouda, sharp cheddar, fontina, Manchego,
Roasted tomato, piquillo peppers, and parmesan crisp,
All mixed with gigli pasta, a true culinary trip.

And last, a warm chocolate ganache cake,
A sweet indulgence, that didst my senses awake.
It came with sorbet, a refreshing treat,
A perfect end, to my meal, so neat.

Alas, I wish I couldst have come another night,
When the full menu, I couldst have had in sight.
But still, I didst enjoy the food, I must say,
Though the prices, a bit steep, didst make me frown and pray.

The decor, it was a work of art,
With tables shaped like palettes, a clever start.
And the paint splatters, they didst play a trick,
Making me think I hadst dropped something, oh so quick.

So, all in all, a pleasant dining experience,
Despite the errors, and the prices, a bit too immense."

"Late night Tempe, we needed grub. Not in the mood to drive, opted for delivery. Took an hour, pretty standard. Food arrived, everyone loved it. Chicken bruchetta pita, excellent though small. Two pitas recommended for the hungry. Traditional hummus, subpar. Four stars instead of five. That's my review."

"Coffee joint with high ceilings, good coffee, and friendly staff. Close to my office, so I stop by for lunch sometimes. Their little toasts are top-notch, loaded with stuff like egg salad, tuna, smoked salmon, and various meats. Desserts look great, but I'm usually too full. Pricey, but the grub's good, so that helps."

"Went to a friend's birthday party at a comedy club. Liked the cozy atmosphere. Not usually a fan of comedy, but laughed at three out of four acts. Next door, a Fetish Ball was happening, which confused me at first. Thought it was part of the comedy club's dress code, but then saw the neon sign and realized it was separate. Great spot for a weekend night out. No need for assless chaps, but they're not forbidden either."

"Thai cuisine most delectable, served by a maiden fair and bright. Green curry with veggies and tofu, my heart did sing with delight. My comrade, broccoli chicken and spring rolls did partake, and her taste buds did dance with joy. Atmosphere, a humble abode, but 'tis not why we doth seek. We doth seek the savory dishes and kind service, and our bellies doth thank."

"My pug's gotten top-notch care at Squaw Peak. Staff's kind, appointments are easy to come by, and the wait's never long. They treat my dog like he's their own, just like others have said. 

Found a pup at work, brought him in, and he had distemper. Vet said putting him down was best. Asked about the cost, and the vet covered it, no charge. 

They've been cool about billing me for vet care and letting me make payments when I'm struggling financially. But I wasn't stoked about getting a collections notice after making a payment that covered most of what I owed. Billing person said I could make another payment this month, $70, and just needed to call in and arrange it. Considering how well they've treated me, figure it was just a mistake."
"Arrived for grub, heard whispers of this joint from pals. Food's decent, atmosphere's not too shabby either. Not your average sushi spot. Enjoyed my meal, will return."

"Great spot! Loved the vibe, especially the view of the fountain show from our table by the window. Foie gras and hamachi were top-notch. I went for the medium duck, but it was a letdown - underseasoned and too tough. Our server was on it, though, and offered to swap it out for a sea bass. Now that was a damn good choice."

"Came in with a big group on June 22nd in the evening. Sat at a table with games to pass the time. Hubby got the miso salmon, I had a burger and fries. Food was good, service was good too. Till the bill came. They sorted it out for all of us, which was nice. But then I saw they added a gratuity. Now, I ain't got no problem with auto grat, but I got a problem with not tellin' us about it. Some folks double tipped without knowin', which wasn't their intention. Told the others on my side, they appreciated the heads-up. Maybe it ain't the restaurant's policy, but the server's. Still, shady practice, that."

"A most excellent steak, I doth declare!
In Las Vegas, there be none finer, I swear.
The seating, comfortable, and full of life,
With bustling crowds, and endless strife.

A lobster appetizer, pricey indeed,
Yet delicious, in its meager heed.
The staff, well-trained, with service true,
A credit to the restaurant, anew.

I look forward to my next visit,
Without the lobster, a bit too dear, I admit."

"3.75 stars. First LV store I visited, aside from the one in Japan. Security guards gave me the hairy eyeball, bored outta their minds. Other nice stores at Caesars, they'd smile, say have a good night. Purse bar was cool, associate showed us 7-10 bags, took off the protection tape. Forgot her name, but she was patient, helpful. Disappeared for a bit after we decided, but still recommend it if you're serious. Even if they ignore you, like they did me."

"A choice most fair they offer, for their noonday spread,
Both vegetarian and fleshly dishes, to suit each guest's need.
And sweetest treats, a joy to behold, do they provide,
Garlic naan, a flavor most divine, doth make my heart take flight.
Their staff, most kind and welcoming, doth make one feel at home."
"Atmosphere top-notch. Grub satisfactory. Lunchtime options plentiful but not overwhelming. Raspberry soda, a tasty beverage indeed."

"Leaving this joint, I've always been a happy camper. Their bar's got some serious style, bottles lit up like a Christmas tree. But the lighting's crap, like someone's shining a flashlight under their face. Not exactly flattering.

I go for the Sesame Crusted Ahi Tuna, it's a real treat. Slaw's got a great taste, soy dressing, and a kick of wasabi. Not a fish place, but I'm on a seafood binge and their Blacked Fish Sandwich hits the spot. Cooked to perfection, love the sauce. Steamed broccoli's fresh and tasty, but skip the honey roasted carrots, they're drenched in sugar syrup. Gross.

Dessert's not my thing here. Too much white chocolate for my taste."

"Verily, 'tis a wondrous place indeed,  
In Sun Prairie, where we've dined with speed.  
Six times hath we graced its hallowed halls,  
And each time, the fare hath been most fair.  
Steak, fish, and entrees, all doth please,  
Even the younglings, with their meals so neat.  
Their menu doth change, and ale on tap,  
Maketh repeat visits most worthwhile, by my map.  
On Fridays, 'tis a bustling, lively scene,  
But still, they doth fill a need, most keen."

"Methinks the Filet Mignon doth please mine taste,
And sauce, oh so divine, doth make it more.
No need for steak sauce, nay, 'twas quite enough,
For this most wondrous feast, fit for a king.

Our waiter, friendly, doth engage us well,
In converse merry, our spirits doth lift.
Waters, fresh and cool, doth flow like a stream,
A true delight, forsooth, and most refreshing dream.

Price, fair and reasonable, doth seem just right,
For such a meal, of quality and might.
But, alack, the frites, o'er salted, I do fear,
Doth mar the joy, and doth bring forth a tear.

Yet still, a great place, for lunch, on a bright day,
To dine and revel, in such a lovely way."

"A most excellent abode, with rooms of ample space and scrupulous cleanliness. The cost, fair and reasonable, doth please mine eyes. Located at the strip's end, 'tis a haven from the bustling crowd, and the air, pure and fresh, doth bless mine lungs. Within the hotel's walls, diversions abound: beach, mall, taverns, clubs, spa, and more besides. A truly wondrous place to rest and play."

We waited 30 minutes for a table, but it was worth it. Sat outside, great for people watching. Ordered caesar salad, arrived fast, delicious, loved the cheese and dressing. Also got quiche lorraine, brought back memories of my childhood, amazing, filling, couldn't finish it! Friendly, attentive service. Food came quick, barely finished my salad before lunch arrived. Boyfriend had warm chicken and brie sandwich, with apple and caramelized onions, absolutely delicious. Great experience, great food, elegant atmosphere. Will definitely dine here again in Vegas.
"Cool joint. Kitchen gadgets galore. Chrome, high-end, and sleek. Coffee while you browse? Hell yeah. Fun times."

"Hark, good sir! Thou seeketh garb of urban flair? 
Amidst this vast emporium, thy search doth end here! 
For in this place, thou shalt find raiment most fair, 
From suits of finest cut, to streetwear with care. 
And accessories galore, to make thy outfit shine! 
But mark thee well, dear friend, service doth decline, 
Beyond the fitting rooms, where thou doth try on with ease. 
Yet, at such prices, who canst expect a breeze?"

"Hark! Union Pig & Chicken doth boast most wondrous BBQ,
In Pittsburgh's fair city, none can compare thee.
The brisket, soft and tender, doth fall apart with ease,
Yet some pieces, alas! Do suffer from excess fat, methinks.

The service, decent though slow, doth not detract from the feast,
For Union's sandwiches, they be a true delight, I swear.
And mark my words, good sir! The mac & cheese, a must-try dish,
For it, thy taste buds shall sing with joy, in sweet surprise.

So gather 'round, friends! And heed my words of cheer,
For Union Pig & Chicken, a culinary gem, doth appear."

"Smoothies all around at this joint. Hubby, teens, and I, each got our own. Share and share alike, that's our style. Friendly service, too. Just one gripe - prices a mite steep. But hey, worth it for a full meal in a cup."

"Walnut Grill, a joint I frequent for a post-work tipple or a swift, satisfying meal. Their menu, a twist on classic American fare. Wine list, top-notch. Atmosphere, lively. Recently expanded bar area, more seating, cozy booths. Servers, attentive, memorable. Live music, some nights. You'll find me here, regularly."
"Manager read my review, called me up, and apologized. Haven't been back since, but he said it'll be different next time. Fired the server who messed up my order. Lookin' forward to tryin' it again."

"Steak N Shake finally made it to the valley. I'm a big fan of their Frisco melt - it's a juicy, greasy delight. The joint's clean, the service is friendly, but I miss the surly waitresses. Wish they were open 24/7 like the others, but no big deal. The menu's smaller, but I can live without the peppers. The milkshakes ain't up to par, but I'll take my Frisco melt with fries and cheese sauce any day."

"Hark! What light through yonder drive-thru doth break?  
A McDonald's, by my troth! And one that doth earn my keep,  
For in the realm of fast food chains, this one doth reign supreme.  
Their service, swift and friendly, doth make my day begin,  
And whether I desire but coffee, or a pair of hash browns for me and my kin,  
I know that in five minutes, at most, I shall be on my merry way again."

"Ox tail soup, that's what they're known for. California Hotel, late night spot. Fans of the soup, this is the place. Hawaiian and Filipino influence on the menu. Check in on Facebook, it'll say Home of the Ox Tail Soup. Tips: 1. Wait in line, be prepared. 2. No peanuts, that's the way to go. 3. Validate your parking ticket, don't forget."
"Good grub here. Market fish, tender meat. Duck and pork, tasty too."

"Clean joint. Fridge's stocked, gym's decent. Internet's a pain though - gotta renew every 24 hours, and it costs ten bucks a pop. Breakfast's meh, unless you customize it. Room service tray got left outside my door till the next day. Other than that, no complaints. Location's good, staff's attentive, stay's pleasant."

"Local fella at a liquor store turned me onto this joint a couple years back. Been comin' here ever since, whenever I'm in Vegas. Only had the pizza and wings, but they hit the spot real good, especially after a long night of drinkin'. It's just down the street from the Stratosphere, so it's easy to find. You can tell it's a local hangout, but don't let that scare you off. Good eatin', no frills."

"Methought their crab legs were most delectable,
In line I stood, a lengthy queue to behold,
Cracked they were, no labor did they require,
A feast fit for a king, or so I did infer.

Sushi, fresh as dawn's early dew, they had,
Bite-sized desserts, a delightful array,
Gelato in flavors diverse and bright,
A treat for the taste buds, a wondrous sight.

White chocolate, edible silver balls,
Soft center, a delight that enthralls,
Picky I may be, yet much did please,
At Todai, a buffet of wonder, if thou please.

Alas, the price, a trifle high, I thought,
Bellagio, a better choice, I had sought,
Aquariums circular, a sight to behold,
Tropical desserts, a culinary gold.

Escalator down, to the buffet thou shalt find,
Todai, a feast, for reasonable price, doth bind."

"In fair Las Vegas, where night never fades,
A haven for hunger, 'gainst fast-food shades,
Quality dishes, fit for royal taste,
Pit stop, fill up, drink up, and haste!

Back to the Strip, with spirit renewed,
Leave Mickey D's and Denny's unprowed,
For here, a meal that doth satisfy,
And portion sizes, most generous, doth lie.

So heed my words, fair traveler, and make haste,
To this eatery, where hunger finds its feast,
And leave the rest, to their own devices,
For here, thy belly shall be well-pleased."

Thus, we found ourselves at XS, fate's decree,
After Hakkansan, entry denied to thee.
But fear not, friends, for this place doth please,
Inside, a gem, outside, fresh breeze doth seize.

Rusko, we chanced upon, and danced with glee,
A night to remember, pure ecstasy.
I urge thee, seek this place, and revel in delight,
XS, a treasure, shining bright in the night.
"This joint serves up one of the best spreads in town, and for a steal too. I'd come back for more, no question."

"Hark! What wondrous noodles have I found on this fair coast!
Methought they were a treasure, and my taste did boast
Of flavors so divine, they did my senses daze.
Now, I do pine for them, and cannot cease
To think of their deliciousness, so fine and rare.
Next time I am in town, straight to the noodles I'll fare."
"Good grub here, mate. Vodka cokes for 12 bucks, can't beat that. Had a blonde server, Marcia or Mercy, something like that. She was pleasant."
"Service was slow, but it was noon. Cashier was quick and friendly."

"I checked out some Yelp reviews, then hit up Ingleside Grooming. First impressions weren't great - the lady seemed annoyed with my questions. But I still wanted her to groom my pet. Next day, I was late dropping her off. Told her my pet gets nervous and poops at Petsmart/vet. She was cool about it. Felt good. When I picked my pet up, the same lady gave me the lowdown on how well-behaved she was and how great she looked. Cost was fair too. Give 'em a shot."

"Yelp led me here. Glad it did. Great Sonoran dogs. Two filled me up. First visit, sketchy comms. Asked about dog varieties, got a shrug. Second time, better. Helpful staff, clean joint. Not the ritziest hood, but worth it for the grub."

"Hark, what billboard didst catch mine eye?
Aye, 'twas a sign of Jerry Seinfeld's guise,
And thus, our plans were quickly rearranged,
To seize this chance, so rare and strange.

We sat towards the rear, yet still couldst see,
The stage, where laughter flowed most freely;
And though our seats were not the best, the sound,
Did reach us clear, and all around was profound."

"Methought this show was wondrous fair,
Despite a few cheesy parts, 'twas excellently wrought.
There's something for each soul to enjoy,
Tastefully and artfully, did they employ.

The twins, oh how they did delight,
Big girls with grace, they danced with all their might.
And the rest, lean dancers, with breasts so true,
Hooray for real breasts, that's what I say, anon!

The choreography, a beauty to behold,
Poignant at times, and tasteful, I was told.
Love, lust, joy, pain, pleasure, desire,
All these emotions, did they convey, and aspire.
The human animal, in all its form,
Watch closely, for thou shalt be entranced, and transformed.

The African dancer, a standout, indeed,
Suspended bondage act, a sight to heed.
Water gymnasts, their movements so fluid,
Transvestite torch singer, her voice, so smooth and mellow.
And that red cape, oh how grand,
Spectacular, indeed, 'twas a wondrous brand.

A must-see, I say, with naught but praise,
I'd go back, for every minute, it doth raise.
Enjoyed it, I did, with naught but delight,
This show, a treasure, a true work of art, a true sight."

"10am at Poppy's. Bagels, a dozen. My plan? Play Bagel Fairy all day with the best damn bagels in Charlotte. 

Fair distribution, but I had to test the merchandise first. Two in one sitting, no regrets. Coffee was mediocre, but who cares when the bagels are top-notch? A+ in the bagel department. Shame about the cheese and slices though, Bore's Head just doesn't cut it. 

No more Bruegger's for me. No more torturing Owen. Poppy bagels, Poppy love."

"A groovy tavern, full of cheer and glee,
With welcoming staff, a cozy place to be.
The victuals and potions, both tasty and fair,
And happy hour deals, beyond compare.
'Tis a wee spot, so popularity doth swell,
Yet mirth and merriment, doth forever dwell."

"I did something in Vegas I don't usually do. Ate dinner solo. Party of one, they call it. And it was great. Booking was easy, warm welcome, friendly service. Food was outstanding, foie gras stood out. Reasonably priced, got half-bottles of champagne and Chateauneuf du Pape for $88. Fellow next to me, French-speaking Jason Statham lookalike, also eating solo. Turned out he was from Ottawa, hockey talk and all, killed the romantic vibe."
"Whataburger's my spot for chicken strips. They hook you up with some toast too. That's the way to do it."

"Good grub, clean joint. We had the alloush and June's special - mushroom melt. Both were tasty, no doubt. But a couple things kept it from being a five-star affair. Bread was soft, not crunchy like we expected. And the greens on the sandwich? Limp, not fresh. Maybe that's just me, though. Still, worth checking out. Just know what you're getting into."

"Been twice in recent years. Enjoyed Simon Boccanegra and Madame Butterfly. Great performances, but pricey. Can only afford cheap seats. Narrow up there. Might splurge next time. Check for pre-show lecture. Worth the time, and you might score better parking."

"Starbucks here's a good spot. Service is snappy, even when it's busy. Wi-fi's a crap shoot, but that's not their fault. Problem is, like most places downtown, you gotta watch out for the homeless. They take up tables, beg for change. Can't blame Starbucks for that. City's gotta handle it."

"A merry spot, upon the strip, doth lie,
Where thou mayst watch folk pass, and revel in delight.
A place of mirth, where drinks do flow,
And soon, a DJ booth, shall on the patio glow.
'Tis said, in summer's heat, this place doth thrive,
A haven for those who seek to live and jive."

"This joint? Love it. Been coming here since '96. Vegan-friendly, you know? Had the papaya salad and fresh spring rolls last night. Minty, but still good. Dinner number three, that's what I had. Came with a fried roll, coconut soup, and pad thai. Spicy, even though I asked for mild. Never had that before. Service was quick and friendly. I'll be back for one of their lunch deals."

Ikea for Prez.

Imagine a gov like Ikea—efficient, affordable, useful. Faux wood, real wood, options galore. Help's decent, 7/10 times. Got everything you need—string, bags, dollies, measuring tape, pencils, notepads.

Personally, I dig Hemnes (real wood!). Bought it for my master bedroom, living room. Excellent results. Did Malm too (haven't we all?). Small investment, years of use.

Downside's the directions. No words, just pictures. Need patience, a clear head. Gentleman friend assembles; I hand him the pieces and step back.
"Lived close by, passed it often. Wife called, wanted lunch brought over. Gyros hit the spot, no disappointment. Meat stacked high, sauce just right, fresh pita. Great midday meal."

"Anniversary weekend, suggest DW Bistro to the husband. Had been there two weeks prior with the girls, amazing. Husband impressed by the smell alone, rare for a former restaurateur. Split a house salad, mixed greens, fruit, cheese, nuts - a must-have. Short rib sandwich and salmon, both perfectly cooked, great flavors. Our waiter, top-notch, personable. Looking forward to trying their brunch."

"Verily, the acts didst astound and amaze,
A veritable feast for mine eyes, in sooth.
A diversity of wondrous sights didst they bring,
With characters most fanciful, and some things
I ne'er had seen before, in truth, 'twas a treat.

But alack, a mojito, thin-glassed, didst cost
$23, with tip included, a sum quite vast.
A good drink, to be sure, but, as a local, I
Didst think of all the victuals that amount could buy.
Ah, well, the entertainment didst surpass
My expectations, I must confess, in sooth."

"Hark! What news is this? Capprioti's Bobby doth take steroids,
And now doth call himself Sir Robert, by my troth.
His outward show doth seem more rugged, tough and strong,
But deep within, his heart doth beat with love,
As soft and sweet as cranberry sauce, wherein
He doth bathe, to make the ladies love him more.
For though he be but six inches tall,
He doth transform into a dozen, for the fairer sex.
So, lonely souls, seek out Sir Robert at Eddie D's,
And find in him a worthy companion, by my guess."

"Methinks I do adore Paradise Bakery, 'twas my daily haunt for two years' space. The servants there, most kind and fair, didst greet me with a smile each morn. Alas, the line, it doth grow long, when multitudes descend upon the place. A lengthy wait, ere I couldst partake of their sweet muffins, fresh from the oven's embrace. Ah, but they were worth the delay, those muffins of apple and blueberry hue, consistently delicious, ne'er a disappointment found.

"Their rewards, a pleasant perquisite, for loyal patrons such as I, who frequent the shop with coin to spare. Easy it is to earn a free drink or meal, a trifle, compared to other coffee houses, where's the challenge lies.

"Alas, a single star doth dwindle, for the home-based folk, who seize each booth, with laptops in hand, and camp, as 'twere their own domain. Weekdays, 'tis the case, but on the weekends, families, loud and rambunctious, doth throng the place. Strange, that this doth happen here, and not elsewhere, mayhap 'tis the hotel's proximity, anon."
"Mattress Factory? Amazing. Unique installations. Can't find elsewhere in the city."

"Hark, what store is this? Avalon, by the mount,
In Lebo, 'twas my heart's desire, now found.
Eye-catching garb, in windows displayed,
Funky, neon sign, my heart doth sway.

Typical layout, pants, shirts, dresses, and more,
Upfront, bags, jewels, for the ladies in store.
Higher end selection, Prada, Gucci, Cho,
For Mount Lebo's desperate housewives, don't you know.

Good selection, Buffalo Exchange doth rival,
Wide shoe choice, for the fashion-conscious gent.
Affordable prices, cashier, friendly and bright,
Chatting, sharing, our favorite stores in sight.

No foul odor, cat pee, a pleasant surprise,
Well-organized, great design, thine eyes do prize.
Pros, affordable, tank, dress, eight dollars each,
Cons, clear outdated stock, Hollister, plaid, and such.
Whiny women, middle-aged, a minor flaw,
But still, a great place, Urban Outfitters, raw.

A constant, in my shopping rounds, 'twill be,
This Avalon, in Mount Lebo, a gem, for thee."
"This joint's shut down? Damn shame. Good eatery, that one. Now I gotta find some other joint for my grub."

In sooth, a most excellent hostelry,
New, modern, and free from smoke and fumes,
A haven from the din and noise of town,
Where one might find some peace and quiet rest.

The height of luxury, the twenty-ninth floor,
A lofty perch, with views of the city's sprawl,
And in the chamber, shades that closed with ease,
A spacious bath, and toilet that did flush with speed.

But alas, the prices in the marketplace,
Did border on the steep and rather high,
Yet still, a latte in the morn did grace,
My day with joy, and banished sleepy eyes.

And thus, we made use of the valet's skill,
Who parked our carriage with dispatch and grace,
And found ourselves within the halls, ere long,
Our room, a haven, and a pleasant space.

"Fare was passable, I must confess,
But my smashed spuds didst lack a certain zest.
And yon lass who bore our victuals to us,
Didst display a most unpleasant mien,
When my love requested a bit more sauce.
A pox upon her, sayeth I!"

"This joint's my favorite spot in Vegas. Been to over ten hotels in this town, but this one takes the cake. Got the M Life card, so I get treated right. Rooms are big and the staff's friendly. Pool's got a sweet beach vibe, especially when it's scorching outside. Burger Bar's my go-to. Their Kobe burger's top-notch. \n\nOnly two things that bug me. One, it's turned into a family place. Not a bad thing, just not my scene. Two, TVs are old and not HD. But hey, that's just a minor gripe."

"Vanguard's been my haunt for a while now. Great spot for a unique cocktail or something new. Bar's always clean, no problem getting a drink even on busy nights. I'm a man of many drinks, but at Vanguard, it's always the Jack Rose. Apple brandy, maple syrup, black cherry - damn, I'm craving one just thinking about it. Maple syrup, you know? Can't go wrong. Drinks are top-notch, but take a break after a few, you hear me? Weekend nights get loud with the DJ, and Fremont's finest come in for a quick shuffle before they bounce. All in all, solid joint."

"Hark! We dined here this eve, and oh, the feast was fair! Our steaks and fish, cooked to perfection, did delight. But alas, the service, slow it was, and we did wait, a good hour or more, for our repast. And yet, to mark my grandfather's day, they gave him truffles in a box, and a gift card of twenty-five crowns.

Food rating, four and a half stars, I say. Service rating, three, alack!"

"Bamboo Club, good eatery. Outdoor seating, nice. Decor, theme, all good. Got there late, sat outside. Food, good. Pad Thai, appetizers, all good. Tuna, frozen. My bad. Maybe their fault, heard they can get fresh fish. Ambiance, good. Service, bad. Waiter, douche bag. Recap, good place, good food, avoid seafood, waiter needs a kick."
"Bar closes at 10pm. Western theme, wagon wheels, peanuts, fries - all bad. Hamburgers, guacamole - good. Cookies - untested, but rumored to be decent."

"ShooGoo was a solid joint, four stars easy. Good grub, American fare, big servings, attentive staff. But missing that je ne sais quoi for five stars. 

My filet with Béarnaise sauce, top-notch. Mushroom Gorgonzola app, the real highlight. Mmm. 
View wasn't bad either, but that's Sedona for ya. Sunny AZ, yow, bill."

Krispy Kreme, a gift from the gods. Passing by, that neon Hot & Now sign calls like a siren. Can't resist. Never been let down by those melty, glazed dreams. Staff, fast and efficient. Pulls a dozen in no time. Inside, fun for kids. Conveyor belt churns out doughnuts. A place of pure joy. Not just breakfast or snack, but happiness. Only gripe, accessibility. Hard to get in and out. Independence, a busy street. But worth it. Love Krispy Kreme, except for their strange spelling. Onward for Hot & Now doughnuts!

"Pittsburgh's got another dive bar that's worth checkin' out. They got this Penn Pumpkin Roll that's pure gold, but make sure you ask 'em to sprinkle some cinnamon and sugar on the rim. It's like drinkin' a slice of pumpkin pie. And don't forget to try their Sprecher, it's a hard root beer that tastes just like the real deal. They got an upstairs too, if you need some extra elbow room or a sweet view."

"A most excellent way to pass an eve,
Our first time here, the seats did surround,
The stage, in circles, actors did perform,
In all directions, their talents did abound.

The singing, better than I did expect,
The wigs, a bit cheesy, yet still quite affect,
A fun night, indeed, save for the crowd,
Geriatric, whispers loud, a bit too proud.

But still, they had fun, so 'twas easy to ignore,
And thus, we enjoyed the play, and that's for sure.
A tip, arrive early, parkings fill fast,
Dinner and show, a good plan, doth last."

"Hark, good sir! Kelly's doth be a merry place,
Where friends do gather, and laughter doth embrace.
A pint of ale, or mayhap a bite to eat,
Doth make for a fine evening, so neat.

The atmosphere, it doth please mine eye,
With cozy nooks, where one can sit and sigh.
And though the service doth move at a slow pace,
'Tis but a minor quibble, in this place.

A velvet rope, it doth indeed adorn,
But fear not, for 'tis but a small horn.
For in Old Town, such finery doth abound,
So let us raise a glass, and make a sound.

And should thou choose to dine within these walls,
Do give the short ribs a try, for they doth enthrall.
Five stars, I say, for their tender, juicy delight,
A culinary masterpiece, in the morning light."

"Passed this joint plenty times, never stopped in 'til an ex wanted to give it a shot. Glad we did. Inside, it's like South Blvd never existed. Classy joint, nice decor. Prices a bit steep, but worth it. Portions big enough for two. Staff top-notch, eager to please. Owner came by, offered free drinks. Not one to turn down a freebie, I'd give it four out of five."

"I like this joint more now that I've been inside. Free drinks for ladies from 10-12am, no line, and friendly staff. The drinks are strong, the place is small but bigger than I thought, and you can sit for free. The lounge is inside, but there's also a bar behind the REVOLUTION letters. The DJ wasn't great, but maybe it was just the music. Good spot for free drinks and chillin' with friends. Some folks were dressed up, but others were casual, like guys in t-shirts and beanies, and girls in denim and dressy tops. The crowd seemed a bit older."

"Food's good, portions just right, service top-notch. But they got a 20-dollar minimum for credit cards. That's a problem for me, since I usually fly solo and don't carry cash. Means I won't be back, 'cause I can get the same grub, service, and portion control two blocks down the road, and use my debit card whenever I please."

"Samosas? Two-and-a-half stars. Potatoes and cilantro? Meh. Naan? Average. Three stars. Kashmiri Dum Aloo? Five stars. Well-spiced, creamy, perfect potatoes. Vegetable Jalfrezi? Four stars. Too much oil. Rice? Perfect. Service? Great. Bollywood videos? Enjoyed 'em. Be back soon."

"This joint's alright, for out here in the sticks. In town, it's just another hole in the wall. But hey, at least someone's giving the locals a decent spot to grab a bite. My pop's taken a liking to the place too, so it's become our go-to when he's feeling hungry. 

The pies are pretty good, and I've had some solid pasta dishes. 

Just remember, it can get pretty packed, so it's best to book ahead."

"Shirts with sleeves, that's the rule for guys in Vegas, no matter how hot it gets. Worth the cost though, the grub and decor make it worthwhile. Plenty of options for your plate, and their desserts? Not bad, not bad at all. Corn on the cob, that's the real winner here."

"Hark! Spinach artichoke dip, a dish divine,
Once larger, now smaller, yet still quite fine.
Drinks flow strong, our spirits they do lift,
And Matt, our waiter, a merry wit.
He guides our choices, makes our evening bright,
As we prepare for a night of delight.
My friend, enamored with the menu's fare,
I, too, pleased with the two for $20 share."

"JD and I were lookin' for a real casual spot to grab some grub after our workout on Saturday. He suggested this place and it was dead on. The chips 'n' salsa were top-notch, either they were really good or I was just starvin' from the gym, prob'ly a bit of both. 

JD gets this cheese crisp thing and I give him a hard time about it, askin' if he's on a diet. Then I eat my words when this huge, greasy, cheesy monstrosity of a pizza comes out. It was friggin' huge! Thin tortilla, loads of melted cheese, cut up into squares like a pizza. Made it real easy to chow down on. I had these Mexican Flag enchiladas, they were alright, but they couldn't compete with that cheese beast across the table. 

All in all, it was a killer meal. Undid all the good I did at the gym, but that's life and I'm a-okay with it."

"Rito's got the best red chile and beans in the world, maybe even universe. Don't let the haters tell you otherwise. Sure, the area might seem rough, but that's just part of its charm. You'll find all sorts of folks here - city workers, CPAs, medical staff, teachers, and the occasional sketchy character. But don't let that scare you off. This family-owned joint serves up some damn good grub. Their menu might be limited, but it's all about quality, not quantity. And don't worry about the prices - you're getting fresh, soulful food, not some heartless crap like at Taco Bell. If you're feeling lucky, grab three tacos while you're there. The guacamole tacos? Amazing. I'd rob old people for 'em. Just saying. Now, if only they'd step up their game and offer fountain drinks... that'd be something else."

"Gold's Gym Elite, now this is a gym worth talking about. Walking in, I felt like I was checking into a high-end hotel, The W, maybe. Modern, stylish, and most importantly, clean. I'm beyond stoked to be a member here. Friendly staff, top-notch equipment, personal TVs on the cardio machines, and a place to plug in your iPod. No pool, but the views make up for it. Watched the planes take off and land at Sky Harbor while getting my sweat on. Not too crowded, either. A breath of fresh air compared to that other gym I used to go to. Filthy bathrooms and way too many people. Glad I made the switch."

"Buffets don't usually sit well with me, but Studio B is an exception. Quality over quantity, and worth the trip. Dinner's around $25 Monday to Thursday, seafood bumps it up to $35 on weekends. Not a bad deal, considering you get unlimited beer and wine. They've got craft drafts and ciders, a few wine options too. Something for everyone - sushi, carving stations, veggie options, and a dessert spread that'll satisfy any sweet tooth. Gelato and milkshakes too. Modern, comfy, and clean, with a view of the Strip. Lines can get long, so come prepared. Check out the M Players Club for free buffets."

"I joined this gym and it's been great. Friendly staff at the counter, always a warm welcome. Plenty of machines to use, variety for every muscle group. Juice bar's top-notch, staff's friendly too. Brent helped me sign up, explained everything clearly. No issues with parking, place is well-kept. Recommended."

"Three of us ate at this joint last night and I'll definitely be back. Service was top-notch, Emily was a real sweetheart, and the owner, Daryl, even stopped by our table to make sure everything was A-okay. Good guy. \nNow, if I had to nitpick, I'd say the apps could've been bigger. They were pretty cheap, so we should've gotten a few more. But other than that, the grub was great. I went for the curried tofu and cleaned my plate. Martha got the Jerk Chicken (real spicy) and Binnie had the Chicken and Dumplings, which was different but damn good. \nAll three of us agreed we'd come back."

In fair Las Vegas, where gambling doth reign,
A classic hotel doth stand, the Rio its name.
A place of rest, with comforts plenty,
Despite its age, modernity doth abound.

The buffets, oh how they doth delight,
A feast for eyes, a treat for appetite.
But alas, the line at check-in doth grow,
As weekenders flock, the crowds they do show.

Yet, staff doth bear it with grace and poise,
Their patience, a virtue, doth surprise.
For those who seek a respite from the fray,
The Rio, a haven, doth beckon thee away.

Though distant from the Strip, a trifle far,
Cabs, aplenty, doth wait, a ride to scar.
Yet still, a gem, this hotel doth remain,
A place to rest, after a night of gain.

So here's to thee, dear Rio, may thy fame,
Endure, and may thy guests find joy in thy name.

"Pizza most incredible, ambiance quite great, service most terrific. 

A spot in Old Town, near Poisoned Pen Bookstore, didst we enjoy. An Emiliana salad, recommended by the owner, didst we share, and then an Italian Sausage and mushroom pizza, both excellently prepared. 

A Sangiovese, I didst order, for luncheon, desiring something light. Three wines, they didst bring, and we didst choose, a Tuscan Cabernet blend, most excellent. 

This place, doth make the list, of "spots to return to", in Scottsdale, for sure! Great service, great victuals, and most pleasant ambiance."

"Green chili burro and beef taco, that's all I got. Took it to go, so it wasn't as good as eatin' there, but the green chili was still a must. Not too hot, not too bland. Good tortillas. Taco was decent, but next time, I'll eat in. It's a pretty good neighborhood spot."
"Prince, Friday night. Saw him from the floor and the suite. Great show."

"Hark, what lodging have we here? LaQuinta, by my troth! Yet, alas, not quite the one we sought, forsooth. 'Twas Thomas, the one on the outskirts of town, where vice and villainy do abound. My mother, dear lady, didst protest most vehemently, "Get thee hence, good sir! This place doth not befit thy station!" And so, we fled with haste, in search of better quarters, where comfort and safety might be found. Our journey ended soon, at Residence Inn, a haven most divine. Our AAA rate, a generous discount didst procure, and for a mere $40, a savings of $10, didst grant us entry to this pleasant domain. A studio, cozy and neat, with kitchen, didst await us, and breakfast, a feast most bounteous, didst satisfy our hunger and our souls. The day, though filled with stress and worry, didst end on a happy note, for our legal case, didst conclude in victory, huzzah!"

"Amidst the bustling streets of downtown, there lies a caf\u00e9, so neat,
Opposite McGill, its location most convenient, doth meet
The needs of those who seek a place to rest and sip,
And enjoy some pastries, fresh from the oven's lip.

The coffee, rich and bold, doth please the palate well,
And Jason, the owner, with his colleagues, doth tell
A tale of friendliness and warmth, so pure and true,
That one doth feel at home, in this cozy caf\u00e9 anew.

The pastries, oh so sweet, doth tempt the taste buds sore,
Fresh from the east end bakery, they doth restore
Memories of mothers' love, and childhood's joy,
In every morsel, a delight, a boy.

I, myself, doth visit oft, this caf\u00e9 so fine,
For in its warm embrace, I find a peace that's mine."

"Re Salon & Med Spa, great place. Staff's top-notch, give 'em a visit. Been goin' there six months, had my fair share of services - cut, color, mani/pedi. Bethany, the color and cut magician, she's the best."

"Smooth ride, great views, and a taste of champagne. Just as promised. But six passengers in one chopper? Felt like a sardine in a can. Couldn't even stretch my legs. Average size, too. Would've been five stars otherwise."

"Bellagio buffet, solid 4 stars. Reasonable price for good variety, including crabs and prime rib. Always plenty of crabs, no need to stand in line. Snow crabs are better than King crabs, weirdly. Prime rib, very tasty, fast line. Typical casino buffet ambiance, not too fancy. Attentive service, no need to ask for refills or take away dirty dishes."

"Solid spot for frybread tacos, but the real draw's the green chili stew. Variety of dessert frybreads, too. Chorizo with hot sauce hits the spot. Good for a change of pace or satisfyin' your sweet tooth."
"BBQ's not bad. Samplers, big ones, liked 'em all. Meat, falls off the bone, nice. Pork, real good. Atmosphere, like gramma's house. Food, plenty. Go again?"
"Planet Dailies and Trader Vic's, then P F Chang's. Happy. Good grub, decent service, fair prices. Minor gripes, but P F Chang's wins."

"Hark, good sir or madam, if thou seek's a cup of joe,
Buzzberry's the place, where local folk do go.
Their staff, quite friendly, and swift in their ways,
Shall pour thee a brew, that doth rival the days.
If thou desirest a large draught, then ask for the key,
To unlock the secret menu, and thus it shall be.
So, support the locals, and give Buzzberry a try,
For 'tis a place, where coffee flows, and mirth doth lie."

"Hark! A traveler, I, in fair Las Vegas,
For months now, have I tarried here,
And thus, a few hotels have graced my presence,
But none, like Downtown Grand, so dear.

A retro feel, it doth possess,
With colors of the sea, so fine and bright,
Yet modern furniture, doth it boast,
Flat screen TV, and cabinets, so fair and light.

Alack! But hidden fees, there be,
For internet, they say, is free,
But alas, 'tis part of the hotel fee,
A secret charge, so sly and sleight.

And should thou choose to park afar,
In yonder garage, dark and grim,
Beware, good sir, for safety's sake,
Lest thieves and rogues, thy valuables take.

Yet still, not bad, this Grand Hotel,
For in its lobby, restaurants doth dwell,
On par, they be, with all the rest,
So eat and drink, and merrily make haste."
"This joint's not half bad. Decent grub, cold brews, and a friendly crew. Had a swell time."

"Hark! The victuals here be of a consistent quality,
Akin to a factory of cheesecakes, all dishes taste the same, in sooth.
I chuckle at my comrades, who cry, "Let us away to Grand Lux,"
For 'tis a frugal fare, they say, yet we ne'er depart a-paying less
Than twenty crowns per head, and that's without a drop to drink, by Jove!
'Tis cheap, I grant thee, for a city such as this, where night doth reign,
But should thou dine too late, the cost doth mount, and service slows, in faith."

"Thou feast we did devour with merriment and cheer,
Our server, Christopher, a most excellent dear.
He did attend to us with grace and finesse,
Making us feel like royalty, in all his presence.
Aye, we shall return, for such service doth deserve,
To partake in their culinary art, once more to preserve."

"Hot Dog on a Stick? No thanks. Just the lemonade for me, friend. Three flavors to choose from, but I stick with the classics - lime and cherry. Can't beat that sweet, refreshing taste. Worth every penny, even if it's a bit pricey. Just don't sit too close, or the sound of those lemons getting smashed might ruin your appetite. But hey, that's just part of the experience, right?"

"In sooth, this eatery doth boast the finest victuals in all of Las Vegas! Aye, the bill of fare doth change with each new moon, and the potions, they doth astound! 'Tis a hidden treasure, indeed. My own lips did savor the tender short rib, gorgonzola polenta, and verily, 'twas a culinary delight!"

"Tried their tapas on happy hour, wasn't impressed. Came back for Paella, it was a pleasant surprise. Food was better, ordered Paella, Camarones Al Ajillo, and Brochettas De Pollo. Camarones Al Ajillo, a must-try. BF almost licked the plate."

"Las Vegas weekend, Gordon Ramsey's restaurant. Foodie heaven. Ordered lamb, melt-in-your-mouth goodness. Mashed potato side, equally impressive. Husband's shepherd's pie, a letdown. Watery mess. Courageously complained, waiter fixed it. Free dessert, a nice touch. Wish I could afford this luxury often."
"Solid joint for breakfast or lunch. Grub's top-notch, plenty of light options so you ain't eatin' just straight fat."

"Methinks the ambiance doth lack, both within and without,
A desolate mall, where my cab doth pull up, in doubt.
Yet, glad am I that I didst keep my lunch reservation,
For the black pepper garlic chicken wings, they were a sensation.

Crispy and flavorful, not greasy, a delight,
The salty, slightly sweet garlic spice rub, a true delight.
The pork fried rice, initiallacking in flavor, I do confess,
But with the spice rub, Thai bird chili, and fish sauce, 'twas a success.

Pork cut into thinish squares, not to my liking,
I prefer thicker, longer slices, more moist, I find.
Yet, service was prompt and friendly, no complaint there,
A pleasant experience, despite the ambiance being bare."

"Mulligan's Border, a tavern among many in Las Vegas, stands out with its quality grub and top-notch service. Their bar food, elevated to the next level, impresses. I've tried most items on the menu, and none have disappointed. My go-to is a simple, juicy burger, cooked medium rare, served with a properly toasted bun. It's a testament to a good burger that keeps me and the missus coming back. We've dubbed it our 'Cheers,' as the staff knows our names. Not a massive menu, but what they have, they do well. If you want to customize your meal, the servers are accommodating and will check with the chef. Service is exceptional. They may not 'Crumb the Table,' but they sure as hell make your visit worthwhile. My wife and I are regulars, hitting it up multiple times a week. Give it a shot."

"This joint's got character, ya know? Funky vibes, good beer, and plenty of veggie options. Art on the walls is top-notch, and they got a killer flier selection. Check it out, especially if you're an ASU student. Oh, and there's a craft fair every second Saturday of the month, put on by local indie crafters. Worth a look, for sure."

"Hark! What trail doth lie within this park?
A winding path, six miles and a half long,
For bikers of all skills, a challenge to embark.
With roots that twist and turn, a tricky throng.

But fear not, brave rider, for the path doth ease,
In parts, for those who seek a gentle breeze.
Yet, for the skilled, a test of strength and speed,
A challenge to be met, with courage unseated.

So, gear thy bike, and pedal forth with cheer,
For here, in this park, a trail doth await, my dear."

"Been to Biaggio's twice this week. Monday and Thursday, both times to go. Fiancé ordered pizza and wings Monday. Wings are to die for. Addicted. Crunchy outside, moist inside, dipped in ranch and hot sauce. Irresistible. Pizza was good, but nothing special. Pepperoni on one half, mushrooms and sausage on the other. Last night tried a stromboli. Bigger than expected. Chicken with artichokes and red pepper. Loved the artichokes. Stick with the $6.99 stromboli's. Specialty stromboli was $12.99. Both meals were around $30. Pricey for pie and wings. Back for the wings though."
"Devil's Diner's got new blood. Ownership and cook, both changed. Food's better now, tasty and priced right. Atmosphere's more welcoming too. Smile's on our faces."

"Methinks 'tis my intent to seek out Serendipity,
When e'er I find myself within Las Vegas' walls,
For there, they serve a frozen drink, most sweet and tasty,
Called hot chocolate, which doth warm my very soul.
And nachos, crispy, savory, and oh so fine,
A feast fit for a king, or so it doth seem.
This doth I order, each and every time,
And shall continue thus, until my dying breath.
The wait, alack, doth often prove quite long,
But, at the to-go window, one may find relief,
And quickly, too, without the need to tarry."
"Cozy joint, good grub and top-notch service. Save room for sweet treats. Skip the mixed drinks, though."

"Hark! A tale of woe and wonder doth unfold,
Of cat grooming woes, and how they were told.
In this fair town, where cats doth roam,
Finding a groomer, a feat most dire, doth become.

Some vets, they offer such a service, 'tis true,
But alas, their skills, do not compare to Katie's, anew.
For she, a skilled cat handler, doth work her magic spell,
Taming the fiercest of felines, with grace and poise, so well.

Josie, my own dear demon cat, doth fear all pet workers,
No reason why, no harm hath been done, yet still she doth lurk.
But Katie, brave and steadfast, doth face this challenge with glee,
And tames my beast, with nary a qualm, nor fear, nor flee.

Tuesday through Friday, she doth ply her trade,
Starting at dawn's early light, when all else doth slumber and shade.
And for a mere six coins, she doth render her aid,
A bargain indeed, for such a noble deed, so well played.

The e-collar, a marvel of modern design,
Doth calm my cat, and doth keep her in line.
Scruffing, a technique most strange, yet effective, I confess,
Doth make my Josie, a picture of tranquility, and peacefulness.

In less than ten minutes, the task, doth complete,
Josie, once more in her carrier, doth rest, so sweet.
Oh, praise to Katie, a true hero of our time,
For taming my demon cat, and making her shine.

A veterinarian, with words of wisdom, didst say,
That sedation, and declawing, were the only way.
But Katie, with skill and art, doth show us,
That grooming, can be done, with gentle touch, and love, so true.

So here's to Katie, a true cat whisperer,
May her skills, forever, be in great demand, and never slack.
For she, a true angel, doth tend to my beast,
And gives me hope, that all shall be blessed."
"Been here a few times, never disappointed. Food's good, service is too. Solid choice for a quick bite."

"Pleasantly surprised, I was, by poutine's fare,
A variety of choices, they did prepare.
The House Special, my heart did steal,
With service good, and space, our party could reveal.

In this place, we found a feast most fair,
And with each bite, our spirits did repair.
The fries, they were crispy and hot,
The cheese, it melted, oh so not.

A meal most satisfying, it did provide,
Our hunger, it did now abide.
So if thou seekest a hearty treat,
Poutine's menu, do thou neat.

For in this dish, thou shalt find delight,
A flavorful medley, morning, noon, or night.
So gather friends, and give it a try,
Together, ye shall poutine's joy descry."
"Prices fair, plenty grub. Satay Chicken, dry as dust. Pineapple Fried Rice, good stuff. Thai Tea, sweet as sin. Phat Thai, solid. Green Curry Paste Fried Rice, spicy as hell."

"Place was great. Styrofoam, construction noise, no big deal. Unit was huge, comfy, perfect for our six-day stay. No daily maid service, but that's cool. We had a washer/dryer, but it was a little temperamental. Towels were plentiful, though. Pool was decent, hot tub and bar made up for it. Location was top-notch, rooms were clean, kitchen was a bonus. Would stay again."

"Hark! A journey to the Mustard Museum doth lay,
A place of wonder, where condiments hold sway.
In the basement, a small yet quaint display,
Of mustard from afar, doth dance before mine eyes.

Alas, no relics from Egypt, Rome or Greece,
But a collection diverse, and full of delight.
Upstairs, a sampling of the wares doth please,
And with each taste, my heart doth sing with joy.

The staff, so friendly and full of cheer,
Doth make the visit, all the more worthwhile.
And now, a warning, for those who do not dear,
Mustard, avoid this place, lest thou dost smile.

For in this shrine, dedicated to the sauce,
Thou shalt find naught but mustard, in its place.
So cross this off thy list, with joy and glee,
And live a life, free from mustard's tyranny."

"Atmosphere wasn't too loud, considering it was the Hard Rock Hotel. Decor was modern, lighting was good. Server recommended their specialties, which I tried. Flavors were great - yellow tail sashimi with jalapeno, black cod miso. Skipped the chef's sashimi, it was just okay. Dessert was good, had many options. Went with vanilla tapioca. Sake was pricey, but worth it. Service was slow, but nice for a relaxed dinner. Would go back for the beef wagyu beef or other signatures. Not a cheap meal, expect to spend at least $150 per person, but worth it for the experience."

"Thursday nights, I hit up this joint for trivia. Always a good time. Menu's got some surprises - salads, wraps, decent pizza. Great spot to catch a game, too. TVs everywhere. But it gets crowded, especially since it's one of the only sports bars around. \n\nOne Sunday night, some drunk dude punched out a window. That was wild."

"Hark! A store most wondrous, nigh to Metro Pizza's door,
A place where fresh produce doth abound, and ne'er before
Hast thou beheld such bounty, at such meagre cost?
In truth, 'tis hard to find, a better prize, than what this store hath lost.

The fruit, so luscious, sweet and fine,
Doth make my mouth to water, like a springtime rill.
Kiwi, peaches, celery, apples, bananas too,
All these didst I purchase, for a sum of twelve and five.

And though the crowd, doth sometimes swell,
The checkout, swift and painless, doth dispel
All fears of lengthy wait, or dismal fate,
For here, good sir, thy time, doth quickly elapse.

The store, clean, well-stocked, and full of grace,
Doth shine, like sunshine, on a summer's face.
Two workers, diligent, their tasks they do fulfil,
One cashier, one stocking, both, with skill and guile.

So, to this store, my friends, do thou repair,
For here, thy needs, shall be most fair and rare."

"AJ's sushi bar, been goin' there since '06. Sushi chefs, top-notch, four stars easy. But then, turnover, reduced hours, quality and value took a dive. Had to find a new spot for my sushi fix. Update '13, they brought back the old chefs, now it's back to bein' one of my favorites."

"Good joint. Craps tables top-notch. Circle bar decent, cougars abound. Off the strip, 15 minutes, worth the trip. Rooms modern, pool sweet. Ex-roommate tended bar here. Laid-back spot when you need a break from the Strip. Big Bingo Room, bowling alley too. Theatre good, avoid weekends, teens swarm. Across from a shopping center, handy. Same ownership as Green Valley casino, similar vibe."

"Hark! What delight doth mine tastebuds perceive?
A culinary concoction most divine,
Cran-slam club, a dish of splendor, doth arrive.
And though the turkey mayhap lacked some moisture,
My kin, with capastrami and bobbie in hand,
Didst proffer me a morsel of their delectable fare.
Oh, how the bobbie doth excel in flavor and texture,
The stuffing, a marvel of culinary art, doth make it so.
Capastrami, too, doth earn my highest praise,
A veritable feast for mine epicurean senses.
Methinks I shall seek out this Capriottis in Beverly Hills,
To savor once more the delectable bobbie, and all its charms."

"Ramen Sora, good stuff. Not Monta-level, but still solid. Fresh ingredients, distinct flavors. Spicy miso, not too spicy. Could eat it again, definitely. If I lived in Vegas, this place would be my go-to."

This joint's got character, man. It's all Beatles-themed and the grub's got some funny names, but don't let that fool you. The fried cheese curds, they're top-notch. And the jalapeno popper burger? Damn good too. Don't sleep on the turkey swiss and slaw either.

Now, if you wanna make some memories, hit this place up on a Tuesday night. They got this trivia thing going on and Kim, the gal who runs it, she's a real kick. The waitstaff, they're A-okay too. Friendly as can be. And they got some decent brews to choose from.

"Airport pizza joints usually rip you off, but not this spot in B concourse. Decent pie, not the best, but a damn sight better than the rest. Crews come here too, that tells you something. Good eatin', fair price."

"I had the Dynamite Sandwich, a fiery blend of sliced brisket, peppers, chilis, onions, and jalapeños, all sautéed with Red Diamond sauce and piled on a jalapeño roll. It was damn good, and I'll be having more of them. But the real star was the Fried Onion Strings. No breading issues here, just lightly coated and perfectly cooked onions that weren't too strong or sweet. And at $1.95, it was a steal. My only gripe was the small portion size, but that's easily fixed by going on the first Wednesday of the month for the $12.95 AYCE lunch buffet. They're only open for lunch, weekdays only, from 10:30am to 3:00pm. If they expanded their hours and upped the portion sizes, I'd give 'em five stars."

"Hark, this store, my family doth frequent,
For Asian goods, 'tis most convenient.
From China to the Philippines, all's in store,
No need to roam, my dear, to find more.

Aisles abound with novelties to seek,
New teas to sip, and treats to eat.
Pho, I made, with ease, thanks to their stock,
Herbs, spices, sauces, all in one spot.

Clean, the place is, and staff, so kind,
English spoken, no trouble to find.
Bakery, too, with pastries, sweet delight,
Dim sum, a treat, day or night.

Deli, affordable, Panda Express, forget,
Here, fresh, huge portions, at a better bet.
Fish, they'll fry, for free, no need to pay,
This store, my friend, doth have it all, in play."

"Hark, what news is this? A burger most divine!
I've savored BBQ, and now, a bacon-brisket treat.
Tater tots, a side dish fit for kings,
And beer, a brew that lifts my spirits high.
A Sam Adams, 32 ounces, for a mere ten dollars,
With a keepsake cup, my heart doth sing with joy.
I do adore I Love Burgers, 'tis a fact,
For their grub doth please my taste buds, and that's a fact."
"Drive-thru's handy, sure. But this joint's got character. Makes me wanna ditch the wheels, stretch my legs. Friendly folk, too. Always nail my order."

"Hark, what steal of a deal doth lie within this place,
A steak, some shrimp, and sides to fill thy face.
For just $7.77, a feast most fair and bright,
Methinks 'tis worth the coin, come, let us dine tonight.

And do not be fooled by service, ambiance, or cloth,
This grub hub doth provide, in truth, a humble booth.
So enter, order swift, and savor every bite,
For here, my friends, we find a culinary delight.

And when thou art done, and thy belly full and round,
Thou mayst depart, and with joy, shout aloud.
For in this place, we find a treasure rare,
A meal most fine, without the need to spare.

So come, my friends, and partake in this delight,
For here, we find a feast, most wondrous and bright."

"Gave it 4.5 stars. Good eatin' joints, slots, bars, pool, kids' play area, friendly servers. Deluxe room, plenty space, but deducted half star for dirtiness. Table seats had food stains, no Wi-Fi, and in-room internet didn't work. Everything else, great. Stay again, for sure."

"Good eatery...sushi, not so much. I'm a sushi fiend, tried 'em all in Vegas. This spot's decent, but not my top pick. Garlic Chicken and Hamburger Steak, that's what I'm talkin' about! Their Hawaiian breakfast too, sausage, eggs, rice - yum! Not for sushi lovers, but still, a taste of 808 in 702."

"Hark, fair Grand Lux, when wilt thou make thy way
To the Bay Area? 'Tis a place most wondrous, they say.
And, verily, thy menu doth resemble that of
The Cheesecake Factory, in its vastness and array.

I chanced upon this eatery with five fair maidens,
And we did order diverse dishes, as our hunger raged.
A stacked chicken quesadilla, seared rare ahi,
An Asian noodle bowl, and tomato bisque, we did engage.

But, alas, the noodles, they were a poor excuse,
A feeble attempt at rice noodles, in my humble muse.
I vow, henceforth, to shun noodles at non-Asian places,
For they do but disappoint, and bring me naught but vexation.

Yet, the ahi and quesadilla, they were delectable,
And the tomato soup, a generous bowl, most palatable.
The portions, large, so sharing, a wise decision,
Lest ye wish to leave, with a full belly, in confusion.

The prices, fair, the service, prompt and friendly,
So, to Grand Lux, thou shouldst make haste, most readily.
For, with some twenty dollars, thou shalt depart,
Full and content, with naught but joy within thy heart."

"Went to this joint with some out-of-towners, looking to cash in on a match play deal I saw online. It's your typical neighborhood poker bar, but with a tropical twist - gotta love that little waterfall. Tiki decor's cool too. Any place that'll match my play's a winner in my book. Didn't try the grub, but the bartender offered me a Blue Moon with OJ. That's a winner too. This place is a Steelers bar, so they got promos and prizes going on during all the games."
"Went to this joint with some pals. Liked it. Wife and I had a veggie sandwich, Caprese. Daughter had an Italian. Friend had the Montagu. Cheap for the Strip, but still hungry after."

"Hark, my friends, we doth frequent fair Mexico,
And but now returned from Baja's tip, ye know.
These tacos, they do taste of Baja's finest fare,
A feast for tongue and senses, beyond compare.
The place, it doth impress, with cleanliness so pure,
And staff, most kind and welcoming, that's for sure.
I didst visit twice, in succession, 'twas my whim,
For this eatery, it doth possess a certain charm."

"Verily, the wash and interior cleaning didst please me well! My aged carriage didst shine with renewed luster, and I didst feel most satisfied. The men who worked upon it didst complete their task with haste, and I didst behold with joy the cleanliness of the windows and the tidiness of the floor. \nHowever, I must confess that the maiden who first approached me to take my request didst speak with such hasty words and a mien of annoyance. She didst seem vexed at having to repeat her queries, and her eyes didst roll in impatience. \nBut the men and maiden who didst attend to the vehicles didst perform their duties with cheer and courtesy."

"Great spot for a big crew. Rented a two-bedroom villa here a couple weeks back for a buddy's birthday. Place is tucked behind the MGM, near Hooters. Room was huge, kitchen fully stocked. Two full bathrooms, extra pillows and blankets. Sleeps six, but could fit ten easy. Price was right, and it was dead quiet. Continental breakfast was top-notch. Lots of options, something for everyone. Solid choice if you don't mind being off the strip."

"Vegan pizza in Vegas? Hell yeah! 

Wynn's got a secret vegan menu, but you gotta ask for it. It's a damn good list too. I'm eyein' the tofu parmesan sub, but my buddy wants a pie to share. 

We grab a meal deal - side, salad, 12" pizza for 24.95, drinks for 3.75 (thankfully refillable). Not cheap, but a good deal for the Wynn. Pizza's decent too, uses Follow Your Heart instead of Daiya. I like it, good texture and taste. Our veggie pizza's topped with olives, onions, and roasted red peppers. Interesting combo, but not my favorite. Crust could be a bit softer too. Salad's alright, nothing special. Fries are crispy as hell, real good. 

Planning my next trip, definitely coming back here."
"Clean joint, few cars in the lot. Sketchy mall, but this theater's alright. Friendly staff, too."

"Mystery meat, that's what they call it. Fills you up for a couple bucks, but I ain't sure I wanna know what's in it. And them blackjack players, always doubling down when the dealer's got a ten and they got one too. Makes me wanna choke 'em."

"This joint's a real gem. Best breakfast in town, bar none. Don't let the line out the door scare you off - it's worth the wait. I went on a Sunday morning and had a hell of a time getting a table, but the server was friendly as could be. Get the chorizo hash, it's a game-changer. And don't forget to try the sage fried chicken and waffles - it's a real treat. If you're feeling thirsty, go for the Tractor Driver Combo. It's a winner."

"This joint's got a hidden entrance, like a secret speakeasy. Inside, it's got a fireplace, dark lighting, and a nice old bar. Feels a bit too open for a wine bar, but I'm used to smaller bars in LA or NYC. They've got a huge wine list and the bartenders are helpful with recs. It's a mixed crowd, dates, groups of girls, and folks at the bar are all mellow. A nice change from the other bars in Old Town. Definitely adding this to my regular haunts."

"Verily, my visits to Pittsburgh ne'er pass without a stop at this place. Aye, I've had me share of sandwiches, and all agree, 'tis true, the victuals be most excellent! Alas, the service doth lag, a trifle vexing, yet methinks 'tis worth the wait."

"Airports for drunken revelry? Try these:

1. Narita/Tokyo - Glassy, polite, and a never-ending monorail ride.
2. Chicago O'Hare - Neon tunnel, perfect for a Dark Side of the Moon soundtrack.
3. McCarran - Las Vegas, where 12 hours of debauchery are inevitable. Slot machines and lizards make great companions.

Quarter deposited, cherry picked. Lemon? Damn. Time to board."

"Two-piece chicken special for 99 cents at Popeyes? Hell yeah, that's a good deal. Don't get me wrong, I ain't no fan of fast food, but every now and then, it hits the spot. And let me tell you, Popeyes delivers. Consistent chicken, decent service. Can't complain about that. Throw in some biscuits, and you've got yourself a damn good meal."

"Verily, good victuals and a noble quest, 'Tis a place wherein thou dost feel blithe whilst dining! 

I do adore the conceit behind King's Kitchen, A not-for-profit eatery that doth donate all its profits to feed the masses. Not merely a righteous mission and vision, but delectable fare as well! 

A group of us didst seek a nearby repast, In Uptown, upon a foul and stormy day. We didst espy The King's Kitchen nearby, And didst enter, to partake of their comestibles. The menu didst please us all, and thus we didst request a table. I didst choose the chicken salad croissant sandwich, With a mixed greens salad as my side dish. The sandwich was indeed most satisfying! The salad, a simple mix of greens, Was fresh and quite palatable. The other dishes at our table Didst appear most appetizing as well! The prices were quite reasonable, $9-13 for the noonday fare. The service was most attentive, and the staff didst treat us with great courtesy. I wouldst desire to return, To sample their evening offerings."

"Brunch on the patio with good company. Eggs, great. Pastries, divine. Bacon, satisfactory. Jelly with mini donuts, amazing. But, they shouldn't call 'em beignets. Donuts, that's what they were. Misnamed, my expectations were off. Fluffier pastry, that's what I expected. Bellinis, awesome. Coffee, too small."
"Tacos, good and simple. Small, cheap, order a few. Horchata, good, homemade. Beans, plain. Not the best, but I'd return."

"This joint's the real deal for a downtown chill vibe, no argument. You got your artisanal brews, your classic Schlitz, and a roast beef sandwich that's straight fire. If you're feeling fancy, they got AZ wines too. But listen up, fellas, if you wanna keep your voice and impress the ladies, sit outside. And don't forget about the mixed nuts and olives, they're plenty generous with 'em. Word."

"Fries here are top-notch. Perfect size, shape, crispiness. All Mandalay Bay restaurants seem to serve 'em. Hard to recall what else I had, they stole the show. Cute spot for a quick bite, but not your typical Vegas fancy joint. Get the fries."
"Fans needed for lunch spot. Hot as hell in Tempe. Music's great though. Service was meh during the rush. But damn, those burgers!"
