"Reserve a table. Consistently good grub. Sesame chicken, mongolian beef, and fried rice are my go-tos. Don't forget to try the bananas for dessert. Watch out for the bar tab, it adds up quick. $9 margaritas, but worth it."

Hark! A tale of woe and hunger doth unfold,
In Fashion Show Mall, where shoppers doth roam.
A craving for victuals, not just any fare,
Didst strike me, and I knew I must prepare,
To find a feast fit for a king, or so I thought,
And thus, my journey to Tapa Toro didst begin.

Two specials didst I choose, with haste and glee,
Swordfish and lamb, both dishes of the sea,
And land, respectively, and I didst say,
"Always order specials, come what may."
For happy hour, with half-priced tapas galore,
I sat at the bar, as requested, evermore.
The menu, though smaller, didst still delight,
And savings, too, didst bring me joy and light.

"Hark, what news is this? Our Manager doth go  
Out of his way to make us feel at home,  
And with his warmth, doth make our bike trip flow  
To yonder restaurant, where we shall roam.  
A friendly staff doth greet us with a grin,  
And with their cheer, doth make our visit spin.  
This little eatery, full of promise doth seem,  
And with its growth, shall be a place of dreams."

"Good eatery run by solid Vietnamese family. Fresh grub, quick service. Been around since 2011. Traditional Viet dishes and some East Asian faves. Prices fair, portions generous. My Tom Xao Ca Ri, $12.50, loaded with fresh veggies, big shrimp. House specials include Banh Tom Ho Tay, $13, and Ca Kho To, $10. Curries pack heat. Canh Chua, $8, homemade broth, daily. Chef's got principles. Hates MSG, watery stock. Says cooks drown flavor in oil. Petite Tonkinoise's only issue? Decor's lackluster. Zen kitsch mini banquet hall vibe."

"Went to Puck's, last minute, for dinner with the fam. Bright semi-open space, nice small bar area. Only had to wait 10 minutes on a Friday night around 9PM. Staff was attentive. 

Food was good. Had the grilled ribeye steak, probably the priciest entree at $40. Cooked perfect, medium rare, with a tasty reduction sauce. Nice stem of mushrooms and blackened green chiles. A good opening meal in Vegas. Nothing too fancy, but good eat's. 

Tried the tiramisu dessert. Really good. Had chocolate beads in the creamy layer, added a nice crunch. Even though it's mainly pasta/pizza & seafood, safely recommend the ribeye here. Enjoy the eats."

"Chicken and waffles, authentic as hell. LoLo's, that's where I found 'em. Waffles, outta sight, man. Chicken, damn near perfect. Me and the boys, we just ate, didn't say a word. Clean joint, friendly service. You gotta try it. I'll be back, for sure."

Last eve, our kin didst venture forth to dine
At North Lake Mall, where we didst find a place
To sate our hunger, and didst take our time
To savor each dish, and every morsel's grace.

The service there, it was quite swift and neat
Our orders taken at the counter, with speed
The fare, it was brought forth with great dispatch
And we didst feast, with joy and merriment.

My wife, she had the pulled pork plate
Whilst I, the half-chicken, didst partake
Our children, they didst have pork sandwich and fingers
Grilled, not fried, a healthier choice, it lingers.

All of us, we didst enjoy our repast
The portions, generous, and the taste, so vast
The BBQ sauces, three kinds, didst please our palate
Sweet tea, a perfect complement, didst satiate.

Self-service drinks, a convenience, indeed
Cleanliness, a virtue, the staff didst heed
Friendly and helpful, they didst attend
Our needs, with smiles, and diligence, they didst lend.

Four stars, I give, for excellence, it doth deserve
Above average, in all aspects, it doth preserve
We shall return, when next we are near
For more of that deliciousness, we hold dear.

"Hark! I didst partake of fish tacos most fair,
My spouse, a bacon cheeseburger of great girth,
Whilst our young progeny, corn dogs they didst share.
The fish tacos, verily, didst please mine taste."

"Fries and hash browns not as good as they used to be. Can't get a straight answer on the change. Place still great, atmosphere still top-notch. Indoor and patio dining, grand opening, service improving. Must-try in PV/Scottsdale. San tan hefe, still love it."

"Big portions, good grub. Not authentic, but who cares? Udon noodles are thick, broth is tasty. Add chili oil for a kick. Clean joint, worth the few extra bucks over fast food. Get extra bowls or a to-go container, you'll need 'em."

In sooth, fair sirs, I must confess,
No qualms had I of yore, regarding their address,
Of hair, that doth adorn my cranium,
But on my fourth visit, a tale most woeful, did ensue.

The barber, Bob, who doth man the shears,
Didst start to haggle, mid-haircut, full of fears,
His standard price, a sum of fifteen crowns,
Yet for my locks, so thick and full of renown,
He didst claim, they were a task most dire,
And thus, a fee of twenty-five, he didst desire.

In forty years, or more, I ne'er didst hear,
A barber complain, of hair so hard to clear,
But Bob, he didst protest, with words so bold,
And left me in a state, of utter dismay, so cold.

Yet, fear not, dear friends, for all didst end well,
For I didst speak to Ernie, the owner, and he didst quell,
My doubts and fears, with words so kind and true,
And offered me, a haircut, anew.

So, to this place, I do recommend,
But shun, dear sirs, the old man, at the rear, so grim.

"Stayed here after a delayed flight. They gave our room away but upgraded us to a better one with a sick view of the strip. Pools were dope, especially the wave pool. Daylight was lit but expensive. Good eats around the casino, but the bars inside were pricey. Would stay again."

"Sweet treats, oh how they delight! Cakes, ice cream, truffles, a feast for the taste buds, no doubt. But alas, too much of a good thing, can be a bad thing, as the saying goes. For after a few bites, my craving is sated, and I am done. Red Velvet cake, a true delight, and the washroom, a marvel of cleanliness and mirrors galore, a true wonder to behold!"

"This joint's got some serious game. Food's always on point, salsa's got a nice kick, and the service is top-notch. Family spot, you know? Chicken fajitas, man. Can't go wrong. And they hook you up with some free soup. Classy move."

"Hark! This place doth serve the finest wings,
In all the valley, I do reckon.
Their portions, generous and fair,
Not drenched in sauce, but crispy, anon.
Their flavors, though not numerous,
Are tasty and spicy, in good measure.
The service, swift and kind,
With rolls of paper towels, at hand.
And wet naps, to cleanse thy face,
After devouring their boneless grace.
Indeed, a place of wing-ly joy,
I shall return, with haste, anon."

"Quaker Steak, six atomic wings. Spicy, but not impossible. Sign a waiver, for show. Habañeros, no issue. Pro-tip: ask for gloves. No sauce, no pain. More wings: Louisiana Lickers, Arizona Ranch, Golden Garlic. Meaty, flavorful. Overpriced? Maybe. But worth it."

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous place, indeed,
Where once we came with frequency,
But later, alack, didst cease to visit,
Forsooth, our paths didst not converge.

Yet now, in recent days, I've chanced to stop,
And savored late repasts, most pleasant,
The folk who tend this establishment,
Are kind and true, their smiles unfeigned.

In summer's heat, their Ensalada doth quench,
A refreshing draught, most cool and sweet,
Whilst I, a Veg Papusa, do devour,
With fried Plantains, a tasty treat.

My spouse, with relish, didst taste their broth,
Chicken soup, a feast for his soul,
And then, with glee, didst he consume,
Their Chicken Special, a dish most whole.

Thus, glad am I that we didst return,
To this, our erstwhile haunt, so dear,
For here, in truth, doth lie a gem,
A treasure trove of flavors, rare."

"Our final usage of the LALALA ramen pass, 'twas a wondrous sight,
In Las Vegas, where we didst savor, a most excellent ramen delight.
The pork within the soup, oh how grand,
Smoky and sultry, with a hint of wood-fired brand.
The waitress, kind and fair, didst attend to our needs,
Ensuring we didst enjoy, our culinary deeds.

At Ramen Misoya Tomi, they strive to be unique,
With traditional care, and unconventional technique.
The decor, not to my taste, with posters so bright,
But the ambiance, lacking, in its present light.
Yet, for groups, 'tis a place, to dine and make merry,
For it's not too crowded, and the ramen, so very."
"Food's a mite salty, but service is top-notch. If you're lookin' for somethin' special, Stratta's worth a shot. Try the tata beef appetizer, it's a real treat."

"Songbird, it's my jam. Work's just a stone's throw away, so I swing by often. Their pastries? Heavenly. Get the brioche cinnamon roll, you won't regret it. Coffee's top-notch too. Not sure what they're doing differently, but it shows. Seating's limited and prices are steep, but it's worth it for the quality."

"Hark! A feast most wondrous didst thou provide,
O' lamb kubideh, with rice and bread beside.
The price, a mere $7.99, didst seem most fair,
For such a healthy portion, without compare.

The bread, made fresh at thy location, didst delight,
And all the flavors, in perfect harmony didst unite.
A Baklava, sweet and flaky, didst end our meal,
Most satisfying, and worth the while.

So here's to thee, dear restaurant, well done!
Thy food, a true delight, doth make my day begun."

"Hark, good sirs and madams, let me tell thee of a place,
Where fine ale and victuals doth abound in grace.
'Tis SanTan, a brewery of renown, with fare to please,
But, alas, for vegetarians, choices be few, I fear.

Fish tacos, I had, upon my last visit,
And found them but so-so, naught too special, I must admit.
The veggie burger, standard fare, doth make an appearance,
But what doth steal my heart, their appetizers, in especial.

A pretzel, oh so fluffy, doth delight,
And beer, their brew, doth flow in abundance, day and night.
Alas, their burgers, of which I've heard such praise,
I cannot vouch, for they do not suit my taste.

Yet still, a local haunt, of merit, 'tis,
Worth a visit, should thou find thyself near it.
So, raise a glass, and cheer, for SanTan,
A place of joy, and revelry, for all to scan."

"Found this joint a few months back, treatin' myself to a mani/pedi. Great deal, thirty bucks. Pedicure comes with a hot stone massage, warm lotion, and a killer leg rub. Been here a few times, never needed an appointment. They always take me in, get me settled in a massage chair, and start workin' their magic. 

One time, my boyfriend asked for paraffin on his hands. Girl brings out two plastic bags with warm wax, tells him to slip 'em on like gloves. Looked a bit dodgy, but damn, his skin came out smooth as silk. 

Headin' back this Friday, preppin' for sandal weather."

Thou villainous deli, how my heart doth sing thy praise!
Years have passed since first I didst step within thy walls,
And yet, thy sandwiches, of highest quality, do remain.
Pizza, a new addition, doth please mine taste,
Yet, alack! A single slice, they doth not sell.
The service, once so warm and full of cheer,
Now doth seem cold, and lacking in charm.
'Tis true, the old owner's way, didst make us feel so dear,
But now, their replacement, doth leave us quite disarmed.
Keep up the good work, fair deli, and heed my words,
For engaging with thy customers, shall bring thee more birds.
Good luck, fair villain, may thy business flourish still!
"Food was top-notch, service even better. Waiter was a real pro, knew his stuff. My wife's birthday, July 4th, they brought out this incredible dessert, sparkler candle and all. Highly recommend."

"We stumbled upon this joint by chance and dug it. Lookin' for a spot to dance, some dude outside Caesar's handed us passes for free entry before midnight. We snatched 'em up and hit the casino. Another fella near Pure gave us the same deal, said to hop in the shorter guest list line. We were groovin' inside five minutes after steppin' into the hotel. \n\nPure's a sweet rooftop club with a view of the strip. I boogied for hours, eyes fixed on the Eiffel Tower. Can't gripe about that, can ya? The DJ spun some killer tracks; wish I could recall his name 'cause I enjoyed most of his jams. Drinks cost a pretty penny, but that's Vegas for ya."

"O, what a wondrous place this was, my friends!
Their pizza, though a bit oily, did please our taste.
And the side salad, oh so fresh and fair,
Did make our meal most satisfying, I do swear.

And when we needed sustenance, they did deliver,
To our hotel, with haste and without a fuss or a sliver.
So if thou art in need of rest and ease,
And craves a meal that doth not tax thy knees,
Then order from this place, and thou shalt see,
That 'tis a choice most wise and fitting for thee."

"Springs Cafe, third time's the charm. Location and view, four stars easy. Food? Solid three and a half. Good eatin', nothin' fancy. Burgers, wraps, pizzas, specials. View's the real star. Definitely worth a visit, especially on a nice day. Sit outside, soak it up."

"A fine establishment, indeed! My heart doth sing with joy at the mere mention of its name. A vast array of brews, a menu most grand, and bottomless drinks, oh what a treat! Brunch, thou art divine, with chicken, waffles, and gravy so fine. A true delight, I doth declare! And, by the stars, I live but a stone's throw away. Verily, I shall return anon!"

"Sushi sleeper in Henderson. Met a coworker for lunch. Lunch specials, cooked options, sushi. First time, lunch special's a good deal. $12.50, 6 pieces sushi or sashimi, 1 roll, miso soup, salad. Opted for sushi, tried the rice. Simple, beautiful plate, generous cuts, nigiri, roll. Maguro, nama sake, hamachi, spicy yellowtail roll. Surprised, quality decent, rice good. Green iced tea, large glass, quick server. In and out in under 35 minutes. Quiet inside, cherry blossom painted back wall. Nice ambiance. Good lunch spot."

"Fair sirs, gather 'round and heed my words,
For I have found a place most wondrous and grand,
Where vegan fare doth please the taste buds,
And non-veg friends do crave it, hand in hand.

The dishes, oh so delectable and bright,
Did fill our bellies with delight,
And though the prices were most fair and just,
Our hunger didst still demand more, we didst must.

But mark this well, dear friends,
For on a Friday eve, the crowd doth swell,
And service, slow it doth become,
Leaving us to wait, our patience doth fray.

So heed my counsel, and avoid that night,
Lest ye be left with naught but bitter plight."

"Hark, good sir or madam, hast thou sought  
A slice of New York pizza, and in Vegas found?  
Indeed, 'tis true, this place doth hold the key  
To satisfy thy craving, let it be.  
Some may protest, saying 'tis too far away  
From the Strip or Summerlin, but nay,  
'Tis worth the journey, trust me, ere I pray  
Thou shalt not find a better way.  
And should thou wish to indulge in sweet delight  
Next door, a creamy treat doth await thee,  
In the form of ice cream, rich and velvety white.  
So, go forth, and partake of this delight."

"Verily, this place doth shine with cleanness! Seats most comfortable, and staff, so kind and prompt in service. By my troth, this Subway doth set a standard, others should follow! I shall return, anon."

"Hark! How is't that I ne'er reviewed this place ere now? 'Tis near my dwelling, thus I do frequent it oft. Once a month, at least, I doth grace its halls with mine own fair presence.

'Tis a dimly lit dive bar, full of character and charm. A place where one might find a willing partner for a night of passion, should they be so inclined. The drinks are cheap, the bartenders friendly, and the atmosphere most convivial.

The patrons, too, are a diverse and merry bunch. Alcoholics, workers, those seeking refuge from the world outside, and many a stoner, all gathered together in this hallowed hall of inebriation. As a comely maiden, I have found the menfolk here to be most courteous and welcoming, albeit with a certain... let us say, enthusiasm.

One may come here to relax and enjoy a quiet ale, or to indulge in a more rip-roaring bout of revelry. Either way, thou shalt fit in well among the throng.

'Tis a place worth visiting, and when the revellers from Santisi Brothers are turned out, they often make their way hither. And should thou be in need of a brief respite, grab a flagon of ale and watch the folk who gather here, for they are a most entertaining sight.

Oh, and note, fair maidens, that there is but one stall for women, yet the queue is oft short, and the scent, though not always sweet, doth not oft reek of foulest farts and feminine mysteries."

"Patio's sweet. Had lunch inside though. Chips, guac to start. Blackened mahi spinach salad for me. Big ass piece of fish on a bed of spinach. Couldn't finish it. Happy hour deals look good. Be back."

"Small BBQ joints need their own customer service rules. They operate at their own pace, forget orders, and treat customers like guests in their home, not a restaurant. Memphis has this vibe. We arrived right at opening, causing "speedbumps." They were still counting change, putting chairs down, and food wasn't ready yet. But, the good news is, the place is delicious. I had mouthwatering beef ribs with a beautiful pink ring, indicating they'd been smoked to perfection. The coleslaw was unique and tasty, with a sweet and sour flavor from the mustard-based dressing. My husband had the pulled pork, but it wasn't as great as my ribs. He didn't love the sugary BBQ sauce with a peppery kick. Oh well, he should've gotten the ribs. Next time you're in Buckeye, stop by and give it a try."

"Good things come in small packages, like this Vegas casino built in 1906. Classy, simple, and clean, it's got old-style slots and dealers dressed as flappers at night. We joined Club 1906, played joker poker, and scored free room offers. Check it out for a downtown staycation or a drink and some craps. It's a fun spot."

"Away with thee, my friends, to Golden Corral we go,
Where a feast fit for kings doth await, don't you know?
My love, she doth chide me for my growing girth,
But how can I resist, when there's so much worth?

The grub, it doth please, though not of highest quality,
And the service, alas, doth leave much to be desired, you see.
But who cares for that, when there's such plenty to eat?
I had steak, chicken, rice, ice cream, and more, oh so sweet!

Golden Corral, thou art a wondrous place, indeed,
Where a man can gorge, and his hunger doth secede.
So here's to thee, dear friend, may our bellies always be full,
And our taste buds, happy, at thy bountiful pull!"

"This joint's got game. Their selection's top-notch, especially the red velvet. None of that flavor-switching nonsense like at MoJo or Yogurtology. Their new features, bananalicious and hawaiin, are straight fire. Only gripe's they don't got juice poppers. What's up with that? Everyone loves 'em."

"Went for brunch, ordered from grilled cheese menu. Wake and bake, cheddar, egg, maple bacon, maple mayo - amazing. Boyfriend had blarney stoner, open-faced, mashed potatoes, beer cheese, stout gravy, fries, hash - potatoes on bread, not grilled, but yummy. Grilled cheeses come with tomato soup, fries. Fries thick, almost breaded, soft in middle, few different flavors, old bay - can't go wrong. Tomato soup interesting, thick, not bad, served purpose of dipping. Service great, quick, efficient, no complaints. Beer list amazing, will be back."

"The Diamond Pizza, just left of Atria's on the Roberto Clemente Bridge side of PNC Park. Good pizza, great cheese. Enter the park there too, no lines. Friendly ticket taker and bag search, program and promo items. Order by the slice, grab a beer, watch the game on the TVs. Restrooms nearby. Busy spot, no-frills service. They make good food for the money."

"Hark, what mischief doth my eyes perceive?
A Ross store, full of treasures to retrieve.
I entered, seeking gifts for others fair,
But lo, my heart didst betray me, and I didst bear
Away with me, a prize most wondrous and rare,
Forsooth, 'twas naught but trifles, baubles, and lace.
My mind, it doth confound, how I couldst be so blind,
To seek for others, yet find naught but mine own kind.
Alas, the lure of Ross, it doth ensnare,
And now, my purse doth weep, and my heart doth despair."
"Steak and lobster, served with veggies and a damn big baked potato. Friendly joint, old-school vibes."

"Holly's review hits the mark. Second time doing this gig, first time was a bike ride, total mess. Not running, just walking the 5K. Always got my beard, no issues there. Park in the north lot, quick exit on Sunset. Don't like the growing number of dogs, at least they kept their business at home. Good entertainment, Jabbawockeez, dancers from Fantasy, flying Santas, makes it a fun event. Walking over the freeway on Sunset, not something you do every day. Main fundraiser for Opportunity Village, a worthy cause in Southern Nevada. I'll be back next year, suit and all."

"NYC transplant, great spot.  Pricey, trendy, menu's a bit tricky with a big group.  Our waiter was top-notch, made sure we were well taken care of.  Joint was jumpin', lots of energy, beautiful people.  If you're with a group, ask for help with the menu.  Couples, you're good to go.  Plenty to try, could eat here 100 times and never get bored."

"Tucked away, hidden from sight,
I forgot how I came to this place,
In the night, with friends, without light,
They drove me hither, in haste.

The inside, small, dark, and funky,
With copper counters, shining bright,
Adds to the charm, quaint and punky,
A place to dine, with delight.

Pork enchiladas, I did order,
And shared the garlic, sauteed,
Oh, how delicious, a true border,
Left me craving, more to savor.

But alas, the garlic, it did seep,
Into my pores, oh, how it clung,
Days passed, and still it did linger,
A scent, that would not be sung.

Yet, worth it, the meal, it was,
A place, you should visit, with haste,
For the flavors, they do entice,
And leave you, in want, of more delight."

"Methinks I didst venture forth to this establishment some months past, and verily, 'twas a wise decision. Forsooth, their victuals didst please mine taste, in sooth, nigh unto perfection. Their spicy meat taco, in particular, didst delight mine senses with its savory flavor. And, upon my return a fortnight later, I didst partake of their burrito, which didst prove to be a most excellent choice, surpassing, in my humble opinion, the offerings of that other establishment, Chipolte. \nNow, in fairness, I must confess that mine only quibble with this fine eatery doth concern the nature of their meats. Forsooth, the majority of them didst remain unknown unto mine ears, and, perchance, a more detailed elucidation of their composition might be in order. Furthermore, a broader selection of sodas, or even the addition of tea, might serve to enhance the overall experience. \nYet, notwithstanding these minor shortcomings, this place doth remain an excellent and most affordable venue for the procurement of delectable tacos, burritos, and street corn, with hours most accommodating."
"Carne adovada, I love it. But sometimes, too much fat. Hate that. Best chipotle ranch though."

"Methinks this town doth boast the best Chai Latte,
A drink most sweet and comforting, no doubt.
With chocolate twist and quiche lorraine, we did feast,
Both dishes light and delicate, a true delight.
A ciabatta boule we brought home, its moistness rare,
Yet, verily, 'twas good, beyond compare."

"Delectable fare, kind service, a place we hold dear. 

Tofu, sesame-kissed, doth please our taste buds so. 

A dish most wondrous, at a tavern of renown."
"Teriyaki Chicken rice bowl? More like a sad, soggy mess. Frozen meal, heated up. Not worth a star. Stickin' with the good stuff - 5-star wraps and salads. Leavin' the 2.5-star bowls for the birds."

"Terrific show. Lead actor killed it. Cozy venue. Wished Angel had more stage time, but enjoyed her in a new role. \n\nP.S. Absinthe's a nice touch, though not quite like the real deal abroad. Appreciate the effort."

"Hark, I didst return a second time, and lo! They hadst altered the preparation of the Wellington. 'Tis now served but one way, and alas! No longer canst thou request it medium well or otherwise. Methought 'twas passing strange, yet still most excellent, I do confess."

"Jennifer C's review hits the mark. I had a similar experience. Being from Pittsburgh, taking a 'tour' felt strange at first, but it was a fresh way to see the city. \n\nThe only gripe I got is that it was more Segway, less tour. Riding the Segway was a blast (especially when they let us loose) but the tour itself was lacking. The guide shared some tidbits here and there, but I expected more."
"Eat big, or don't eat at all. Gigantic portions, guaranteed food coma. Fries? Top-notch."

"Hosts in restaurants, lately? Zero personality, poor first impressions. But hey, let's talk food and service. Carol, great. Makes up for the podium guards' lackluster vibe. Tomato capresi appetizer, excellent! Classic with a twist - fresh red onion, balsamic reduction, basil. Could be a main course, but I lack self-control. Pasta Franco, very good too. Olives, artichoke hearts, sun-dried tomatoes, a tad salty towards the end, but expected. Would order again. Carol, attentive, not pushy. Ask for her."
"Coffee's good. Soup, sandwiches, smoothies too. Service needs work, but worth a visit."
"Tasty grub, quick service. Thai tacos and mac 'n cheese, a real treat. Burgers done right too. Not gourmet, but good eats all the same."

"Place was hoppin', Monday night or not. Malbec flowed like water, olives marinated to perfection. Sausage and mushroom pizza, just the right size. Decor? Top-notch. Not exactly easy to find, but worth the search. Local spot, hidden in a strip mall behind the tire shop. Check it out, Arden."

"Hark! A word of caution, ere we dine,
This Chinese restaurant, I've tried but their noon repast,
Their buffet, full and plentiful, a feast for the eyes,
With eight treasures and chicken curry, my heart doth rise.
A solid meal, at a fair price, without delay,
'Tis a bargain, my friends, come, let us dine today!"

"Dickey's saved my Thanksgiving. My brother and I decided to do Thanksgiving with friends last minute. No turkeys at Hash House a Go Go. WTF? Same at Mimi's Cafe, Lucilles, and Famous Daves. Double WTF. Needed Thanksgiving to-go, stat. Dickey's had two turkey options for $49.99 - Cajun Fried or Smoked. Course they were sold out of the fried, but had one smoked left. Called dibs! Pick-up was easy - zipped in and out in five minutes. Closed on Thanksgiving, so picked up the day before. Ready-to-heat, oven-safe aluminum pan. Two hours to eat-time. Perfect - my friend just moved to Vegas, minimal bake/cookware. Needed low maintenance. Dickey's delivered. Pretty tasty too. A little worried the smoked wouldn't deliver the flavor, but it was delicious. Not the best, but damn good. Love cooking, but it was nice to skip the large bird and focus on Settlers of Catan and Wii Tennis."

"Walked into the joint, tired from the day's work. Menu was different, couldn't find what we wanted. Waiter still took our order, though. Ended up with a makeshift surf and turf - filet mignon, lobster tail, mashed potatoes, and a sad excuse for a salad. Salad was a mess, just a bunch of wilted lettuce dumped in a bowl. Lobster was overcooked, tough as shoe leather. But the filet and potatoes, they were top-notch. I'm a meat and potatoes man, through and through. Atmosphere was still nice, despite the mediocre grub. Maybe it was the late hour, who knows? Been there before, food was better. Give 'em another shot, sure."
"Sweet joint for ice cream, old-fashioned style. Load up on toppings, make it your way. Fun spot, good service, and the scoops? Top-notch. I'll be back next spring, you can bet your ass on that."

"This joint's not half bad. For a chain, the grub's pretty damn good. Their tacos are loaded with homemade-tasting stew meat. And don't even get me started on the burritos - they're the size of a small child. Staff's friendly too. They'll hook you up with a free cookie or scoop of ice cream for dessert. Not bad for a quick, cheap Mexican fix."
"Wait wasn't long. TV's on, news or sports. Brought my own readin' material. Techs were top-notch. Office staff friendly, bit scattered. Try their best for patients."

"Good eatery, this one. Been there thrice, never had a bad meal. Garlic crab, top-notch. Salt and pepper calamari, tasty, but watch out for the seasoning. Atmosphere's swell, live jazz playing in the background. Great spot for a romantic evening or meeting up with pals. Not the best for kiddos. Parking? No clue, always take a taxi."

"Ravioli, six pieces, covered in rich Alfredo sauce. Breadstick, warm and soft. Filling, perfect portion. Best Alfredo sauce I've had, not watery, full of flavor. Pizza, too pricey. Going back for more pasta."

"Hark! What flavors doth NoDa Brewing Co. bring forth?  

Inspired by Dogfish Head and Founders, they do sing 

A tale of two IPAs, both bold and hoppy, one with a hint of earthiness, the other citrusy and sharp.  

And then, there's Coco Loco, a brew that doth please, 

A rich, smooth porter, perfect for a night of ease.  

The taproom, full of life and energy, doth play host 

To many a beer enthusiast, of diverse backgrounds, all united in their love of the craft.  

Though the beer may not quite knock thy socks off, 

NoDa Brewing Co. remains a place worth visiting, and that's no jest. 

Give Coco Loco a try, and ignore the rain, 

For in this taproom, thou shalt find joy, and perhaps a bit of gain."

"Naked Pizza, my new fave. Finally, something fresh in this tired town. Anticipation built, I pulled in on a Friday night, snagging a prime parking spot. No seating, just takeout/delivery? No worries, if it's tasty. Ordered a 10\" Superbiotic and 10\" BBQ chicken, both on original crust. Busy bees buzzed in the lobby, warming oven full of pies. Waited 7 minutes, happy with the service. Home, the crust blew me away. Superbiotic, as good as any $19 wood-fired pie. Crust, delish. Not a big pizza fan, but ate every bite. Back Sunday and Wednesday. Welcome, Naked Pizza!"
"Went there twice since opening. First visit, few mistakes on order, but fixed quick. Good grub, fair price. Clean joint, fun vibe. Compare to Baja Fresh, Wahoos wins on value."

"Saturday night, six of us hit up this joint. Table was ready, nice touch. Old spot, loads of character. Busy as hell, staff looked slammed. Took a while to get bread, even longer for apps. Waiter disappeared for long stretches, tough to order more drinks or food. Service was meh, but the grub? Top-notch. Fresh, delicious, some of the best Italian I've had. Gnocchi? Outta this world. Would go back, hoping for better service next time."

"Taco heaven found. Sampled chicken, asada, pork street tacos. Pork, sweet and smoky. Asada, well-seasoned, smoky. Chicken, flavorful but not as much. Husband shared Bombero burrito. Mexican barbecue sauce? Yes! Dining experience worth 30-minute drive. Would sample entire menu. Thanks, Bill B."

My dearest sister and I did dine at this establishment,
Upon seeing an advertisement most persuasive and fair.
It showed Rachel Bilson and Paris Hilton, both of great renown,
Celebrating parties here, and thus we thought it a crown.

The menu did boast of "gourmet college food,"
A claim most intriguing, and our taste buds quite mood.
We ordered Mini Kobe Burger sliders, oh so fine,
And Buffalo Chicken wings, a dish most divine.
Fries came in a swirl, a clever presentation indeed,
All of the food we ate, our hunger did exceed.

Alas, the prices may be somewhat high,
But still, a trendy place to dine, and worth the try.
If thou art in search of a hearty meal,
Mayhap the steak, a dish most famed and real.

"Saturday mornin', we hit up this joint in Ahwatukee for brekkie, third day in a row. Place was bustlin' but the hostess hooked us up with seats at the bar. We waited for a table, sippin' coffee, chattyin' with the locals. Chiliquilas, man, they were better than expected. El Jefe, just like they said, no disappointment there. Huevos rancheros, that's what I ordered, came with a killer pancake on the side. Ranchero salsa, damn good too. Service, solid. Busy place, tickets took a bit longer, but hey, that's Saturday mornin' for ya."

"I'm a Penn Brewery devotee, a true beer aficionado. But alas, I can't indulge during work hours. Tragic, I know. Still, I had to come here for lunch, even if it meant abstaining from my beloved brews. And let me tell you, the Braumeister Steak Sandwich and fries were top-notch. Service and ambiance? Spot on. Make time for a visit. It's worth it."

"Good grub. Sipped brews and snacked at the bar with a mate. They got some top-notch IPAs. Not a fan of squid usually, but their stewed calamari was damn fine. Also had a caprese that hit the spot. It's a chill joint, not the best for watchin' a game, but perfect for a romantic evening."

"Went to Zinburger with my buddy on a weeknight. Place was hoppin', but we snagged a spot at the bar. Great view of the joint, nice design. Food was pricey, but worth it. Shared a kobe burger, double truffle fries, zucchini fries, and a bottle of vino. Left feelin' good, maybe because of the wine. Definitely comin' back to splurge. This place was top-notch."

"Benihana's where you wanna be when you got cash and a crew. Once or twice a year's enough. My Iowa pals come visit, we got time and money to burn. Friendly folks, love the cook-in-front-of-you vibe. Fire tricks can be a bit much, but hey. Not a sushi joint, so skip that. Hibachi's the way to go. If you're a kid, get the kiddie meal. I'm 30-something, my little ones are too wild for fancy places. But their fried rice? Top-notch."

"I checked out this boarding joint and I gotta say, it's not half bad. I left my little terrier there for a night and everything was A-okay. Sure, it's a bit pricey, but the place is huge and the dogs get to run around all day. That's worth a few extra bucks in my book. They got different sized play areas for different sized dogs and the staff was real friendly. I'd definitely use 'em again. It ain't perfect, but it's getting there."

"Hark! Good sir or madam, seek thou out this place,
In Belmont's heart, where atmosphere doth grace
The premises, with food most wondrous fair,
And service, that doth rival any there.
A burger, juicy and of finest sort,
Didst I devour, within this cozy Irish sport.
So, if thou art in search of sustenance fine,
And hospitality to match, do make it thine
To visit here, and taste their culinary delight,
Forsooth, 'twill be a veritable feast for thy sight."

"Tucked away in the MGM Grand, this joint's a gem.  Food's top-notch, especially the pork belly sandwich and caesar salad.  The pizza's good too, but could be crispier.  Still, it's a great spot for a break from the slots."

"Tortillas made this joint. Went at 12:30, got grub and a table quick. Had the bean and cheese burrito with guac on the side. Fresh and excelente, but the tortillas, man...homemade and off the chain. Menu's limited, but prices are right. Cute little spot, too. Dug it even more when I found out America was the owner, not some corny name."

"Tough times, indeed. Can't fill a Cirque du Soleil stadium on a Saturday night? That's rough. Went last minute, kid wanted to see it again. Enjoyed it, prime front center seats. Noticed new things second time around."
"Waverley Train Station's got limited grub options. Sandwiches, salads—that's about it. And don't expect much after dark. Shelves empty, staff scarce. It's a tight squeeze in there."

"Hark, what have we here? A new pretender to the throne, vying for the title of finest Thai cuisine in Las Vegas. But fear not, dear reader, for I shall give thee an honest account of my experience at Komol.

In sooth, I ventured forth to this establishment, unsure of what lay ahead. And lo, didst Komol deliver? Verily, their culinary prowess didst impress me mightily. Fresh spring rolls, crispy and delectable, didst start our feast. Next came the Pad Kee Mow, with tofu, a dish most wondrous and flavorful. Alas, my taste buds, unaccustomed to such spice, didst falter at level 3. Yet, I persisted, and the Panang curry with chicken didst bring a smile to mine lips.

Forgive me, dear gourmands, for my palate, unrefined, cannot yet handle the fiery heat of true Thai cuisine. But fear not, for I shall return, and with each successive visit, my tolerance shall increase, until at last, I shall give Komol the full five stars it doth deserve. Huzzah!"

"Been here twice. First time, 4/20/13. Place was jumpin'. Line to get to the rooftop, packed like sardines. Dancin' was tough, too many people. Second time, 1/10/14. Still busy, but managed to grab a beer and hit the dance floor. Drinks ain't cheap, $17 for a beer and cosmo. Bartenders knew their stuff, though. No problems either time. Good vibes, we'll be back."

"I've been here twice now. Like the way they work together, efficient as hell. Get the job done quick, too. Just had my car painted, so I didn't want 'em to use the high-pressure hoses. They were cool about it, used the regular one instead. Even offered to bundle and save me some cash when I asked for a detail on the inside."

"We stumbled upon this joint while explorin' our new city. Best find so far. \n\nWalked in for a late dinner, got seated quick and easy. Service was top-notch. Ordered some garlic naan, chicken tikka masala, and chicken vidaloo. Food came out fast, and it was freakin' delicious! Tikka masala was smooth, fresh. Beau got his vidaloo spicy, just right. Been back at least 8 times, always leave full and happy. (ITIS!)"

"Fare thee well, good sir! Forsooth, the victuals here be excellent, by my troth! 'Tis true, the confines be somewhat cramped, and the patrons, commonplace. But, prithee, pay no heed to the ambiance, for 'tis the cuisine that doth make this place worthwhile. Verily, the cooks of Scottsdale, skilled in their art, do prepare most delectable dishes, and at a fair price, I dare say. An it please thee, good sir, to partake of a meal in Scottsdale, sans the trouble of a long journey, then hasten hither, forsooth! In sooth, I wouldst give it five stars, were it not for the inconvenience of the site and its dimensions."

"Pimpin' ain't easy, but this joint's got you covered. Consignment and new gear, all top-notch. Vargas girl ties? Hundred bucks a pop. Everything else? Eighty-five, every damn thing. Lady behind the counter didn't even look up from her phone. Didn't offer no help neither."

"This joint's got some real nice trinkets. Colorful too. Furniture, sculptures, fabrics, bobbing turtles - they got 'em all. Picked up some decorative tiles for a buck apiece. Unique, cheap gifts. Good spot for an Arizona-themed present."

"Saturday mornin', 9:30 sharp. Seated right away. Service good. Enjoyed my Brunch Des Cantons. Beans cooked just right, pork variety nice. Fiancee liked her Brunch Sucre, but not too impressed. Coffee and OJ, solid. All in all, pleasant."

"September '07. Twice. What the hell?

Allergic reaction, viral something. Throat closed up, couldn't breathe. Nearly passed out.

Nurses? Top-notch. Private room? Bangin'.

Told 'em about my hidden veins, they listened. Butterfly needle, perfect.

Beau, parents, daughter visited. All pleased with my digs.

If somethin' else happens, Meriter's my hospital. Thanks."
"Panera, same in Madison. Quality grub, friendly folk. Busy joint, but they keep things movin'."

"Burgers were decent. Server, Dominic, was top-notch. Joint's clean, friendly, and good for families. Can't recall much about the grub, except for the endless fries. Burger I had was a tad dry. Might come back, but won't order that again. Place gets a second chance, though."

"Methinks 'twas fate that brought me to Burrito Boyz that day,
For at a meeting, where the grub was catered, didst I partake.
A mystery burrito, wrapped in secrecy, didst appear,
And with one bite, my taste buds didst sing with glee.

"Ah, what a wondrous sight! Avocado, a fruit most fair,
Didst mingle with the rest, in harmony so rare.
Their burritos, packed with all that's good and true,
Didst leave me in awe, and craving more anew.

"Alas, the Toronto location, doth falter, I do fear,
In quality, service, and price, doth not compare.
But still, my heart doth yearn for that sweet, sweet wrap,
For Burrito Boyz, my love, doth never slack."

"Methinks my love and I didst venture hither on a night most fair,
A date, if thou wilt, of sushi and drinks most rare.
The crowd, it didst swell, upon a Saturday eve,
With DJ's tunes, that didst lift our spirits high and free.
Our waitress, kind and fair, with menu's wisdom great,
Didst serve us well, and made our visit most elate.
We shall return, anon, to this place of delight,
For more of its yumminess, doth shine so bright and light."

"Went here for lunch with the missus. Nice spot. They give you a discount if you bike or walk. Check in on foursquare, use your Amex, get five bucks off. 

 Had a good time. I got the trout, she got the happy hour fish and chips. Food was top-notch. Only gripe was feeling a bit rushed. But the grub and drinks were great. Fish and chips were fresh, crispy. Trout came with green beans and peanuts. Got mash as a side, too. Fish was seasoned just right, green beans nice and crunchy. 

 All in all, a swell joint. Be back."
"Wine snob? No worries, they got you covered. Lobster, crab legs - can't go wrong. Custom dessert? You bet. Sit outside, enjoy the view. That's the ticket."

"Toast, a prime spot for a weekend breakfast. Efficient service, teamwork among staff, prices reasonable. Food exceeds expectations, especially eggs, coffee, corn bread, fruit. A great spot for young families, fast service, moderate prices. Grandparents will appreciate the tunes. If the food doesn't meet your lofty standards, try The Gallery, Cafe Monte, or Zebras, but be prepared to pay double Toast's prices. For me, Toast strikes the perfect balance between quality and cost."
"Surprised by the joint's offerings. Thought it was just another deli, but they got a menu that'll please anyone. Stopped in for a quick bite, but I'll be back for a real meal."

"Hark! If thou dost love Hip Hop and R/B, 'tis here thy quest doth end. A place most wondrous, full of cheer and joy, where thou mayst eat and make merry with friends. I, myself, did partake in their finest fare, a fire pit, worth the fifty gold coins 'twas priced at, for 'twas a feast most divine. But lo! The Rum Jungle doth transform, when night doth fall and restaurant doth close, into a club, where music doth play and people doth dance, as if the very heavens did open up and bless the place with rhythm. Thus, my friends and I, did stay and revel in the joy, for 'twas a night to remember, in year of our Lord, two thousand and five. And upon my return, in year two thousand and nine, the Rum Jungle did not disappoint, for 'twas still the same, a haven for those who love Hip Hop and R/B, with strong drinks and varied rums, a place of wonder, where I, myself, did have a hard time leaving, for other clubs in Vegas could not compare, to the Rum Jungle's charm and delight."

"Fair prices, generous portions, a feast for mine eyes! My belly, full and content, doth sing thy praise. Twice have I graced thy halls, once for break of day, once for evening's repast. Both times, service swift and courteous didst attend mine needs. Verily, a place to revisit, anon!"

"Don't judge a book by its cover. We passed by this joint dozens of times, thinking it was just another dive in a strip mall. But boy, were we wrong. Last night, we wanted some good Wisconsin grub, something different. So, I checked out reviews and decided to give this place a shot. My family was hesitant, but once we walked in, they were impressed. The joint was big, well-laid out, and the decor wasn't half bad either. And the food? Top-notch. The only gripe I had was the fish fry. It took forever to come and no one asked if I wanted more. But hey, they were packed, so I'll give 'em a break. Can't wait to go back."
"Worth the wait, my friend. Texas-style BBQ, like Franklin's in Austin. Avoid the crowd at 11, come at 1:30 for a shorter line."

"Fremont Street's where it's at, friend. More laid back, less flashy than the Strip. Historical sites, street performers, and tech, all mixed together. It's got a bit of grit, but that's part of the charm. Took public transit there, cheap but slow. Cabbing it back was the way to go. \n\nDug the vibes of the joints, bars, and eats. Affordable, not too fancy, but comfy. Like stepping back in time, you know? Everyone's chill, it's Vegas, after all. Restaurants and bars, some swanky spots, but cheaper and with character. That video screen's a real showstopper, too."

"Methinks 'tis a place most fair and clean,
Where food of quality doth abound.
A simple menu, yet full of delight,
Doth please mine eyes and stomach sound.
Cheesesteaks, fries, and more, all doth impress,
But watch thou out for cheese fries' excess,
For real thick cheese doth make it quite rich,
And may o'erwhelm thy taste's gentle switch.
Yet, verily, 'tis a place most meet,
Where we shall return, to eat and greet."

"O, what a wondrous sight doth meet mine eyes!
A place where furniture doth reign supreme,
In shapes and sizes, diverse and grand,
To fit each room, and suit each whim.

A coffee table, we sought, and an ottoman,
Of size most generous, to seat many a man.
The prices, steep they be, yet worth the cost,
For each piece, unique, and of artistic boast.

The salesfolk, friendly, didst not beset,
Nor did they greet us with a fawning threat.
We browsed at ease, and found no need,
To query them, their wares to heed.

A design center, too, they didst possess,
Where one might plan, and fashion, with great finesse.
Alas, the perfect piece, we didst not find,
But still, the visit, most pleasant, didst entwine."

"Met an Aussie mate at the diner, decided to do the whole American thing. Fun times, good eatin'. Friendly staff, laughed with 'em, like we were old pals. Food was top-notch, loved the chilli cheese fries - hard to find that good stuff across the pond. Had the Chicken Philly cheese steak, damn good, cooked just right, served quick. Good prices, too. Efficient service, friendly folks. I'd go back for lunch, no doubt."

A wee Irish pub, all cozy like, with wooden panels inside. Great spot to spend a lazy arvo or chow down on some hearty grub with mates. Perfect pitstop after a museum visit up north. Pints poured just right, drinks cheap 'n good. Food's top-notch, especially the beef, marinated in Guinness (bloody excellent, mate). Give the boxty's a go if ye're feelin' daring. Oh, 'n if ye're lookin' for the joint, it's on Monterey street, near the YMCA.

"Cheese curds, best of my life. Beer cheese soup, too. If you're a cheese fiend, sprint to this joint. 

Notes:
-Big portions, so pace yourself. 
-Curds, glorious curds. 
-Gluten-free bread, three options. 
-Dirt cheap prices. Four people, full bellies, under 70 bucks. 
-Cheese curds, did I mention them?"

"Methinks 'tis a fine establishment, this restaurant of which I speak. In California, at the Beverly Center, there doth lie another of its kind, but here, in Las Vegas, I have supped upon my last two visits. A comfy, cozy place, with portions most generous, and prices, fair. My companions and I, we could not finish all our victuals, so great was the bounty. I, myself, didst partake of salmon, prepared in three diverse manners, and found it most delectable. Beignets, too, we didst enjoy, and found them superior to those at Disneyland. A worthy place, indeed, for those who seek a meal, sans the pomp and circumstance of other high-end eateries in this city of sin. Our server, alas, didst err in our bill, charging us twice for gratuity, but our friend, keen of mind, didst note the mistake. And, verily, the server didst not return oft to attend to our needs, or to refresh our cups. But, on a Sunday night, at ten, the crowd was sparse, and we didst not tarry long."

"Coffee, good stuff. Student brings me two cups, Creme Brulee and Sugar N Spice. Spread the love, he says. Give one to co-worker, they like it. Don't live nearby, but support local. Tasty coffee, twist and all. One day, drop by."

"By chance, I found this haven, now my heart doth sing,
My love, a novice, did partake in their delight,
On Valentine's Day, a special deal didst they bring,
For couples, and now, together, we do take flight.

Our sessions leave us feeling grand and light,
The price, a mere $30, a true delight,
In Yakima, such bliss, I did not know,
But now, 'tis mine, and I do cherish it so."

"Methinks 'twas fortuitous fate that led me to this place,
A craving in my belly, a desire on my face.
My comrades, too, did share in this quest,
And thus, our band of merry men did find the best.

The hour of noon did strike, and busy was the scene,
Yet one of their own did approach with grace unseen.
He asked if aid was needed, and we did reply,
"First-timers here, good sir, do tell us why."

He led us to a side bar, samples did provide,
Of Jade Chicken, Carnitas, beans, and rice, all did abide.
We savored each morsel, and with glee did order more,
Our hunger sated, we did return once more.

The sun did set, and Snickerdoodle did arrive,
A sweet reprieve from toil, a gentle breeze did strive.
Each of us did partake, and joy did fill the air,
This outing, a success, we shall return, be sure."

"Viv B., a swell joint with a sophisticated yet youthful vibe. Their jewelry, art pieces, and scents are top-notch, and though their clothing selection is limited, it's carefully chosen. The owner, a sweet gal, named the shop after her grandma, whose portrait watches over the place like a stylish guardian angel."

New patient. Arrived 545, waited 'til 6. Room right away, 20-minute wait for the vet. Told her the issue, she took her back for a full exam. Cost $42 (chihuahua, size varies). Clipped her nails ($10, horrible parent, very long). Needed more done (x-rays, blood tests, two meds). Bill $700, no diagnosis. Pain and barely using left front paw/leg. Sent home with pain meds and anti-inflammatory. Back a month later, same thing. Nice doctors, staff seemed rushed, not concerned. Good overall, back a few times a month for nail clipping.
"Good times here. Grub's on point, service is snappy. Catch a flick then swing by."

"Hark! What a pleasant sight doth meet mine eyes!
A cinema of such grace and beauty lies
In this fair town, where ne'er before did I
Set foot within its hallowed walls. But lo!
The restrooms, clean and new, didst surprise,
As did the theatre, spacious and well-appointed,
With snacks aplenty at the counter, a feast
For mine own eyes. I shall return anon,
To revel in the joys this place doth bring."

"Hark, fair diners, listen to my tale,
Of Halcyon, a restaurant most regal.
Their food, a feast for royalty, no doubt,
But prices, dear friends, leave much to ponder.

Compare thee, if thou wilt, to Harvest Moon,
A grille most fine, with prices soon to swoon.
Appetizers, rich in flavor, yet so dear,
Fourteen dollars, pray tell, what dost thou hear?

My ribeye, a spackle, full of cheer,
Stuffed with veggies, cheese, and whatnot, my dear.
But lo, the cooking, a surprise, alack,
Medium well, or well done, I did not expect, alas.

Desserts, a sweet delight, but oh, the cost,
Twenty dollars, a sum most astronomical, at any rate.
So, friends, heed my words, and compare with care,
For Harvest Moon, a better choice, doth bear.

And lo, 'tis situated near the Blumenthal stage,
A coincidence, or fate, what dost thou presage?"

"Pho Kim Long, heard good things, checked it out. Not disappointed. Big place, seated quickly, attentive staff. Menu, impressive, not just pho, apps, entrees, smoothies, more. #11 Rare Steak and Brisket Pho, Chinese Doughnuts too. Doughnuts plain, used peanut sauce, good fix. Fast service, apps good, pho stole show. Steak, brisket, tender, delicious. Noodles plenty, broth rich. Going back."

"Airport's a dump, but that's Vegas for you. Security's a breeze, nothing special. People complain, but what's the point? Just grab your gear and move on. It's not worth sweating in the grand scheme."

"Hark! A tale of two visits, both with excellent service, I swear! 
A convention, thou ask? Indeed, 'twas the cause of my stay, 
And the hotel, it did provide a most spacious venue, fit for a king! 
The chamber assigned to me, luxurious and grand, did offer sweet repose, 
After a day filled with training, mingling, and drinks, as one does suppose. 
The space, so plentiful, allowed me to fully unwind, without a care, 
And though the cost, I cannot say, yet gratitude to my employer, I do declare! 
To experience it all anew, I would not hesitate, forsooth! 
The Venetian theme, a delight! The casino, a place of merriment and chance, 
And the eateries, a culinary journey, a true gastronomic dance! 
This part of the Strip, most ideal, a location most prime, 
Viva Las Vegas, indeed, a city of wonder, a place divine!"
"Solid joint. Killer cocktails, tequila's my poison. Nueva Latina bites, duck empenadas a highlight. Upscale vibes, attentive bartenders. Fun spot."

"Methinks 'twas one of th' best buffets e'er I saw,
With meats diverse, as lamb and prime rib, both cooked fair.
I do confess, I am quite choosy o'er sliders,
But here, they did impress, beyond compare.
The ramen, decent; crab legs, not too shabby,
A vast array of victuals, each dish, a joy to sample.
Not fond of buffets, I, but this one, an exception, doth make."
"Good workout at the gym during lunch. Hate the teeny bopper crap they play in the men's locker room, though."

"Cheap Chinese joint on Harris. Price is tight. Lunch special's a steal ($5-6, includes egg roll). Tea's a bit off, so I stick to water. Chicken's real, sauces ain't too salty, and veggies are plentiful. Don't expect authentic Cantonese or Szechuan. It's Americanized Chinese, but it's worth four stars for the price."

"Cool joint. Not big, but good vibes. Places to sit: high tops, bar stools, plush chairs, couches. Solid drinks. Great beer selection, like most Madison spots. Heard good things 'bout the grub, especially sandos and wraps. Lookin' forward to tryin' it out."

"First timer here. Loved it. $9 lunch, worth it. Downsides? Long wait, crowded walkways, kids running wild. But hey, that's part of the buffet vibe. Chocolate fountain, cotton candy, sweet tooth paradise. Variety of grub, nothing fancy, nothing nasty. Give it a shot."

"Hark, what news is this? A culinary delight in the North, they say! 

Fried Chicken, oh how sweet thy taste doth be! A generous portion for two, indeed. 

Catfish, verily, a fine dish, yet a mite too scanty, alack! 

Burgers, ho hum, a common fare, they do resemble. And thus, I ponder, why Hamburger Hut, when burgers be but middling, pray tell? Haha! 

A curious establishment, half shop, half eatery. Busy as can be, 'tis true, with fried chicken the popular choice, no doubt. 

But lo, the parking space, a scant seven, alas!"

"Eat'n Park, a joint I know well. Lived blocks away, back when Wilkie's Inn was still kickin'. Memories of drunken brawls, but that's another story. This place, it's the real deal. Scrambled eggs, french toast, burgers, pickles - the works. And don't forget them smiley face cookies. Can't get enough. If you're new to Pittsburgh, make sure to stop by. You won't regret it."

"A merry inn, with theme park on its roof,
My family found, at price most fair and proof.
With amenities galore, 'twas fit for kings,
Though not a five-star, still, 'twas pleasant things.

Atop the building, pool did shine,
Where water sports did take their place in line.
And rides, oh rides, how they did thrill,
Upon the roof, a wondrous sight to fulfill.
As guests, we gained entry, free of charge,
To this most lofty realm, where fun doth large.
The site, most prime, the Strip doth border,
Convenient, indeed, for those who do explore."

"Clean joint. Good for fam and buddies. Pizza's decent, not top-shelf but better than most bar grub. Thin crust, ground beef, tasty. Games galore - pool, shuffleboard, TVs. Focaccias are my jam too. Weekends are prime time for sports."

I took an iPad 2 from work to get fixed here. They fixed it in six hours, no problem. Needed a new glass, cost me $129 plus tax. Happy with the service, they give a 90-day warranty. Wish they were a bit more professional, but they got the job done. Shop's on Mill Ave, easy parking and drop-off.

"Jasmine Tokyo, give it a shot. Big guy, 6'4\", folks think I play for the Cards. Owners probably sh*t themselves when I walk in. Not a glutton, just there for the seafood, sushi, and green tea. Sushi selection beats anything AYCE in the Valley. Twenty types of rolls, real tuna, salmon, snapper nigiri. Fried rice, Chinese sausages, grilled chicken - all delicious. Raw oysters, never had 'em this good in AZ. Service, pleasant. Decor, Claim Jumper vibes. Huge restaurant, huge selection, veggie paradise."

"Hark! What place is this they call Bouchon?  Many speak of it with glee,  
But ne'er have I set foot within its walls,  
Until this day, when curiosity didst beckon me.  
'Tis said it lies within the Venetian's southwest quarter,  
But who, pray tell, hath a compass in a casino's thrall?  
Aye, 'tis by the registration lobby, simple as can be,  
Take elevators up, and straight away, 'tis there to see.  
A brief wait for brunch didst we endure,  
The menu, much like breakfast, save a few new dishes to allure.  
Chicken and waffles, oh how grand!  
The waffles, with bacon bits, a culinary brand.  
The chicken, roasted, not fried, a wise choice indeed,  
For naught can beat this dish, in all the land, I do aver.  
French toast, a feast for thine eyes, yet not so grand,  
Best to try another dish, at thy command.  
The ambiance, alas, doth suffer, I do confess,  
Dated decor, and tables too close, to make one stress.  
Two lonely men, with coughs, didst sit alone,  
Their escorts of yestereven, left behind, unknown.  
Yet still, I say, give Bouchon a go,  
For chicken and waffles, worth the trip, dost flow."

"Coffee here's top-notch. Had their red velvet latte today and it's in a league of its own. Employees are friendly and the joint's got a cozy feel. Only gripe's the price, but it's worth it. No high chairs, but that's minor. I'll be back."

"Hark! A business breakfast we did organize,  
And by the service, our spirits did rise.  
A choice table, with windows facing, did they provide,  
And for our purses, a tiny chair did they devise.  
  
My meal, the duck hash and eggs, did please my taste,  
Though pancakes, too, did seem most fair and bright.  
Classy and elegant, yet casual, did they make,  
This Tableau, a place of delight."

"Stayed at NY NY in Vegas. Hotel's a mini-city. Big casino, plenty of tables and slots. Food's a plus - cheap eats or high-end dining. Stayed on the 32nd floor of the Century Tower. Best view in Vegas - strip and mountains, lit up at night. Room was spacious, comfy for three guys. A bit dated, but clean and functional. Separate sink room, nice touch. High-end shower, plenty of hot water. Impressed with my stay, would recommend."
"Cheba Hut, never a bad meal. Food's great, subs toasted, yum. Must-try in Mesa."

"First off, my girl and I hit this joint in Vegas. I'm dressed down, the only one in the place who ain't tryin' to impress nobody. But the hostess gives me the stink-eye like I'm some kinda scrub. C'mon, lady, you work in Vegas, you know the drill. Rich dudes and their sugar babies, that's the name of the game. Anyways, the place is poppin', real classy, upscale joint. Food's top-notch, especially the salmon sashimi. Damn, that shit's good. Two days later, I'm still thinkin' about it. New standard for salmon, fo sho. Lobster's pretty sweet too. Prices are steep, but hey, you gotta pay to play, right? Minus the snooty hostess, this place gets five stars from me."

"Cafe grub's good, real good. Eight bucks gets you a blueplate special, comes with soup and salad bar too. Salad bar's top-notch, even got fresh fruit for dessert. Don't expect fancy, just a damn good value. Staff's friendly too. They got dessert specials every month for two bucks."

"Food was top-notch, but service was a bit wonky. You don't order from the sushi chef, you gotta go through the waitress. We got three rolls and some sushi, you'd think the sushi would come first? Nah, they brought out all the rolls and forgot about the sushi till we reminded 'em. But hey, their fish was fresh and didn't taste fishy, so that's a plus. Will be back, and their AYCE deal is a steal with plenty of options."

"Free? Hell yeah, that's the way to do it. Got into one of them LMFAO nights and it was top-notch. Ended our Vegas trip with a bang. Each room's got its own vibe, specially the library. Not too cramped, not too loud. XS still my favorite, but damn, these club designers know how to bring the heat. All about creativity and throwin' a killer party."

"Hark, good sir or madam, seek thou seafood delight?
Then hasten thee to Boardwalk Billy's forthwith!
Their steampot, a feast most wondrous and fair,
With broth so savory, doth make my mouth to water.
And shrimp, oh shrimp, how bountiful thy portion!
I pray thee, keep the oysters, give me more of these.
Aye, and the potatoes, roasted to perfection,
With corn, a sweet accompaniment, doth make
This meal most satisfying, fit for any king.
And chowder, clam, a delicacy of the sea,
Doth taste of heaven, a true gastronomic spree.
Thursdays, we gather, trivia our quest,
And drinks, two dollars, a price most modest.
Even drafts, local, of finest brew,
Two coins, a bargain, doth make my heart sing anew.
Galleria, the place, where we do frequent,
Service, prompt, and friendly, doth never falter.
But alas, good sir, their burgers, a woe,
Avoid them, stick to seafood, wings, and thou shalt know
No disappointment, nay, a culinary bliss."
"Good grub, nice folks. Been comin' here a bit. Prices went up some, but still worth it for the curry."

"By chance, we stumbled upon this humble abode,
Whose sign, Chicago Gyros, did our hunger implore.
A family-run establishment, cozy and snug,
With fare that did our taste buds most kindly allure.

I ordered my usual, a gyro, and fries,
The latter, standard issue, crispy and hot,
But the former, oh so plentiful and fine,
Did fill me up, a feat most wondrous and not.

The proprietor and his daughter, kind and bright,
Did attend to us with warmth and gentle might.
Our victuals came forthwith, piping hot and neat,
A pleasure it was, to dine at this eatery so discreet.

Indeed, I do cherish the local and true,
And thus, shall return, to this place anew."

"Methought the romaine lettuce served with spring rolls did overflow in bounty. Swift and attentive, the four servers did attend to mine every need. A pleasant experience indeed, and my first taste of pho within this city's walls. The broth, though not the finest I have savored, did not disappoint."

"A Starbucks once, now bakery, doth pique my interest. Strange hours, indeed, yet still I ventured forth. Stuffed cookies, a delight! With treats within, like Oreos, cheesecake, and such. Cake pops, too, in varied hues. Caramel apples, chocolate-dipped marshmallows, oh my! Good service, fair prices, a pleasant surprise. But alas, their schedule doth confound, a puzzle to unravel. I shall return, forsooth, to partake in their sweet delights."

"This joint's part of a chain, but don't let that turn you off. It's got some top-notch grub and brews. I had the flammekuchen with Gruyere and smoked meat, and my missus went for the veggie option. Both were damn good. Next time, I tried the meat dish with ham, pork knuckle, sausage, and a killer sauerkraut. We watched the Habs game at the bar after our meal. All in all, it's worth checking out, especially for the beer."

"Hark! What news is this? A humble tavern,
On Mondays, doth offer such a bargain.
A burger, priced at five dollars, thou shalt gain,
When thou dost purchase, with three dollars, a beer of fine quality.
'Tis a deal most wondrous, and the victuals, most delicious.
So, gather round, good sirs and madams, and partake
In this feast, fit for a king, or commoner, as thou wilt."

"My taste buds ain't exactly refined when it comes to Indian grub. My tongue's too used to the bland, and the spices leave me feeling like I've been set ablaze. But I decided to toughen up and give it another shot. Went with the Kashmiri curry, and a cold one to wash it down. And damn if I didn't enjoy it. Each flavor stood out, instead of getting lost in the heat. Not bad, not bad at all. I'll be back for more."
"Sashimi, good. Rolls, plenty. Spice, yes. Tuna, salmon, combo. Room left, HD TV big. Distraction, porcelain cats, Japanese decor."

"Aaron, you got some top-notch customer service skills, my man. Same goes for that brunette bartender. You two are a force to be reckoned with. Now, about those nachos - they were a real challenge, but I'll be damned if I didn't enjoy 'em. Made some new pals too - Greg and Mariam from Cali, and Mark from NM. Give 'em a shoutout when you can. Keep up the good work, and I'll make sure to swing by again soon."

"Hark! What's this? A Cuban eatery, by my troth!
The sandwiches, they doth taste of authenticity,
And pastries, oh so sweet, a true delight.
Breakfast, it doth fill me up, and not too greasy,
A budget-friendly feast, a true godsend, I say.

Ironbeer and Materva, drinks of old Cuba,
Here found, a rare treat, my heart doth sing.
Om nom nom, I savor each delicious sip,
A taste of Havana, in this distant land.

Alas, they do compare themselves to Portos,
But fear not, friend, for they are not the same.
No long lines here, a mercy, praise the Lord,
The pastries, though fewer, still of high renown.

So if thou seeketh Cuban fare, look no further,
For Yummo, 'tis the place, a true treasure."

"Lived here three years, still call it home. Noise, parking issues? Sure. Rent's steep, too. But damn, it's beautiful. Inspiring, really. Met some good folks here, expanded my network. Gave it four stars 'cause it's not perfect, but it's close. If you're lookin' for a place, start here. Year minimum, that's my advice. Can't wait for the new village, Sonoran Village. Similar setup, other side of the mall."

"In May, a gathering at Caesars didst I attend,
Whose grandeur and luxury didst my senses wend.
Though oft I had visited, ne'er didst I stay,
Until that day, when in the Octavius Tower they didst me convey.
A room most spacious, with bedding soft and inviting,
Bathroom, too, with all amenities, exciting.
The view, oh, the view! A sight most fair and bright,
Caesars, indeed, doth know how to make one feel quite right."

"Verily, I say unto thee, fair reader, that mine experience at this establishment was most pleasant indeed! A half pound Jalape\u00f1o Jack burger, with onion rings beside, didst I order, and oh, how grand it was! The burger, with its spices in perfect harmony, and meat of highest quality, from Midwestern fields, didst tantalize mine taste buds. And let us not forget the cheese, so rich and flavorful, that didst complement the dish most excellently. The onion rings, crispy and golden, didst delight mine senses as well.

A hearty portion, indeed, for I didst feel most satisfied, and full, I didst not leave. Yet, a minor quibble, good sir, for mine bill didst amount to eleven and change, a sum, methinks, a tad steep for so humble an abode, that doth cater to those in search of swift sustenance. But fear not, dear reader, for this is but a small complaint, and shall not deter thee from partaking in this delectable repast. I do recommend it, to all who seek a burger most excellent!"

"Methinks this place doth bring to mind
The Italian eatery, Pompeii, of Chicago kind.
Where my roommate and I did oft partake
In victuals from thence, our hunger to slake.

We ordered carry-out, as 'twere our wont,
And I, in sooth, didst deviate from our wont.
A panini, with salami, turkey, ham, and mozzarella,
I didst choose, with red wine vinaigrette, a tasty fellows.

The ingredients, fresh and well-packaged, didst seem,
And prices, though average to mine eyes, mayhap a dream.
For in this place, I wouldst not mind,
To try other dishes, of their kind."
"Burgers, built your way. Fries, served crazy-style. Hot, fresh, cooked to order."

"Verily, I must confess, fair friends,  
That I have graced this place with my presence,  
Aye, more than once, and found it to be,  
In sooth, a haven of mirth and revelry.  
'Tis true, my dear companions, that I've seen  
Fairer clubs in the land of the maple leaf,  
But, by my troth, this place doth hold its own,  
Against the rest, in this fair valley, 'tis shown."

"Thin noodles, woked chicken & shrimp, scallions, egg, cabbage, Thai spice. Squeeze a lemon, I'm in heaven. One order feeds three, but we get two. Honey chicken, yummy appetizers, spring and egg rolls. Friendly service, no wait. Good Asian food at a fair price."

"Hyde's got a swanky vibe, perfect for a romantic night out. But watch out for those stunning wait staff, they might just steal your attention. Calamari's top-notch, crispy and flavorful. Wine's pricey, but worth it. And don't even get me started on the soda prices, six bucks a pop? Ouch."

"Whoa, this joint's a real behemoth. Don't reckon I've seen all of it yet. Multiple stages, upstairs rooms, you name it. The gals here are a real treat, too. Course, might be 'cause I'm a gal myself. Nah, it's 'cause they're strippers, that's why. Strippers, they're good people, and they smell nice too."

Two nights at Aria didst I stay,
A grand hotel, in truth, they say.
My company paid, 'twas their desire,
For such expense, I wouldst not aspire.

Drinks at the pool, a costly affair,
A sum, indeed, beyond compare.
No chocolates or turn-down service, I found,
Yet, all else, was quite profound.

Bath products, of lower end, alack,
And quality, not of the finest tack.
Restaurants, a delight, I must confess,
Thai cuisine, in the US, a rarity, at best.

Casino, pleasant, smoke-free, they say,
Servers, quick, in a timely way.
Pool, a haven, with choices, a few,
Adult-oriented, peaceful, anew.
Shade and umbrellas, a wish, I do declare,
Yet, a great pool experience, beyond compare.

In conclusion, a grand hotel, indeed,
Pricey, yet, luxury, doth proceed.

In sooth, this hotel doth boast a modern theme,
A chill and classy refuge from the city's scheme.
Its pros, my friends, are many and fair,
A clean pool, rooms, and hallways beyond compare.
The rooms themselves are fitted with all mod cons,
Electric stove, fridge, microwave, and dinner table, no less.
The staff, too, are friendly and kind,
Eager to help, their service most divine.
But alas, my dear, there be a con,
For those who seek to party, this may not be the spot.
Little black dresses, alcohol, and stumbling feet,
May earn hard stares, and trouble, perchance, doth meet.

"Hark, what rating doth my stars bestow?
A 2.5, nay, a 3, I say, yet know
That coffee, place, and brew, did make amends
For that fourth star, which otherwise doth wend.

Oh, food, thou art a curious thing,
For some, a pleasure, for others, a sting.
Authentic Spanish dishes, a delight,
But for those who have tasted, a sorry sight.

Olives, good, gambas too, a treat,
Paella, risotto-like, yet a feat.
Tortilla, burnt and dry, yet fair,
Wine selection, limited, beyond compare.

Coffee, a saving grace, a gem,
Cold brew and kopi luwak, a worthy theme.
Paraphernalia, a sight to see,
For caffeine lovers, a paradise, 'twill be.

Menu, a mystery, a secret kept,
Cafe bombon, a Spanish classic, unheard.
I shall return, to verify,
And savor coffee, a true delight, anon."

"Richardson's, a place so dear,
Where warmth and joy do abound,
A haven from the world outside,
Where laughter doth resound.

Their cuisine, a wondrous sight,
With flavors that doth delight,
Green chile potato, a dish so fine,
And pork, oh how divine!

I, myself, do love the sea,
And fish, a feast for me,
But scallops, blackened and grand,
Did recently take my hand.

A salad, huge and fresh, did join,
The scallops, oh what a treat,
Tortilla, rice, beans, and spice,
A dish that doth entice.

Wine, a bottle or two, did flow,
And pizza, plain, yet sweet,
A feast for all, a time to share,
At Richardson's, we did meet.

So, go thou forth, and dine with glee,
At Richardson's, a place to be,
But call ahead, a reservation make,
Lest waiting, thy patience doth break."

"Tucked away in a strip mall, this joint's easy to miss. Went with Elite Emily, and we were the only ones there. Orders were huge, fresh, and damn tasty. Had to ask for a box. Looking forward to trying something else next time."

"By Jove, the lad doth not delight in museums, but this one didst stir within him mirth and glee. A plethora of ancient instruments of love and passion, and strange contraptions besides, didst catch his eye and hold his attention. Clips of videos, films, and demonstrations, didst play before him, and a vast array of objects, steeped in sexual intensity, didst surround him. Bonds of pleasure, and images of desire, didst fill his gaze, and a rich tapestry of erotic evolution didst unfold before him. Verily, 'twas a place of wonder and fascination, and he wouldst return anon. The staff, kind and unobtrusive, didst attend to his needs with grace and courtesy."

"Sunday afternoon, no reservation needed. This joint's the cat's pajamas. 

Terrific smells, swell decor, and top-notch service. Mentioned I was vegan, chef showed me what was good to go and what could be tweaked. Who knew oyster sauce was in everything? 

Give it a shot. Can't wait to come back for that green curry and tofu... mmm."

"Methinks I've visited this place twice before,
And found it to be quite pleasant, by my troth.
Our latest visit was with kin and friends,
And all did leave with full bellies and merry grins.

If thou dost seek unique cocktails, well-crafted,
Then this place is a must-visit, ere thou art daft.
They've categorized their drinks by era,
And the menu doth provide a tale of each draught.

Happy hour, with steaks at half the price,
Did tempt us all, and we did partake with glee.
The filets were cooked near perfect, save one,
But all the sides we ordered were quite won.

Truffle mac and cheese, a favorite among us,
And the "Farmer" flatbread pizza, oh so tasty!
With bacon, spinach, and a cracked egg,
It's a dish that doth defy explanation, so neat.

Desserts, we thought not of them,
Until the server did describe their charm.
We tried their pizooki, homemade doughnuts too,
And all agreed, they were a heavenly delight, anon.

A satisfying meal, with drinks and atmosphere,
Away from the Strip's hustle and bustle, a true gem.
So if thou find thyself in Las Vegas,
Do give this place a visit, 'tis a true treasure, I do reckon."
"Patio's grand, perfect for shootin' the breeze with pals. Inside's tidy, service is snappy. Pastries? Mouthwaterin'."

It was a sweltering spring day in Chinatown and I was famished. I'd had enough of my usual Thai food and was eager to try something new. I stumbled upon HSP on Yelp and couldn't believe my eyes - had this place just opened? I made my way to the end of the Chinatown Plaza extension on Wynn Rd and Spring Mountain, where I found a small shop with a variety of poke bowls. The woman working there told me they'd been open for five years, and I felt like a fool for not knowing about it sooner. The quantities of poke were small, but that was a good sign - it meant the fish was fresh. I'm not from Hawaii or an islander, but I could tell the difference between fresh and funky fish. My Shoyu Limu Tuna bowl was delicious, with no trace of funk and only fresh, warm rice sprinkled with black sesame seeds. It was a steal at around $8. I couldn't wait to come back and try more.

"Boys had a blast. Pricey, but worth it for the clean, well-lit atmosphere. WiFi's a bust, grub's mediocre and overpriced. Can't bring your own drinks, but hey, at least they got Pepsi. Games were in good shape."

"Been comin' here since the 80s. Consistent, no frills, good grub, fair price. Service is top-notch. On a cold winter's night, nothin' better than battlin' through the double doors into a warm, invitin' aroma of Indian spices. Watch out for the naan, they only come in feed-the-5,000 size."

"Patio wait time's a bitch. Been here plenty, know they don't take reservations. But a 90-minute wait at 5:30's a bit much. Food's always great though. Get a steak, hubby does skate or short ribs. Service is solid too. If you want the patio, be prepared to wait. People watching's top-notch, but the sensors only work close by in the casino. Worth it in the end."

"Never caught a Cirque de Soleil show before. Nor any Vegas act. But damn, I loved it. Musicians killed it, dancers popped, acrobats took my breath. One hell of a night. And hell yeah, free tix made it sweeter."

"Lobster and shrimp dip, we ordered. Twice, we sent it back. Too cheesy, it was. Chips broke, sauce couldn't handle the weight. Off the bill, they took it. Parmesan chicken and baked potato, we tried instead. Good, it was. Enough for two, it was."
"Good eatery. Unique menu, witty. Food, top-notch. Pierogi sliders, eggplant lasagna, both A-1."

"Good eatery, plenty on the menu. Breakfast too, eggs, taters, that sorta thing. Not sure 'bout the authenticity, but they got good meat. Pastrami, corned beef, can't go wrong. Service top-notch, friendly folks. Popular spot, I'll be back."

"Went on a date night with the missus. Had a swell time. Our instructor, Melissa, was a peppy gal, full of energy. She talked fast, but gave us enough time to paint each step. There was a finished painting to reference. Drinks were average price, five bucks for beer, seven for wine. Last call drinks were half off. Didn't eat there, but people were snackin' on apps throughout the class. Would do it again, and recommend it to anyone lookin' for somethin' fun and different."
"Grave, 7 a.m., Joy. Great server. Saimin, Portuguese sausage, scrambled eggs, rice. Ono after a night out."
"Food, authentic. Spicy, like the name said. Went there twice, happy both times."

In fair Summerlin, where folks do dine and drink,
A new establishment doth now take its place,
A pub, where one may find solace and cheer,
And partake in victuals of merriment and grace.

The staff, so friendly, doth attend to thy needs,
With smiles and service that doth make one feel at ease,
Their chicken sandwich, a dish most wondrous and fine,
Doth satisfy thy hunger and doth taste divine.

Yet, alas, there be a few things to note,
For those who doth frequent this place, beware,
The house whisky, a drink most vile and base,
Doth taste of cinnamon and orange, a wretched mix, I pray thee, pass it by, and save thy taste.

And lo, the bathroom sinks, a curious sight,
A slab of tile, tilted, doth make it hard to stay dry,
A basin, a better choice, doth save thy clothes,
From splashes and the limited space, which doth annoy.

In conclusion, a great place to visit, indeed,
With food most delicious, and staff most kind,
But shun the bathroom sinks, and the house whisky,
And thou shalt have a merry time, I doth predict.

"Been here thrice now, and'll keep comin' back. Best buffet value for locals, and with coupons, a good deal for visitors too. Prime rib's perfect every time, ask for a thicker cut and they're happy to oblige. Crab legs are fresh, and they got several types of shrimp. Somethin' for every seafood lover. Mexican food could use some work, enchiladas been a bit hard, but they got plenty of Asian choices, and the American part's always delicious. And the desserts?
