Oh yeah, lots of 'em, with plenty of no-sugar-added options for those who need 'em. Servers are professional and personal."
"Family-owned joint, great service. Bagels, top-notch. Breakfast and lunch menus, plenty to choose from. Kitchen's accommodating, too."

"Moved to the other side of town, found a new sushi joint nearby. Service and rolls, top-notch. Happy hour, 4-8 pieces, try a bunch of different ones. Nice spot, loving everything so far. Better than my old spot, I Love Sushi."
Wine and bruschetta, real good. Apple one, best. Live music, nice touch. Outside, needs work. Fire pit, add some life. Great spot, still.

"Verily, they do take their time with mine own children, and are most skilled. Ofttimes, they have a list of those who wait, and are full booked, so 'tis wise to call ahead and make a meeting. Forsooth, 'tis well worth the while, for the outcome doth speak its own tale."
"Pizza impressed me. Mozzarella and provolone blend, not too much provolone. Service top-notch. Been underwhelmed here before, but yesterday they brought their A-game."

"Great spot for a family horseback ride. Setup's easy, paperwork's a breeze. North Scottsdale desert's lookin' good this time of year. Grounds are perfect for a spring ride. Staff's friendly, courteous, and knowledgable. I'd go back in a heartbeat."

"Roller coasters, casinos, hotels—life's a thrill. Sick as hell, who cares? You're young once. Lines were weird, inefficient. Everyone made a mad dash, 10 minutes before closing. Scary, hilarious ride. Didn't plan my shirt well. Laughed with my girlfriend. Pictures were $15 each, $22 for two. Split it, charged two cards. Employee gave me a look. Be happy, dude."

"Hark, fair maiden, what news dost thou bring?
A tavern named Whiskey Dicks, of dubious fame,
In location most vile, yet within, a gem.
The service, swift and kind, doth make amends,
For beer, a decent choice, doth flow like streams.
A hearty welcome, from a lass so fair,
In shorts, didst greet us, with a smile so rare.
I prayed for Ranger IPA, a brew most fine,
And lo, they didst possess a range divine.
My feast, a Philly cheese, with fries of might,
The seasoning, a marvel, a true delight.
Alas, the steak, a tad dry, and bread, excessive,
Yet onions, fresh, and peppers, a true delicious.
Thus, with the ale, and service so bright,
I raised my rating, one whole star in flight.
For most pubs, alas, do lack such brews of renown,
But here, a few New Belgian, and Sam Adams crown.
Since nigh, my work doth lie, I shall return anon,
To savor more, their ale, and cheerful tone."

"Eaten here plenty. Used to get delivery at my old gig, then worked just a block away. Hit it up once a week, always the Chicken Pita. Grilled bird, nice flavor. Whole wheat pita, cucumber sauce, hot garlic chili sauce. Perfect. Highly recommend. Eight bucks for a full pita, not bad."

"Place is solid, been here a few times. Staff, A+, friendly and prompt. Vibe, B+, like a Toby Keith's JR. Entertainment, A+, live music is awesome. Bar, A, got everything except Norm. Prices, average. Food, B, pass on the steak, go for burgers and fries. Overall, give this place a SOLID A. Check it out, you'll love the people and atmosphere. We'll be back for sure. Burgers."

"Methinks 'twas my first time at this place,
With an educated shooter, who showed me grace.
He brought guns for me to use, and thus,
My second time shooting, but first at a range, 'twas.
They sold us bullets and targets, and gear to protect,
And off we went, to an enclosed room, to shoot and inspect.
The place, well-set up, in a central spot,
The staff, kind and helpful, did show me what's what.
Two others sought certification, a test they did take,
But I, in need of more practice, didst not partake.
Tourists abounded, which didst vex mine eyes,
I doth hope they open another place, for locals to prize.
Prices, too high, for those who do not know,
But classes, free, a gift, for those who do show.
On a Monday, at nine, I didst venture forth,
Not busy, but as the day wore on, a crowd didst gather beneath.
So, go during the week, early, to avoid a wait,
I shall return, to practice, and take a test, but fate,
Shall seek a cheaper place, for bullets and targets, to find,
For thriftiness, doth beckon, and I must be kind."
"Food's great. Better than other Biancos, more options. Service? Slow, forgetful. Portions? Small. Went on Sat night, had our pick of tables, no wait. That's hit or miss."

"Vietnamese Sandwiches, the only reason I come here. Best in Las Vegas, trust me. Fresh-baked bread, soft and crunchy, still warm. Tried others, this place wins. 

Other dishes? Meh. Vietnamese, Chinese, Thai, but not super authentic. Stick to sandwiches and boba (decent, not great). No Pho fan here. 

Price? Dirt cheap, $3.50. Minimum $20 for debit cards, annoying. No cash, no problem. 

Dine in? It's alright. Odd cleaning product smell, weird sea theme, eye-sore bathroom hallway. 4/5 stars for price, sandwiches, boba."
"Barbecue was decent, not amazing. Sauce selection, top-notch. Kettle chips, free and tasty. Food arrived quick, like lightning."

"Damn good burger at The Farm. Sweet potato fries, too. Powdered sugar, nice touch. But service? Forget about it. Forgot our fries, had to ask twice. By the time they arrived, we were almost done with our burgers. Slow, man. Real slow."
"Ten years I've been comin' here. Try other joints, but always end up back at Nancy's. Friendly folks, good work, like my nails and pedis."

"This joint's great. Got a ton of hand-me-downs for my kid when he was born, but he couldn't wear 'em all. So, I hit up some consignment shops. Checked out a few, but Smarty Pants was the best. Friendly owners, nice selection, and got some sweet deals. They're expandin' too, gonna have a separate spot for furniture and more adult clothes. Can't wait to go back and spend my consignment cash."

"Paul's review got me thinking. This joint's got a sweet setup, outdoors but feels like a club. Acoustics are top-notch. But, let's talk turkey - drinks are pricey. Like, credit card or hide-your-flask expensive. The parking lot's begging for a keg party, but we tailgate before shows anyway. Ten bucks gets you a 12-pack and a sandwich, or one 24-ounce beer inside. My two cents? Lower those drink prices, folks. Still, this place is solid, bringing in better acts all the time."

Verily, fair friends, we chanced upon this place,
Whose praise on Yelp did loudly sing its grace.
From Scottsdale, we didst journey to Tempe,
To partake of victuals and imbibe.

The doorman, with a query, didst ask my age,
And, knowing I was past three decades, didst engage
In pleasant conversation, wishing us delight.
The bartenders, too, didst tend to our each plight,
Asking oft if all was well, with cheerful sight.

A blue cheese burger, savory and fine,
Didst please my taste, and my boyfriend's, likewise divine.
He sampled beers, three in total, with glee,
And found them all to his liking, as bright as can be.

The atmosphere, casual and sportive, didst suit,
Our mood and purpose, in merry fruit.
A great place, indeed, for grub and ale,
We left, in high spirits, with naught but praise to hail.

"Drove by, saw a vacant storefront with no signs. Turned out they moved across the street, closer to the other furniture joints - At Home, Creative Leather, Spencer's Appliance. New spot's got more light, big windows all around."

"Verily, I say unto thee, good sir or madam, that Princess Nails, though humble in appearance, doth possess a gem of an employee, one Michelle, whose skills in eyebrow waxing be most excellent. My second visit, much like the first, did prove her worth, and I do implore thee, dear reader, to request her services, should thou decide to venture forth into this establishment. Alas, I cannot, in good conscience, grant it a full five stars, for tidiness doth not seem to be its strongest suit. Yet, I must confess, Michelle's prowess doth make up for this deficiency. Take heed, my words are based solely on my experiences with eyebrow waxing, and naught else."

"Aged inn, not new, not grand,
No thoughts of feasting, hand in hand.
Yet fate didst lead us to its door,
And lo, the spread was fair, not poor.
Though choice was limited, all was fine,
A pleasant surprise, indeed divine.
Worthy of return, this place doth be,
For those who seek a meal most heartily."

"In Phoenix, a few summers teach you where to find watering holes. Sphinx's date shake cools you down after a long, hot afternoon. It's a treat that's been around for decades, hydrating sweaty residents."

"Been eager for this joint to open. Went there second night, pretty damn good. Service, chips, salsa, grub, and drinks all top-notch. They did a swell job fixin' up the inside. Another solid spot in the area, variety's always welcome."

"Jimmy John's finally made it to town. People raved about it, so we gave it a shot. Two sandwiches caught our eye - the No 9 Italian Night Club on a crispy French roll and the No 12 Beach Club on hearty seven-grain bread. Quality stuff, no doubt. Good bread, too. Prices were fair. But the joint was loud, what with the tunes blasting and the echoey decor. New spot, though. Maybe they'll tone it down as time goes on."

"Went to a burger joint at Mandalay first. No service for five minutes. Left. Came here. Service good, not snooty. Got different tasting menus. Mine was four courses sans wine. Cold broccoli soup, lobster curry, foie gras filet, Armagnac dessert. Everything presented well, tasted great. First time with foie gras. Rich, but balanced by filet. Junk was tasty. Only misstep, basic mashed potatoes. Atmosphere romantic, view stunning, experience to remember. Not cheap, but worth it."

"A real swell little cafe, right in the heart of town. Tucked away, but worth finding. Between Eaton Center and Place Ville-Marie, you'll spot it. More of a counter than a sit-down joint, but don't let that deter you. Orders are quick, service is snappy, just like the location. A hidden gem."

"Big meals. Came here with colleagues during a seminar at the Hilton. Sat down quick, our server hustled with a smile. Ordered a cheeseburger, fries, and salads. Salads looked like three servings combined. Steak and mushroom, fruit on top. Portions shocked us. Cheeseburger came well done, but burnt. Ate it, but disappointed. Good spot for a bite. Riviera has poor food options. Eat here again? Only if nearby. Glad to be back in SF."

After our woeful night at PURE, we stumbled, inebriate, towards Poetry. The sweet melodies of hip hop, a welcome respite from the tedium that had beset us, greeted our ears. Our initial visit occurred on a Thursday eve, or rather, Friday morn, around the hour of 1:30, with nary a penny charged for entry (a feat of magic, indeed). The fairer sex paid a mere $20, as I recall. Verily, we danced the night away, imbibing in drinks that flowed swiftly, and reveling in mirth. This haven, a paradise for aficionados of hip hop, shall be my destination of choice whenever Fortune guides me to Las Vegas. We returned the following eve, and, lo, the merriment continued unabated.

"Hark! Fish and Chips, perchance? Aye, had them, with quesadilla too,
Last eve, and deemed them most delectable, I do confess.
But, alack, this morn I feel a tad sluggish, 'tis true,
Yet blame not the victuals, for they were quite fine, I do aver.
The tavern, neat and tidy, boasted a fair maid,
Whose service was prompt and most courteous, I must say.
A quiz night, or trivia, did ensue, and all was mellow,
Save for the tap beers, which seemed quite standard, I do tell thee.
Still, I shall return, for a nightcap, 'tis my intent,
Since 'tis but a short stroll from mine abode, thou wilt see."
"Smoked salmon, egg white omelet. Nice staff, great ambiance, easy parking. Prices, comparable to downtown Scottsdale. Drink, a bit weak. Return, definitely."

"Hark! My review doth speak of what I didst order,
A White Pizza, straight and plain, yet full of flavor.
Cheesy, but not too much, so as to be a burden,
One slice, a meal, for one of moderate means.
Fresh from the oven, hot and savory,
Ricotta, in great quantity, a true delight.
I do confess, a tad more creamy, my desire,
But still, a worthy slice, and worth the fire.
In Las Vegas, five dollars, a fair price,
For late night morsels, a convenient device.
The staff, kind and quick, a joy to behold,
So, heed my words, and give it a try, I do bold."
"Haircuts make me nervous. Met this girl Summer, though. She knew her stuff. Did exactly what I asked and acted like a pro. I'll be back."

"Victoria's, my second visit. Yelp event, great atmosphere. Bar staff, friendly. Mulled cider, try it. Lingonberry, my favorite. Reminds me of IKEA meatballs. Part of Swedish-themed bars in Edinburgh. Will meet here again."

"The second day of our eatery's opening, all hands were on deck, you see. We sampled the Salumi & Cheese Board, a platter most fine, with olives, veggies pickled, bread grilled, and meats cured, a feast divine. The capicola and proscuitto, oh how they shined! And the gorgonzola, a cheese most rare, with a taste of blue and a texture so fair and bright. A burger, you say? Indeed, we didst play, with the Pat Lafrieda, a sandwich of delight, brioche bun, tomato aioli, provolone cheese, and fries of the Tuscan kind. The tiramisu, a sweet treat, the best we hadst e'er met. Ask for a table by the window, a view of the Strip most grand, and bring thy camera, to capture the cakes, a sight most bland."

"Oh, how I adore those cinemas that screen not mainstream flicks,
Independent, artistic, documentaries, and suchlike.
And thus, dear friends, Camelview doth rank among my top picks,
For 'tis one of the few theaters here that doth showcase these gems.

Now, let us count the ways in which this place doth shine,
With friendly staff, great movies, and drinks of reasonable size.
Their cinnamon almonds, too, doth tempt my taste buds,
And the retro vibe, it doth bring back memories of days past.

But, alas, not all is bright and shiny,
For the seats, they doth lack comfort, and the theater doth feel old.
No stadium seating, either, doth make me frown,
Yet still, I find myself returning, time and again, to this place.

Ah, yes, the clientele, it doth skew towards the elder crowd,
Which doth make for an interesting experience, indeed.
But still, I say, Camelview, thou art a fun and quaint spot,
And though not perfect, thou doth hold a special place within my heart."

"Yelp steered me right. Hired solo, had doubts 'bout the movers. First off, they sent a pic and bio of the estimator—made me feel safe. Showed up dead on time, worked like hellions. Five stars, no question, but for the botched trundle bed. Still tryin' to fix that mess. Other than that, A-1 move. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend 'em."

"Methinks I've had but little dealings with such places as this, where strong drinks flow free. Yet, here, I've found the servants most kind, helpful, and discreet. Once, with my love, I came hither seeking a brew of special sort. The man behind the board, with cheerful mien, did vow to get it for us. And lo! When next we came, 'twas there, in all its glory. We bought much of it, and all else fades from memory."

"The show was good, not great, but good. Considering they do two 90-minute sets a night, I can see why they wouldn't wanna push themselves too hard. They still added some spark with their fancy tech though. Nice mix of tunes, something for everyone - 40s, Disney, Hip Hop, Punk, even some disco. Fun, but not mind-blowing."

"Good joint for the location and size. Good place to start the night. Got carded for water at the bar, what a drag. Drinks were tasty, though, and there was a tiny dance floor. \n\nBut the real action was on stage. A sultry broad belting out tunes, oh man. Great entertainment after a few drinks."
"Coffee, good. Food, great. My spot."

"Hark, what news is this? DSW doth carry now
Running shoes, a sight most wondrous and fair.
In days of yore, they had but casual and formal,
For men, a selection most limited and bare.

But lo, I ventured forth to DSW's halls,
And found a treasure trove of running shoes,
Mizunos, Asics, and more, a feast for mine eyes,
A store that catered to my every need, with ease.

I, a man of habit, didst stick to the right,
The men's shoes, the back clearance, my heart's delight.
My sister, a woman of great taste and grace,
Didst oft visit DSW, and spent hours in the place.

Their selection, vast and wide, didst astound,
A veritable feast, for all to be found.
So, gentle readers, take heed of my words,
DSW, a store of wonder, for all, not just a few."

I walked into Waffallonia, curious about the joint. Ordered the waffle with Nutella, bananas, and strawberries. It looked small at first, but boy was I wrong. It was packed with flavor and filled me right up. Reminded me of a funnel cake, those sweet bites. Fresh fruit, great mix. Glad I tried it, that wait next door led me to this gem. Cozy spot, few seats, but worth it. Waffallonia, great waffles.

"Went to Oregano's in Mesa. First time. Had a great bowl of pasta. Bartender/server was top-notch. Name's Ashley. Friendly, efficient, and knew her stuff. Made the whole experience even better. Will be back for more."
"Sipped Grey Goose and cranberry, savored a Las Vegas roll - my favorite, fried or not. Courtesy of the owner's girl, who trimmed my locks. Her treat, my delight."

"Upon our journey from the airport, my comrades and I didst seek sustenance to start the day aright. Happily, we chanced upon an IHOP, where we didst partake in a hearty breakfast. The establishment was mostly vacant, save for a few other groups. Our server, a pleasant lass named Shee, didst attend to us with haste and warmth. The victuals were consistent with the standard of the chain, naught extraordinary but still satisfying. As an added boon, the IHOP lay near the Pinball Hall of Fame, a site most wondrous and worthy of visitation. Verily, 'tis a decent venue for breakfasteers, and I shall return, mayhap."

"I wandered into the Chippery, Forum Shops, looking for a quick bite. Friends were getting daiquiris, but I spotted homemade chips in the back. Shoved through the crowd, made my way to the counter. Selection was decent, 6-8 flavors. Prices, $3-$5 per bag, depending on size. Service, however, was lacking. Not exactly the friendliest folks at Caesars that afternoon. Still, a hidden gem for a cheap snack."

"Toy store's a real maze, kid. Organized, too. Easy to find what you need. Sections for toddlers, games, stuffed animals, learnin' toys, dolls, sports, action figures, cars. One way in, one way out. They gotta keep the little ones from runnin' wild. Curvy aisles at the start, then you hit the main drag. Checkout was smooth. Lady caught me hidin' somethin' from my niece's view and she scanned it when she wasn't lookin'. Prices are steeper than most department stores, but worth it for the selection."

"Small place, but the vibe's good. Decor's tasteful, service top-notch. Pad See Ew's got serious flavor, but the portion's a bit small. Maybe it's 'cause I ordered it for lunch, but still, I wanted more. Pad Thai's the real deal, though. Chicken's tender, noodles perfect. Portion's just right. Since I live nearby, I'll be back for sure."

"Tasty joint. Drive-thru's still kickin', order-taker's friendly and peppy. Wings? Perfectly cooked, big as hell. Sides? Meh. Fries good, potato salad small, overpriced. Avoid 'em, stick with wings. Mix and match flavors, you won't regret it. Other wing spots, watch your back."

"This dive bar's become a regular haunt of mine in Vegas. Two shots and a cold one for nine bucks? Hell yeah! Crowd's a mixed bag, but they know how to have a good time. Karaoke's top-notch too. Place gets packed on Saturdays, but that's part of the charm. If smoke bothers you, best to steer clear. Bartenders pour 'em strong and the staff's friendly as can be. One thing though, there's just one john in the joint, so be prepared to wait your turn, ladies."

Leith Links, a peaceful haven in north Edinburgh, offers a serene escape from the bustling city. Paths crisscross the expansive green space, playgrounds dot the landscape, and the atmosphere remains tranquil, even during busy times. Unlike the Meadows, Leith Links avoids crowds of picnicking students, providing a calmer environment for leisurely strolls, runs, or walking your furry friend. While the northeast corner may carry a slight scent due to nearby sewage works, the rest of the park delights the senses.

Allotments and a Children's Orchard thrive within the park's boundaries, adding vibrancy to the area. Visiting circuses and festivals like the Leith Festival in June and Edinburgh Mela in August further enliven the scene. Golf enthusiasts will appreciate that Leith Links, though no longer a golf course, holds the distinction of being the birthplace of golf's official rules. A unique blend of history and natural beauty, Leith Links beckons visitors to explore its charms.

"It's a joint, ain't no different from any other. But the grub's fresh, mostly, and the prices are fair. They got them half-and-half combos for soups, salads, and sandwiches. That's what keeps me comin' back. The Fontana grilled cheese, tortellini Alfredo, and Cesar, they're all classics, done decent here. \n\nBut there's this one thing, the sweepin'. Someone's always comin' by my table with a brush broom, sweepin' the carpet. Dust gets in the air, in my food, it's loud, takes away from the meal. Not the best, but not the worst either."

"Food's great here. Clean joint too. Chef's a friendly bloke, makes sure all's well with the grub. I'm not vegan, but their vegan dishes are top-notch. Gardein beef, fish, and chicken, all amazing. Sweet and sour scallops, made with king oyster mushrooms, breaded and fried, a clever vegan twist on the classic pork dish. I'll be back, that's for sure."

"Loved this joint. Went to Purple Zebra, got a giant frozen drink, Vegas-style. Mom was hungry, though. Nice host outside said it was cool to bring in my extra alcohol, so we sat down. Margherita, at a Mexican restaurant, was a major fail. Bad, even though the waiter was nice about taking it back and replacing it with a different one. Second margherita was bad too. Avoid 'em. Everything else, amazing. Carnitas tacos, ooey gooey flavorful love. Guacamole with pomegranate seeds, #idied So. Freaking. Good. Had rice, green rice, looked like throw up. But close your eyes, open your mouth, and you're on a journey. A journey into epic rice land, full of love and yumminess. Yeah... Go there."
"Enjoyed my meal here. Good grub, friendly folk. Reminded me of Bangkok Balcony back in Squirrel Hill. Cozy spot."
"Good grub. Pricey, sure, but worth it. Fills you up and makes you feel like a king."

"Hark! A restaurant within these conference halls,
Deserving of its own review, methinks. Alas,
Our visit was but brief, due to a missed flight,
And we did not partake in the full delight.

Jenn, the waitress, served us with a smile so bright,
In the lounge area, where we did take refuge.
She worked late, with a rush of hungry folk,
Yet her demeanor was cheerful, as if 'twere a joke.

A soup and salad did I order, to assuage
My hunger pangs. The Chef's Famous Chicken Tortilla Soup,
It was called, and I must say, 'twas a marvel indeed.
The best I've had, at any place, I do declare.
Oh, how I wished for the recipe, to savor its taste,
But alas, 'twas a secret, locked deep in the chef's chest.
If anyone doth come upon it, pray tell,
For I wouldst be forever in thy debt, my friend."

"Wildflower, a quaint eatery serving up tasty soups, sandos, salads, and pastries. Bright and airy, this joint's got a welcoming vibe. Food's always fresh, made with quality ingredients, and their bread? Top-notch. Get yourself a loaf to go, like the sourdough with rosemary and sea salt. Prices are fair, and the menu's got some unique options. Go for the spinach salad, sans bacon, or the egg, tomato, and feta breakfast sammy on ciabatta."

"Soup joint's got a good spread, variety wise. But their smoothies? Not so much. They all taste like OJ. Don't get me wrong, I still order 'em, but it's a letdown every time. Except for the Blue at Franktuary. That one's the real deal."

"A fine establishment, cleanliness abounds, service most excellent. Fare, passable, yet naught but a touch of flavor doth the deviled egg possess. Short ribs, o'er-salted, alas! A pity, for a bit more seasoning, perchance, wouldst make it quite divine. Andouille sausage, shrimp, and grits, a trio of delight, didst request an added pinch of heat, lest it be too tame. Grits, a curious choice, methinks, yet naught but discord doth it bring unto the dish. Lastly, a donut, sweet and fluffy, didst grace our table, a pleasant start to our repast."

"Lunch at Wynn's poolside, pricey at forty bucks. But the chopped salad, damn! Fresh as hell, celery, peas, lettuce, bright and flavorful. Chicken, herbs, and more. Light dressing, perfect. Tasty taco-like shell, sesame seeds, too. Skip the fries, flabby and overcooked. Not worth the seventeen bucks. But hey, it's Vegas, right? Get the salad, amazing, amazing."
"Pizza's good, but pasta's outta sight. Family joint or date spot, both work. Salads too."

"This joint's my jam. Low-key, upscale vibes, strong drinks, and damn good grub. Never had a bad meal here. Great spot for a chat over a stiff drink. Crowd's mostly young professionals. Consistently solid experiences."

"Reserved a table at opentable for breakfast. Good thing too, 'cause the line was thirty minutes long. Plenty of empty tables inside, don't know why the line was so long. Got to try both breakfast and lunch dishes since we arrived at 10:30. Came for the AYCE macarons, mom wanted to try 'em. Said they were a disappointment, didn't melt in her mouth like good macarons should. Rest of the desserts were decent, creme brulee and fruit tart were good. Crepe was a bust, tasteless batter and sour berries. Candied nuts weren't fresh, had that refrigerated taste. Meat dishes were great, prime rib was cooked just right, pork apple dish was yummy. Hot cherries were good too. Sushi was a joke. Service was average, had to put our finished dishes on another table. Enjoyed the food, would go again. Quality desserts and meats are always a plus."

"Went to Outback for a quick bite. Seated right away, no wait. Server was sharp, knew the menu like the back of her hand. Ordered the side salad, soup of the day. Salad was fresh, crunchy, garlic croutons were top-notch. Soup was a surprise, creamy onion and cheese, hit the spot. Bread and butter, as always, divine."

"A haven for a swift and wholesome repast,  
With flatbreads, wraps, panninis, salads, soups, and more,  
E'en quesadillas, for those who dare to explore.  
The calorie count, next to each dish, doth make us aware  
Of what we consume, and thus, we may adore  
This place, where health and taste do meet and share.  

I savored the chipotle chicken wrap, with glee,  
Its veggies fresh, its flatbread soft, yet sturdy, see,  
The chipotle sauce, with just the right amount of heat,  
Did make my taste buds dance, with joy, so neat.  
My only grief, the chicken, a bit too spare,  
But still, the peppadew hot sauce, did make me cheer.  
Better than Tabasco, by far, I must confess,  
This sauce, did make my meal, a true success.  

Oh, how I wish, there were a place, near Scottsdale,  
Where I could partake, of this delightful fare,  
So many choices, at a price, most fair and reasonable,  
$5, a wrap, a drink, and chips, or cookie, or brownie,  
What a bargain, Subway, cannot compare,  
To this, where health and taste, do truly pair."

"Primo location, near ASU and local joints. Good seating, easy parking. Staff is top-notch, friendly and helpful. Food's decent, nothing special, but never bad either. Bagels are meh, but you can upgrade to a better bread. Solid choice, great service. You'll leave happy."

"A damn fine locals joint. You know it's the real deal when bartenders from other watering holes come to play and socialize. Good grub, good gaming, and top-notch tenders behind the stick. I hit it big twice - $400 on Keno and $200 on video poker. One of the rare places I'm still in the black. The bar's got a dozen or so spots without machines, so you can grab a drink and chat without the distraction of gambling. A few booths and high-top tables round out the setup."

"Haven't eaten here yet, but the view's worth five stars on its own. My old man and I hit the Duquesne Incline, then had some time to kill before his flight, so we swung by the Grandview Saloon for a cold one and some patio time. Great spot, right? Riverside view, incline running up and down, decent beer selection. Our server was on it, too. Not sure what the food's like, but I'd come back for the view any day, especially with company."
"This joint's got some real good grub and a swell vibe. But last time I was here, the new menu item? Not too shabby."

"Hark! What fun doth lie within this place,
Food most wondrous, folk of joyous grace.
Yet one thing doth mar this merry scene,
A lack of sweets, a sorrow most keen.
No s'mores nor Twinkies to delight,
But fruit, alas, doth take their stead tonight.
Despite this flaw, methinks 'tis still a sight,
Amazing, indeed, in its own right."

"Impressed by new restaurant in SLS Vegas. Chic tapas spot with tasteful decor and good service. Dishes were delicious, especially watermelon feta avocado and spiced nuts. Fresh pita bread too. Can't wait to return and recommend to others."

"Ryan J took me out here and, damn, I brought my A-game. Ordered the Bear: PB, Cracker Jacks, bacon, Gouda, and BBQ sauce. State fair-what-the-hell-did-I-just-do? amazing. So good. 

Those carneys selling overpriced knitting nearby? Weird. But the Mad Men lamp guys? They had it going on. 

Don't know much about Short Leash Dogs, but they've got something special. The Bear dog was part of a D-Backs contest. They won, now it's a big damn deal. 

Ryan J got a different dog. He said it best two years ago: you gotta unleash your hot dog inhibitions to get into this joint. 

Who's got hot dog inhibitions? Dummies, that's who."

"Been here twice. $27 for dinner, all you can eat. Sushi's good, not fantastic, but not bad either. Comparable to most places. What's fun is ordering and ordering and ordering. Since you can get half rolls, you can eat a lot of sushi and try everything. Check the blackboard to the right of the sushi bar for specials. Salmon Belly, super fantastic. Super White Tuna, fantastic too. Salmon and Hamachi, really good. Scallop, good. Conch, Halibut, and Sweet Shrimp, just OK. Lots of desserts included. Sea Weed Salad, things other than sushi, order with your waiter, not the sushi chefs. Sit at the sushi counter, fun, attentive service. Spicy Tuna crackers, not that special. Pork Belly, OK. But hey, it's included, so give it a shot. Service is good. Sitting at the Sushi Bar, much better. Have the sushi guy right there, asking what you want all the time. Fun to take a friend and just go through all the sushi you can."
"This joint's got it all. Friendly folk, fair prices, and a steady stream of regulars. Don't even get me started on the sweets. That Red Velvet Cake? Divine. And now they've got donuts? I'm sold."

"We've stayed at Harrahs a few times, my wife and I. This trip, we brought the kids and grabbed a 'classic' 2 queen bed room. It's bigger and quieter than the 'high roller' or 'premium' rooms, strange as that may seem. No desk, but a small table with two chairs does the trick. Not fully updated, but it's not bad. I'd book this room again, given the chance. Didn't give it five stars, though. Bathroom tub had a bit of a drip. Not loud, just a minor annoyance."

"Happy hour, finally. Good grub, cheap. Daily, 5-7 PM. Specialty drinks, $5. Pomitini, poured at the table. Girly, but good. Ahi, seared, with Jicama carrot salad. Decent quality. Other $5 options too. Burger, $6. Huge. Onion rings, challa roll. Ahi burger, $12. Croquet style. Portobello burger too. Bar area or patio. Heaters for cool nights. Prices, we ate. Stuffed. Recommend saluted mushrooms. Enhance any meal."

"La Cerise, a short walk from work, a double-edged sword. Temptation, thy name is deliciousness. Friendly service, fantastic grub, decent joe, homemade ice cream. Reasonable prices for the quality. Panini, croissant, wrap, or bun, the choice is yours. Soup, pasta, and veggie options, daily. If nearby, stop in, treat yourself."

"Big park, lots to do. Lake, drainage system, or maybe a submarine top. Nice hoops courts, tennis courts across the way. Kids' play area looks good. Softball fields, four of 'em. Impressive, real impressive. Could use some TLC, but hey, funding's tough. Recycling drop-off in one corner, nice touch. Yelp says it's in Ballyntyne, but it's really in South Park, Park Road, south of Tyvola/Fairview."

I stepped into Whiski Bar and Restaurant, unsure what to expect. The atmosphere was chilly at first, but it soon warmed up. The staff were friendly and helpful, eager to guide me through their extensive whisky list. I returned several times during my stay, enjoying the lively atmosphere and good food. Standing at the bar, sipping on a fine whisky, was a pleasant way to pass the time. Don't mistake Whiski Bar for its sister establishment, Whiski Rooms. Though related, they're separate entities.

"Hark, what news is this? My friends and I didst venture forth to Snots-dale, or as some do call it, Snobs-dale, in Arizona, where the San Francisco Giants do hold their spring training. And lo, didst we have a most excellent time at Majerle's Sports Grill!

We entered the establishment, our hunger and desire for merriment leading the way. And verily, the music and atmosphere didst strike a chord within us. The numerous Samsung flat screens upon the walls didst catch mine eye, forsooth, a true sports grill shouldst have a television on every wall, methinks.

The victuals, the service, and in especial, the manager, a gentleman named Corey, didst make our sojourn there most pleasant. We didst celebrate Stephanie G's twenty-ninth birthday in grand fashion, like a group of ladies gone wild, and verily, we could not tear ourselves away from the premises.

I doth await the day when I may return to Majerle's and partake in the revelry once again, dancing the night away, and feasting mine eyes upon the finest hip hop and r&b videos, displayed upon those wondrous televisions. Farewell, Majerle's, until we meet again!"

"Work dinners brought me here. Pricey, but that's Vegas. Entrance and lobby impress. Wine tower commands attention. Service attentive, not rushed. Server checked in often, ensured we had everything we needed. Accommodating too, made subs despite prix fixe menu. Good experiences overall."

"Whisky's not my thing. Smell of it makes me queasy. Worked for a catering outfit in school, had to hawk trays of the stuff. People kept asking which was which, and I didn't know. Made up names, but no one was fooled. Bought a few bottles for retirement gifts, but still don't know much about 'em. This shop's crammed with whiskies, old-fashioned lookin', got gins too, but whisky's their game. If you're lookin' for a certain label, you'll find it here. Good for a Scottish keepsake, gift for a whisky lover, or treatin' yerself to a fancy new bottle."

"Breakfast at TI, not bad. Eggs, bacon, hash browns, sausage, all good. Wonton soup too, but too many bean sprouts. Shrimp noodle soup, pho, miso, all looked decent. Sandwiches, pretty tasty. Didn't try sushi, BBQ, or salads, but they looked alright. Dessert, chocolate covered strawberries and cannolis, super yummy. Only buffet I went to in Vegas, but worth it if you're staying at TI and don't want to walk far."

"This joint's a real gem. Looks like a dive, but the grub's top-notch. Service too. My boyfriend's coworkers rave about the salsa. It's damn good. They got daily lunch specials, cheap too. Outdoor seating's a plus."

"Methinks at times, my heart doth yearn for sweet,
Packed ice cream, none of that frozen fluff.
This place, they say, hath quality of the finest sort,
Chocolate-dipped wafers, sturdy as a fort.
A variety of flavors, I do choose with glee,
Whatever doth please me, that doth make me sing."

"Hark! My friends, I present to thee this wondrous place,
Where food and drink do flow with grace.
In Las Vegas, city of sin, we didst stumble upon,
A culinary delight, fit for a king, or so it seemed.

Their menu, diverse and vast, didst cater to our needs,
And with each bite, our hunger didst decrease.
The prices, fair and reasonable, didst make us cheer,
For such a feast, we didst not have to fear.

But beware, dear traveler, of the hour of seven,
For then, the wait, a mighty seventy-five minutes doth convene.
Yet, fear not, for 'tis worth the wait, I do declare,
For this establishment, the best value doth bear."

Upon a cold, grey eve, I chanced to stray
Into a drinking hole, a place they call The Boozery.
The room was bare, the crowd was scant,
But service swift, the bartender quite gallant.
He knew his whiskey well, and shared with glee
Tips on how to savor it, and drink it with decree.
The spot itself, within a container confined,
Yet outside, a charming patio, sunshine inclined.
A perfect perch, to watch the world go by,
And sip upon a dram, of fine Las Vegas rye.
For 'tis the only bar, in all of Sin City,
That serves the spirits, of our own distillery.
So, seek it out, this hidden gem,
And taste the flavors, of a true Las Vegas gem.

"Jersey Mike's makes some killer sammies. Located near Firefly, they've got cold and hot subs, all cut fresh in front of you like Port of Subs. No baked subs, but they've got a grill for their phillys. I went for the Club Supreme - loads of meat, perfect toppings, super crispy bacon. Service was top-notch too. My buddies had the Chicken Parm, but it was a hot mess. Props for the UNLV discount, but avoid lunchtime, it gets packed."

"In fair Tollcross, there doth lie a Greek tavern,
Whose name doth speak its purpose, and its wares do tell.
'Tis a place of authentic taste, and plentiful fare,
Run by a Scottish pair, who didst dwell in Kefalonia's lair.

My love and I, upon a whim, didst step inside,
And found the tables full, a sign most fortunate and bright.
We chose not to decide, from the menu vast and wide,
But instead, didst select a few, from the starters' delight.

Home-made humus, taramasalata, tzatziki too,
Huge olives, juicy and fresh, and whitebait, crispy and new.
With bread aplenty, and wine, a house specialty,
Our meal was wondrous, and our bellies, full of glee."

"Pizza joint with plenty of slice options during the week, fewer on weekends but still decent.  NY-style pies, nothing special but still good.  Crust is chewy inside, crispy outside.  Sicilian crust not as great.  Lunch specials are a good deal, but building your own pie gets pricey quick."

"Viva Mercado's, we hit it up regular. Service is top-notch, always a smile and a refill on the horizon. Soup, compliments of the house, is a damn good start. Chips and salsa, or bean dip, whatever your poison, it's all fresh and crispy. Now, the main event - their chimichangas, a personal favorite. Hubby's got a thing for the fajitas, still sizzlin' when they hit the table. You haven't been? You're missin' out, friend."
"Mexican joint, real good. Sauces, best I've seen. Homemade, all they need. Food, damn tasty. Price, can't beat it. Fish tacos, the bomb."
"Dined here last night. Pinot Grigio, just okay. Food, damn good. Recommend it."
"Fajitas, great. Hunger, sated. Night, wild. Cocktails, many. Craps, lost. Live band, good. Decor, nice. Return, definite."

"Oh, how I doth adore the Prime Rib, 'tis tender and tasty indeed! 

To avoid the queue, I didst make reservations through OpenTable with great haste, 
And thus, my friend and I didst enter through the "VIP" door, where we didst check in, pay, and sit with great celerity. 

Our server didst come unto our table straightaway, to take our drink order, and thence, we didst proceed to receive our victuals. 

But lo, the Prime Rib, it didst captivate mine eyes, and I didst wait with bated breath, 
For those before me to choose their cut, and decide which sauce to take, ere I didst partake. 

Next, I didst venture to the seafood area, where a throng of people didst gather, 
Taking all the crab legs, which didst vex me sore, for they were not the only ones at the buffet, alack! 

But I didst leave, with intent to return for my second helping, and behold, 
The desserts didst catch mine eye, and I didst love the french macaroons the most, 
And lo, the same person who didst take all the crab legs, didst stand behind me, 
So I didst take all the chocolate french macaroons, in revenge, I do confess. 

And thus, I didst enjoy my crab legs, and departed, a happy man, indeed, 
Our server, swift and attentive, didst fill our waters and drinks with great speed."

"Hark, I say, this place doth please me well,
No rowdy collegians or crazed folk to tell.
A tranquil spot, where flavors doth abound,
And peace doth reign, without a single sound.

Their flavors, standard, yet delicious still,
We doth enjoy, with nary a thrill.
Naranja, coconut, names not quite known,
But tasty, nonetheless, as expected shown.

Upon their walls, stickers doth adorn,
A space for each, a message to scorn.
Mine, an upside-down one, doth reside,
Upon the speaker, with pride doth abide."

"By fortune's grace, this eatery didst fall within mine eyesight, as I didst stroll about our humble workplace. Verily, 'tis a place of gastronomic wonders, wherein doth lie a feast most hearty and divine. My taste buds, they do sing praises of the Jambalaya, a dish most delectable and fine. Alas, the queue doth oft grow long, yet fear not, dear patron, for 'tis a wait most worthwhile. In faith, this tiny venue doth hold a treasure trove of culinary delights, which doth make the wait most bearable."

"Pho at Kinh Do, not the best I've had, but still damn good. Born and raised in San Jose, biggest Viet population in the States, so I know my pho. Broth's the key, and Kinh Do delivers. Get the chicken pho, fresh bean sprouts and basil, good combo. Service could be better, sometimes gotta flag down a waiter for a refill. But hey, that's just how it goes."

"St Francis, been there a few times. Love it. One dish stood out. Forbidden rice bowl, mind blown. Chicken added for protein, fresh veggies, tasty rice, shredded chicken, perfect. Sauce, delicate, aromatic, light. Ate most for lunch, took home leftovers for dinner. Could eat this dish weekly. Planning to go back soon."

"New management's takin' over Wet'n'Wild water park in a couple weeks. Check out their site for a glimpse of what's comin'. Looks like they've stepped up the landscapin', too. 'Bout time Phoenix got itself an A-list theme park. Travel Channel's got a list of top ten water parks in the States, and we ain't on it. Time to change that. Hope they fix up the wave pool, make it more like Big Surf. You know, rollin' waves instead of that weak undulation crap. They'll be open till October, and season passes are discounted till opening day. Get 'em online at phoenix.mywetnwild.com. Follow 'em on Twitter, Facebook, too. Maybe you'll score some free season passes. Grand openin's gonna be a real splash."

Fancy, fancy. Love fancy food, fancy restaurants. Reserved table, Friday night. Tasting menu, added foie gras, 'cause who doesn't love that? Bottle of wine, dinner's expensive, delicious. 

Annoying part, valet not free, $13. Nice touch though, closet for jackets. Food, delicious. Presentation, fantastic. Not one of the best, service good. One descriptive, answered questions. Some hard to understand, :(. Fancy restaurant, wanna know what I'm eatin'. 

Menu degustation, $92 each. Foie gras degustation, add'l $12 each. Baron Louis bottle of red wine, $80.
"Good eatery. Food's top-notch. One of my faves in the East End."
"Good joint, real close to home. Been there plenty, always good eats. Rare beef, brisket soup, mixed dumplings, imperial rolls - that's my jam. Tasty stuff."

"Fair sir, this victual here doth please my taste,
Four stars, I say, for in other towns I've had
Better Chinese fare, yet in this place, 'tis true,
The cuisine doth lack, and so this dish doth shine.

The fried rice, alas, doth lean towards the steam,
And thus, doth lack the crunch that doth make it prime.
But fear not, dear friend, for the Mongolian beef,
Doth boast a flavor rich, and savory, beyond belief.

The Lo Mein, a delight, doth dance upon my tongue,
A worthy meal, indeed, and one that doth begone.
The spring rolls, a shame, doth lack the crispiness,
That doth make them sweet, and worthiness.

Yet still, fair sir, I do enjoy this place,
For in this town, where Chinese food doth race,
It doth stand tall, and worthy of my praise,
And so, I say, give it a try, and raise

Your chopsticks high, and let the feast begin,
For here, my friend, thou shalt find culinary kin."
"Chowed down on their BBQ chicken pizza. Damn good, but the toppings'll cost ya. Wish they had more variety, but still, not bad."

"This Vegas spot's one of a kind. Everyone should give it a shot. Brought my bro and girl here on our last trip. Lasted two hours before we froze our asses off. Dress warm, girls. You won't look cute in a black dress. Guys, have a few drinks first. They're strong, but you won't feel 'em 'cause you'll be too busy shivering."

"Levant, new joint in town. Uptown Mint Museum building, side entrance, across from Knight Theater's big screen. Same folk as Kabob Grill, good people. Been there once, take-out, real good. Helpful staff, hot and fresh wrap. Office mates loved the smell, came by to check it out. Had the Kafta wrap, fresh hummus, tender beef, crispy fries, well-seasoned. Gonna try it again, eat-in next time. Downtown Charlotte's come alive with new grub spots. Wish 'em luck."

"We gave this joint a shot,'memberin' how it just opened up. Glad for a Viet sandwich spot near our digs. Reviews said it'd be a wait, but we got in quick, two minutes max. Place was dead, just us two. 

Had the sliced pork, #7. Meat was good, veggies fresh. 

Wife went for the Mekong special, #11. Swapped bites, she liked hers more, I liked mine. Difference is, I wanna taste the meat, she's good with veggie flavor. 

Definitely comin' back, recommend it."
"Good coffee joint in a nice town. Friendly folks workin' there, tunes are swell, vibe's top-notch. Only gripe? Parkin's a bit of a hassle."

"Liked the small hotel. Good spot, across from Hard Rock. Rooms were fine, staff was top-notch. Pool was swell. Only gripe was no pack n' play. Not their fault, though. Had a baby with us, so we grabbed one for the night. Appreciated how they welcomed our pup. Food and service were A-okay."

"Diner's got character, like a '60s joint should. Ruben, fries, all good. Corned beef, not the processed crap. Real deal, tender, flavorful. Maybe the best I've had. Pie, damn. French silk, rich, chocolatey. Stop by, yeah?"

"Sandwiches? No way. These are culinary masterpieces. And at 4am, Earl's got me covered. Three days in Vegas, three visits to Earl's. Club sandwich, Caribbean jerk, tomato soup - all winners. Bacon makes everything better, but the Caribbean jerk takes the cake. Spicy, flavorful, and tender. Best sandwich ever. Tomato soup, topped with croutons, just right. Not too filling, perfect for a light lunch. Cheap, fresh, and damn delicious."
"Corn beef hash, real deal. Tasty. Small joint, popular spot. Get there early, avoid the wait."

"Hark, my comrade and I didst visit this establishment,
To cure our aching heads, a woeful hangover's sting.
Their victuals were most excellent, and reasonably priced,
Our bellies full, our spirits lifted, all was well arranged.
They doth serve breakfast till two o'clock in the day,
A friendly staff, who brought us pitchers, nay, not just a single mug,
So we could quench our thirst, without much ado or fuss,
A pleasant experience, indeed, 'twas a fine day, I must confess."

"Rooms? Nope. Eat at the Grand Cafe though. Good grub, decent prices. Portions fit the bill too. Buffet's solid, not that I hit it up often. But hey, variety's nice and if you've got a Players Card, you're in for a treat. \n  Smoke's everywhere, baby. It's Vegas. Can't avoid it. Slots are alright, play 'em while you're winning. That's my motto. Service? Eh, it's a crapshoot. Cutbacks still in full effect. But hey, those dudes in suits with badges? They'll help you out. Just saying. \n  Station Casinos love locals. That's a fact."

"Six of us shared a feast: duck fat fries, meatballs, pork belly, mussels, pappardelle, lamb carpaccio, dates, octopus, beets, porchetta, guinea fowl. Dessert was cheesecake custard bread pudding and port tawny. Top picks were duck fat fries, pork belly, and dates - all outstanding. The rest was good, except the lamb. Avoid it - slimy, tasteless, and overpriced. Service was great, our server recommended a fantastic wine. Bill was around 300 bucks for all the grub and drinks, including dessert. Reasonable, I'd come back."

"Hark, what news is this? A mill most cool,
Deserving of five stars, 'tis no fool.
But alas, there's room for improvement,
For greatness lies within its bosom.

My heart doth sing of Big Ben's pub,
Of Zucca's pizza, Savory Spice's hub.
A gallery space of note, thanks to Elder,
A marketplace, with vendors, a true treasure.

But lo, the market's not my favorite part,
For during the week, many booths lie dark.
Yet still, it holds potential, a grand sight,
Worth a visit, day or night.

And thus, my favorites, in order true,
Pickleville, Cloister Honey, Simply Local too.
Uncle Scott's root beer, chocolate bars galore,
Muscadine juice, a drink most divine, but not quite four."

"Methinks 'tis merry within these walls, where French hospitality doth reign. Fare, though unremarkable, doth please, for ambiance doth make our visit worthwhile. Tariff, fixed and fair, doth draw us in, despite the throngs that gather here."
"Wife and I chowed down on some solid grub at this joint while crashin' at the Wigwam. Coffee was top-notch, and them omelets were real fillin'. Good eatin', real good."

"Good spot for art enthusiasts, decent for students like me fulfilling course requirements. This gallery stood out with its electrifying display, though I didn't grasp the idea fully. Still, had a blast and snapped some solid pics. Worth the visit."
"Brunch at this joint was top-notch. Server Brady kept things tight, attentive without intruding on our chat. Well done."

"Methinks 'tis a fair establishment, wherein I've dined but once, yet found the victuals most pleasing. A Thai Peanut sandwich and tomato basil broth didst I consume, and both didst delight mine taste buds. The former, with its savory blend of peanuts and spices, didst satiate mine hunger, while the latter, with its velvety texture and subtle tang, didst warm mine soul. The exterior, with its vibrant hues and cheerful ambiance, didst entice me in, and I must confess, I didst find the interior equally as inviting. Verily, 'tis a place I shall return to, and soon, forsooth!"

"Delta Hotel, top-notch joint. Ambiance, excellent. Room, excellent. Service, excellent. Parking, reasonable. Location, excellent. Good price if you plan right. Short walk to shops and eats. Plenty of parking, but watch out for Montreal Downtown streets. Signature Club room, nice upgrade. Access to Signature Lounge, continental breakfast, hors d'oeuvres. Great for a coffee fiend like me. Delta fan, recommend it."

"Hark! This place doth please, if thou hast great hunger and lovest meat. A salad bar there be, with artichokes, caprese, calamari, and more, a tasty complement to thy feast. I chose the seafood platter, with shrimp, scallops, grilled salmon, and tempura cod. Alas, the salmon was dry, the cod too oily, but the shrimp and bacon-wrapped scallops did please. I would not recommend the seafood platter, my dear.

My love, he chose the all-you-can-eat meat, a wiser choice, methinks. A variety of lamb, sirloin, chicken, and more, didst they offer. My heart did sing for the lamb with balsamic reduction, tender and full of flavor. My love, he didst enjoy the spicy chicken, juicy and delicious, indeed.

We didst save, by using the Tix4tonite, a fair price of twenty-four dollars."

Hotel was top-notch, room was spacious. Arrived Christmas Eve, left Christmas Day. Got a deal, two nights, two tix to Le Reve, two buffets. Booker said special was available during holidays. Happy about the $96 food credit, considering we paid $50 for Xmas Eve dinner. Not a fan of the resort fee, since we only used the internet. Would've preferred to pay for that separately. Room wasn't cleaned once, but rest was good. Partner's name on TV was a nice touch. A/C struggled to cool the bedroom, even at 65. Slept naked due to heat.

"A surfeit of confection, a cornucopia of delight!
The cakes, they did overflow with sweetness and light.
Macaroons, aplenty, to tickle one's fancy and taste,
But lo, the almond croissant, oh how it did waste
My senses, with its sickly sweet embrace.
I pray, good sir, for a less sugary grace.
La Belle Terre, thy name doth ring true,
For in thy almond croissant, I didst find anew
A sweetness, tempered, not overwrought,
A delicacy, fit for a king, or a maiden, besought."
"Breakfast here the other mornin'. Grub was good, servin' was snappy."
"Discovered a swell joint on the South Side. Not your usual dive, this place has top-notch grub and a smoke-free atmosphere. Highly recommend grabbin' a few sliders next time you're 'round."

"Wolfman's got game. Their pizza's no CPK, but it's still good. I dig the White Wolf and the chicken, spinach, and herb pie. Crust's on point, too. Not too thick, not too thin. Appetizers are solid, but forgettable. Salads are big, so share 'em. Friendly service, but slow at times. Beer selection's decent, and they got specials some nights. Outdoor seating's a plus."

"Patio's top-notch here. Microbrews too. Dig the setup - front and back patios, dog-friendly. Back patio's sweet, great view of Camelback, rad tire fan art. Hit it up on Father's Day, BBQ Sunday special did not disappoint. Huge portions, friendly staff, solid recs from our waitress. Lookin' forward to round two."

"A fair and lovely venue for a wedding feast,
Within its hallowed walls, a chapel most meet,
For couples who desire a place of olden charm,
And not a church, where they may take no alarm.
'Tis situated 'twixt midtown and uptown bounds,
Convenient for guests from far and near,
With gardens green and shady, a gazebo sweet,
A perfect spot for wedding pictures, dear."

"Cirque du Soleil's latest show is not for the faint of heart. It's a raw, adult production, with nudity and mature themes that may leave you squirming in your seat. But don't let that scare you off - the visuals are still breathtaking, with elaborate costumes and a perfectly curated soundtrack. The acts are fresh and daring, showcasing the incredible talents of the performers. Just remember, this ain't no family-friendly affair. Leave the old folks at home."

"Good eatery, this one. Cambodian grub, friendly folk. Clean joint, too. Decor's nice, got some books to flip through while you chow down. Food's good, had the Loat Cha noodles, beef and eggs, but small portions for the price. Corn for dessert, roasted, slathered in sweet and fish sauce glaze. Nice change from usual sweets. Place is a bit tough to find, name's on the side, not out front, and you gotta enter through a mechanic shop. Not obvious."

"Used a Groupon for the missus and me. Enjoyed the massage and detox. No shortchanging on time. Only thing I'd say is to let 'em know if the masseuse is too rough. They'll tailor it to your likin'. We got our heads, necks, shoulders, arms, feet, and legs worked on. Felt real good after."

"Methinks my roommate and I did break our fast  
With Thai cuisine, and joy did it bring.  
The restaurant was quiet, as Mondays do,  
And thus, the service was swift and true.  
I had the swimming rama, beef in peanut sauce,  
Steamed veggies beneath, a wondrous cause  
For delight, and worth the order, I say.  
My roommate, he had pad pik sod, a spicy dish,  
Mixed veggies and chicken, a flavorful wish.  
His eyes did gleam, his taste buds did dance,  
But the heat, it did leave him in a trance.  
We both did join the clean plate club, anon,  
Our hunger sated, our bellies full and gone.  
The others, they had yellow chicken curry,  
Tom yum soup, a feast for the eyes, verily.  
The restaurant's atmosphere, open and bright,  
Clean, yet sterile, a curious sight.  
Prices fair, around ten to fifteen,  
A reasonable sum, for such a culinary sheen.  
My entree, enough to make me return,  
But others' dishes, they did my heart yearn.  
So back to our diets, we must, alack,  
But Thai food, it shall forever be in my pack."

"This joint's the real deal. Big portions, quality grub. Get the mixed plate or beef combo with mac salad. Don't know if the owner's local or just bought the franchise, but the food's legit Hawaiian."
"Had their brisket a few times. Damn good. I'm a BBQ nut. If I like it, you'll love it. Had some of the best BBQ in the world. This stuff holds its own. Give it a shot."
"Good spot for coffee and a croissant. Maybe even replace our missed Ellefsen. Located in Ahuntsic, weekdays seem slow, but weekends bring a crowd for brunch, bread, and pastries."

"Good service at Del Taco. Didn't need to ask for anything extra. Worker, Guillermo, did a fine job getting my order out quick. Ordered dinner on November 15th at 6:42 PM. Del Taco does it right, puts other drive-thrus to shame."
"Kona coffee, a personal fave for my hubby and me. Love the banana crepes, Monte Cristo too. Chicken strip salad, another winner."

"Yard House, where we stop for grub and brews before Coyotes games and concerts. Long waits, 30-45 minutes, but worth it. Great beer selection, food too. Sliders, my fave, $10.85. Green Flash IPA, $7, perfect pairing. Solid spot pre-game. Return Factor, 90%."

"Hark, good sir! Thou wouldst have earned a five-star rating, an' 'twere not for the slow service and wait. Thy victuals, by the gods, didst impress! Thy twisted farm fare, they didst deliver, in sooth. Thy fried sage fried chicken, a dish most wondrous, and thy chicken and waffles, a feast most fair! Alack, poor service doth mar an otherwise excellent meal!"

"Hark, good sir! I do frequent this place,
With mine own canine, of size quite vast,
Upon the large dog side, 'tis true, I grace,
A few times weekly, to let him run and play,
And sniff about, with nose upturned, in joy.

Now, mark you well, most dog parks are mad,
With yapping curs and chaos, loud and sad,
But here, methinks, all's quite calm and still,
The owners, responsible, their dogs do fill,
With love and care, and cleanliness doth abound,
In this, the park, where all the large dogs may be found.

'Tis convenient, too, in truth, I say,
For here, there's room enough, for all to play,
So, come ye hither, with your furry friend,
And let us frolic, in this merry end!"

"Hark! In Phoenix's vicinity, there be many an eatery,
A Chinese scholar, I, declare Szechwan Palace doth reign supreme,
In authentic Chinese cuisine, it doth hold sway,
Methinks 'tis a haven for those who crave spicy delight.

I didst order Mopo Tofu, Chongqing Hotpot, and boiled beef,
And fish, all dishes that didst ignite my taste buds with glee.
Forsooth! They were fiery, and my heart didst sing with joy,
For in this land of plenty, Szechwan Palace doth employ
The finest chefs, who doth weave a culinary spell,
That doth transport me to China's bustling streets, so well.

So, if thou seekst a meal that doth rival the sun,
In heat and flavor, seek out Szechwan Palace, ere thy day be done."

Wings sated my craving for American-style wings after a long day exploring Edinburgh. Good vibes and a movie marathon downstairs. Decent service. Enjoyed a Magners and blue flame dance (spicy blue cheese). I'll return soon.
"Autozone crew, top-notch. Twice now, they've recalled me. Friendly bunch, that's why I'll drive the extra mile. Summer heat brings battery seekers, lines form, but service remains swift."

"Airport floors, my bed for the night. Feeling connected, I do. 

Pros: 
1. Free Wi-Fi, I'm using it now. 
2. Smoke-free, thank the heavens! 

Cons: 
1. Uncomfortable design, meant to be suffered. 
2. Wheel of Fortune slots, haunting my dreams. 

Been here 12 hours, craving a potted plant. Any plant, really. Poison oak, even. 

Smoke-free airports, a blessing. But someday, botanic gardens. No more screams, no more tossed bags."

"Hark! If not for Yelptern Izzy D and a street meeting of Monroe-ish sort,
This place I might have ne'er discovered, alack!
But glad I did, with joy my heart doth sing,
For within its walls, a treat doth lie in wait.

The interior, quirky and chill, doth please,
A place to sit and sip, in peace, one finds.
Two sides there be, the entrance side, most meet,
With furniture that doth my fancy greet.

The staff, so kind and welcoming, doth abide,
And rusheth not, thy work, they do provide.
Java, strong and rich, doth satisfy,
A perfect spot, to pass the time away.

Live music, nightly, doth play, they say,
A bonus, indeed, to draw thee nigh.
Food and tunes, a wondrous pair,
Shall we, dear friends, this place repair?"
"Renovated, functional layout. Kiddie corner, far from the rest."

"Firebirds, I like 'em. Good grub, nice atmosphere. Servers and bartenders, top-notch. But, for the love of all things holy, keep your damn thumb outta my food. Trays exist for a reason, folks. New spot's a real looker, too."
"Food's damn good here. Fusion of Mexican and Chinese, like nothin' you've had before. Laid-back spot, too. Enjoyed a glass of wine with my meal. Count me in as a fan."
"Good eatery. Meat's top-notch, service is A1. Hookah's solid, dudes are friendly, keep it fresh. Live tunes on occasion. Drinks are aces too."

"Hark! 'Tis wise to call ahead, my friend,
For service here is slow, and lines do tend
To form, alack! But fear not, for within
The cramped confines, a feast doth await thee, fit for a kin.

Alas, the customer service doth leave much to be desired,
But patience, dear heart, for all shall be required.
The parking lot, a challenge it doth pose,
Yet, worth the trouble, for the treasures that it holds.

In the deli case, a variety of pasta salads doth abide,
By the pound, a perfect pairing for thy sandwich, they doth provide.
And thus, my friend, I pray thee, heed my words of wisdom,
And taste for thyself, the culinary joys that this place doth dispense."

"Pasand's under new management, and I gotta say, it's lookin' good. Went there today, expectin' the usual fare, but what I got was some damn fine grub. Spices were poppin', flavors were fresh, and the food was a helluva lot better than before. Talked to the new owners, they're gonna spruce up the joint, add some more buffet spots. All in all, I give 'em two thumbs up, especially for the chow."

"Lunch at this joint was decent. Friendly staff, quick service. BBQ was on point, ribs had that smoky, dry-rubbed flavor. Cornbread was meh. Hot sauce overpowered the meat, not because it was too spicy, but because it dominated the taste buds. Not a bad spot for 'cue in the South Side, but it was empty when I went. Maybe give it a try, keep the lunch hours alive." (497 tokens)
"Monday, 04/29. Dined here. Ordered Korean steak tacos. Nothing special. Vanilla bean cheesecake, good. Waitress, young lady, long blonde hair, attentive."

"Freed's Bakery made getting a custom cake easy as pie. Week before we hit Vegas, they hooked us up with a killer red velvet cake. No fuss, no muss. We went for the Irish Bailey filling and butter cream frosting. Cake was on point, girls loved it. Thanks, Freed's."

"Best Wishes, an indie gift shop in Edinburgh, sells unique items like artsy cards, funky wrapping paper, jewelry, trinkets, makeup, and toys. Not the cheapest, but good quality, like Clinton's but better. Well-organized store makes it easy to find what you need, a plus for me since I tend to get lost in these types of shops and end up buried under stuffed animals. Friendly owner offers wrapping services and chats with customers."

"Methinks I wouldst give this place five stars,
For friendly service, delectable fare,
And prices that doth please mine eyes.

But lo, a caveat doth impede my will,
For though they doth prepare most wondrous dishes,
Their employees, alas, do smoke and chill.

Now, when I order buffalo hummus,
Or yummy grape leaves, oh so tasty,
I cannot help but think of nicotine,
And fingers stained with smoke and grime.

Ah, smoking and cooking, such a pair,
In a vegan restaurant, most strange,
A deal-breaker, indeed, a curious sight,
As if from an SNL skit, most queer and bright."

In fair Villeray, a nail salon doth shine,
Newly established, yet doth make haste to be divine.
A spacious place, with comfort doth abound,
Cleanliness doth reign, and all doth astound.

A choice of hues, OPI, Essie, Shellac in store,
To please thy nails, and make them look evermore.
On Mondays and Tuesdays, students and elders doth save,
With 15% off, their wallets doth not become a slave.

Prices doth compete, without the discount in sight,
A visit doth await, to make thy nails take flight.

"This joint's the real deal. Always bumpin', service is top-notch. Been here three times in two months, and let me tell you, the portions are huge and the options are endless. Staff's got their stuff together too. Only thing I'd avoid is the steak menu. Sirloin's a bit fatty, not worth it. But everything else? Sushi, chicken, shrimp? Off the charts, fresh as can be. Get a group, grab the sushi boat, and get ready for a treat. This place is a hidden gem, and it's in our regular rotation. Check it out for yourself."

"Place was better than expected. Arrived around 10:40. Paid for brekkie, got two meals instead. Beef sausage, not your average breakfast links, was damn tasty. Flank steak, too. Mexican rice, spot on. Price, unbeatable."
"Breakfast menu, top-notch. Seated quick, service A-1. Returning for brunch date or special occasion, you bet."

"Aria, second time around. New Year's Eve. Table minimums, up. Keeps the crowds away, good. But not worth it, playing $5 Roulette at noon. Holiday weekend, still found better tables at MGM, $10, nighttime too. Room, nice, but MGM Grand, nicer. Aria, issues. Minibar fridge, broken. Dirty room, unserviced. Water, $30 at room service, instead of $10 in minibar. Beds, comfy. Casino, nice, attracts a good crowd. MGM Grand, still better."

"I ain't gonna lie, I do love comin' here. Service is top-notch, atmosphere's swell, and the manager's a real Italian gent. But let's be honest, the grub's just not that great. I mean, it's not bad, but it ain't no match for the stuff you'd find in Italy. Maybe it's the water in Charlotte that's the problem. Don't know about that, but I do know the grilled octopus is the best thing on the menu. No contest."

"Methinks 'twas a grand establishment, whereupon we didst partake of delectable victuals. A royal Hawaiian pizza, with toppings most fair and plenteous, didst grace our table, alongside a cheese bread of generous proportions, nigh the size of their pizzas. And, verily, a dish of roasted fowl, bathed in pesto's verdant embrace, didst complete our feast. Flavors most excellent didst these dishes possess, save for the cloying scent of firewood, which didst somewhat mar the ambiance. Yet, in sooth, 'twas a place of merit, and worth a visit, an it please thee."

"Wings, my main food group. Miss 'em since leaving Arizona. Perfect blend of spice, heat, and sauce. Spoiled by NNY, can't find a close second. Love the other grub, service always good. NNY's my excuse to visit kin in AZ."

"Haircuts ain't my thing, but miniBar Ber Shop was a pleasant surprise. A bit too modern for my taste, but after a few cold ones, who cares? Beer at the barber? Genius! Boris gave me a trim, shaved my beard, and we chatted about life, kids, and the struggles of New York. Had a couple more brews after my cut. It's near noon, and I'm on vacation. PS: The girl at the front desk is a real sweetheart."

"Came here last time in Vegas, came back 'cause it's that damn good. Don't eat burgers, so my review's on the milk shakes. Had the mother fluffer twice now, and it's freakin' delicious. Hubby had the lunch box milkshake, loved it too. Had a Caesar salad, it was good, nothin' special. Hubby had the classic burger, said it was good, not the best. But the milk shakes, they're great, and the fries too. Go for those, you won't regret it."
"Great theater. Clean, friendly staff, big screens, comfy seats. Stadium seating, not too crowded. 24 screens, always a showtime. Validated parking. That's why I like AMC at AZ Center."

"Four years a slave to coffee, still I crave,
The brew that fuels my mornings, keeps me brave.
This place, their coffee be excelente, I confess,
A regular cup, a chocolate-coated treat, impress.

My friend, a Rockstar with fruit punch did choose,
But seemed quite pointless, for they sell it in stores,
The double drive-through, prices cheaper than foes,
The staff, friendly, worthy of praise, no doubt.

But alas, their menu doth overwhelm,
Too many options, confusion doth stem.
A simpler list, or larger font, would be a boon,
For those who seek a drink, not a lengthy tome.

Despite this flaw, I still do recommend,
This place, for coffee lovers, a true gem.
Give it a try, and taste their brews divine,
For coffee aficionados, a haven, truly fine."

"Pulled up to Senor Taco in Fountain Hills, behind a Circle K in a rundown strip mall. Noticed trucks in the lot, good sign. Inside, formica booths and tile floors, clean but nothing special. Order at the cashier, takes about five minutes. Prices can't be beat. Fish taco plate, two huge tacos in fresh corn tortillas, cabbage, fresh crema. Rice and beans, awesome but not quite hot enough. Split one platter for $6.99. Authentic flavors, folks who eat here know their Mexican food. Self-serve salsa bar, usual salsas, pickled carrots, fresh radishes. Not fancy, but cheap, quick, and delicious."

"Wood-paneled, tucked away, this place has been servin' up good eatin' for 35 years. Wine list's a bit pricey, but worth it. Like a scene straight outta Goodfellas. 

Pasta's their game, but they got other tricks up their sleeve too. Squid ink fettuccine, pesto made fresh daily. Beer selection's lackin', but the wine list makes up for it. 

Scalopini, soups, seafood galore. This ain't your average pasta joint. 

Service is top-notch. Friendly, professional. I'll be back for sure."

"Steak and eggs, that's what I came for. Three ninety-nine, they said. Four forty-nine, it turned out. Not great service either. Seemed like they were always in a foul mood. 

But the steak, it was alright. Nerves and fat, sure, but it had some flavor. And the toast? Get the toast. Biscuit in gravy? Forget about it. Cold and canned, that's all it is. 

Would I recommend it? Sure thing. You get a lot for your money, and that's good when you're living on a shoestring."

"Verily, this spectacle doth differ from all others thou hast beheld. "Different," pray tell, may signify much, contingent upon thine inclination, temperament, interests, and the extent of madness. 

I cannot express how greatly I didst enjoy the melodic aspect of this production, and I do wish they wouldst occupy more of the show's duration with tunes. The band, in sooth, is quite cool, as are the blue men; and, furthermore, the special luminary effects do render the entire experience a most enjoyable show. 

Some of the comedic exploits, methinks, do tend to linger a mite too long. Perchance, they couldst accomplish somewhat more than merely standing and devouring cereals. But, again, mayhap I didst not comprehend the message aright. 

I do not desire to reveal too much, yet, prithee, do attend and discover for thyself. I do most heartily recommend this show."

"Hark, what joy doth lie within this place,
A breakfast most divine, a wondrous grace.
After five hours' trek through Red Rock's glebe,
I chanced upon this cozy retreat, wherefore
I entered, eager to partake of their feast.

The crowd, it did astound, on this Wednesday eve,
Yet still, the server, with haste, didst attend to my need.
My comrade, on a diet most strange, didst order tuna,
Whilst I, a heartier fare, didst choose, anon.

A Mexican omelette, with carnitas, jalapenos,
Pico gallo, pepper jack, and sour cream, didst flow.
And though 'twas good, yet didst my heart desire,
The red velvet pancake, a dish most rare.

I'd ne'er been fond of red velvet, I confess,
But this, my friends, didst make me reassess.
Soft, fluffy, sweet, with cream cheese frosting,
It stole my heart, and left me rapturing.

My comrade, too, didst share her biscuit, fair,
But I, in haste, didst devour it, without a care.
Oops, said she, laughing, thou hast eaten it all,
Without a morsel left, for me to sample, alack.

Affordable, too, this place, with service true,
The staff, most friendly, and attentive, anew.
I shall return, for breakfast, once again,
To savor Baby Cakes' delights, and not in vain."

I swung by this joint on a hunch, figuring they'd have wifi, ya know, coffee, tea, smoothies, the whole shebang. Turns out, no wifi. No big deal. The chick working was cool, gave me the lowdown on the menu, what she liked. I went with a strawberry piña colada smoothie. Damn good. Cheap too. Sat outside, enjoyed it. The foam on top, man, that was the cherry on top. Gotta come back, try one of their joes.

"First came here years back, when it just opened. Ceasars and Mirage were the big shots, and that pirate ship show outside was a real spectacle. Got upgraded to a top-floor room, sweet view, and fell hard for this town. \n\nYears later, maybe 15, I hadn't been back much, just passing through. But I saw a $5 craps table on my way out, decided to stick around and play a bit. Morning crowd was light, dealers were friendly, everyone was having a blast. Like the feature bet, sure it's a long shot, but 176 to 1 odds can make a guy feel pretty good. I'll be back, to play craps and slurp some soup. Good luck."

"Hark, what news is this? A place most wondrous,
Where folk of all sorts gather, in joy profuse.
The Grapevine, a spot most fair and bright,
Where laughter doth flow, like a river in flight.

In daylight or dark, in summer or winter's chill,
This haven doth beckon, with naught to fulfill.
Above, a patio, where families and friends do meet,
To partake of victuals, and revel in the heat.

And lo, a bar, with televisions in view,
Where sports enthusiasts may their games pursue.
But as the sun dips low, and night descends,
The fun doth not cease, for karaoke ascends.

Oh, the songs they do sing, with glee and with mirth,
From Elvis to Dixie Chicks, to Sir Mix a Lot's earth.
In this place, all may find, a bit of each delight,
A veritable smorgasbord, of music in sight."

"Schwartz's in Montreal, that's where you'll find me. My husband's got a thing for it, so we always stop by. Can't say I blame him. People order however they like, no judgments here. Me? I go for a sandwich, fries, pickle, and a cherry coke. A1 steak sauce on the side, of course. This place ain't no Katz's, but it's damn good smoked meat. The line looks long, but the guy at the door knows his stuff. Trust him, trust the staff, trust the smoker in the kitchen that's been cranking out killer sandwiches for 82 years. Just hope Celine Dion don't mess it up when she buys the place."
"Free weights, separate from treadmill zone. Pool's aces, trainers top-notch. Post-work visits, never too packed. Spin classes, fantastic."

"Oh, how I do adore their Chai frost, topped with fluffy whipped cream! 
In this snug coffeehouse, dim lights cast a warm and inviting glow, 
A perfect place to curl up with a pillow and blanket, don't you know? 
The service is swift, a delight to behold, and in the summer's heat, 
Misters mist, keeping all cool and comfy, what a treat! 
Verily, 'tis a pleasant spot to sip and savor a steaming cup."

"Hark! A report of inspection, dated 1/24/11, doth lie before mine eyes. And lo, upon perusal, naught but five items of import doth it reveal. Alack! No date didst grace the salad dressing, portioned forth for daily use. A minor quibble, surely. Fish and fries, conveniently placed for hasty lunchers, doth merit a mention, as doth an errant ice drain line and an air gap, both of which doth trouble the drive-through window. A bag of ice melt, stored near food, doth round out the list. Fie upon these paltry concerns! A score of 31, I say, doth suggest a kitchen plagued by spoilage, sickness, and the scurrying of rodents. Nay, good sirs! This humble abode, despite its flaws, doth serve the finest burgers, fries, and fried okra (by the gods!) in all the land. Alas, their drinks, a sorry lot, doth lack both root beer and ginger ale. Thus, I never doth order aught to slake mine thirst."

"Swung by Trader Joe's for some essentials. Employees were friendly, as usual. Fresh produce caught my eye, and I scored some free samples. Got more beer and wine than I needed, but that's beside the point. Trader Joe's never disappoints."

"Been here a few times. Atmosphere's great, servers are chill. Not busy, so service was top-notch. Been there when it was slammed too, still did a good job. I'll be back. Don't take offense at the four stars, hard for me to give a five."

"Methinks 'tis wondrous fortunate that we chanced upon this place,
For at the Sahara, alack, we found naught but disgrace.
Closed on Thanksgiving, e'er didst we find,
And so, with haste, we came hither, to dine.

A hostess fair, with patience most divine,
Didst tell us, "Wait thou shall, for one to three hours, by my troth!"
But, lo, a third time, I didst ask, with hope most bright,
If perchance, we might enter ere the night grew old and cold.

And thus, a booth didst open, as if by fate's design,
And in we went, with joy most truly divine.
A feast most wondrous, with steak of New York,
And ribeye, tenderloin, all didst please mine eye.
Sweet potatoes, too, though not so sweet,
Yet still, a worthy dish, to mine own conceit.

Fried green tomatoes, oh, how they didst delight,
With balsamic dressing, a most curious sight.
Chicken, blandish, yet paired well, I must confess,
With fried and balsamic, a most curious mess.

The view, by night, o'erlooks the pool, most fair,
Better, by far, than Sahara's, beyond compare.
And so, with full bellies, we didst take our leave,
With three-fourths of food, our hunger to relieve."

"Polar bear mascot at the Coca-Cola Store on the strip. Top-notch costume, better than the usual character getup. Puppet-like top, lots of animation. Take your own photos against a green screen, or spring for the package deal - two 5x7s and four smaller pics for $35. Friendly staff, plenty of Coke swag. A fun, free attraction in Vegas."

"Yeah, it's a chain, but it served its purpose. My mom wasn't eatin' well on her own, so my middle daughter'd stop by Boston Market, grab a couple dinners, and they'd have a nice visit and meal together. Mother liked what my daughter brought, and it was good nutrition. I'd stop by too, when I was in town. Liked their sides, sometimes just got a veggie plate. Their roast sirloin was decent, and their desserts were pretty good. They had dishes you don't usually find in fast food joints. Never had a problem with their grub, and it was consistent. Give it four stars, on a scale of fast food places."
