"Saddle Ranch ain't your typical restaurant, gotta give 'em that. Mechanical bull in the middle, skimpy shirts and fake racks everywhere. People gettin' tossed left and right, pure entertainment. Haven't tried the grub myself, but the folks say it's good stuff. They got treated like royalty when they went, even got a freebie from the manager. That's how you keep customers comin' back."

"This joint's our jam. Hit it up monthly, at least. Bottomless fries, killer appetizer for the rugrats. Burger game's on point. Service? Prompt and friendly, every time. Snag their frequent diner card for freebies and a b-day burger. Boom."

"Shoe warehouse, not just for gals. Men's section too. Organized by style - boots, laceups, slip-ons. My average feet, no problem finding fits. Clearance rack, score! Timberlake, 20% off, $52. Encore rewards, 10% off next visit. Not likely, but who knows?"

"Oh, woe is me, fair citizens of Pittsburgh! For in this city, there doth exist a great schism, a chasm wide and deep, 'twixt those who swear allegiance to Pamela's, and those who, like myself, do pledge their loyalty to Deluca's. 

Now, I do confess, dear friends, that I am proud to count myself among the latter group. For though Deluca's may have its flaws - long wait for a table, an atmosphere somewhat kitsch and retro, and a staff not overly concerned with pampering their clientele - yet, these very quirks do charm me still.

In truth, I find them rather endearing, and do seek them out, for they remind me of a simpler time, a time when diners were not so concerned with frills and fancy fare, but rather, with serving hearty portions of honest food, to satisfy the hunger of weary travelers and workers alike.

And so, dear friends, I say to thee, let us raise our mugs of coffee high, and toast to Deluca's, that humble diner, whose burritos are as large as our heads, and whose orange juice doth flow like a river in springtime! May it forever stand, a beacon of hope and comfort, in this bustling city of ours!"

"Get half the size you want. One scoop's about two. Fair prices, unique flavors upstairs in the smoky casino. Saw a kid with shaved ice as tall as their cup. Girlfriend said it's good, but not Baskin-Robbins good. Had banana Carmel chocolate chip. It was good, but I'm not an ice cream guy, so meh."

"Capastrami and Bobbie, those are the magic words. Know 'em and you'll leave one happy sandwich-eatin' mofo. For me, Bobbie takes the cake. Pastrami from Brix in Sunset Beach, that's some good stuff. But the real deal, that'd be the Bobbie. Turkey, stuffin', cranberry sauce, all on the softest bread. It's like Thanksgiving in a sandwich. You'll wanna find the nearest Capriottis and get there pronto."

In sooth, fair friends, what mattereth it where we lay our heads?
'Tis but a poor district, yet fear not, for we shall find
Comfort and ease within these walls, as though 'twere
A palace of the finest sort. Hark! What cheerful greetings
Stephanie doth offer thee, with smiles and courtesies abound.
Quickly, now, and with great ease, shalt thou depart,
Leaving behind the foulest thoughts that plagued thee.
This, then, is the West Side's creed, where all are welcome,
And Walmart, dear friend, doth stand as proof of this tale.

"Hark! What news is this? A craze doth sweep the land,
Frozen yogurt, self-served, doth please the crowd.
Some places doth excel, while others doth falter,
And some, alas! Doth leave a sour taste within.

Moshi, oh moshi! Thou art a wondrous treat,
A marshmallow's kin, yet kosher, doth appease.
With any yogurt flavor, thou doth complement,
A perfect pairing, sent from heav'n above.

Strawberries, oh ripe and juicy sweet!
At Yogurtology, they doth abound, a treat.
Other places, with lesser berries doth compete,
But here, they doth shine, a true delight.

Cleanliness, a virtue, doth this store possess,
And decorations, unique, doth make it stand.
Alas! The price, a bit steep, doth hinder,
A five-star rating, else it would command.

So four stars, then, for Yogurtology,
A place where frozen yogurt doth reign supreme.
Moshi, strawberries, cleanliness, doth make it be,
A spot where sweetness doth forever gleam."

"This place doth astound on weekends, full of life and bustle, yet on weekdays, 'tis empty as a barren land. The service, though, doth leave much to be desired, for when the staff hath naught else to do, their labors doth flag. The victuals, good, yet eggs, alas! doth come forth o'er runny, sunny-side up, they doth resemble not our request. Alack! We pay, methinks, for ambiance fair and freshness of some viands. Verily, I didst enjoy this place and shall return anon. :3"

"Fare sumptuous, prospect grand, attendance prime. Asketh not, for naught else doth matter. We, of yore, the prix fixe have savored, And from the common bill, a feast didst make. In sooth, a night most special, this place doth render."

"Great service at check-in. Staff took our bags, no need to lift a finger. Told us to call for room number instead of standing in line again. Guy on phone was rude, gave us wrong info. Spent 45 minutes searching for our room. Finally found it in the grand tower. Room was amazing, booked a suite. Housekeeping kept it spotless. Trying out THE Hotel @ Mandalay Bay and Bellagio next. See which one wins."

"Local joint, heard good things. Modest spot, friendly staff. If you can't handle heat, don't bother. Posole, amazing. Homemade tortillas, must-try. Different from the usual, but that's the point. New Mexican style, not Chicago Mexican. Good experience, will return."
"Grilled cheese, tomato soup, and a cold one. That's all I need. And maybe some dim lighting and good service. The Rogue Hazelnut does the trick."

"Fair food, how sweet thy taste doth be!
I didst partake of Vegenini, a feast for mine eyes and belly. 'Twas as a vegetarian pizza, and oh, how delectable! The potato fries, they didst complement mine meal most finely. And let us not forget the gentle folk who didst serve me, their kindness didst know no bounds."

"Cosmopolitan. Nice joint. Not as swanky as Aria or Vdara, but still, not bad. Feels a bit cluttered though. Casino's a maze, multi-level mess. Couldn't even find the sushi bar we wanted. No staff in sight to guide us. Still, not a bad spot. Imagine staying here? Balcony, minibar? Not too shabby."

"Food was three stars, but Tashja, our friendly waitress, bumped it up to four. She knew her stuff and made great recs. That North Boulevard drink? Dangerous. Tasted like happy lemonade but packed a punch. Fried pickles? Crunchy and delish. I went for the Ahi Tuna burger, and it hit the spot. Hubby's turkey burger was just okay. Sandwiches are on the smaller side, but who needs a big ol' burger when you got Tashja's charm?"

"In Venetian's heart, Bouchon Bistro lies,
Thomas Keller's gem, where culinary surprise,
Awaits those who seek a meal divine,
With chic and casual air, it shines.

Google's queries, dress code, a quest,
Reflects confusion, a true test,
But fear not, for we shall reveal,
Its nature, traditional, yet concealed.

Steak Frites, a plate, pan-seared prime,
Flat iron, maître d'hôtel butter, sublime,
With frites, a perfect pair, a treat,
For meat lovers, a dish, neat.

Sourdough Waffles, a delight,
Bananas, walnuts, maple syrup, a sight,
Tahitian vanilla bean butter, rich,
A flavorful mix, beyond our reach.

Beignets, chocolate, fruit, a treat,
Dipping sauces, cinnamon sweet,
Bread, fresh, authentic, crusty, a delight,
A feast, for senses, a true delight.

D's steak, good, fries, a letdown,
House-made, special, not quite found,
My waffles, fantastic, vanilla, walnuts,
A taste, divine, beyond our talons.

Syrup, warm, not needed, a grace,
A small fault, in this culinary place,
But still, Bouchon Bistro, a gem,
In Las Vegas, a must-visit theme."

"Went there with the missus for her birthday. Cozy joint, good service. Server kept checkin' on us, makin' sure all was well. I had the Bolognese, bit dull. Boyfriend got the FRUTTI DI MARE, damn good. Shrimps were a highlight, I swiped 'em from his plate. Dessert, gelato with espresso, pure bliss. Enjoyed the grub and service."
"Decent Viet grub in Vegas. Found it on Yelp, gave it a shot. Food's solid, prices right. Friendly service too. Authentic eats. Be back."

"Arby's, best one around. Wait's a bit long, but worth it. Order's always right, food's always fresh. Get coupons in the mail, Centennial View too. Other deals, rotating. No complaints, good mood food."

"Macaroni Grill, a solid spot. Been there a few times, never disappointed. Service is friendly and prompt, food is good for a chain. Had their pasta dishes, grilled pork chops, and Insalata Blu - all good. Their bread with olive oil and black pepper is a nice touch. Blackberry mint iced tea, too. Music is a mix of Italian opera and 50's crooners like Sinatra. Sometimes a singer does "Happy Birthday" in Italian. Restrooms play Italian lessons. Good spot for solid Italian food and friendly service."

"Verily, a fine establishment this was, and upon the world wide web didst I discover it. Alas, my stomach didst protest, and thus I didst opt for noodles instead of sushi, which didst satisfy mine hunger and warm mine belly. A pleasant salad it was indeed, and I didst enjoy it much. Aye, I didst wish to partake in other dishes, but alack, 'twas not meant to be. Yet shall I return anon, forsooth."

"This joint used to be a real oasis, and it still is, even after they fixed it up. Prices ain't as cheap no more, but it's still one of my faves on the strip. Don't know what that other guy was talkin' 'bout, 'cause this place is spotless. Layout's great, lots of room to chill, way better than that cramped Mirage joint. Lightin's nice and dim, makes ya feel real relaxed. And they got plenty of water and cucumbers for your peepers, that's top-notch. If you're like me and like to spend some time loungin', Nurture's the ticket. Shame the strip don't take spas serious enough, so I can't give it a full 5. But hey, it's still a damn good spot. Just remember, it's a bit of a hike from the parkin' lot, so give yerself some extra time, especially if you ain't stayin' at the Luxor."

"O, how I adore this place, yet oft forget,
The rockin' shrimp, a dish most wondrous, get.
The slider app, a meal most fair and fine,
For ladies, a delightful repast divine.
I cherish the salmon, my heart doth sing,
My husband, the chimichurri skirt steak doth bring.
Their happy hour, a time of joy and cheer,
One of the best, without a doubt, my dear."

"Vegas, we drank and ate well here twice. First, shared chicken and steak nachos, huge and delicious. Couldn't finish it together. Second, tortilla chips, salsa, and mild chicken wings. Good, not overfilling. Beer helps. Not expensive, good sizes. Get tix from girl outside for buy one get one free drinks. Cheaper than happy hour. Great service, friendly staff."

"Subway, ain't no denying. Best bang for your buck, that's for sure. Clean joint, quick service. Rich folk 'round here, they know their stuff. Busy as hell during peak hours, but hey, that's life. Better subs out there? Maybe. But not at this price, pal."

"Liked it here. Atmosphere, friendly service, cute decor. Clash played too loud. Prompt chips and salsa. Good chips, not burnt or thick. House salsa, smoky flavor, not too spicy. Cucumber mint agua fresca, light and refreshing. Nachos, corn added. Server said, "It's like a meal." Filled me up, lots leftover. Will return for other agua fresca flavors, veggie tacos."
"Inn's decent. Google led us astray, but we made it. Parking's a ripoff, but rooms are clean and staff's friendly. No French spoken."
"Fresh veggies at a steal. Avoid the crowds on the first two days of the month, when the prices are at their cheapest."
Hotel cafe, pricey but worth it. Crowded, long lines, typical Vegas scene. Opens early, perfect for post-club hunger. We waited, eager for breakfast. Only in Vegas, I tell ya.
"Airport grub, not bad. Four stars, slaw on burger. Outside, three stars, tops."

"Motel One, I like it. Central location, modern design, comfy beds. No frills, just what you need. Same goes for the one in Edinburgh. Perfect spot, though it's a bit tough to find. Breakfast is alright, nothing special. Friendly service. No twin rooms, that's a bummer."

"Hark! A tale of Panini Cafe, a place most fair,
Where kosher and veggie dishes do abound.
A pescatarian feast did they prepare,
With fish as sole meat option, proffered round.

Their menu did include salmon, tuna, and tilapia too,
And hummus, oh so tasty, with pita bread anew.
Ravioli Athens, with garlic, basil, and feta on top,
Did tempt my taste buds, and I did not stop.

Though pricey, at sixteen ninety-nine, I did not mind,
For flavors so delightful, it was worth the find.
Kosher, too! A bonus, indeed, a true delight,
And portion size, most generous, a pleasure to bite.

My friend, with roasted eggplant, creamy and sweet,
Did enjoy her meal, and service, we did meet.
A house salad, too! Most pleasant, I must say,
At Panini Cafe, a visit, we will make again someday."
"Nice joint. Good grub and drinks. Smells like coconut, like sunscreen. Better than cigarette stench. Staff's friendly."
"Rough day, needed a drink. Went to the place down the street, had a duck breast and some pork meatballs. Damn good. Chocolate soufflé for dessert, not bad either. Friendly staff, good service."
"Went to the club for the first time. Bouncers were cool, made sure there was room to move. Sound system was top-notch. DJs were on point. Two floors, upstairs was bigger."

"Five Guys, a solid choice for a burger that ain't no fancy-schmancy gourmet meal. Their patties are damn tasty, and you get a shitload of free toppings. I mean, who doesn't love free peanuts while they wait? Now, the fries - that's where it's at. Regular or Cajun, they're both top-notch. And let me tell you, the regular size is plenty big, even for two people. They got a simple menu, but hey, it works. They got dogs and grilled cheese too, for those who don't feel like a burger. Me? I'd say it's a close call between Five Guys and In N Out, but I end up here more often."

"A humble abode, this eatery doth be,
Where margaritas flow like nectar from the tree.
And though the fare may not be fancy,
'Tis good and plentiful, a true delight.

La Mejor, I do confess, doth please me well,
While my dear husband doth swear by Pollo con Crema.
And when we leave, our bellies full and content,
We take with us the leftovers, a bonus, no doubt.

The service, alas, doth vary in its grace,
Sometimes swift, sometimes slow, a puzzling race.
But generally, the servers doth attend with care,
And bring our feast with haste, without a snare.

The dining hall, I must confess, doth show its age,
A bit worn down, like a worn-out page.
The booths and tables, once grand, now doth appear,
To need a sprucing up, to banish fear.

Yet still, we come, for value doth it hold,
A place to dine, where coin doth not unfold.
So if thou seekst a meal, both hearty and fair,
Come hither, friend, and dine with nary a care."
"Strong margaritas and a snack at this joint after work. Familiar vibe, like Super-Mex. Drinks, appetizer, and bartender all good."

"Rolled in around 10 am on a Friday with my main squeeze. Didn't make an appointment, but still got seated quick for some pedi action. 

Word of advice: book ahead, 'cause after a few minutes, the place started bustin' at the seams. 

They asked us which pedi we wanted, and we went with the Luxury option - $45, but worth every penny. Best pedi I've ever had, hands down. 

It was like royal treatment, complete with leg mask, salt scrub, sugar scrub, and even hot wax for our dogs. Henry and an older lady tended to us, both super friendly and helpful. 

We were mighty impressed, so we decided to make it our regular spot for girls' day pedicures."

"Hark, what a wondrous site doth lie before mine eyes! A place of gastronomic delight, wherein I did partake of a delectable farmer's sandwich, savoring each morsel with relish. The service, too, didst impress me mightily, for 'twas prompt and most courteous. The ambiance, with its quaint patio and charming decor, didst evoke within me a sense of merriment and joy. And though the menu may be limited to salads, sandwiches, and pizzas, yet didst it satisfy my hunger and craving. Verily, I do recommend this Liberty Market to one and all!"

"Ordered drinks for the long haul back to LA. Not disappointed. One of the better boba places I've tried in Vegas. Squatty cups, like Half n Half back home. Tea was good, boba was soft, but not as sweet as I hoped. Nice atmosphere, friendly employees. Not bad, if you're in Vegas."
"Parents rave about this joint. Now, so do I. New York-style pizza, thin crust, long slices, just like back home. Don't be fooled by the prices, it's worth it."

"Spent a wild weekend in Vegas. Wynn hotel, minibar, room service, champagne, and XS nightclub. We lived like rock stars, until the room bill arrived. $700 for the room, $800 for room service. Suddenly, we felt like nervous teens who had crashed the family car. If you're looking for a good time, get the burger sliders and champagne. They're worth it. But, maybe consider saving some cash and sticking to sparkling wine instead."
"Good service, but jammed. Make an appointment or wait twenty minutes. Pricey for gel nails."
"Cracker Barrel, always a fan. This one, same charm, same cuteness. Food, homestyle, well-prepared. Service, friendly. Prices, reasonable. One of my go-tos for home cookin' when I'm feelin' lazy."

"Coffee's not great here at the Beat, but who cares? Food's good, atmosphere's better. People come to hang out, chat, listen to tunes, eat some grub, or just do their own thing. Location's prime too - plenty of parking and big windows for people-watching. Coffee's not the best, but I can live with it. Other things make up for it."

"Flew in and out of McCarran last week. No issues. Shuttle to hotel was quick and easy. Small buses for a small fee. Security snafu with a multi-tool in my friend's bag, but that's another story. Still trying to recall the night before."

"Methinks 'tis naught but a brief delay,
Five or ten minutes, ere I may partake
Of yonder burger, deftly wrought with care,
And savor each morsel with rapt attention's glare.
Aye, verily, the victuals have ever been
Of quality fine, and worth the waiting seen."

"Hark, my dearest friend, what news I bring thee! 

To yonder hookah lounge we didst repair, 

And found most wondrous deals, our spirits to cheer. 

Drinks and victuals, both halved in price, 

Didst tempt our taste, and we didst not think twice. 

A Pear-sian Drop martini, sweet and tart, 

Pesto Pita Pizza, with flavors so bright, 

And Athens Fries, crispy and golden, didst play their part. 

The staff, so friendly and helpful, didst greet us straight, 

With hookah scents, a tray full, didst present. 

A simple concept, yet most excellent, indeed, 

For flavors at other hookah places, can be hit or miss, 'tis true. 

We opted for the frozen hookah, with gel so cool, 

And paid ten silver pieces, a fair price, methought. 

The atmosphere, lush and exotic, didst envelop us, 

And classic rock didst fill the air, most wondrous. 

But alas, dear Paymon, a gripe I do have, 

For coal refills, during happy hour, didst thou not provide. 

A waste, a shame, a bowl with life still in it, didst go to waste. 

I pray thee, change this policy, and five stars shall be thine, 

For otherwise, thy hookah lounge, doth shine."

"Eagle Mountain Golf Club, Fountain Hills, AZ. First time playing here, loved it. Course in great shape, fairways and greens top-notch. Challenging layout with options for all skill levels. Rolling hills, changes in elevation, beautiful. Fun, undulating greens. Spectacular views of Phoenix. Cheap beer, $2 16oz PBR. Can't wait to return. 95% return factor."
"Good joint for accessories. Snagged a few nice blazers. Staff wasn't exactly warm, but not outright rude either. Just a tad meh."

"Never been to Philly, but this joint reminds me of Frankies in Tucson. Used to be on 5th Ave, now it's on Craftsman Ct in Old Town Scottsdale. Triple the space, still open 24/7. My girl got a Groupon, finally took me here. Ordered a regular cheesesteak with whiz, fries on the side. Food came fast, disappeared even faster. Bread was soft, steak was flavorful. Awesome spot, but damn parking was a pain. Feels like we drove around for hours, but probably wasn't that long. Love this place, hope to be back soon."

"Drinks here are top-notch, service even better. Friendly folks, good conversation. Menu's not as big as Starbucks', but more unique flavors for those looking for something different. And let's be real, they taste better too."
"Burgers at Buta were a revelation. Flavors I loved, all of 'em. Didn't expect much, but damn, it hit the spot. Second in line, service was quick. Pricey, yeah, but worth it."

"Place reopened, thankfully. Hot damn, pizza's good. NY style, fresh, less than that dump across the street. Hot, I mean smokin'. Quality, service, late evening. Quick slice on E. Fremont? This is the spot. Uncle Joe's cool, but don't mess with him. Two jerks got tossed like yesterday's trash."

"Moved to Bloomfield in April, thought Little Italy would be a good fit. Wrong. Every Italian joint I tried was subpar. Until tonight. Lombardozzi, had no idea why I hadn't tried it until now. Had their meatballs during Little Italy Days, enjoyed 'em. Decided to give 'em a shot. Started with calamari, perfectly fried, no rubbery texture. Gnocchi with red sauce, homemade and delicious. Meatballs, just as good as I remembered. Service? Bad. Waitress took forever to take our drink order, seemed annoyed. Will be back, though. No Italian food in Bloomfield comes close to Lombardozzi."

"A feast fit for a king, with fresh shrimp and crab legs to delight. Prime ribs and leg of lamb, oh what a wondrous sight! And on the carving table, many other dishes to choose from, a veritable cornucopia of delights. And let us not forget the sweetest of treats, crepes made to order, a true indulgence. But fear not, good sir, for the weekday price is most reasonable, a true bargain indeed."
"Steak sandwich, damn good. Fries, crispy and hot. No sauce needed. Wife had Mamas burger, bun and mushrooms, nice. Meat, flavorless. Give 'em another shot."

"Sitting down to eat meant waiting in line on the street and sharing a table with strangers. Didn't bother me none, though. It added some charm to the place, I thought. The smoked turkey sandwich was real good, moist and tender. Fries were crispy outside, soft inside. Dill pickle was big and tasty. Cole slaw was lightly dressed, some of the best I've had. Our server was top-notch, funny and fast. Place had the best reviews and highest rating, no surprise. Worth checking out."

"This joint was top-notch. Had the buffalo cheesesteak sandwich with raw jicama fries, a welcomed change from the usual fare. 

Modern vibes, plenty of comfy seats, and a decent-sized crowd. Most folks were dressed for the gym next door. Parking was a bit tight, but there was always space to be found. 

They had a nice cafe area too, with some stylish furniture. Impressed, and I'll be back."

"Hark, had it not been for Lotus of Siam's fare,
Five stars, perchance, they would have graced their lair.

Appetizers, a must, the beef thai jerky doth please,
And, of course, their tom kha soup, a symphony of ease.

Entrees, oh how grand, Prik King and Panang, a delight,
I pray, good sirs, that you may savor each bite with all thy might.
As age doth creep, my taste buds, alas, do lose their zest,
Thus, mild I order, and spices on the side, I do request.
Ask, thou must, for they may not offer, 'tis a shame,
Yet, 'tis worth the query, for thus, a greater flame."

"I step into the joint, straight outta the black and whites. Red lipstick, cocktail dress, the whole nine. Jazz bar, that's where I'm headed. Clickin' my fingers as I descend the stairs, feeling like a boss. House band's on point, especially the piano man. But sometimes, it's a crap shoot with the guests. Can be amazing, can be terrible. All in all, still a fan."

"Walked from Caesar's Palace towards the Forum Shops, left at the fork. Ordered waffle fries dusted with cocoa and chili powder, chocolate chai to go. Watched the barista make my drink, step by step, like a recipe. Ate a few fries before heading back into the mall, before they got soggy. For $7, about 10-12 large waffle fries. Didn't taste much cocoa, just a hint of chili. Drink was worth it, rich and hot, but not too frothy."
"Killed time at Apache, waited for a spot to open. Enchilada plate, red and cheesy, surprised me. Tomato-based sauce, not my thing, but it worked. Six bucks, a steal."

"Coffee was weak, but dad's breakfast special - two eggs, hash browns for 3.95 - was a steal. Korean omelette was flavorful, but won't order that combo again. Cheery owner and chef. Colorful decor. Great morning spot."

"I ain't from 'round here, so when I hit Phoenix, I gotta stop at a Jersey Mike's. They ain't got none of 'em where I live, down in So Cal. Can't wait 'til they open up some more, 'cause their quality's top-notch, way better than that Subway or Quiznos crap."

"Verily, the victuals didst prove worth the coin,
In size, they didst surpass our expectations.
The menu, alack, didst stretch on for miles,
A burden for our taste buds' deliberations.

A trimming, perchance, wouldst do it good,
To split the choices twixt morning and evening's mood.
But, lo, the innards of the place didst shine,
With artistry that didst mine eyes doth blind.

Four burgers we didst sample, each a delight,
And fries, in varied forms, didst please our sight.
In sooth, a feast most wondrous and fair,
That didst leave us sated, without a single care."

"A place most wondrous, where pizza and wings doth please,
With friendly folk, and service that ne'er doth cease.
'Tis one of mine own favored haunts, for dinner most fair,
In atmosphere most jovial, and food most rare."

"Friend told me Guy Fieri did a show here, so I figured I'd give it a shot. Rolled in at 6:30 sharp and ordered the enchiladas. Not bad, not bad at all. Expected a bit more, but still, a solid plate."

"McAlp's, across the street from where I worked. Twice a week, minimum. Atmosphere, good. Food, better. Desserts, best. No need for renovations. Classic vibes only. Making me hungry just thinking about it. Need to schedule a downtown meeting, excuse to eat there again."

In fair Scottsdale, where spring's warmth doth reign,
I sought a savory steak, of finest grain.
The locals, all, did speak of Mastro's fame,
And thus, I ventured thither, with keen aim.

The entrance, full of life and energy,
Did greet me well, with bustling glee.
The bar, though crowded, did not deter me,
For spirits, fine, did flow, in abundance, free.

The feast, oh, how it did delight!
The steak, a tender, juicy wonder, took flight.
Of three, the best, I dare say, it doth rank,
A culinary joy, that doth leave no blank.

Though prices be not, of the lowly sort,
'Tis worth each coin, this culinary sport.
So, if thou art in Scottsdale, do not tarry,
To Mastro's Ocean Club, make haste, and hurry!

"Wine list? Ridiculous. But that's their shtick. Huge, like a damn phonebook. Organized by price, not variety or region. Serves two restaurants, Cowboy Ciao and Kasmierz. Cowboy Ciao's doing well, location, setting, food's good. Went there with L and my pops and his new wife. Had the K Vintners' highly-rated wine for $200. Better memory with wines than what we ate."

"Driving back from Tempe, I swung by this joint for a bite. Clean digs, friendly folk, and damn good grub. Had their ribeye steak sandwich, a solid 7 bucks, with fries and onion rings. One of the better steak sammies I've had. Onion rings? Not usually my jam, but these were game-changers. Giving 'em four stars for now. Need to try the burger before I can give 'em the full five."

"This joint's the real deal. Heard about it a couple months back, and my wife and I checked it out last Saturday. Then again the next day. Yeah, it's that good. Cozy spot for a cup o' joe and some R&R. Cinnamon roll's top-notch, especially the frosting. Waffle sandwich with Bechamel? One of the best breakfast sammies I've had. Took my wife's cousin Johnny along the second time, and he gave it two thumbs up too. We're makin' it a regular stop, every Saturday or every other. Give it a shot, and don't forget to try the lunch options."

"Steakhouse, good stuff. Salad, veggies, lobster mac, all delish. Service top-notch. Ambiance, music, A+. But steak? Overcooked. Medium rare, my ass. More like medium-well. For real? Payin' premium, expect better. That's a fact."

"Saturday night, Labor Day weekend. Not too busy. Scored a sweet spot in the back, comfy couches. Our waiter, a friendly bloke, gave us the lowdown. Sampled some wine and dessert. A bit steep, but we'll be back. Solid experience."

"In went I, and of the pork rib and fatty brisket did partake. And verily, 'twas quite good, I must confess. Forsooth, I do not oft care for pork ribs, but this, it did fall off the bone with ease, and was most moist and juicy. The brisket, too, did please mine taste, with just enough fat to make it most flavorful. 

They had three sorts of bbq sauces, sweet, smokey, and a white thunder. The sweet, a typical bbq sauce, was naught to write home about. But smokey, ah! That was my favorite, with a rich, deep flavor. White thunder, alack! Was naught but heat, and little else. 

The prices, standard fare, did start at eight dollars. And since 'tis near my place of work, I would indeed return, anon."
"Urban chic, this place. Chai tea latte, top-notch. Breakfast, pricey. Bagels, Sara Lee. Honey-butter, makes up for it."

"Four to five stars, easy. Spicy as hell, but that's what we came for. Fried avocado, oh man. Best thing I've ever tasted. Owner was a sweetheart, too. Friendly, helpful. She knew her stuff. Thursday nights, wine's half off. We took advantage, stayed for hours. Small joint, but packed. Must be the good word from the locals. Summerlin knows a good thing when they see it. Great lighting, too. Don't let the strip mall location fool you. Perfect for a date or girls' night out."

"Verily, 'tis a pleasant scent that doth fill mine nostrils.
A trifling sum, indeed, doth purchase this delight.
A subtle jape, a playful jest, doth aim at thy hygiene, good sir.
And lo, another market doth present itself, where gifts for women of a certain age may be had, come Christmas tide."

"Best brunch buffet in town. Omelet station, killer eggs, top-notch desserts. Champagne flows like water. My tiny roommate devoured everything in sight. Three hours straight. Food coma ensued. That's how you know it's good."
"Lunch menu, good stuff. Be back next time in Vegas."

"Hark, what news is this? A Monday, and near three,
We arrived, and found but four folk before us, yea,
Yet did it take some ten minutes to find our seat,
And lo, the line grew long, and folk didst tarry,
Their dinner, and their time, they would not yield,
For they didst wish to see the feast, and savour it,
As did we all, with eager, hungry eyes.

But alas, dear friends, I must confess,
Some parts of this fair meal didst not impress,
The eggs benedict, so hard to cut,
And when I bit, 'twas rubbery, and not so neat,
And though I love meat, two choices there were,
Top sirloin, and flank steak, and naught else to spare,
The sweets, so cute, but some didst not delight,
Too creamy, or too sweet, and not quite right,
I asked for milk, to ease my taste buds' plight,
But still, no second helpings didst I take, alack,
For though the food was good, yet didst not shine,
A star deducted, for not serving dishes divine."

"Atmosphere and service, top-notch. But let's get down to business. Cocktails, no kick. Two drinks, still sober. Popcorn, good. Albacore tuna, phenomenal. Prime rib, fun presentation. A fun joint, worth another visit."
"Birthday dinner with loved ones. Sushi spread fit for the gods."

"Hark, they do provide conveyance of victuals!
Their pizza, a culinary delight, doth surpass
Most other delivery establishments in flavor.
A ten-inch pie, a suitable portion for one,
Doth satisfy hunger and craving. The staff,
In merriment and mirth, didst converse with us,
And answers to our queries didst provide.
We shall, anon, partake of their fare once more."

"In days of yore, when EM Cafe didst open its doors,
'Twas a hit straight away, by fortune's favor.
Its decor, so breezy and effortless, doth please,
With tall ceilings, white walls, and art local.
A big table in the midst, for gatherings great,
Doth make it a place where folk do congregate.
The victuals, though basic, didst satisfy,
But late, alas! some dishes didst decline.
Sandwiches, omelets, and French toast, a treat,
Portions, not vast, yet still, they didst suffice.
In Mile End, 'tis now a haunt most dear,
A wonder, indeed, on Parc Avenue, quite near."
"Aria or Cosmo? Toss-up. But I know one thing - Aria's got the best poker game in town. That's why I stick with them."

"Food was top-notch. Had the carne asada platter, real good. Friend had some burrito, said it was great. Service was slow, but the guy at the register was friendly. Didn't get our drinks refilled, no one checked on us. Not a big deal. We'll be back."

In fair Noda, where parking's a fray,
A coffee shop did catch my eye, by name.
With private lot, a rarity, I say,
And Wi-Fi free, a bonus, come what may.

The shop, cozy and quaint, didst greet,
With ten small tables, inside and out.
A roasting machine, a treat, didst meet,
For coffee fans, a joy, no doubt.

My taste, sweet and strong, doth crave,
Like Cuban brew, a flavor, not a wave.
But hazelnut cold brew, I didst choose,
A mistake, perchance, yet still, it does.

To research, I came, with time to spare,
Three hours passed, with thoughts to share.
A Chai iced latte, lemon poppy muffin,
Didst order, with anticipation, tuffin.

The latte, good, yet not a must,
In my drink list, a maybe, just.
But staff, so friendly, kind and bright,
A reason, sure, to return in sight.

In colder days, Cuban coffee, I'll try,
And see, if it doth make my heart fly.

"Had a swell time. Feedback from pals wasn't glowin', but she cleaned up nice. Bottle service did the trick. One Cîroc for four gals, we drained it and raised hell. Comfy bench, prime view from up top. Dancin' with pals, props, and dancers made for a wild night. Would do it again."

"Hark, what revelry doth fill this place!
Loud, boisterous, and full of grace.
A reservation, praise the stars above,
Didst grant us entry, and thus we didst love.
The service, swift and attentive, brought
Our victuals forth, and drinks, as sought.
No seat, methinks, didst lack in charm,
In this, a tavern of good renown, no alarm.
A simple feast, a cheeseburger, didst please,
And left me yearning for the next time's ease.
The brownie, too, didst bring me bliss,
As if in heaven, my soul didst dismiss.
A wine list, long and varied, didst show,
With choices rare, and some, not oft known.
I shall return, in haste, anon,
For more of this, most decent American fare, well-done."

"This joint's great. Good eats, cheap. Persian/Middle Eastern grub, casual, fast, and fresh. Lunch with a drink, under 8-9 bucks easy. Kubideh combo, two skewers, ground chicken and lamb, plenty of food. Eight bucks, that's all."

"A humble coffeehouse, beneath Elizabeth Arden's famed Red Door Spa, doth lie. 

Their pastry selection, though limited, didst catch mine eye. Yet, I didst opt for an iced coffee, priced at three silver dollars. Alas, the brew didst taste a tad too watery, yet on a sweltering day, it didst quench mine thirst. 

Methinks a pinch of sugar, in water form, wouldst have elevated the drink, but lo, 'twas nowhere to be found."
"Food's alright, but the service is top-notch. I come here for the game, a couple drinks, and the atmosphere. TVs everywhere, different games on each one. Big screen on the patio, it's a real treat."

"Saturday mornin', still on the road. Laundry time. Real easy access, real clean too. Nice attendant tells me they got fluff 'n' fold for $1.50 a pound. Plenty of machines, wifi, change machine, soap, TVs, A/C, ceiling fans, carts, foldin' tables, seating. And if you're a trucker, this place is on the corner, plenty of bobtail parkin' on the street. I'll be back."

"O, how my heart doth sing with joy for thee,
Cajun barbecue shrimp, thou art divine!
Bread, oh bread, thou art a worthy friend,
To mop up all the saucy goodness that doth end.
Great service, drinks of fine quality,
Before the crowds, a peaceful reprieve doth be.
And music, country tunes that doth delight,
In this, a country bar, where spirits take flight.
Aye, shrimp most wondrous, thy praise I do sing,
For thou dost make my taste buds dance with glee!"

"I didn't stay here, but I did win a few hundred bucks gambling. Had a good time, but getting drinks took forever. Not gonna let that ruin it for me though. The roller coaster's a blast. Rode it last time, had a hell of a lot of fun. Can't wait to come back and maybe even stay here next time."

"Methinks 'tis a grand conceit, my friend,
This notion of individual portions, quaint and rare,
A novel way to dine, with laughter ne'er-ending,
And share we shall, like friends of old, in fairness.

The highlights, they did shine so bright,
Pesto mashed potatoes, prime rib, fried delight,
Mushroom risotto, truffled scalloped potatoes,
A feast fit for a king, with naught to doubt.

But alas, not all did please mine eyes,
Ramen, too salty, a bitter surprise,
Sushi, a disappointment, so I did hear,
And some desserts, rock hard, without a sigh.

A clever thought, the mac and cheese bar,
Yet one bowl sufficeth for the table, fair,
For rich and creamy, it doth overflow,
And leave room for the king crab legs, we must, ere we go.

Though variety may lack, in comparison,
This place doth offer dishes of distinction,
Different ingredients, unique and rare,
A culinary journey, beyond compare."

"Good eatery. Love their chipotle sausage. Cheese top-notch. Had it on a burger, too. Hushpuppies decent. Moist like conch fritters. Pork, mac, beans all good. Variety of sauces. Signature sauce, vinegar and tomato mix. Brisket, meh. Ribs, fatty and tough. Hope that's a fluke. Support local spots. Friendly staff."

"Husband and I hit up Presto for the first time. Ahi tuna sliders, Greek pide - both solid. Never had pide before, but the non-greasy crust was a welcome change from the usual pizza mess. Service was good, despite some online gripes. Only gripe: pre-made salads kept in a cooler. Wanted the ahi salad, but it sat all day, so passed. Can't say how it tasted, but overall, a good lunch spot."

"The Cosmopolitan, four stars. Didn't stay, but still saw plenty. Casino's a stunner, crystals hangin' like a chandelier. Loved it. Clubs and shops, high-end, outta my league. Sports Book, watched my team win. Better odds than my place. One of the nicest on the Strip."
"North Phoenix, friend's birthday. Mutual pal chose the spot. Authentic joint, Cantonese-speaking staff. Helpful with recs. I'd return if I lived nearby."

We stepped into the bar on Las Vegas Boulevard, dodging the commotion of the strip. My pals and I were eager for a drink and a bite before hitting the cinema at South Point. Aware of the crowded casino, we opted for this spot. My initial visit was uninspiring, but this time proved improved. We settled into a side booth around 10 pm. The staff took their time acknowledging us, but once alerted, they became attentive.

The menu stretched far and wide, a double-edged sword. My first encounter left me unimpressed, particularly with their chili. However, the variety of salads won me over. On Thursdays, they feature BBQ chicken atop cold soba noodles, surrounded by a medley of vegetables. The marinade brought to mind Chinese-style BBQ, albeit saltier than sweeter. The half-portion, priced at 8.95, satisfied my hunger. I aimed for a healthy choice, yet couldn't resist swiping my friend's fries. Thick-cut and golden-brown, they were utter perfection.

An added bonus, the bar played an abundance of 90's alternative tunes. Smashing Pumpkins and Bush transported me back to my youthful days.

"Methinks what pleaseth me most about this place, my dear,
Is the basement where the used vinyl doth reside.
In Milwaukee, twain locations doth have the records on the ground,
So full they be, that sitting on the floor doth seem profound.
And moving twenty at a time, 'tis a chore, indeed,
But here, oh here, the vinyl doth reside in bins with ease,
Seventy-five percent, a number most divine,
Doth make my heart sing with joy, and my spirit doth entwine.
And in this basement, empty and still,
I doth feel welcome to sit and peruse at my will.
For two hours, or more, I doth not feel ashamed,
To search through each album, and each note, unnamed.
In Milwaukee, at the store on 76th street,
I doth not feel welcome, with people all around,
But here, my dear, I doth feel most at home,
In this basement, where the vinyl doth roam."

"Moon Doggies, a dive bar that's surprisingly clean, serves up grub that's worth trying. Chris, the owner of Naked City Pizza, told me it's a cool spot, mostly for industry folks. I took my hubs and dad there for lunch, and we skipped the pizza - I mean, when in Rome, right? We went for the buffalo wings instead, and they did not disappoint. They were cooked just how I like 'em, nice and hot. My old man loved his chili cheese hot dog, loaded with all the fixin's. The steak frites sub was a beast of a sandwich, packed with garlicky beef, creamy horseradish, and crispy fries. It came with a side of peppery gravy that hit the spot. Our lunch for three was $25, and we even took some home. I'll definitely be back soon to try the pizza!"

"Saturday afternoon, early, dropped by for lunch. One other table, not many, but new, so understandable. Server, new too, but did well. Ordered Ma Po Tofu, Baked Pork and Rice with Portuguese sauce. Good taste. This place, good for Hong Kong-style western dishes. East side alternative to Spring Mountain Road Chinese restaurants."

"Tis not for gastronomic delights that I doth frequent Dish,
But rather for its easygoing air and savory southern dishes,
A grilled cheese sandwich, half-cooked, doth please mine appetite,
With cup of tomato bisque, a pairing most delightful.

The deviled egg, a side dish, doth add a special charm,
A nice touch, indeed. And thus, my heart doth sing,
For black bean and rice burrito, my taste buds doth clamor.
In this cozy spot, with cool tunes playing on the jukebox,
I find contentment, free from fancy frills and fuss."

"I hit this joint twice in 24 hours during our Vegas trip. Reasonable prices, food's not half bad either. Had the garlic chicken wings, hubby liked 'em, but I thought they could've used a bit more flavor. Crispy garlic was decent, though. Salted fish and chicken fried rice? Hell yeah, that's what I'm talkin' about. Generous portions, too. My pops wasn't feelin' too hot, so I got him some jook - salted pork with thousand year old egg porridge. Not bad, nice balance of saltiness without bein' too watery. Later on, my old man had their curry beef. Can't say for sure how it was, but he cleaned his plate, so that's a good sign. Beef chow fun? Now we're talkin'. Lot of flavor, nice kick from the stove. A few other dishes, but overall, this tiny hole in the wall outside the strip's a solid find. And best part? Won't break the bank."
"Good work, fair price. Took my Audi to Dan, a man I trust. No issues, like usual."

"Went there last night with some pals. Service was top-notch. Our server kept our glasses full and even split the tab for us after we forgot to tell her to. My pizza was damn good. Got a personal pie with artichokes and sliced tomatoes. A bit pricey, but the ingredients were high-quality and I was real pleased with it. Everyone else at the table raved about their grub too. Didn't see a single slice of pizza left at the end of the night. Worth going back for, just wish they had more options on the menu."

"Food's better than your average pub grub. Got some real interesting dishes, like that tomato soup with goat cheese, goat cheese fritters, and butternut squash croquettes. They got a good selection of local beers on tap too. Atmosphere's cozy, just like you'd want from a pub."

"This joint's always bumpin', but not so packed the staff can't take care of you. I've chowed down here a few times and the grub's always been top-notch. Their pasta dishes are where it's at, haven't had a bad one yet. If I'm feelin' frisky, I'll go for the flank steak salad. It's still damn good. And their Italian sodas? Hurricane's my jam. This place is my new go-to for Italian and it's a must-try."

"Great joint near Concordia, good for a fast lunch or a spot to hit the books. They got everything - good eats, drinks, and even poetry readings on the weekends. The panini and soup combo is a steal for a student like me, and the lavender lemonade is top-notch. It's not too sweet, which is nice since most lemonade is watered down. It's a cool spot, laid back, and good for whatever you need - studying, chillin', or just grabbing a bite. Would be great to see them bring back the shisha, though."
"Saturday afternoon, lunchtime. Food came quick. Tasted good. Had Pa-nang curry, pineapple fried rice, Mongolian beef, chicken pad Thai. Spicy, but needed more. Order at 11, maybe you'll get lucky."
"Lunch was good. Service? Not so much. Came here after Qua Spa. Pizza? Amazing. Toppings galore, crispy crust. Server? Unresponsive. Water glasses empty. Meal unchecked."

"Verily, I was informed that this buffet was the finest in all of Las Vegas, and upon my visit, I found it to be most excellent indeed. A feast fit for a king, with snow crab, king crab, steak, prime rib, shrimp, and all manner of delectable dishes that one might find at such an establishment. Though the cost may be a bit steep, 'tis a small price to pay for such a sumptuous repast. I didst partake in a bounty of crab, worth a pretty penny, no doubt, at any other eatery. And what's more, I didst spy John Wall, a man of great renown, enjoying himself nearby, which didst only add to the ambiance. In conclusion, I shall most certainly return to this buffet again, should I find myself in Las Vegas once more."
"Great bar. Friendly bartenders. Good beer. Try the red ale. Memories of Lulu's tuna poke on Maui. BJ's held its own. Nice take on the dish. Avocado egg rolls, too. Not greasy. Good spot for sports."

"Best joint on Mill for grub, hands down. Chicken ceasar salad, phenomenal. Fussy about my ceasar dressing, but this one's spot on, not too fishy. Margarita pizza, great too. Woodfired, so might be a tad dark, but just tell your server to cook it less if that bugs you. Service top-notch, dig the vibe."

"HH, a joint for the cash-strapped, offers a sweet deal on Mondays. Used to be a medium 1-topping pizza for $5.55, but now it's a large for $5.99. Not bad, considering you don't need to buy three pizzas like at other places. The taste? Pretty good. Thin crust, sausage or pepperoni, and a few added toppings. They don't drown the sauce or skimp on cheese, and the pizza's still decent reheated."
"In we came, for dinner. Enjoyed it. Ordered masala, spicy. Not like others, too bland. Here, flavorful, hot. Staff, friendly, attentive. P.S. Love Indian food."

"Southern grub, delicious. Cornbread, damn fine. Ribs, beefy, vinegar-slathered. Mac and cheese, gooey. Collards, tangy. Yams, sweet 'n' savory. Charlotte dinner, satisfying. Prices, decent. Service, good. Parking, tricky. Structures, your best bet."

"Chipotle be damned, I found a new fix. Tortilla soup, enchiladas straight from the oven. Why didn't someone think of this before? Parking's a bitch, but worth it. Snickerdoodles and Mexican wedding cookies too. Arrrgh."

"This small shop suits me just fine. No need for the chaos of that behemoth up in north Scottsdale. I prefer the peace and quiet here. Sure, they don't have everything, but they've got the essentials. And no crowded food court or rowdy bar to contend with. Just a simple, straightforward shopping experience. I stop by after hitting Trader Joe's."
"Chicken's good. Been there a few times, simple menu. Only issue's the chicken, sometimes it's rubbery. But that's on the bird, not the cook."

"Sierra Gold's got a real cozy vibe goin' on. Good grub, too. You can score some solid satisfaction whether you're there for the game, poker, or just hangin' at the bar. Happy hour's every day, 3-7 and 12-4. That's right, half off all drinks and pizza. Now, let's talk food. Thin crust pizza, not my thing, but it's decent. Wings, they got 'em in a bucket, and they're pretty great, especially the garlic parmesan. Curly fries, yep, they got 'em too. And don't even get me started on the Zookie. It's like a warm hug for your taste buds. White chocolate macadamia nut cookie, vanilla ice cream, whipped cream, and chocolate and caramel drizzle. Service ain't bad either, even at midnight. Open 24 hours, this place is a gem."
"Thai Taste, a college haunt of mine. Green curry, my heart's desire. Later, fate took me to Thailand, devouring dishes I once savored here. Thai Taste's renditions? Sublime."

"Atop yon hill, a wondrous sight doth lie,
On fair days, all of Edinburgh's land doth meet thine eye.
The Observatory, a marvel of old, doth stand,
And columns of a monument, unfinished, yet grand.

In summer's heat, when sun doth shine so bright,
Thou shalt bask in its warmth, and all thy cares take flight.
And should thou be a photographer of skill,
Sunrises and sunsets here, shall make thy heart fill.

This hill, a venue for arts and performances, doth play host,
To Beltane Festival, on April's thirtieth, a night of boast.
And on New Year's Eve, fireworks doth light the sky,
One of seven hills, where revelers doth gather nigh.

Mayhap, they shall not change this hill, nor hinder access,
For 'tis a blessing, for residents, in this busy city's press.
I find solace here, in peace, away from throngs,
A haven, for quiet walks, where troubles fade, like morning's mist."

"My first dim sum adventure didst take place at Great Wall, a tableau rosa* indeed. Being unfamiliar with such cuisine, my thoughts are but a narrow reflection of my own limited experience. Nonetheless, I shall share them with thee.

Mr. K hath penned a most accurate depiction of this establishment, so I implore thee to peruse his words. The victuals didst taste pleasant unto me, and the atmosphere didst possess a merry and lively quality. Verily, the demonstration of culinary artistry found within these walls doth differ greatly from any other eatery I have visited in Phoenix. Those who lament the dearth of variety in this fair city, mayhap a visit to Great Wall shall broaden thy horizons.

I must confess, I didst traverse a considerable distance via the highway to partake in this gastronomical journey. Thus, my willingness to return doth speak volumes. For those whose sense of direction doth falter, fear not! The restaurant doth reside within the initial shopping plaza situated on the east side of 35th Avenue, a short distance north of Camelback."

"Pizza joints claiming to be the best in the States? Been to a few. This place? Not bad. Motorino in New York City and A16 in San Fran still top my list. But hey, good pie. Cool spot. Friendly service. I'd go back."

"Friday night, me and the boy hit up Tamari. Reservation was for around nine, but we had to wait a few minutes 'cause the place was hoppin'. Hosts were real friendly, though, and got us drinks from the bar while we waited. They've got a good selection of drinks, some interesting cocktails, and decent wine and beer.

Now, the tapas. They've got some real creative combos. I was impressed. Didn't even need to eat much, just wanted to try a couple things. Had the lamb lollipop, real tender and tasty. And the red snapper, man, that was good. Came with mussels in a saffron broth, real different, real yummy.

The boy didn't like the empanadas too much, but he loved the hangar steak. Said it was worth way more than the $2 price tag. They're small servings, sure, but quality makes up for it. Haven't tried the sushi yet, but I'll be back. Oh, and Sam Worthington was there. From Avatar. That's worth an extra half-star, according to the boy."
"Arrive early, seats disappear fast. Love this theater, unique flicks and plush seating. Prices steep, crowds swell, parking a pain on Saturdays."

"This joint's gotta be my fave sports bar. Atmosphere's top-notch, screens galore, and not a bad seat in the house. Plus, they got a sick patio - one of the best in town, easy. Been there twice in the past week for Suns playoff games. Grub's solid, especially for bar food. First night, we shared some wings, potato skins, chicken quesadilla - you know, the usual health nut stuff. Second night, we went for the prime rib, mashed potatoes, and asparagus. Twelve bucks, and it was on point. Finished it off with the skillet cookie - best thing I've ever had, period. Only downside was the waitstaff. Had to work for our drinks a few times. But hey, that's minor. Great spot, and we'll be back."
"Clean, fresh grub. Great addition to any town. Owners on the ball, giving folks what they want: organic, healthy options."

"This joint's got a killer vibe, perfect spot to grab a drink and let loose. We hit up the dance floor hard during a private shindig and had ourselves a real good time. Apps and drinks were top-notch, bartenders kept 'em coming quick. Loungey feel, bumpin' tunes - this place has it all. If you're lookin' for somethin' a little more chill than XS or Tao, give it a shot."

"Hark, good sir or madam, to my words of praise,
For Villa Antonio's lunch buffet, 'tis a feast most fair and bright!
For just nine silver coins, thou shalt partake,
Of a meal most wondrous, with no limits to thy plate.

Their baked chicken, roasted veggies, salad so fresh,
Mashed potatoes, cheese ravioli, all doth impress.
Other Italian delights, they do provide,
A veritable cornucopia, to satisfy thy inside.

So, if thou art in search of a quick repast,
During the workday, when time is of the essence, at last,
Villa Antonio's lunch buffet, doth come highly recommended,
For value and quality, it doth leave all else unmentioned."

"Jason's, my usual haunt, delivers. But if you're feeling restless, the salad bar's worth the trek. Small, but well-stocked, it's a solid choice for $7.99. Unlimited trips, mind you. And don't forget the Captain's Wafers - those bring back memories. Skip the patio, though. Vagrants tend to loiter. If you're looking to stay on task, they deliver too ($3). Turkey reuben's my pick. Good stuff, under 550 calories with baked Lays and a pickle."

"Vegas, four days. Level 107, two nights straight. Loved it. Seven of us. Service, top-notch. Food, damn good. Martinis, buy one get one free. Appetizers, half off. Not a martini guy, but caramel and raspberry, hell yeah. Go, you'll have a blast."

"A sunny joint near our digs in Brossard. Ate here a few times during our two-week stay. Fillin' plates, they do. Crepes, waffles, pancakes, omelets, blintzes - got 'em all. Free joe with your grub, too. Keep it topped off, they do."

"Weekday crew doesn't speak much English. But weekends, they got a hostess and some others who show up. Mostly, they speak English good. Didn't have no trouble gettin' what we wanted."

"Don't know 'bout them other bad reviews. Maybe folks up here got higher standards than what I'm used to back home."

"First Watch, a place where healthy meets delicious. Consistently serving up great meals, with service to match. Never had a bad experience, always leaving me wondering why I don't come back more often. Chickichanga, my personal favorite, but everything on the menu is top-notch. Love that I don't feel like I've consumed a ton of grease after eating here. A truly fantastic spot for breakfast."

"Freshly baked pastries, loaves of bread, morning meals, noon repasts, eve feasts
In a snug coffeehouse setting, with hearth ablaze, and ample seats to seize.
Pay in cash, upfront, and await thy fare's delivery, 'twill be brought forthwith.
Replenish thy cup with coffee, freely, and never depart unsatisfied."
"Peru, been there a few times. Food's good, real good. Went for lunch, came back for dinner. Owners and staff, they work hard. Make sure you enjoy yourself."

"My kid took us out for our anniversary last month. Decent joint, not bad for Arizona. Used to live in San Fran, so I know my Chinese grub. Pricey, sure, but worth it for the vibe, service, and eats. Still on the hunt for a non-chain spot with some real dim sum."
"Good pho joint. Special combo's solid, but portions vary. Big one day, sad face the next. Only pho game in town, though. Service is top-notch. Hope this helps."

"Chuck Wagon, that's why you hit up Longhorn Casino. Takes up a good chunk of the joint, like it should. Decent grub, fair prices. My go-to's are the breakfast items. Stampede, eggs, bacon, hash browns, toast. But the real draw's the S.O.S. My old man, a retired Marine, gives it the thumbs up. If he don't know good S.O.S., who does?\n\nService is top-notch. Minus a star for the smoke-filled casino and the wait."

"Never again, County Market. Old Time's got what I need. Customer appreciation card, 10% off, $200 purchase. Sausages, good. Special flavors, applewursts, classic bratwursts, mild and spicy italian. Flank steak, good. Bulk italian, worth it. Spaghetti sauce, scratch. Helpful staff, special cuts."

"Fuzzy's Tacos, been there a few times. Good experiences, always. Taco Plate, my go-to. Two tacos, two sides, six forty-nine. Veggie, tempura shrimp, both solid. Chips, salsa, plenty. Burritos, eh, stick with tacos. Hot sauce, sufficient. Waited a while, few times. Suggestion: grab chips first. Good spot for tacos, chips, sports. Give it a shot, buddies."

"A hearty burger, priced at six dollars doth please,
With smashed fries and fried pickles of excellence.
The service, swift and friendly, doth abound,
A place to dine, with shakes, for just a few pence more found."

"Wine shop, good one. Went there for a CMYE, though don't drink much wine. Organic, sustainable wines for the eco-conscious. In Atherton Market, plenty of parking, but the Vin Master's hard to find. Tucked away, hidden behind a pizza joint. Thankful for signs and GPS or would've missed it. Shop's bigger inside, exposed brick, high ceilings, pleasant lighting. Couple chairs, tables, folks sipping wine. Nice touch, trying before buying. Owner Chris, super friendly, certified sommelier. Helps you pick the right wine. Check it out, worth it."

"Closed for reno, two weeks now. Pricey? Maybe. But for a Berto's plate, I get a nice seat, good salsa, and some heat. Service is solid too. Problem is, the food's a mixed bag. Great ingredients, but the protein's a letdown. Shame, really. If your pals rave about Macoa's, this place will blow 'em away."

"Love the joint's focus on fresh, local ingredients. Atmosphere and decor? Top-notch. Service? Impeccable. Water glass always full. Goat cheese appetizer? Damn good. Beets added a nice touch. Smokey burger? Flavorful, but a bit messy. Fries? Spot on. Sirloin steak? Decent flavor, but chewy and gristly. S'mores parfait? Delicious. Would definitely return, maybe try the prime rib or fish next time."

"I'll level with you, I didn't have a damn clue what was happening. But it looked pretty cool, like a full-on assault on the senses. Not sure I'd pay to see it again, but it was definitely something."

"This joint's alright. Good lighting, decent grub. Me and the boys come for the pizza deal. Half off after midnight, ain't bad. Thin crust, best I've had. They got games too, pool tables, TVs. Don't know what they're called, but people play 'em. Jukebox, couple songs for a buck. Place is hidden, but worth findin'. Across from Smith's, past 10, they'll buzz you in."

"Hark, what news is this? A meal most fair and bright,
At Newk's, a place of wonder and delight.
Their soups, a feast for the tastebuds, so grand,
A rarity, indeed, in this fair land.

Lobster bisque, a dish fit for a king,
And Ultimate Lobster, a wondrous thing.
A Caesar salad, fresh and crunchy, too,
With toppings galore, to make it anew.

Roasted garlic, hot peppers, pickles, and cheese,
A veritable feast, for all to appease.
Thin crispy breadsticks, a delightful treat,
To mop up the sauce, with glee and neat.

But wait, there's more, a bonus, so grand,
The giant plastic cups, at Newk's command.
For water or tea, they hold a generous amount,
A practical gift, for those who frequent the mount.

Indeed, 'tis the little things, we see,
That make life worthwhile, in harmony."

"Tasty deals at this joint - two for $5 fro-yo or boba. I stick with taro milk tea and pearls. They give you a stamp card, too. Every purchase earns a stamp - waffles, crepes, fro-yo, or boba. Double stamps for the twofer. Waffles are great, but take a bit. Shaved ice is good, too. Regular with fro-yo, three toppings, shaved ice, and condensed milk. Solid spot. Give it a shot."

"Pray, good sir, fetch me another SinCity burger, forsooth! How delectable it doth seem! A burger topped with an egg, bacon, and cheese, methinks 'tis a feast fit for a king! And their Smash Fries, alack! They be good, but not always of the same quality, I do confess. Forsooth, the salads be not bad, but mark my words, good sir, tell them to place the dressing on the side, lest thy lettuce doth swim in the sauce. Alas, a five-star rating doth escape them, for the inconsistency of the fries and the drowning of the salad doth make it a four, I do declare!"
"Took CCW course, instructor knew his stuff.  No gripes, made me a better shot.  That's all I need."

"A bar most wondrous, full of brews most fine,
In Pittsburgh's streets, doth stand so tall.
With daily deals, that doth change with each sun's shine,
And appetizers, oh so tasty, one and all.
Burgers, stacked high, with toppings galore,
And wings, oh wings, so crispy, savory, and more.
Teriyaki or honey BBQ, both doth delight,
Buy the sauces, and make your taste buds take flight."

Comfort fast food, Chick-fil-a doth be,
For me, 'tis a haven of ease and delight.
Their original chicken sandwich, a feast for the taste,
With honey mustard, a perfect pairing, I do declare.

Waffle fries, oh how I adore thee,
But alas, they skimp on them, it doth seem.
Yet still, I savor each bite with glee,
For Chick-fil-a's fare, doth bring joy to me.

A balloon artist, a master of his craft,
I chanced upon, at this very location.
His skills, they did astound and amaze,
As he twisted and shaped, with such grace.

The wait, it did fly by, as if by magic,
For I was entranced, by his artistry so fantastic.
And though the restaurant, did swarm with young ones,
My experience, it was not diminished, but rather enhanced, by the sweet innocence of youth.

Chick-fil-a, doth cater to families,
With toys and games, that promote learning and literacy.
So gather round, and partake in their cheer,
For Chick-fil-a, doth offer, a welcome respite from fear.

In this humble, family-owned bistro,
Their culinary delights do truly glow.
A place to dine within, or swiftly fetch,
Their delectable victuals, fit for a king's repast.

We savored each dish, oh so divine,
And found that each portion, generous and fine.
With leftovers aplenty, a second feast,
Our bellies full, our taste buds did revel and gleam.
"Steak, bacon, and sweet potato tots with a dash of hot sauce. That's how I started my day. My friend Scott went for the Hawaiian breakfast. We both left satisfied."

"Hark! If thou seeketh suicide by sweet and fizzy draught,  
Come hither, for Rocket Fizz doth hold thy fate.  
A haven of odd sodas and confections, doth bring  
Back memories of youth, and joy doth spring.  
I chanced upon a similar shop in St. George's land,  
But this, my friend, doth far surpass that humble stand.  
The Jelly Belly Strawberry Jam soda, do not miss,  
For 'tis a drink most wondrous, and doth please.  
Prices fair, a bounty of soda to choose,  
And candies, too! Oh, what a wondrous place,  
Rocket Fizz, thy name doth ring with glee!"

"Coupon for a free glitter ball in my email, so I took my little man for a free toy. Plenty of glitter balls to choose from. Signing up with the email rewards club is a good idea, they got events for kids, freebies, and great coupons. Took my little guy here when Ozzy Osbourne was signing his new book, it was wild, line around the building. But I cut in front, no one said anything 'cause I had my baby. Met Ozzy, had a blast. Staff was a bit overwhelmed, but they handled it."

"Rest in Peace, Chocolate Swan. You fought hard against the whims of consumers and trends. Your sweet treats brought joy to many, especially the brides who sought you out for their special day. Your legacy lives on in the hearts of those who savored your delights. My condolences to your loved ones."

"La Condesa, a place most fair,
With salsas fresh, and tacos rare,
Shrimp and steak, both doth delight,
And mole chicken, a wondrous sight.

Busy they be, with service slow,
But worth the wait, I do avow.
In the area, give it a go,
A culinary joy, it doth bestow."
"Went with pals for all-you-can-eat. Cheap, food good. Seated quick. Server sharp, kept drinks full, brought more meat. Great start to finish."

"I've been hitting up this PetSmart pretty regularly over the past couple weeks. Got a new pup at home, and he needs his fair share of treats, kibble, and toys. Howie's a fan of Blue Buffalo, no surprise there. It's the good stuff, no soy, gluten, or corn, and no meat byproducts. Yeah, it's pricier, but hell, I eat healthy too, so why shouldn't my dog? The toy selection's alright, I guess. People might not wanna shell out for fancy toys, but come on, give a guy some options. And the collars and leashes? Forget about it. I've got a boy dog, and I'm a girl. Some variety would be nice. It's his outfit, after all. He should look sharp every day, coordinated with his coat. The staff's been cool, though. They're dog lovers, and they've given me some handy training tips. But I ain't taking Howie into PetSmart. It's a germ fest in there. You never know what sicknesses other animals might bring in. Not everyone's got their animals vaccinated or takes care of 'em right. It's nice to shop with your furry friend, but they're better off at home."
"Solid joint for a quick bite. Been here a dozen times, still good, but not as impressed this trip to Vegas. Sandwiches are always on point, but skip the salads."

"Good grub, that green chile burger hits the spot. Don't mind ordering a burger from a Mexican joint, it's damn good. They bring sopapillas after your meal, and they're freaking delicious. Service can be slow, but who cares when the food's this good?"

"Went in based on good reviews. Didn't disappoint. Had machaca breakfast with rice, beans, and tortillas. Asked for more tortillas, didn't know there was a charge. Two small flour tortillas for $1.50? Ridiculous. Food was good, but little things like that don't sit well. Free refills or extra salsa, come on guys. Will bring it to their attention next time."

"Service was top-notch, even though it was a busy night. Our waitress hustled her butt off, keeping our glasses full and our plates clean. Props to her for a job well done. 

The menu at this local sports bar had everything - burgers, sandwiches, salads, and more. We went for the Western burger, which was a solid choice. The patty could've used a bit more seasoning, but the BBQ sauce made up for it. Frings on the side were crispy and well-seasoned, too. 

All in all, a great spot to catch a game and grab a decent meal. Good selection, good grub."

"Amore Pizza Discovery! \n\nI was sniffing out some grub in the kitchen and found last night's leftovers from Amore in the fridge. Grabbed a slice of deep dish and chowed down cold, no warming up necessary. Damn thing was tasty, like sitting on your folks' couch kinda good. Don't know how to feel about it, but that pizza was better cold than fresh from the oven. Flavors popped that I didn't notice before. Keep a cold one on deck for when your little bro or bro-in-law swings by."

"A fine place for a meal or a snack, my dear,
On Christmas Day, when other places may be shut.
The pork buns, they were a goodly size,
Fresh from the oven, at a fair price.

The chicken pot pies, not worth the cost,
Unless you crave the American twist.
The shredded beef with green onion roll,
A tasty treat, but a bit too dear, I fear.

But honey, I do desire to see,
Your pork buns in Vegas, baby Vegas,
For they are a delicacy, indeed,
And my hunger, they would surely feed."

"Parking lot, easy peasy. Bar first, Crown Royal, no dice. Un-freakin'-believable. Breadsticks, hot, perfect. Grilled shrimp, clams, great. Angel hair, marinara, meatballs, excellent. Busy, service good. No room for dessert, next time."
"Pizza in Madison, WI. Good stuff. Crust, meh. Toppings, wow. Had it again after five years. Glad I did."
"The joint had space, lots of it. You could dance on the water and not feel cramped. A good time was had by all."
"This spot's my fave for a boa. Staff's friendly, helpful. Gets busy, sure, but that's 'cause all the retailers bank here. Don't mind it, though. When you're done, plenty of grub spots around."
"A decent spot for a casual breakfast. Food was good, but you gotta fetch your own stuff - silverware, condiments, drinks. And no booze, so forget about that Sunday funday vibe."

"Hark, what news is this? My birthday bowl,
I sought it here again, on this fair day,
The seventh of May, a date most true,
And lo, the corporate folk didst play,
A part in extending my special treat,
In letting me have it, whene'er I'd eat.

Oh, props to them, for their kindness shown,
For making my day, with this gift alone.
But alas, a wait, there often doth seem,
Whenever I doth visit this place, 'tis true.
Yet, this time, my veggies, cooked to perfection,
And my sauce, almost flawless, save a little too much salt,
But still, a great $16, for two, I do avow,
Love to thee, GG, forevermore, thou art my bowl's best friend, now."

"Good layout here. Custom baby store, but not just for rich folks. Quality stuff at different prices. Some made me and the missus do a double take, but we're old pros now. Third kid, nine years later, lot's changed. Staff was top-notch, gonna register for some essentials."

"Solid joint. Not Two Sisters Thai or Sala Thai in Phoenix, but still good. Flavors are above average, not exceptional. Go there often since it's close to home. More authentic than trendy Scottsdale spots. One thing, if it's packed, leave. They can't handle a full house."

"Burger joint, great. Went on Memorial Day, place was jumpin' but not too packed. Grabbed two seats at the bar, easy peasy. Wanted a boozy milkshake, but the missus was feelin' frisky, so we went for a cocktail instead. Brown cow float, that's what I got. Light, but still needed a hand from the missus. Damn good, taste the booze, you bet. Love a good root beer float. Burgers, we both got 'em. Steakhouse burger, egg on top, nice touch. Funghi, that's my jam. Cooked just right, generous portion, damn delicious. Truffle flavor, Gruyere melted perfect. Refined mushroom and Swiss burger, yessiree. Fries, just okay. No excuse for subpar fries, but props for includin' 'em in the burger price. Service, good from the bartenders. Shakes and burgers took their sweet time, though. BF said his cocktail was on point. We'll be back, and next time, I'll make sure my fries are crispy."

"Methinks 'tis but a stone's throw hence, where'er I dwell and toil,  
That yonder tavern doth prepare to raise its curtain,  
And thus, my heart doth sing with joy, for cheap and tasty tacos near,  
Are a boon most wondrous, sent from heav'n to cheer.  
  
A score of visits hath thy humble scribe made hitherto,  
And ne'er hath disappointment reared its head, save for a few,  
The pork, now sublime, doth dance upon mine taste buds,  
Whilst beef and chicken, both, a worthy choice, they buds.  
Carne Asada, alas, doth leave much to be desired,  
And fish, a sorry sight, doth fail to stir my fires.  
  
Yet, note their cabbage and tomatoes, organic, fresh and fair,  
A virtue, indeed, that doth redeem their lacking flair.  
Flavored lemonades, a curious lot, some excellent, some not,  
Yet, three huge tacos for four dollars fifty, a bargain, by my troth!  
  
Authentic, perchance not, yet healthy, cheap, and with a smile,  
This tavern, once a week, doth earn my while, in sooth, for a long while."

"Hark, this review doth be for Le Rive alone,
A spectacle that didst meet mine expectations,
But lo, not quite in the way I had supposed,
For 'twas a tad too busy, afeard to say.

In sooth, the tale didst unfold with some confusion,
And left me wondering what would be the conclusion,
Yet still, the synchronized swimming didst impress,
With red heels shining bright, and nary a mess.

The arena itself, a marvel of design,
Didst offer a full view of the watery scene,
A feast for mine eyes, a treat divine,
And thus, my night at Le Rive was quite fine."

"XS may have stolen Tryst's thunder, but I still dig this joint. Always a good time. Love how the dance floor spills outdoors by the waterfall. Fresh air, you know? Layout's got character, not like those cookie-cutter clubs. Staff's top-notch, way better than TAO. Getting in's a breeze, never a hassle. Drinks come quick, and the bathrooms? Adorable."

"Hark! A place of gastronomic delight,
Where burgers beckon with savory might.
Though not the best, 'tis still a tasty sight,
With veggies fresh as morning light.

A plethora of toppings doth abound,
To customize thy patty to thy ground.
The prices, fair, for what thou dost receive,
And portion sizes, generous, as thou shalt perceive.

A tip, my friend, the regular burgers be vast,
So order junior, and thou shalt find it vast.
The fries, small, yet large, as if by fate,
Leaving thee to ponder the large, in awe and debate.

Clean atmosphere, and service, swift and neat,
Doth round up this eatery, a worthy treat."

"I hit this spot every two weeks. They got a killer selection of organic veggies, always rotating so you ain't stuck with the same old thing every week. Employees are generally solid, happy to lend a hand. Just watch out for some quirky cashiers. But hey, they mean well. Some folks gripe about long lines, but I ain't never had that problem. Guess I'm just lucky, or maybe it's 'cause I go during the week. Either way, I dig shopping here."

"A humble bakery, tucked away on Rachel street,
Across from yonder church, where souls do meet.
Near Jeanne Mance park, where trees do sway,
A haven for sweet-tooths, 'tis a place to stay.

The space is small, but worth the wait,
For friendly staff and pastries, oh so great.
We ventured in for croissants, fresh and hot,
But alas, they were not yet ready, we were told.

So we didst venture forth, and tried instead,
An almond chocolatine, and petit pain brioche in our stead.
Oh, how delightful! Our taste buds didst sing,
For those sweet treats, they didst take wing.

I shall return, to sample more,
For there were pies, that didst call to me, and squares galore.
A veritable paradise, for those who love to eat,
This bakery, a gem, doth await thy treat."
"Good eatery. Plenty grub options, no wait. Sugar-free cheesecake, a highlight. Worthy indeed."

"Food was good, not great. Atmosphere was stuffy, overdone. Broccoli for ten bucks? Rip-off. Service was top-notch, though. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Would I go back? Sure, but with lowered expectations."
"Fresh grub, 'cept the meat's frozen. Service is good though. For nine bucks, you get a heapin' bowl of food, rice, soup, noodles, and a drink. Clean joint too."

"Solid Japanese grub, I reckon. Originally from Cali, studied in NYC, had my fair share of good Japanese food. Chaya's up there, no doubt. Best I've had? Nah, not quite. But enjoyable? You bet. 

Prices are a mite steep, if you ask me. Some menu items, I just can't justify the cost. But hey, they can charge what they want, I guess. Good service, though. Friendly folks, attentive, always checking in, offering water refills. 

Want traditional Japanese cuisine in Pittsburgh? Got some cash to burn? Give Chaya a shot."

"Just landed in Phoenix from the Pacific Northwest. Found this joint called Big Heng on Yelp. Food was decent, portions were generous. Had some minor mix-ups, paid a bit extra for stuff that usually comes with the meal - like egg drop soup. Had to ask a few times for mustard and sesame seeds, too. They're usually a given where we're from. Ordered the kung pao chicken and a combo plate (#3). Food came quick, which made me wonder about the freshness. But overall, it was good grub and we'll be back."
"Bibimbop, good. Normal bowl, expected. No hot pot, menu said no dolsot. Kimchi, good too. Server, pleasant. Price, ten bucks. Reasonable. Glad to have bibimbop near me."

"Love this joint! Great sushi, all you can eat for $25. Quality's always been top-notch. Busy as hell, especially during mealtimes. Noise level's a bit high, but that's the price you pay for popularity."

"This joint's got a lively bar scene, downtown Phoenix, near the US Airways Center. Family area's separate, which I liked. Plenty of seats, but it gets packed on game nights. Parking's a pain, especially if you're just there for grub and drinks. I paid ten bucks for parking, oops. Ordered a Long Island Iced Tea, strong and tasty. Hubby got wings, seemed impressed. Fish tacos were solid, cilantro sauce was a bit thick and ranch-like, but the salsa was alright. Friendly bartenders, attentive service. All in all, great spot."

"Tao's my jam for dinner. Food's great, service is A+, and the joint's got style. Salads are a fusion of American and Japanese, and they're so good I could make a meal out of 'em alone. Seabass is top-notch, almost as good as Sushi Samba's skewers. Desserts? Amazing. I've tried 'em all, and they're worth saving room for. And the lounge? Perfect spot for a pre- or post-dinner cocktail."

"Amazing grub, veggie-friendly too. Reminds me of a joint in the Meatpacking District, but cheaper. Never had issues with the crowd, but the service can be slow. If they stepped it up, I'd give it five stars. Great Italian food without the marinara sauce. Worth a visit if you've got time to kill."

"Crab cakes, perfect. Flavorful. Dim lights, candles, romantic. Tables too close. Server, good jokes. Ribeye, big portion, lacking flavor. Average. No dessert, too full. Waiter, anniversary plate, chocolate, Happy Anniversary. Night made."

"XDC event, been here a few times. Only seen one track, but that's not all. Next to it, a lake, big as hell. People drive their water vehicles, do jumps, skiing. Get burnt, sure, but that's part of the fun."

"A merry spot, indeed, to halt for sweet delight,  
If thou dost roam the campus, weary of thy plight.  
'Tis situated neat, just off the quad, on Wright's street,  
With flavors fair, and freshness doth it greet.  
But, alas! They didst cease to make my heart's desire,  
The Earl Grey truffle, and thus, I must retire  
My love for it, and leave it to fate's whim,  
For who can love a treat that's no longer in trim?"

We hit up Delights after a night of drinking at the Signature. The grub was solid. I had the Las Vegas Blvd sandwich - skirt steak, fried egg, caramelized onions, and a tasty sauce. It was a damn good sandwich, but the portions were a bit small and it was on the pricier side. I shelled out $12 for it, but it was worth it. No major gripes.
