"Doug's Place is top-notch. Five meats, two sides, and a bread for around eight bucks. Ribs, beef ribs, fried chicken, catfish, and perch. Collard greens, black-eyed peas, sweet potatoes, mac and cheese, sautéed veggies. Corn muffins, hush puppies, or dinner rolls. Sweet potato pie and lemon cake for dessert. Doug cooks in the back, his wife does the rest. Solid grub, no frills. Fried chicken is choice, crispy skin, juicy inside. Mac and cheese, collard greens, too. Pork ribs were lackluster, but better the next day. Ten tables, takeout available. Not busy on a Wednesday night, but still worth it. Doug's trumps Kip's, in my book."
"Food so good it'll make your taste buds dance. Pho, fried rice, rice plates - all winners. Don't take my word for it, try it yourself."
"Rigatoni Bolognese, a dish divine. My go-to order at this joint. A taste of Italy in every bite. Delayed post, but still worth the share."

"Took a gander at Joe's Diner with a master chef and food historian. Been comin' back ever since. Classic American diner vibes, but the grub and joe are top-notch. Sandwiches for a tenner, done just right. Arbuckles Ariosa cowboy coffee, straight up. Waitress was a peach. Real nice spot in the Melrose District."

"Happy and full, I've been here a few times. Drink menu's great, especially the red headed stepchild and stoney bah-loanie. Pure vesper's good too. Food's always on point. Pork belly, nancy with pork belly, charcuterie, pork tostadas, and the TOT of the day are must-trys. Can't see myself having a bad meal here."

"Hark, what service doth this company bring!
They didst go above and beyond, to make sure my quote was true,
With haste, they came and checked the serial numbers, to see if warranty didst apply.
Their honesty, in pricing, didst shine so bright,
And though their quote, was higher than the rest,
They didst guarantee their work, with a year's warranty at best.
My house, they cooled, in just a day,
In summer's heat, when sun didst ray.
Twice, they called, to ensure all was well,
Good, honest service, doth this company sell."

"Good grub, friendly folk, swell joint. Not the cheapest in the MGM, but worth it. Four of us had drinks, plenty of victuals for $300. Oysters, mate, they're top-notch. Don't bother with clams, they're mediocre at best. Meat selection's limited, but what they got is decent. Rib-eye's the real deal."
"Went to the lunch buffet with friends. First time there. Amazing spread. Tons of veggie options. Loved it."

"Hark, this be the spot where my love and I do partake,
In libations and tomes, and games of wit and chance.
'Tis not the hippest joint, nor the most in vogue,
But regular hours keep, e'en on the Sabbath day,
When grading papers doth my mind beset.
The staff, a kindly bunch, with smiles so bright,
Do offer to procure books, should they be out of sight,
And games, aplenty, for a bookstore of such might.
E'en Pandemic, that wondrous game of strategy and skill,
Didst I purchase there, with joy and delight.
And oft, I do espy, amidst the throng,
Teachers, like myself, who do delight,
In this, our haven, from the world outside."

"Stay here if you don't need frills. Not luxurious, but good experience. Went with friends to Vegas, booked two suites for three nights. Full kitchen, washer/dryer, two bedrooms, living room, flat screen, couch, chairs, dining table. Comfortable, homey feel. Clean, plenty of towels. Nice pool, no glass, solo cups okay. Relaxing, quiet. Would stay again. Only issues: suite wasn't ready, bathroom door had a hole."
"Food and service, top-notch. No frills, just damn good quality. Every dish looked and smelled like a winner. I'll be back for more."

"We caught the late show, unsure what lay ahead. But damn, it was a treat. Variety acts, plenty of 'em. Adult stuff, no kiddies allowed. Seats? Tight fit, like a too-small saddle on a horse. But hell, it's worth it. Good time, that's for sure."

"Wildflower Bread Co., a spot where you can grab a solid sandwich and not feel like you're in a stuffy joint. One of the founders even hit me up after I gave 'em a good review, just to address some minor gripes. That's service. They got a variety of sammies, salads, and pastries, all made with fresh bread. My missus' Caesar salad? Top-notch. This spot's got some perks too - power outlets under the booths, a chill lounge area, and a private room for bigger groups. If you're in the area, give 'em a shot."

"West Elm, love it. Great stuff, bedding, pillows, everything. Big store, but not all designs from the site. Wish they had more. Prices differ from online sales. Friendly staff, helpful. Glad Vegas has West Elm. No Crate and Barrel, sadness. One of the best home decor spots in Vegas."

"Ethiopian grub, love it. First had it in Frisco, courtesy of an uncle's connection. Damn good. Then, a family friend from Ethiopia, introduced me to more. Would eat it daily, no problem. Blue Nile, first Ethiopian joint I tried in Phoenix. Always passed it, till one day, decided to give it a shot. Impressed, it was! Don't recall the names, but had the chicken with mushrooms, lentils, and that spongy bread. Eating with your hands, awesome. Wish I could've tried more dishes at once, but oh well...Cafe Lalibela, holds a special spot. I'll be back, and I recommend giving it a go."

In days of yore, when thirst didst beset thee,
And thou didst seek a draught to quench thy drouth,
A place there was, in Michigans' heart,
Where spirits flowed like a bounteous brook in springtime's birth.

'Twas called The Old Fashioned, a name most odd,
For within its walls, youthful vigor didst abound,
Amidst a college town, where learning didst unfold,
This tavern didst dispense a merry round.

Mixed drinks they offered, of quality fine,
At prices fair, that didst make thy purse to shine,
But one dish, above all others, didst entice,
The humble cheese curds, a culinary surprise.

With sauces diverse, they didst come to thee,
A treasure trove of flavors, for thy taste to see,
Worth every penny, this dish didst impart,
A joy to consume, and set thy spirit apart.

"Hark, what a wondrous sight doth meet mine eyes! A place so cool, it doth astound and surprise. The stools, made from tree stumps, doth add a rustic charm, while the tables, unfinished and adorned with hardware, doth give a sense of rough-hewn elegance. And the staff, so friendly and kind, doth make one feel most welcome. But alas, the coffee, oh how it doth impress! A simple iced latte, yet it doth satisfy and delight. And the chocolate chip cookie, with bacon, no less! How doth it manage to make all things taste better? Verily, I say, 'tis a marvel indeed. I shall return anon, to sample their wine collection, and revel in the joy it doth bring."

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous place indeed,
With ambiance that doth please mine eyes and soul.
The lighting, cool and dim, doth set the tone,
And at the bar, a sight most fair doth unfold.

The bartenders, skilled in their craft,
Do mix and shake with grace and art.
The drinks, a far cry from the common fare,
Are truly an experience beyond compare.

But alas, the special dish, so smoky and strong,
Did taste as if a piece of wood were consumed.
Yet, no high-handedness didst the server show,
For she did take it back and prepare another dish, as requested, with nary a frown or slow.

The chacatuire, a delightful appetizer,
Was served with fried Brussels sprouts, a tasty treat.
The main course, a special strip, so tender and juicy,
Did satisfy mine hunger and leave me feeling quite sprightly.

But, alack, the waygu, oh so fatty and bland,
Did detract from the meal, leaving a bad taste in mine hand.

Yet, fear not, dear friends, for dessert did save the day,
Chocolate pecan pie and mousse, both doth convey
A taste so sweet and rich, we did crave more,
And nearly ordered another, such was our desire.

This place, a gem in our fair city's crown,
Doth deliver a dining experience most renowned.
Karen, our waitress, a true delight,
And my friend from Cincinnati, in awe, did say,
'Twas naught but envy, for in his city, none could compare,
To Meat and Potatoes, a true culinary lair."

"In days of yore, ere Whole Foods graced our fair city's bounds,
I chased each store with zeal, as if 'twere a noble crown.
But now, a decade passed, my fervor doth abate,
And though this place be new, my interest doth not slack.

The outdoor seat, on second floor, a pleasant sight,
Did make me wish for spring, and sunshine bright.
A deal, four salads for four coins, a bargain rare,
Yet soups, aplenty, did my heart with joy fill.

Alas, hot dishes, cold, a letdown, I must confess,
But parking, ample, down below, did ease my stress."

"By chance, we learned of this bakery through Yelp's graces,
Whose sweet almond croissants our taste buds did embrace.
In the area, we chanced to be on a fair Saturday morn,
But alas! The pastries, all gone, did our hopes scorn.
Yet still, we chose an apple pastry, and pistachio eclair,
Both delectable, our hunger to assuage and cheer.
We shall return, our hearts with joy doth sing,
To savor more of their confections, anon, ere long."

"Sandwiches, good. Open 24 hours, convenient. Late night visit, line still long, tables taken. Crispy bread, nice. Recommendation: Original. Horseradish, unexpectedly enjoyable. Returning, updating review."

"Good eatin' at this joint. Grilled steaks, burgers, chicken, all that jazz. Rustic but clean. Prices fair, selection decent. Service top-notch. Off the US 60, take the Idaho exit. Give it a shot, won't regret it. Only downside, snowbirds flock here."
"Labwork, wife busy elsewhere. Empty room, just me. In and out in seven. Now closed, damn it."

"Methought, fair friends, that long I had desired
To visit this place ere work did consume my day,
And lo, last week, the chance did finally arise,
And verily, 'twas worth the wait, in sooth.
A dollar fifty, mere pence, did they demand
For doughnut and coffee, a most excellent plan.
Their pastries, too, didst delight mine eyes,
So do thou stop, good sir, and partake in their guise."
"Flew with them once, Phoenix to Portland. Enjoyed it. Terminal 2, easy parking, quick security. Would fly again if heading back to the PNW."
"Pasta's my weakness, being Italian. But this joint? Fresh stuff. Sauces, too. Helpful staff. Good for guests."

"Hark! I didst partake of the jambalaya, 'twas verily a feast most fair and fine. My dearest GF, she didst enjoy the fish and pasta, with glee didst she devour it, by the stars! Alas, our table outside didst play host to a pesky bee, which didst cause some vexation, I do confess. Yet, the potions didst flow freely, the victuals were abundant, and the ambiance didst possess a tranquil air."

"Hark! What's this? A Chinese takeout shop most fair,
Where Hunan Park doth reign supreme, with nary a care.
Their service swift, their dishes a delight,
Tis a place where hunger doth take flight.

I do beseech thee, gentle reader, give it a try,
And ask for utensils, lest thou doth have to sigh.
For General Tsao's chicken, oh how grand,
A feast fit for an emperor, 'twill please thy land.

So, take my word, good sir or madam,
And heed my advice, ere thou dost ramble.
To Hunan Park, thou shalt not go amiss,
For there, thy taste buds shall be in bliss."

"Food was top-notch, especially the salmon. Waiter was a character, had a bit of an attitude when we asked questions, but the price was right so I'll give it four stars. First time here and I'm not one for rude service."

"This joint's a gem, off the strip but still top-notch. Renovated with millions, it's a steal for those on a budget. The pool's the real draw - a shark tank with a slide right through the middle. A sight to behold, believe me. Admission's just $20, a bargain compared to the strip's pools. Downside? Air quality ain't the best, but smokers won't mind. Non-smokers might find it a bit bothersome."

"Tea Station's a joint that'll perk you up, late night. Me and the boys hit it up before we paint the town red or after chowin' down. It gets wild 'round 9-11. Real laid back vibe, but the service used to be lackin'. Nowadays, they're on the ball, friendly too. Got all sorts of teas, boba included. Taro milk tea's my poison."
"Food, top-notch for a brew pub. Beer, some of the best I've had. Service, prompt and friendly."

"Great spot for a burger and beer. Good for the whole fam. Solid selection of craft brews. Not the best burgers, but still good. Reminds me of SmashBurger or Big Daddy's. But hey, the beer makes up for it. One of the best casual dining spots in Charlotte."

"Dependable. Consistent. That's what I like about the Cheesecake Factory. Big menu, always good. Not gourmet, but worth the price. Their curbside pickup? Genius. Convenient as hell. They were the first, far as I know. And the cheesecakes? Damn good. Variety, too."

"I'm writing this in December 2016, so by the time you read it, it'll be March 2017. I've tried most of the Strip buffets, and let me tell you, this place delivers. Sure, they've got those tiny pots and baskets for some dishes, but they're cute and you won't need much more than one. The seafood selection is solid, and the bone marrow? Damn good, but don't start with it or you'll be too full for the rest. Desserts? Plenty to choose from, including macarons. Service is top-notch, attentive and friendly. The only downside is the hike to get there, but hey, that means shorter lines. So, grab a plate and get ready for a food coma."

"Tucked away in a corner of the grand canal shops on the Venetian side, this little hole in the wall restaurant is a gem. Family run, authentic Italian, and the wait staff are straight from Italy. They know their stuff, and their recommendations are spot on. I went for the linguine fruti de mare - clams, calamari, and shrimp in a spicy marinara - and it was a winner. My mom opted for linguine in clam sauce, and my aunt went for the swordfish piccata style with steamed veggies. All hits. The garlic knots were a nice touch, and the tiramisu, despite looking too creamy, was a surprise delight. Light, delicate, and a perfect way to cap off a great meal. Glad to hear they're expanding. They deserve it."

"Hark! I didst partake of chicken rice noodle brew,
And found it to be quite delectable, I do declare.
My spouse, he had the chicken curry broth,
But alas, it didst not meet with my approval, I fear.
Their Thai coffee, however, didst please mine taste,
And I wouldst return, to savor it once more, in haste."

"Caballero Grill, what a joke. Name's got nothing to do with the grub or atmosphere. Place needs to shut down, like Goodyear needs another pizza joint. But hey, we gave it a shot. Had a damn good burger and fries for six bucks during happy hour. Wife had a couple of their fancy drinks, decent deal at four bucks. Rest of the menu? Meh. Trio dip, overpriced at five bucks, mini chimis, not worth four. Club sandwich sliders, too much bread, not enough flavor. Domestic drafts half off during happy hour, microbrews, twenty percent off. Not bad, but not great either."
"Good grub and attentive service. Cozy joint, not too big. Sat down, and a server came over right away. Will be back to sample more from the menu."

"Took the family and grandkids to Joe's for breakfast. Left without breaking the bank and everyone was pleased. If you like bacon, get five sides of it - you won't want to share. French toast, breakfast burrito, pancakes, and cinnamon buns were all devoured. My son and I had the biscuits and gravy - soft biscuits and perfect gravy. Would go back just for that, and it's only $2.99. More than enough food too."

"A hearty bowl of pho, the broth most savory and rich,
A generous portion, fit for a king or such.
And rolls, oh rolls, prepared with utmost care,
A delightful treat, beyond compare.

I've visited this establishment twice,
For the fare, a worthy prize.
A lengthy drive, but worth the while,
To partake of their culinary smile.

With comrades, I have tried their diverse dishes,
Enough for all to sample and enjoy,
And even had some left o'er,
To savor later, with a joyful sigh.

Though late in the evening, they did admit,
Us and others, with a kindly spirit.
Good people, indeed, and most obliging,
A credit to their trade, and worthy of praising."

"Sushi at your own pace, no need to tell the chef what you want. Quality's good to excellent, surprising for a conveyor belt joint. Prices are reasonable. Staff keeps the dishes fresh and cold, no warm or lukewarm sushi here. Selection's average, more rolled sushi than nigiri. Hope they give out ginger and wasabi to all customers. Not a place for power meetings, but good for groups and families in a casual setting."

"Went there for grub and drinks. Place was swell. Pretzels were huge and soft, slathered in butter and cheese. Rich, but good to share. Prices were fair, patio was nice. But the real kicker? Music. They played some great tunes."
"Whole Foods, fresh grub, decent prices. Employees? Rude, lack personality. Cashiers, glum, little chat. Four stars, despite the staff."
"Brunch in Montreal. Worth the wait? Hit it midweek, avoid crowds. Did just that, ran into GSP. Eggs Benny and a UFC legend. Not bad."

"Charlotte's got its own mini Central Park, The Green. It's a peaceful spot, with sculptures and quirky signs. Take the kiddos here after ice cream, let 'em burn off energy. Or stroll with your sweetheart, feelin' the sun. I threw a penny in the fountain, watched the big fish swim. Weddings happen here, but I'd pick somewhere else. I just like walkin' the paths, chillin' out."

"Hark! A craving for Asian fare didst beset mine appetite,
And so, I chanced upon PF Chang's, a place of note.
A solitary diner, I didst fear neglect or scorn,
But lo! The service was swift and with a smile born.

The lettuce wraps, crab rangoon, and hot and sour soup,
All three didst please mine taste, and I didst devour them with glee.
This place, I do recommend, to travelers on business bent,
For nearby hotels, it doth present a convenient invent.

Well worth the visit, PF Chang's doth prove,
A haven for flavors, both new and well-loved."
"Wi-Fi in my room, fast and strong. Nice work, whoever's handling it."

"Tiny shop in Bellagio, smaller than Aria's. Chocolate fountain, a sight to behold. Confusing line, packed with people. Limited seating. Excited for individual desserts, missed the rose oil detail. Didn't enjoy my raspberry macaroon, but friends loved theirs."

"O, how my love doth grow for this fair place,
Where vegan fare doth grace the menu's space.
Amazing, too, the staff doth show their care,
Eager to right each wrong, and make us share
Their passion for good food, and service true.

Our orders, thrice they came with seafood's stain,
But we, in love, did look beyond the pain.
For staff, so kind, did rectify the flaw,
And we, in gratitude, did pay the law.
No freebies sought, just justice in the kitchen's art,
And thus, our love for this place shall never part.

Great drinks, great food, and staff of noble mind,
Shall keep us coming back, again and again, in kind."

"O, how I do adore this place, my friends! For those who cherish Mexican cuisine, 'tis a must-visit, indeed. My heart doth sing for their flour tortilla chicken flautas, a dish most divine. The complementary chips, salsa, and beans that come before thy order, do make a fine pairing, I do confess. And on Sundays, their brunch buffet doth shine, with homemade tortillas and breakfast dishes most fine. Juevos con hamon, chile verde con pollo, and bacon, oh so sweet! 'Tis a feast fit for a king, with live music to boot!"

"Methinks 'tis a fine establishment, based on two points, good sir! 

The first, a hearty breakfast at a fair price, eight dollars and ninety-five cents, ere ten o'clock, mind thee well! And should thou arrive later, fear not, for the brunch price, thirteen dollars and ninety-five cents, doth still offer a feast most bountiful! 

Aye, the buffet, a spread most wondrous, with divers dishes, both sweet and savory, didst delight mine eyes and stomach, in equal measure! Fresh fruit salad, biscuits and gravy, grits, cheese and potato hash, muffins, scones and pastries, eggs, egg benedict, sausage, bacon, blueberry french toast, and more, all fresh and cooked to perfection! Crispy, where it should be, fluffy, where it should be, and moist, where it should be! In sooth, 'twas a veritable feast, most excellent! 

The servers, friendly and attentive, didst ensure mine needs were met, and by ten thirty, the crowd didst swell, a testament to the popularity of this fine eatery! The south-end location, a boon, indeed! Give them a try, thou shalt not regret it, I doth assure thee!"

"Oyster shots, mate! Fresh as can be, straight from the ocean. Bartender's a real character, knows his stuff. Four different kinds, each one unique. Sampled 'em all, chose the best dozen. Seafood special's a bit lackin', but still good. Sit at the bar, get friendly with the bartender, and you'll have a swell time. Fifty bucks well spent."
"Cozy joint, great pastries. Staff's friendly, lots of seats too. But watch out, they give out free samples. You might leave with more than you bargained for."
"Ten minutes, that's all it took. They called my name and it was done. Fastest oil change I've ever had. Cost me $38 and some change, but I got a $5 discount for the ladies' special on Wednesdays."

"O, what a wondrous sight doth lie within these mounts,
A journey through their peaks, so grand and fine.
I shall extol this place to all who draw near,
For 'tis a marvel, and a wonder to hold dear."

"Restaurant's got a new look, feels bigger than Nix. Bar's been pushed back, more room for mixin' and sittin', vibe's hipper now, leather chairs, red lights. My favorites? Cowbell Chili, Smoked Cornbread, black bean burger, sweet potato croquettes, Dali's fries with garlic aioli, buffalo, Parmesan, fresh herbs. Full review's on the blog, these are the highlights."

"Methinks this tavern doth possess most excellent flavors, good sir! Verily, I am quite taken aback by the sheer variety of tasty victuals they do offer. The prices, too, are most reasonable, and the hours do stretch late into the eve. Should thou be a devotee of genuine Mexican cuisine, and dost crave a plethora of delectable meats to choose from, then hasten thee well to this establishment! \nAlack, the only cause for my rating of four stars doth lie within the somewhat disorderly queue system. Fear not, fair traveler, for a simple query unto a staff member or a fellow patron shall swiftly clarify which line to join. A pair of tiny signs, placed above the ordering stations, would surely enhance the experience and earn this place a full five stars, anon!"

"Years of visits. Happened to pass through today. Stopped in. Should've ordered one sandwich. Split it instead. Enough for both. Saved the other for later. Fried okra? So-so. Zucchini's better. Prices? Fair for what you get. Didn't eat outside. Too damn hot. Brought it home. Pretty good. Be back next time."
"Good grub, good sizes. Service? Meh. Still, I'll be back."

"Eggspectation, tried and true. Kitchen's still got it, service stepped up. Four stars, no question. Menu's changed, puns and quirks gone, but eggs still rule. Missing the old variety, but they've honed in on what they do best. Flavors are solid, brunch game still strong. Worth the hike."

"Went with two girls. Squash blossoms, great. Ambiance, perfect. Pork chop, thick, grilled medium rare. Juicy, flavorful. Quail, showstopper. Highly recommend. Menu's seasonal, will check back. Wine list, AZ-made. Didn't partake this time. Next trip, definitely. Very sensual experience. Yum."

"This mall's the best of the three. No vacancies, gets busy. Great steak joint, too bad it shut down in Springfield. Like the specialty shops here - kitchen, kids', GameStop, departments, pet store, etc."

"In Vegas for a nursing conference, September 18, 2013. On the strip, my friends wanted to eat at the Bellagio. We settled on The Noddle. Food was better than expected. I had shrimp pad thai, very good, much better than expected for a strip Asian restaurant. Friends had soup/noodle dishes, good but beef slightly overcooked. Highly recommend."

"Upon a Saturday eve, my wife and I didst venture forth to Praying Monk, a place of great repute and charm. The staff, with their warmth and hospitality, didst make us feel most welcome. 

A fan of Belgian brew, I was delighted to behold their fine selection of ale on tap. I didst partake in a St Bernardus ABT12, while my fair spouse didst indulge in the Triple Karmilet, our two favorites. 

And thus, we didst proceed to the fare. We didst begin with Brussels sprouts and a soft pretzel, both of which didst impress. The sprouts were light and fresh, not heavy and oily as at many an establishment, and the pretzel was served with a most excellent mustard butter. 

For my main course, I didst opt for the Burger, a savory and juicy delight. The Sriracha Aioli didst add a pleasing heat, and the arugula, a most noble garnish, didst complete the dish. 

My wife, in her wisdom, didst choose the Kale salad. The kale was crisp and fresh, though perhaps a bit large in its pieces, but my wife didst find it satisfying. The dressing, well-balanced and not overpowering, didst complement the greens most nicely. 

Verily, I do look forward to my next visit, when I shall endeavor to sample the Lump crab, a dish of great renown."
"T-bone steak and eggs, a hidden gem on the menu at one of my go-to spots for cheap eats. Check out the photo."

"This joint gets two thumbs up, despite the worst waiter ever. We had a blast, though. Two locations, side by side, and we mixed up our meetup spot. Classic Vegas. 

Both visits, service was solid, grub was good, and variety was on point. Shame about limited menu options, but we made do. 

Both spots were clean, well-kept, and we got seated quick. That's key in Vegas, especially when you're feeling the night. 

That's all she wrote. It's like Cheesecake Factory, but not necessarily a bad thing."

Hark, what news is this? A place most wondrous,
Where lines do form, and folk do ponder,
If worth the wait, their bellies to fill,
With victuals hot, and drinks most thrilling.

I, myself, didst venture twice,
To partake in their culinary delights,
And found, to my surprise,
Their chicken sandwiches, a true delight.

One, with hot peppers, didst ignite,
My taste buds, with flavors most bright,
The other, with cheese, bacon, and lettuce,
Didst leave me cold, the sauce, a disappointment.

But fear not, dear friends, for they do serve,
A brew most excellent, a coffee, most divine,
And should thou find thyself in need,
Of a salad, Greek, with freshness, doth shine.

'Tis a place, open round the clock,
In Planet Hollywood, a location most prime,
The food, it doth come forth, with haste,
And lines, they doth move, with speed, most fair.

"Hark, what hidden gem doth lie within Charlotte's bounds?
A place called Wing Haven, full of feathered friends,
Tucked away in quiet street, betwixt Dilworth and Sewlyn ends.
The locals know it well, but strangers may not hear its call,
Until they stumble upon it, as I did, on a bike ride's fall.

A lovely spot for bird enthusiasts, nature lovers too,
With activities for young ones, and space to rent anew.
So seek out Wing Haven, on a sunny afternoon's stroll,
And discover the charm that doth this place unfold."

"Hark! If thou seekest a feast fit for a king,
Go for the Salt n Pepper Shrimp, 'twill be thy thing.
Fried chicken wings, cocktail shrimp, snow crab legs,
Raw oysters, greens, and fish, a veritable smorgasbord.
They also have clams, mussels, crawfish, a treat for young and old.
The kids love this place, 'tis a true delight.
And with a 10% off coupon, 'twill be a bargain, so bold.
For all the seafood they offer, 'tis better than the rest,
A true gem, a treasure to behold, and truly blessed."
"Lounge/bar review. Loved the vibe and decor - balcony overlooked the casino, colors shifted. Plush leather seats, pricey drinks. Boogie enough to impress, Vegas style."

"Lululemon, my dear. Can't help but think of you as "The One." Charming, well-built (all that yoga and running, must be working hard), polite, attentive, good sense of humor, kind heart... and always taken by the prettier girls! I adore Lululemon's clothes because they last forever, but with the price and limited colors, it's a luxury I allow myself only once a year. It's missing a star, but let's face it, "The One" isn't perfect. Can't help but visit my dear Lulu regularly, hoping for a more durable relationship, living happily ever after."

"Food reviews? Read 'em elsewhere. Service here's top-notch. Yolanda, our server, even emailed to thank us for bein' great guests. Broke a glass with my iPhone, no big deal. Bartender William's a hoot. Now, the grub. Loved the tomato soup, roast chicken, and steak. Portions ain't huge, but quality's outstandin'. All food quibbles'll get ironed out, 'cause the service shows they give a damn. Me, I stick to wild-caught salmon or sustainable stuff. Can't afford the rest. Raw tuna dishes were good, but a bit rich. Ordered four desserts for five of us - all good, except the potato chips with the ice cream. Angelo's got the important things down, the rest'll follow. Thanks."

"Hark! A Groupon didst I purchase, good sir,
For the Ultimate Wash, a deal most fair and bright.
They scrubbed the carriage, ere it didst enter,
And dried it well, with nary a drop in sight.
I shall return, anon, to this place,
For their service was of the highest grace."

"Saks Fifth Avenue, my go-to spot for top-notch service. Friendly folks, always ready to greet and offer a drink. They let you roam free, checking in just enough without being too pushy. Makeup counter, best in the valley, no contest. YSL and Dior, a duo of excellence. They know their stuff and aren't afraid to suggest alternatives. Last visit, they showed me their concealer and even ran to the Nars counter for a better match. Just wish they had a bigger shoe selection, but that's a minor gripe. All in all, a fantastic experience."

"Hark, do thou enjoy gyros, fair sir? Verily, I do, and have done so since youthful days in Chicago's suburbs. Upon consuming mine first gyro from Mad Pita Express, I did exclaim to mine betrothed that 'twas the best I had e'er tasted! Tender meat, fresh cucumber sauce, tomatoes, and herbs didst make mine mouth to water. And the pita, puffy and soft, didst complete this culinary delight.

Mine second visit to Mad Pita Express, I didst bring mine betrothed, and she didst order a most excellent lemon rice soup, full of tang and flavor! A piece of fresh baklava, special indeed, didst she also partake of.

Five tokens for the gyro, a fair price indeed! The soup, a mere 2.99 tokens, a generous portion.

A brief wait, a few moments, didst we endure for the food to be prepared. But the quaint, cozy restaurant, with its interesting decor, didst provide entertainment for mine eyes and mine betrothed's. Family pictures, diverse plants, and eclectic artwork didst adorn the walls, a feast for the senses.

A small, casual eatery, Mad Pita Express, counter-service, dine-in or carry-out, the choice is thine. We, the latter, didst choose, and our food, with plastic-ware and napkins, didst arrive swiftly."

"Health issues? Limited diet? No problem. Found some great raw options at this joint. Chile rellano, coconut curry spring rolls - outta sight! Vanilla cupcake with coconut strawberry frosting? Even better. This place is my go-to for raw food."

"Love the Destihl in Bloomington-Normal, had to try this one. Co-worker and I, dinner on a Thursday night. Not too busy, but enough business. Decor was cool, booths were neat. Waitress was rad. Same menu as Bloomington-Normal, except beer selection. Had the Beer Battered Asparagus, delish! Usual is White Cheddar Stuffed Poblano Peppers, but switched it up. Potato Crusted Rainbow Trout, fantastic flavor! Co-worker got my usual, loved 'em. Went for dessert, Creme Brulee. A bit runny, not as smooth as I like. Great food and service though. Love this joint."

"Good grub, good times, packed with Philly fans. Tucked away in the city, this joint's got game. I went for the Philly sub, and it passed with flying colors. Fresh roll, that's the key. If you're lookin' for somethin' else to do, grab a stogie and head to the shuffleboard table. They got friendly poker games once a week, too. Just show up and play. Staff's friendly, don't mind chattyin' it up. Only downside, place ain't exactly spotless. But hey, you know what you're gettin' into. Enjoy!"

"Clean joint, a tad pricey, but worth it. Felt like royalty, got a gel mani, white tips with glitter, $42. Not bad on my natural nails, but the fake ones, not so much. Looked a bit chunky, but blended okay with the rest. All in all, not bad."

"Solid joint. Good value, too. Went for the 3-meat combo, didn't spring for the fancy stuff. Had a few plates of it, though. Can't recall the cuts, but one was eye of round. Sukiyaki style is the way to go. Sweet soy has more flavor, and the udon noodles are better. Add some minced garlic for extra depth. Noodle and veggie plates are premade, which can be a bummer. Meat plates are done right, sliced to order. You can watch 'em put it together, too. Four stars, mostly 'cause I messed up and got the shabu shabu instead of Sukiyaki. Made do with Anthony M's leftover broth, but a staffer topped me off with shabu shabu water and it got watered down. Not his fault, but I didn't get to taste everything in Sukiyaki."

"I found this joint on Yelp, 3000+ reviews, 1 buck sign, 4+ stars. Only one like it on the strip. Had to check it out, needed a break from those $75 lunches. EoS is solid, variety of sandwiches, all tasty, easy on the wallet. Close to half the strip, even a $15 cab ride's worth it. Breakfast menu 'til 11 am, didn't make it, but their hot sandwich menu's my jam. Had the Chicken Chipotle Avocado, then the 1786 original. Needed more sauce, got it with extra, awesome. Can't go wrong for $7 a pop. Note: Sandwich ain't huge, but I don't eat much. My boys might need two. Note2: If you hit it for dinner, check the Pleasure Pit in the PH, you'll see..."

"A feast most sumptuous we didst partake,  
With forty colleagues, in this fair place.  
The victuals, delectable and fine,  
Didst please our taste, and cheerfulness didst trace.  
The service, too, most excellent we found,  
And in the courtyard, music didst resound.  
A quartet, with strings, didst play and sing,  
In harmony, their melodies didst bring.  
This place, most wondrous, we wouldst revisit,  
For another feast, most joyous and fit."

"Ah, nostalgia! A child of the eighties, I am drawn to this place,
For Thrifty's ice cream, a sweet and tasty delight.
I've visited before, but tonight's experience was grand,
With circus animal flavor, snickerdoodle, and sugar cookies in hand.

Who's counting calories? Not I, for tonight at least,
For this indulgence is worth every bite, and every penny spent.
The cookies, once hard, now soft and perfect for a sandwich,
Their scoop, a generous portion, a treat beyond measure or riches.

The staff, friendly and kind, keep the place clean and neat,
A goodly space, with arcade games and unique sodas to greet.
All I need now is music of old, MJ, Madonna, and more,
And this place shall have five stars, and my heart forevermore."

"Tuesdays, $2 Signature dogs. Who can resist? Maybe those who don't eat pork, but they're missin' out. These dogs are delicious. I'm workin' my way through 'em, and they keep changin' up the game with local brewery-inspired dogs. They grill 'em to perfection, and the toppings are endless. Great house chips and onion rings too. I usually do takeout, but the patio's a great spot to grab a beer and enjoy the spring evenings."

"Loved the crispy crust of the pizza. Super good. Worth a visit if you're at San Tan Mall. Went on a double date. Pretty good experience. Small dining area, though. Long wait. Got loud on a Friday night. Not ideal, but still worth it if you love pizza. Might stop by for lunch sometime. Avoid Fridays, too busy."

"Good grub, good people. Art, the owner, takes care of his customers like they're family. Had a swell time chattin' with him last visit. Food's solid, too. Roasted turkey's my jam. Fresh bread, decent cold cuts. Mozzarella's tasty, too. Turkey chili's a winner on a chilly day. Drinks are huge, so be ready. Typical 1/2 sandwich & soup lunch deals, too. Give it a shot, you won't regret it."

"Arena's easy to find, parkin's a breeze. Garage or street lot, both right next door. Decent size, mostly hockey and grads. Box Office is a bit off, but close enough. Restrooms nearby, prices fair. Seats comfy, ice rink covered for events, still feels chilly."

Amidst the splendor of the Palazzo's halls,
We tarried for a night or two, my friends and I,
Then descended upon the Cosmopolitan's walls,
To sample its wares and gauge its vaunted pride.

A far cry from the tawdry, overwrought decor
That plagues the Strip's more garish venues, this place
Exudes an air of elegance and modernity,
With nary a tacky statue nor kitschy grace.

The rooms, a haven of refreshment and delight,
Invite one to linger, free from stress and fright,
While the casino's ambiance, though pricey, feels right,
A cosmopolitan blend of style and excitement bright.

In Citycenter's heart, the Cosmo stands apart,
A beacon of sophistication, for those who seek
A respite from the Strip's more crassy, boisterous art,
And wish to indulge in finer pleasures, without meek.

"Pancakes, best I've had. Fluffy, warm, buttery, moist. Crisp outside. Maple syrup, warm. Eggs, phenomenal. Apple-smoked bacon, avocado, jack cheese omelet. Deconstructed. Pure egg whites, scrambled well-done. No high chairs. Service, meh. Facelift needed."

"Last eve, my love and I did share
A meal most wondrous, fair and rare
A pie of white, with onions sweet
And cheese, oh so delectable treat

With steak, our hunger did abate
And left us both in joyful state
I do adore this dish, my friend
And urge thee, give it a try, ere end."

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous place, wherein I find
Great pleasure in the victuals they do serve.
Apart from the bar, a separate space they do keep,
For dining, where one may savor each delicious bite.
Their burgers, diverse in style and form, do please,
And in the dining room, a large screen doth play,
Whereon we watched a game of hockey, full of delight.
On Mondays, verily, the burgers be but five,
A price most fair, methinks, for such a feast.
Yet, were they eight or eleven, I would not pay,
For that, my friends, doth seem a bit too much to me."

"Inside the wildest indoor carnival, Circus Circus' walls did hold
A feast most wondrous, a veritable cornucopia to behold
Three of us did dine, our hunger to assuage
For two hundred pieces of silver, a sum not too large
I, a triathlete, did compete that morn
And with my comrades, devoured a ribeye, a meal most born
In this meat oasis, we did find our peace
And left, our bellies full, our spirits release."
"Had a killer meal here, three years back. Spicy shrimp, lit AF. Service and vibes, top-notch. My man and I still rave about the Mexican feast we had. Give it a shot."

"Hark! A traveler doth speak of Southwest Airlines,
Whose staff doth show a friendly face, full of grace.
But lo! In winter's chill, when snows do fall,
The flights doth fill, and passengers doth throng.
I, lucky wight, didst escape all delays,
Yet, alack! The gates, they doth resemble a maze.
So come ye early, lest ye wish to stand,
And wait, a-weary, for thy flight to land."

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous place indeed,
Where breakfast doth reign supreme, in deed.
A Fat Boy bloody mary, with bacon and cheese,
Did start my day most excellently, if thou please.
Crab Benedict, a dish most fair and fine,
Didst follow, and with delight didst shine.
My comrades, they didst order Denver's scramble and prime,
And both didst declare their meals most sublime.
The cookie dough egg rolls, oh how they didst tempt,
With sweetness and richness, they didst invent.
But alack, the wait on Sundays doth prolong,
So heed my words, and tarry not too long.
A lounge area, with drinks to pass the time,
Doth make the delay seem less a crime."

"Verrado Grille, last night. Got there at 8:30, closed at 9. Expected poor service, but the waitress was nice. Had a pint of Verrado Ale, ordered the Almond Encrusted Basa. Beautifully cooked white fish, delicious Orzo/Risotto side. Price was right, would pay a bit more. Great experience, recommend it for sunset dinner. View over the golf course and White Tank Mountains was amazing."
"Always open, always friendly. Girls who work here, nice as can be. Chat us up, clean place, snacks galore. We'll be back, sure as sunrise."

"Good Blockbusters abound. One's near my crib, but the selection's weak, the staff's rude, and it's a straight-up dump. This spot's huge, got a killer selection, and the employees are A-okay. They're funny, too. Got the online thingy, works like a charm. In-store exchanges? Bam! Quick as can be. Other place had issues with that. This is my go-to Blockbuster in the valley. Two things keeping it from five stars: crappy parking lot and it's not right next door. That's how it is."

"Reservation time, sat promptly. Bread, one measly roll. Waiter rattled off menu. Spinach salad, good. BBQ shrimp, four tiny ones for twenty bucks? Rip-off. Seabass, lamb shank, decent. Blueberry cobbler, great. Maybe come back for lunch."

"I came here 'cause it's close by, good for a student like me livin' in Campustown. They got good hours, never had a problem gettin' an appointment. Price is right too, ain't broke the bank for a GUYS haircut. Been to pricier places in the NW, same quality. It's quick, no waitin' around. Stylists are friendly, one of 'em always jokes with me, says "That'll be a million dollars, please." If you're lookin' for deals and wanna pay cash, you can get your 10th haircut free."

"Yoshinoya's got fans beyond Cali, kid. New Yorkers dig it too. Me and my buddies hit it up all the time when I worked in the city. Packed joint, good grub, quick service. Only gripe? It's a haul from Phoenix. But hey, it's just a minute off the highway. Wish they'd bring it to the city limits, though. And yeah, that clam chowder trick? Crazy, but it works. But if you're new to the beef bowl game, start with the basics first. Enjoy."

"Kickass margaritas at Los Dos Molinos! 🍹🌮👌

Near downtown, this place has got the best margaritas in town. 💯 Grabbed a pitcher with some amigos and we had a blast! 🎉

Chill atmosphere, outside seating area's got some character. 😎 Random decor, but who cares when you're sipping on some top-shelf margaritas? 😏

Ordered some apps to share, that adovada ribs tho... 🍗👀 Spicy as hell, but damn good! 🤤 Flour tortilla was on point too! 🌯

Chorizo pizza, oh man... 🍕🔥 Another spicy bombshell! 😵 Thin crust, crispy and loaded with that spicy chorizo. 👌

Highly recommend this spot for some kickass margaritas and delicious eats! 🙌🏼🍴 Cheeeeers!"

"Hark, fair maiden Rachel doth possess  
A kitchen, wherein she doth prepare  
Savory wraps and burgers, of quality fine,  
Yet 'tis the smoothies that doth make her shine.  
Oh, traveler, do thou highly recommend  
Her sweet concoctions, for they doth ascend  
To heights of flavor, unmatched by any other,  
In this fair town, where gastronomy doth reign."

"In fair Chandler, I didst chance upon
A gyro place of wondrous renown,
The flavors didst dance upon my tongue,
And filled my heart with joy and cheer.

The proprietor, a man of Chicago born,
Didst share his tale of culinary skill,
And I, a humble traveler, didst partake
Of his most excellent gyro dish, so thrilled.

I have returned, my friends, full twenty times,
And still, the taste doth linger sweet,
The plates, they didst delight mine eyes,
And left me in a state of blissful treat.

Alas, the website, poor and weak,
Doth not do justice to the feast,
But fear not, dear friends, for I do swear,
Their food, it doth excel, beyond compare."

"My wife talked me into it. Said it'd be a swell time, a steal. And it was. We took advantage of the 24-hour pass. Started with a late dinner at Paris. Good grub, long line 'til closing. Next day, lunch at Planet Hollywood. So good, we went back for dinner. Clean, well-managed, fresh. I reckon their buffet's worth it. It's not about gorging or sampling everything. Just enjoying a salmon Caesar salad in Vegas for under 30 bucks. Not something I'd do every day, but hey, why not once in a while?"
"Been seein' Doc Woodson for years. Always real friendly, takes his time explainin' things. Office got better since new folks took over. Wait can be a bit long, but Doc's worth it."
"Shoes fixed here. Sole peeled off, glued back on. Two others needed new soles. Boris, the son, nice guy. Fast turnover. Pricier than home, but fair and good quality. Thanks, Yelpers."
"Tostones. Big, juicy. Hot sauce and mojo. Two virgins to Cuban cuisine. Plates licked clean."

"Cold winter day? This joint's got you covered. Spicy grub, warm belly. Start with a free bowl of miso soup, then move on to the good stuff - spicy barbecue with top-notch meat, served steaming hot alongside kimchi and other Korean delights. Prices might seem a bit steep, but most dishes are big enough to share."
"Mandalay Bay's got a killer breakfast joint. Hash browns, waffles, you name it. Shame about the juice, but still a solid spot."

"Dinner with the missus and three rug rats. Grub was top-notch, service even better. Not much for little ones, but they shared a drumstick app nice and juicy. Big burger, decent steak, but the nachos were lackin'. Pizza stole the show, though - buttery, flaky crust, well-balanced sauce and cheese. Wouldn't mind havin' it again. Interior could use a spruce-up, but eatin' outside's an option too."
"Perfect spot. Dentist next door. Chicken's top-notch. Spicy Honey Mustard, Asiago Parmesan, both must-trys. Homemade Asiago Chips, nice."
"Good pho. Not the best I've had, but still satisfying. Spicy, but needed a bit more kick. Just right after a cold snowy day."

"Food court review, mostly. Stores too, sure. Nike, Adidas, Oakley, Guess, D&G, plenty more. Outdoors, dress right. Food court, limited pickings. Japanese, Chinese, Subway, Italian. Pizza for lunch, decent. Sampled teri chicken, Japanese, and orange chicken, Chinese. Good, could be better."

"Dined here with the missus, ma, and our little one this weekend. Place was dead, but service was top-notch. Food was traditional, but still damn good. Had the appetizer platter and three specials off the yellow menu. Mango lassi too. Bill came to $43 with tax. No booze, but they let us bring our own from the store next door. Grabbed a couple cold ones. Background music and TV were a real hoot. Indian Who Wants to Be a Millionaire followed by music vids. A funny night."
"Pizza Hut? Good? Damn right. 10:30 AM, best time to be there."

"Wrote about Tacone in Tustin, had to give props to the one in Vegas too. Had a coupon, took the fam there for lunch. Didn't expect much, but damn, those wraps were huge and delicious. Free sauce bar, kids loved it. Thai cone was legit, hubby's Mambo wrap was on point. Pricey, but worth it. Four stars."

"The chambers, fair and pleasant, yet a tad dull,
The grand bathroom, in lowly rooms, a boon most great.
A place to soak in luxury, a deep tub doth provide,
And thus, thy cares and woes, they shall be alleviated.

The rest of yonder Casino, a sight most fair,
Yet, I, a wanderer, shall seek my former lair.
For there, at Mirage, my heart doth sing with joy,
And thus, my spirit, doth soar, with naught to destroy."
"Vig McCormick Ranch, good job. This'll be a swell spot for grub in your foodie book."

"Hark! What joy doth bring me cheer? A Komex doth now reside near! A place most wondrous, swift and bright, Where one may find a meal most fair and light. I do confess, my heart doth sing, For fusion tacos, they doth bring. Spicy pork, a flavor most bold, Doth make my taste buds dance with glee. Other dishes, I have tried, 'Tis true, But none, my friends, can compare to thee, Oh fusion tacos, how I adore thee!"

"Verily, 'tis a curious place, my dear,
A take-out spot, with hours of five to ten,
No ordinary Thai food joint, I do declare.

The victuals, they are quite divine,
My heart doth sing with joy at the Mango Sticky Rice,
A generous portion, indeed, doth shine.

Cleanliness, a virtue they do hold,
No tables, yet nary a speck of dust doth bold,
A testament to their diligence, I do unfold.

The matron, a friendly soul, doth greet,
With haste and purpose, she doth meet,
Her kin, anon, doth aid, a family affair, no doubt.

In conclusion, 'tis a humble abode,
Quaint, inexpensive, and of gastronomic renown,
I do implore thee, give it a go, my friend,
For those eves when homebound, a movie to amend."

"We scored a sweet deal on Priceline for $90 a night. The room was cozy, but the view of Heinz Field made up for it. Great location too - we walked everywhere. The hotel's lobby was a work of art, maintaining its historic charm while still feeling modern. Skip the restaurant though. Overpriced and forgettable breakfast."
"Dumplings, homemade. Soft, like a fresh kill. Carrot and beef, my choice. Delicious, like a well-placed shot. Congee, cheap at two bucks a bowl. Spare change, I stop by, grab one. Give it a try."

"Cirque, you know it's gonna be good. Flaw? Vague storyline, but who needs it with sets, costumes, and choreography like this? After a few cold ones, I realized KA's story is basically Star Wars. Luke, Leia, Vader, Emperor - easy as that."

"Grand Lux Cafe, founded by the creator of Cheesecake Factory, is an upscale, 24-hour eatery. After a wild night, it's the perfect spot to sober up. I've been here before, and I recommended it to my friends Lucy Y., David G., and Sarah A. when we were all hungry at 4 a.m. We encountered some rowdy, half-naked drunks outside the restroom, but that's part of the charm. \n\nWe were quickly seated, and I ordered the Smoked Salmon with onions and scrambled eggs, which came with hash browns. It was simple yet elegant, with the contrast of flavors creating a satisfying meal. It was filling enough for bedtime, but pricier than other 24-hour spots. However, the quality of the food and service makes it worth it."

"Wynn Casino: swanky joint. Had a blast at their casino, even though I didn't stay there. Signed up for their Red Card, got $10 free play. Enjoyed some tasty chocolate martinis, feeling pretty good by 1 pm. Hit a nice streak on the Mona Lisa slot machine, walked away with an extra $12. Thanks, Wynn. You've got my heart. Looking forward to coming back."

"Great spot for meetings in Edinburgh. Rented the 'Glass Room' at the top, private balcony with a view. The Hub served sandwiches, but the real treat was the chocolate cake. Damn good. They also left Edinburgh rock on the tables. Perfect for when the meeting got dull. A sugar rush to keep me alert."

"Cozy joint on McGill street. Good spot between the business district and Old Port. Easy to adopt for an evening out after work. Menu's simple but solid - tartares, hearty salads, burgers. Prices are middle-high ($25 a plate). They got a good wine selection too. Service is friendly, though a bit slow. We enjoyed our time and will likely return!"

"Methinks 'twas a grand evening, fair friends,
At the October Adults Night Out, where all could partake
In free admission, libations, and merriment,
A most excellent way to pass a Friday night, by my reckoning.

But alack, two issues did arise,
That did dampen the spirits, so to speak,
The first, a lengthy queue to gain entry,
Moved slow as molasses, and caused much dismay,
And the second, a beer garden, with but two servers,
To tend to the throngs, with nary a pause,
The line crawled at a snail's pace, and caused much vexation,
Leaving many to abandon their drink tickets, in frustration.

Despite these flaws, I would attend once more,
For the concept, it doth please me still,
Yet, mayhap, in the future, they shall make amends,
And rectify these issues, that did cause such ill will."

"Methinks this place doth hold a special place within mine heart, forsooth.  My friends and I, we do endeavour to partake in a 'girl's night out' once a month, and thus, we find ourselves at Radio Maria, drawn by the savory victuals and convivial ambiance.  Verily, 'tis a tranquil abode, replete with objects of interest that do spark lively discourse.  The hospitality, too, doth excel, making it one of mine dearest locales to break bread in Champaign."

"Hark, good sir! I pray thee, bring me sustenance,  
For I find myself near TownePlace Suites, in sooth.  
A feast fit for a king, with sushi most divine,  
And haste, for 'tis a Saturday eve, and time doth flee.  
In thirty minutes' span, or less, 'twill be delivered,  
By thy swift courier, with speed unmatched, 'tis hoped.  
Then, prithee, let this humble request be granted,  
That I may dine in splendor, and my hunger be vanquished."

Across from Midwestern, a fave spot for lunch. Lunch special, student discounts, but get there early. Crowded, slow service, but worth it. Tasty grub, salads, paninis, pizzas, all good. Tomato soup, must-try, best in Phoenix, almost like having soup all day.
"Rose macarons, my dear. Exquisite, just like the rest of their sweets. Avoid the crepes, though - they're a letdown. This joint's got it all: class, elegance, and a passion for perfection."

"Hark! What's this? A mighty sandwich, so big and grand,
With bread that's fresh, or fair, depending on the land.
My mother doth adore the Philly cheese-steak,
Whilst I, a humble Italian, do seek
Hot peppers, added to my feast with glee.
But, alas! The payment process doth confuse,
For one must order, then straightaway pay,
Lest hunger pangs doth strike, and thou doth stay,
And thus, the risk of theft doth come what may.
Yet still, their chips, of which I do not know the name,
Are quite delicious, and worth the fame.
So, to this place, I shall return again,
For BBQ, my heart doth truly gain."

"Though not as grand as Palazzo or Venetian,  
Their rooms are fair, comparable to Cosmo and the rest.  
Perhaps the same size, or even larger, we find.  
The difference lies in kitchenettes, where we can prepare  
A meal, reheat leftovers, or snacks, 'tis true.  
A convenience indeed, for those who desire to do so.  
But alas, dear friends, 'tis located far from the Strip,  
A trek through MGM's tunnel, quite a hike, I must admit.  
No casino within, and parking, well, 'tis quite a chore,  
For guests only, valet, no self-parking, we find.  
Yet still, a quiet, pleasant stay, it doth provide."

"This joint's got some serious mojo. Folks are cheerful, welcoming. Pool's a real treat, too. Had a bite to eat at five different spots. All five hit the spot. Strolling through the forum shops, feeling good. Only downside's the stench of smoke. Strong stuff, man. Brought the kiddos along, they had a blast."
"Flavors of India, decent joint for a quick lunch. Been there a few times, food's hit or miss. Wish they had more variety. Friendly service, good price. Giving 'em four stars for now. See you there."

"In Chandler/Tempe, this joint serves up genuine Italian grub. Family-owned, just like Nonna used to make. Decor's nice, service is friendly. Caesar salad, hell of a start. Linguine with red clam sauce, loaded with garlic and clams. Baked ziti, two pounds of heaven. Even the kid loved it. Cannoli for dessert, perfect ending. Prices? Fair, especially for an Italian spot. Coupons and takeout deals? Jackpot."

"Methinks I've had the pleasure of partaking in their delectable confections on multiple occasions, and by the stars, they doth delight my taste buds! Their frosting, not overly sweet, doth complement the subtle flavors of their Asian-inspired creations, such as green tea and sweet potato, which may not be to everyone's liking, but are indeed divine. The more traditional fruit flavors are also quite satisfying.

Verily, I do implore thee, good bakers, to consider adopting a modern payment system, such as Square, to ease the burden of those who do not carry cash. Forsooth, thy cakes are pricey, and it doth cause me vexation to procure the necessary funds. Methinks a small surcharge for the convenience would be worthwhile."

"A waiter of wit and charm doth serve us well,
With mango mojitos that our thirst doth quell.
An appetizer most wondrous doth precede
The delectable pan bread, a feast for our eyes indeed.
And though the restaurant be within a mall,
The owner's taste in decor doth make it stand tall."

"Solu'shn, a record shop that defies the mainstream. They pride themselves on the rare and hard to find. Vinyl and CDs, averaging 12-14 pounds each. But you can test them out on their decks before buying, like trying on a pair of shoes. Perfect for aspiring DJs seeking to bolster their collections with unique tracks."

In sooth, I call this place the Key Shack,
A humble abode, scarce seen, yet true,
In Park Road Shopping Centre, 'twill lack,
A place of wonder, or of much to do.

But fear not, for its outward show,
Doth hide a secret, worth the know,
For within, a treasure doth abide,
A key, so rare, and hard to find.

A friend didst recommend this place,
And I, with haste, didst seek its grace,
For in my hand, a key didst lie,
To unlock doors, of uptown's pride.

The Key Shack, didst deliver, in truth,
A new key, made, in mere youth,
And for a price, most fair and bright,
Didst exchange, with speed, the night.

So, if thou art in search of a key,
That doth evade thee, do not flee,
For in this Shack, a solution doth lie,
And thy quest, shall end, most happily.

And when thou art done, with joy and cheer,
Thou mayst stroll, through Park Road, my dear,
For cupcakes, coffee, and more, doth await,
In this shopping centre, most elate.

"Tried out Isis Salon last month. Read the reviews, decided to give it a shot. Kelly was great, real friendly and listened to what I wanted. Loved how my hair turned out, got a haircut and partial highlights for $85, half of what I usually spend. Great price, been to fancy salons before and got mediocre service. Now that I know about Isis, I'll be back."

"Sunday reservation, easy peasy. Prices, reasonable. Service, attentive. Steak bernaise, surprise - lemony butter, good. Sirloin, chewy but manageable. Fries, plenty. Good meal, sure. Four stars, two thousand Yelpers? Meh. Apple tartin, underwhelming. One big slice, no fanfare. Three stars for food, plus one for service. That's four."

"Went to Butters at 11am on a Saturday. Half hour wait. Popular joint. Waitress came over quick, got us our coffee and OJ. Carafe of ice water on the table. Coffee was good, OJ fresh squeezed. Ordered an omelet with hash browns and pancakes. All very good! Service was attentive, despite the crowd. Place was hoppin'! Scottsdale, ya know? Women in their 40s and 50s, fake fun bags galore (if that's your thing). Overall, a solid spot for breakfast, even with a bit of a wait."

"Verily, I have beheld each and every performer who hath graced this stage, from those most skilled to those less fortunate. But lo, the night past with Coco, 'twas the best of all, by far! Mel B. and what's-his-name, they were quite excellent in days of yore, when the show first began, for they could both sing and dance with great skill. But alack, poor Holly Madison, she was woeful, afeared and lost, a mere shadow of her former self. Angel Porrino, a vision of loveliness, with passion and grace, didst shine brighter than Holly, and we doth hope to see her again in this fair city. And CoCo, oh how she doth reign supreme! With her bountiful charms and lissome limbs, she didst bring joy and mirth to all who didst behold her. Mayhap, in time, they shall alter more of the show, that we mightst see yet more of CoCo's wondrous gifts."

"Lunch at a spot down the street. Guac and sangria margarita hit the spot. Torta was good, meat marinated well, not too sweet. Fish tacos solid too. Service lacking though. Opentable reservation mishap. They didn't log it in and I got a call asking where I was. Sorted it out but shouldn't have happened."
"Good grub, top-notch service. Big joint, no waitin' around. Family friendly, give it a shot."
"Sunday mornin', we rose with the sun, makin' for Edinburgh Castle. Beat the crowds, we did. The castle, well-preserved, a must-see, it is."

On a Sunday eve, we ventured forth,
Three souls, in search of dinner and mirth.
We thought the village would be bustling,
But alas, 'twas deserted, like a ghost town's lingering.

We parked in the garage, and saw but a few,
Cars, and through a passage, we did pursue.
The lower shopping area, a barren land,
Didst strike fear in our hearts, like a zombie's hand.

In the main street, a eerie feeling didst prevail,
As if in the Twilight Zone, our fate didst unveil.
We dined at Black Pepper Grill, with but a single soul,
Amidst an empty room, our meal didst unfold.

The food and service, both excellent, didst shine,
But the emptiness, didst make our flesh didst shrink.
We walked to Ravella, new and grand,
With a cozy bar, and prices, so bland.

But alas, the hotel lobby, didst seem so still,
As if in a dream, or a scene from a thriller.
I pray that Lake Las Vegas, doth flourish once more,
For it hath much to offer, and we doth implore.

Till then, I shall film, a tale of woe,
Of a place, that once didst thrive, now doth lie low.

"A most excellent shopping place, full of delightful shops and eateries. Verily, I didst give four stars, forsooth, for that the mall doth pose a challenge to navigate during the sweltering summer months. Moreover, certain grand department stores and retailers lay afar, requiring a gallant knight to drive and re-park his trusty steed multiple times, ere he may reach all of his desired destinations. Save this minor quibble, 'tis a most enjoyable experience."

"Sitting at the bar, sipping a whiskey, feeling like a king. Food was top-notch, cooked to perfection. Not every dish was my cup of tea, but you could tell they put their heart into it. Pricey? Sure, but worth it for the experience."
"Chairs out front for socializing in the sun. Friendly employees, especially in the morning. Moderate crowd due to location."

We chowed down at an off-strip hotel with some pals. The server gave us the lowdown on the menu and portion sizes. We had to try a couple of their raved-about dishes - Sage Fried Chicken Benedict and Griddled French Toast. They were gargantuan! Our server was cool and warned us about the size, even offering to-go boxes for our leftovers. We devoured half of each dish, feeling stuffed and satisfied. The breakfast menu was top-notch, according to the concierge. The only bummer was the trek from the Strip. Next time, we'll hit up the joint on West Sahara or Imperial Palace.

"Went in for a slice, felt like they made a fresh pie. Annoyed no one said anything. Left due to time. Came back, ordered an 18" pizza and wings. Forgot how many wings I ate, but they were good. Place makes decent wings, not too hot, but I'll feel it tomorrow. That's the true test of wings."
"Fresh joint. Good eats. Friendly folk. Country charm."

"Good BBQ, but not perfect. Chicken was a tad dry, and the joint could've been cleaner. Not dirty, mind you, but that damn sign on the fountain drink got under my skin. And what's with the trash cans? One's turned around and another's just sittin' there, takin' up space. Still, not a bad visit."

"Hark! Good sir or madam, listen well,
For I have news of a most wondrous deal,
A feast fit for a king, a meal most swell,
In Chicago's fair city, 'twain Vienna Beef doth reveal.

A juicy hot dog, with all the trimmings,
And crispy fries, made from scratch, no sham,
All this, for just four dollars, a steal!
The best bargain in all the land, no need to conceal.

So heed my words, good people, take heed,
And hasten thee to this culinary creed,
For thou shalt not find a better deal,
In all the town, nay, in all the realm, 'tis no steal.

Thanks be to thee, kind reader, for thy time,
And may this message bring thee joy, and end thy rhyme."

"This joint's a real gem. For $30, it's a damn good deal, especially when you consider the unlimited booze. I mean, who doesn't love bubbly? And the grub? Top-notch. They got everything from fluffy pancakes to Korean short ribs. That's how my mind works, a mix of sweet and savory. 

You can get a custom omelette or just grab whatever you want from the rows of seafood, Asian, fruits, veggies, pasta, eggs benedict, and even sushi. And let's not forget the desserts. Gelato, pastry, rich chocolate mousse, tangy passion fruit, gold-flecked wafer cones, chocolate-covered strawberries. It's like a dream come true. 

And the best part? They know how to do portions right. No more loading up on mac and cheese. They got mini cups, bowls, and dishes for everything. Nice and easy. 

The wait wasn't too bad, but still, two lines? One for the cashier and one for the buffet? Silly."

"Not big on breakfast, but some days need somethin' quick. Today, that meant The Silver Spoon. No corned beef hash, dammit. Jono suggested the breakfast bagel sandwich. Everything bagel, bacon. Tasty. Pleased with the result. Had to pause from bank chat to enjoy."

"Need a fancy dress outfit? Look no further than Party Mania. They got all sorts of getups for any occasion. Superheroes, disco divas, witches, and more. They even got accessories like wigs, hats, and gloves. And don't forget the Hen Nights essentials - L-plates and garters. 

Halloween's their busy season, but they're always well-stocked. Makeup, ribbons, feathers - they got it all. Conveniently located near the university, too. 

But, fair warning, it ain't cheap."

A shop most wondrous, full of wit and mirth,
With papers fine, and novelty of worth.
The staff, so kind, with manners true,
Do make each visit, a pleasure anew.
Parking, alas, may prove a test,
But once within, thy heart doth rest.
For there, thou shalt find treasures galore,
And leave, with smile, and purse a-store.

"Hark! Cancelled my membership, six winters' duration,  
No fuss, no muss, a most welcome liberation.  
Refunded, too, for time yet to come, a pleasant surprise, indeed.  
A worthy place, but private yoga now doth suffice,  
Gym, alas, no longer needed, farewell, adieu!"

"Married in Caesars Palace, stayed in the Augustus Tower. Asked for a room with a view of the Bellagio water show, but got put on the wrong side. Still, the room was huge, bathroom was enormous, and the bed was incredibly comfortable. Pillows were great too, wish I knew what kind they were. Despite being near the elevator, it was quiet. Would definitely stay here again."

"Step onto the patio, feel the mist from the waterfall, and let it cool you down. Bliss. No need for lines here, no sir. Got my own bodyguard, takes care of everything. Best table, front of the line, you name it. Service is top-notch, attentive, and friendly. Little perks like chilled strawberries make it extra special. Dress to impress, strut your stuff, and you might just find yourself at a table surrounded by admiring gentlemen."

"Verily, this Chang's doth serve the finest Dim Sum in all of Las Vegas! Thrice have I visited this establishment in recent months, and each time, the fare hath been most excellent. Alas, the service doth leave somewhat to be desired, for we have been compelled to request our beverages twice upon each visit. But, indeed, 'tis the Dim Sum that doth make this place shine, for the carts doth overflow with delectable victuals. The 'cart pushers,' though not overly friendly or loquacious, doth provide the items we desire with nary a fuss. And, verily, the prices doth seem most reasonable for a family of four. \n\nAlack, the parking situation doth leave much to be desired, for the lot doth fill up quickly, and we have been forced to wait for others to depart ere we could park our carriage."
"This joint's the real deal. Like a subway, but with pizza. Friendly staff, too."

"Bought a Groupon deal for two months of unlimited car washes. Fifteen bucks. Includes their "red towel" service. They give you a microfiber towel to use, and when you bring the dirty one back, they give you a clean one. Air and vacuums included. Self-service bays too. Asked about adding one-off services like wax. They said sure and gave me a free wax on the spot. Been a few times, and I'm satisfied. Wish I could pause the tunnel to give my wheels some extra attention, but that's not gonna happen. Also wish they opened earlier, but 8-6 is reasonable. After my Groupon is up, I'll keep my membership going. Sixteen bucks a month. Only need to go once a week to make it worth it."

"We hit Greek Wraps in Peoria once a week. Their hummus is top-notch. Never had a bad meal. Veggie pita wrap with grilled eggplant and onions drenched in yogurt sauce? Amazing. Grilled lemon kebab with garlic sauce? Equally great. \n\nLine forms quick, but worth it. Fresh food takes time. Portions are generous. Wish they delivered."

"Good run of luck lately. Sat down for brekkie, nice welcome. Friendly server, efficient as hell. Pancakes and eggs benedict, top-notch. Muffins could use some more toasting, though. Coffee's decent, but my home brew's better. Still, a solid spot for breakfast. Oh, and my cat just hopped on me. That's all for now."

"Tigerlilly's my jam. Better for cocktails or tea, you know? Had a great meal, but the afternoon tea's where it's at. Ketel One cocktail, plenty of sweets, scones, and sammies. Staff's top-notch too. Decor's swell, atmosphere's always on point. Professional all the way."
"Pricey for the portion size. Good grub, but the bill added up quick. They say their Krab is legit Cali-roll stuff, though. Tasty, just a bit steep."

"Good Oriental grub, good American choices too. Wide selection, sushi bar top-notch. Love it when they got what I like. Don't like it when they ain't got what I usualy like. Service always good. All you can eat, wow! Good for fam, good for group."
"Went to Archie's Cafe. Service good, grub top-notch. Had the Pad Tai, six on the heat scale, coulda used more fire. Nice joint, though."

"A book shopper of haste, I doth prefer,
To swiftly find my quarry, and away I fare.
For purpose-driven purchases, I do seek,
Bookstores that cater, with ease, to my need.

Borders, a haven, with layout so fine,
Doth present its wares, in categories divine.
New non-fiction, clearance, and bestsellers too,
Await my perusal, with eager view.

Prices, alas, do climb to lofty heights,
Compared to online realms, with digital delights.
But browsing, a breeze, doth make up for cost,
In Borders' halls, where knowledge doth unfold, with ease, no boast.

Friendly staff, and parking, plentiful,
A Seattle's Best, within, my heart doth fuel.
A coffee shop, of renown, I do adore,
Yet, on this visit, empty-handed, I did explore."

"A wondrous place, full of hands-on delight,
Where one can spend an afternoon in joyful sight.
My favorites, the robots, never miss a shot,
At basketball or air hockey, they're never caught.
A fun and informative way to pass the time,
Indeed, a place that doth make the spirit shine."

"Hark! We've arrived at last, my friends,
And found a place where food and drink do flow.
The victuals here are quite divine, I say,
And if thou asketh for heat, they doth provide.
Aye, 'tis a challenge, but one worth taking,
For they doth serve it hot, and not just faking.
Their curry, made with veggies so fine,
Doth please mine taste buds, and doth combine
With wine, a selection most excellent,
To make a meal most worthy of our dent.
The staff, so friendly and so bright,
Doth watch us closely, and doth bring more rice in sight,
When they perceive our plates to be running low,
So here we'll stay, and revel in this feast, I trow."

"Went here for a quick dinner. Newer spot. Food was good, variety of options, big portions. Staff was great, rolled food in Chinese pancakes table side, cool. Offered wine and warm sake, nice touch. Overall, solid choice for Chinese food in Apache Junction."

"If you're lookin' for some damn good Mexican, this place is worth the trip. Friendly staff, clean as a whistle, plenty of seats, and a killer view. Had the shrimp tacos and sweet plantains, both top-notch. Their ultimate margarita was a letdown though, three types of tequila or not, it didn't even give me a buzz. Pricey too. But overall, this place serves up some of the best Mexican I've had."

"Lunchtime in Vegas. We're hungry. Place is new, maybe not fully up to speed. Waitress is decent, but some staff seem lost. Salads take an age to arrive, barely enough time to enjoy 'em before the main course shows up. Twisted Mac and Chicken & Cheese hit the spot. Atmosphere is classic Hard Rock, always a good time. Hope to swing by again next time I'm in town." (497 tokens)

"Postino's still kickin' ass, especially since they cut ties with LGO. This new joint's the best yet, and I ain't just sayin' that 'cause it's closer to my pad. Love the indoor/outdoor bar, feels like a real hangout. Food's on point, menu's been updated, everything's cooked to perfection. That grilled French toast with egg and asparagus? Deadly. And the cheap wine? Even better on weekends. Sauvignon Blanc's worth tryin', too. All in all, this place rules. Service can be spotty, but I can let that slide for a 4-star review."

"In Scottsdale, found a gem. Twenty bucks for a haircut, great atmosphere. Two-dollar beer happy hour, served in the bar or while you're getting trimmed. Cool, knowledgeable dude cut my hair. This'll be my spot from now on."

"Four of us dined at Roy's on a Saturday night. We walked in, were greeted, and sat down promptly. We were glad to be seated in one of the quieter rooms. Our server introduced herself, poured water, and took our drink orders. We ordered a Cosmo and a Martini, but the Martini came without olives and with a lime wedge instead. We sent it back and it was quickly corrected. \n\nWe started with Tuna Poke and a Signature Roll, both delicious. For entrees, we had Braised Short Ribs, Seared Sea Scallops, Blackened Island Ahi, and Tempura California White Sea Bass. All were cooked to perfection and tasted great. While the food and service were excellent, Roy's still felt like a chain restaurant. Maybe it was the decor, the number of tables, the scent, or the lighting. Despite this, it's a great place for a family dinner. Not sure if it's the best spot for a romantic evening, though."
"This joint's got character. Like a neighborhood bar, but for adults. Good grub too. Entertainment's top-notch. Get a table, it fills up fast in summer. Service is A-one."

"Friday afternoon, hungry and broke. Where to eat? Not the fanciest joint, but for $7.55, you get a lot of grub. Fill your gut, but watch out, it's easy to overdo it. I know, I did. Belly's full, feeling guilty. Shouldn't complain, it was cheap. :)"

"Fan motor busted, needed a new one. These guys delivered. Got me a good price, too. Showed up to pay, they had it ready. Even offered a free capacitor, but didn't need it. Good work, boys. Only hiccup? Miscommunication about payment. Thought I could pay later, but they wanted it up front. No biggie. Hours on Yelp? Inaccurate. They close at 4:30."

"Went to Bunna with the missus last Saturday. First time. Heard they had a poetry slam goin' on and we were hungry. Place had a cozy vibe, eclectic. Owner seemed proud. Didn't try the coffee, but will next time. Husband got the Mediterranean chicken wrap, I had the turkey and swiss panini. Both good. Came with veggie chips, different, but nice. Lunch menu's a steal. Will be back."
"Lisa's Bowl of Balls, it's a damn good dish. Satisfying, real satisfying. Meatballs, that's what I'm talking about. Craving meat? Go to Lisa G's. Highly recommend it."

"Mistakes happen, folks. People, companies - we're all human. But what matters is how we take responsibility and fix 'em. The owner here, they took it personal, fixed the problem pronto. Shows they give a damn about their customers and their business. That's how you build trust, by being accountable."

"A pleasant place indeed, my love didst rave about it,
And thus, he took me there, to dine and revel in its delight.
I do confess, I have a fondness for baked potatoes,
And he did say, this place didst serve them in abundance, with great relish.

But alas, I must admit, I felt a bit deceived,
For all I had, was potatoes and corn bread, and naught else did I perceive.
And yet, we paid a sum of thirty pieces of silver,
For what seemed to me, a paltry meal, and nothing more, nor less.

But fear not, dear friends, for I shall give thee a chance,
To redeem thyself, and prove thy worth, in this dance.
For I didst espy, the BBQ, which didst seem most fair,
And the aroma that didst waft, didst stir my hunger, beyond compare.

The atmosphere within, was homey and warm,
And the folk, didst bustle about, with nary a storm.
The cornbread and honey butter, didst taste most sweet,
And I didst covet, a pan of it, to savor and to eat.

In conclusion, dear friends, the price didst seem a bit steep,
But the food, didst satisfy, and didst bring me cheer, in my sleep.
So I shall return, to partake of thy BBQ,
And pray, that it shall be, a culinary ecstasy, for me."

"Pho: 4/5. Good stuff. Loved the pho tai chin, bo vien too. Noodles not stuck together, good temp. Spring rolls? Meh. Not impressed. 

Service: 5/5. Friendly, attentive. Kept my water full, brought the bill quick. 

Ambiance: 4/5. Nice spot in Asian Town. Smells like pho, which is a good thing. Fish tank looked a bit rough, but maybe they were cleaning it. Minus one star for that."

"3.5 stars, but let's call it four. Long lines, especially during that damn BOGO promo. Waited an hour, and just made the 4pm cutoff. They said if we didn't make it, we'd pay full price per person. Jesus. 

But once inside, the spread was impressive. Anything and everything, plus free booze. Food was good too. 

Go for lunch, it's cheaper. Twelve bucks with the player's card. Dinner's a bit steep. Think they take reservations, unless there's a promotion."

"Good eatery. Big portions. Chica, their purple corn drink, tastes like hibiscus tea, not corn. Had roast chicken on a Friday. Juicy, tender, herby, roasted right. Fish ceviche for an appetizer. Nice tang, citrusy. Also had lomo saltado. Beef's tender, full of flavor. Friendly service, a bit slow. Will return."

"Hark! I chanced upon Federico's, seeking sustenance fleet.
Two beef tacos, prithee, with a draught didst I request.
The maiden at the counter, with duties dual, didst attend
To drive-through and counter, with slowness didst impend.
But lo! The victuals, of excellence didst speak,
Tasty, the tacos, crisp, the lettuce, fresh, didst seek.
Impressed, was I, by the fare, of great worth,
A very good value, for the coin, didst procure."
"The clothes here ain't top-notch, but if you frequent the place, you might find something worthwhile. The fella who runs the joint's a good egg, too. Get to know him and he'll help you out."

"Primanti Brothers, the real deal. If they were in San Fran, I'd be their neighbor. Their sandwiches? Sloppy, robust, full of goodness. Pittsburgh to the bone. Love the OG spot, got memories of drinkin', devourin' kielbasa like a true Yinzer. May they rule the sandwich game forever. Amen."

"Houstons, consistent as hell. Hillstone Group knows their stuff. Tell Fox Restaurant Concepts to take notes. \n\nWord to the wise, Houstons soup enthusiasts - they swapped out the Mexico City style for Mushroom Artichoke on Sundays. Bummed, but still stoked on the new option. Two thumbs up."
