They're all business when it comes to moving the line along, too. Efficient, no-nonsense, and quick. Just how I like it. And don't forget the affordable fuel. A pleasant surprise, that's for sure."
"Coffee and Danish, best in town. Cheese Danish, cappuccino, and a sweet stick of sugar. Forget the buffet, this is the real deal."
"This joint's my go-to spot in Vegas. Drinks are dirt cheap and the vibe's always lively. You can bet your ass I'll be here every time I'm in town."
"Best restaurant in Vegas. Never had a bad meal. Been there in April, and we'll be back three more times this summer. Always great."
"Flowers were damn fine, just like online. Got 'em same day too."

"Pineapple Park, our new fave for sweet treats. Everything's been top-notch. Recently, we went for something sans pineapple - bananas foster sundae. Didn't disappoint. Service is quick and friendly. Wish the owner would open one up near our neck of the woods."

"Love this joint! Veggie options for me, meat for the hubby. Pulled pork sandwich and ribs, he says. Tofu and seitan, cooked just right. TV tray dinner, variety pack. Cornbread, amazing! Beer selection, top-notch. Fun spot for a game or dinner. Mindy, our server, great too."

"Vegas has been my playground since I was six. Excalibur, the coolest hotel back then, still holds its charm. Now, as an adult, I've found even more joy at another hotel. 

The room's gadgets kept us entertained for hours - lights, curtains, you name it. It was like being a kid in a candy store. 

Lost some money at blackjack, but craps made it all back. Staff was great, security was tight, and my bikes were safe. 

View from my room? Epic. Hot air balloons, sunrise, and the red rocks. Posted a pic. Maybe, just maybe, this hotel is as cool to me now as Excalibur was back then."

"Sakanas, been goin' there for years. Never had a bad experience. Sushi's top-notch, fresh and generous portions. Rolls are delicious too, always some cool specials on the whiteboard. Lunch special's a steal, lots of rolls for a good price. Service is A+, Yoshie's always makin' sure everyone's taken care of. Five stars across the board, Sakanas is the real deal."

"Charlotte, March. Cook Out, OMG! Why ain't got nothin' like this in Miami? 4 a.m., pulled pork, corn dog, hush puppies, cole slaw, banana shake. Best damn thing I ever had. Six or seven bucks. From the land of batidos, where bananas grow. Tempted to look up franchising. Little chain, queen city. Win."

"Pink Cadillac cupcake, my latest fixation. Frosting, my weakness. Rarely indulge, but damn worth it. Staff, friendly and accommodating. Helpful in choosing the perfect treat. Only gripe, no place to sit and savor. Can't deduct a star for that, though. Cakes too good to penalize."

"Chowed down on a killer chicken Shawerma wrap, fries, and a drink for $8.25. Fries were top-notch, especially with the tangy dipping sauce. My wrap had a nice kick from the garlic and tahini sauces. Better than Filfila or Kyklos, even though it wasn't as massive. You can get a solid gyro bowl, either chicken or beef lamb, and the rice is cooked to perfection, maybe with a little gyro gravy. Honey couldn't finish her rice, but damn sure I'll be back for more."

"Best burger joint I've found. Not for the faint of heart, but if you're looking for something new, give it a shot. Their Bhan-mi burger is my current favorite, followed closely by the Miyagi-san. Don't skip the oxtail chili fries or pork belly buns - they're life-changing. And if you only have time for one thing, go for the chili fried chicken. It's worth it."

"Super 8 Review\nClean, safe, and affordable digs with free brekkie. Friendly staff, quick check-in, and spacious rooms with TV and WiFi. No noise, no sleep issues. Tasty continental breakfast with waffles, yogurt, eggs, cinnamon rolls, cereal, coffee, and milk. Pros: clean, cheap, amenities, top-notch service, free grub. Cons: none. Hidden perks: free WiFi, breakfast, Wyndham Rewards for free nights. Sold on Super 8, great chain."

"Banh mi devotees, pay your respects at this humble shrine. Don't let appearances deceive - the bread, made fresh daily, elevates the sandwich to something transcendent. Forget General Lee's pretender down the street; this is the real deal. Prices range from 3.25 to 3.75, a steal for a foot-long masterpiece. Buy 11, get the 12th free - an offer you can't refuse. With 12 varieties, including a veggie option, you'd be remiss not to give it a shot. My enthusiasm knows no bounds; experience it for yourself."
"Fresh grub, clean joint. Owner's a peach. Feels like home."
"Good service. In and out quick. Polite employees."

"Verily, the finest sandwich e'er I didst taste,
With bread so soft, it didst my senses amaze.
I chose the Italian, my love, a turkey didst claim,
And both of us, our meals didst loudly proclaim.
Oh, woe is me, that we didst find this place so late,
For I wouldst have returned, with haste and great zeal.
The service was swift, and we didst dine right there,
To savor the sights, and the flavors so fair and rare.
Methinks, I do miss such sandwiches at home,
For they didst bring me joy, and made my heart sing and roam."

"Love this joint. Came in last night with the missus for V-Day. Always get the duck tacos and lobster bisque, but our server, Zach, talked us into trying the fish tacos too. Damn good call. Got those and the chicken tequila fettuccine. Great night. Service and grub top-notch, but the can could use a refresh."

"No family, no frills. Just me, solo. Not exactly the kind of joint I'd bring the missus and kids to. Sign outside reads 'Chinese and Cuban.' Usually a bad sign, but I was desperate for a bite. Closed up shop early, so I took a chance. Glad I did. Had the Hunan Fried Rice, a house specialty. Eggs, bacon, and a kick of spices. Asked for no mushrooms, got a confused look from the waitress. She thought I said no hot sauce. Brought it on the side, just a dash did the trick. Nice and spicy. Loved the place, glad I stopped in. Budget-friendly too."

"Pack your knives and get outta here! Tom Colicchio's joint is top-notch, nothing to complain about. Unlike some Vegas spots, the atmosphere is straight-up chill, like you're in another world. Service is A+, food is off the charts. Wine list is crazy, but you can find a good bottle for under a hundred bucks. We got oysters, yellowtail hamachi, and lobster bisque for apps. The bisque was pure perfection, we shared it in four little cups. I had the wagyu skirtsteak, best damn steak I've ever had. Yukon potatoes were amazing, fries were on point. For dessert, get the monkeybread, it's incredible. Pecan/brown sugar ice cream is a game-changer. Chocolate tart was meh, didn't like the maple bacon ice cream. Overall, one of the best meals in a while. Five stars, huge fan!"
"Lobster Burger, phenomenal. Best thing I've ever had. Service impeccable. Open 24/7."

"Found this joint while searching for a whisky gift for a mate. Staff was knowledgeable, helpful, and not too pushy. Selection was vast, with notes on each type. Good prices too. Would return for future gifts."

"Found this sweet truck at Vegas StrEATS fest. Didn't disappoint. Wait was long, but worth it. Not your typical snow cones, this ice is smooth, like silk. Large is five bucks, regular is four. Choose up to three flavors. Classics like cherry and bubblegum, Hawaiian flavors, cakes, and more. Add-ons like ice cream and sour spray are cheap. Condensed milk is free. Follow 'em on Twitter for updates. Cheap and delicious way to beat the summer heat in Vegas."
"This joint serves up top-notch grub for a steal. But, I'm hesitant to rave about it, lest too many folks catch wind and ruin the place with their crowds."

"Moved from San Tan to Prescott Valley in Sept '14. Mostly smooth sailing. Some hiccups, sure, but the owner, Derek, stood by his word. Fixed up the damages pronto and stuck to the original estimate, even though it was off by a bit. Hard to find a company with such integrity. We'll be sure to send our friends their way."

"Burgers, delish. Salads, yum. Staff, lookers. Guys, grab a seat up front or at the bar. Food's got game, no doubt. Yam fries, soggy sometimes. Prices, steep, but hey, it's the Cosmo. Give it 4.5 or 4.75 stars."

"Spa review: Positive. Had a massage there last week. Clean joint, good massage. Kept my clothes on, masseur used towels. Some discomfort but didn't want it easier. Felt great after. Feet in heaven for days. Good price. Be back, bring friends."

"Postino's, always a pleasure. Valet works hard, food's top-notch. Bruschetta's the way to go, especially the ricotta, dates, and pistachio. Salami and pesto's a close second. Wine by the glass is steep, but a bottle's a better deal. Get it? Better deal. Someday, I'll take advantage of that $20 wine and bruschetta special."
"Food's great. French dip, kill me now. Service, top-notch. Clean, fancy joint, hidden gem. Hubby and I, big fans. Can't wait to go back."

"You haven't lived till you've tried this joint. Dirt cheap and the grub's top-notch. Bean and cheese burrito? Life-changing. Breakfast burritos? Heavenly. And the menu? It's like they knew what you wanted before you did. Don't sleep on this place, it's a gem."

"My dealership said my brakes needed replacing pronto. So, I took my ride to Brake Masters, where Steve helped me out. Had a buddy drop me off and asked him to give me a ring with the lowdown. Twenty minutes later, he calls and says my brakes are A-okay, no work needed. My dealership fed me a line, but Brake Masters straight up told me the truth. They could've taken my cash without doing a thing, but that one phone call earned my trust. Next time I need brake work, they'll be the first ones I call."

"Jared Blake Entertainment, best wedding DJ outfit I've seen. Been to plenty of weddings, but this one took the cake. Extra musicians brought their A-game, added a special touch to the night. Great tunes, danced our hearts out. Jared himself handled the mic like a pro. Top-notch affair, would hire him again in a heartbeat."

I walked into the place, expecting a long wait. But no, they had it together. Smooth operation. In and out in no time. Talked to a guy at a window, paid the fee, and before I knew it, they were taking me to the back. Quick pat-down, clean fingers, and that was it. No hassle, no mess. I'll be back if I need it again.

"Prenatal massages for under $40 an hour? Count me in. J got me a gift cert for my birthday, but I waited till April when I was further along. Hooked after the first one, I started going every two weeks. $33 an hour, not bad for a student with the right training. Thanks, SWIHA. You made my last month of pregnancy bearable."

"Zia's got great staff. Helpful, fair dudes. Good for rock, metal, and some jazz. Marcus and Brendan know their shit. Solid used vinyl too. Check conditions though. Indie stuff? This is the spot. Better than Chandler for sure. Imports, rares, maxi-singles galore. Hip hop's aight, but if you're into underground and turntablism, this is your joint. Best Zia in town. Don't hate on 'em for credit issues, hate the game. Their points program's cool, and that 20% survey coupon's rad too."

"Methinks we've summoned sweet delights from Treehouse twice,
And in those confections, found joys beyond compare.
Lemon blueberry, vanilla, chocolate, and churro too,
Each one a flavor that doth dance upon the tongue anew.
The mini cupcakes, oh how they delight,
A perfect morsel, fit for a king or queen in sight.
I do adore them, and to thee, I highly recommend."

"Fresh grub, that's what they serve up at this joint. First timer, and I gotta say, it's top-notch. Been around the block a few times when it comes to Mexican food, but this spot's got game. Service is snappy, no complaints there. Seating's a bit cramped, but who needs elbow room when the eats are this good?"

"Hark, this eating house doth merit five stars, by Jove! 
On Father's Day, we didst venture hither, with some trepidation, I confess.  Perusing the bill of fare, I didst make ready my palate for a feast. 
Upon arrival, Tutti Santi didst charm mine eyes, a cozy, family-owned haven.  My excitement didst grow, as I didst anticipate a delectable repast. 
Aye, the ravioli appetizer and bread didst prove a delight, with seconds for all, by the gods! 
Fresh lettuce and veggies, in a tasty dressing, didst adorn our salads, a true delight. 
Though entrees didst take a bit to arrive, we didst not fret, for patience is a virtue, and lo, the manager didst proffer an apology, with a promise of speedy satisfaction.  And, verily, within ten minutes, our dishes didst appear, as if by magic!  Fiorentina, a chicken dish, with breading light, and a creamy white sauce, didst grace mine plate, accompanied by sauteed spinach, a true culinary joy! 
At meal's end, the manager didst present a complimentary slice of cheesecake, for the delay, and a shot of sambuca, for mine father, a most generous gesture.  Huzzah!  Great service, a merry ambiance, doth ensure mine return, to savor another delectable meal, at this, mine newfound favorite haunt!"

"We arrived on the 23rd, hungry for kebabs. But the local joint was closed. So, I recalled a place with a striking mosaic sculpture. And a large Day of the Dead woman out front. Seemed like a good omen. Inside, the Mayan tacos were a revelation. Orgasmic, even. I took my folks there four days later. Same magic. My dream meal? Many friends, many hours, many tacos, and cold beers. Or margaritas. The salsa bar impresses, especially the pink radish salsa. I could drink it straight from the bowl. This review may seem hedonistic, but that's what the experience was. Eat here. They must never close."

"Frozen custard, you say? Never had it before, but now I know why they rave about it. Nielsen's in Vegas, our last stop before heading back to Cali. Had to try it, even though we had a long drive ahead. The workers, friendly as can be, offered us free samples like there was no tomorrow. Vanilla custard, chocolate concrete with Kit Kat, we couldn't finish it all. It's like a richer, creamier version of ice cream, without the extra fluff. Frozen yogurt's got nothing on this stuff. It's a game-changer, a must-try. Don't be a fool, give it a shot."

"The joint's massive, can't even describe it. Grub's top-notch, wanna grab a bite close to work, hit it up often. They got these canisters, pick what you want from four or five different spots, ten meters each, service on both sides. Lot of options. Weigh and pay in cash. Cutlery's available after you grab your food."

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous place, my dear!
We journey fifty miles, or more, I fear,
From Anthem's bounds, to taste their brew,
And savor dishes that our senses woo.
Their selection of craft beers, so fine,
Doth rival all the rest, in this land of mine.
And, oh! The nacaroni, with brisket, too,
Doth make my heart sing, and my taste buds anew.
Verily, 'tis a culinary delight,
That doth make our journey worth the while, by night."
"Greatest sandwiches I've had, no contest. Place is why we stay at Planet Hollywood. Killer breakfast sammies too. We hit other joints for drinks, but Earl of Sandwich for dinner, no question."

"GameStop, my local haunt. You know the drill - video games, systems, trades, and deals. Raff, the manager, is a stand-up guy. He looks out for me and my cuz. When I'm not snatching up Amazon steals, I'm scoring here. Mention Mario, maybe you'll get a sweet deal. Brownie points, that's the goal. Win-win, indeed."
"Peppers, stuffed, no breading. Tequila, serious business. Margarita, Naranja, damn good. Bartender, chatty, shared secrets. Server, knowledgeable. Be back."

"Sushi and sashimi, never knew they had it.  Server knew his stuff, thank God.  Expensive, yeah, but worth it.  Black Cod, melted in my mouth.  Exotic trout, shocked my tongue.  Kobe beef, heavenly.  When will I be back in Vegas?  Don't bother with the regular sushi, get the special menu items."
"Happy hour, my friend. Cheap pints, good brews. IPA, Santa Klaas Holiday Ale. Dark, rich, coffee and chocolate. Service, top-notch. Will return."
"In Sin City, we met up with kin. My uncle said hit up Mimi's for brekkie. We did. Damn good call. Grub and service, top-notch. Pumpkin pancakes? Off the chain."

"This joint's a gem. Been here a few times, never disappointed. Jennifer's got the magic touch, that's clear. 

Cuban sandwich? Hell yeah. Plentiful, delicious. Asparagus, burrata, prosciutto salad? Nice light option, still satisfies. Butternut squash soup? Spot on. Fresh shrimp po boy? No fry, healthy vibes. 

Nosh boards? Meh. Corn chips, nothing special. Combo's a bit strange. 

Brownie cookies? Do it. Won't regret it."

"Things look good so far. I'll give an update after the wedding, but for now, planning with Mandalay Bay has been a breeze. Our coordinator, Aleena, is on top of things. She's quick to respond and helpful as hell. We checked out the chapel in person and it's a real looker. Fingers crossed everything goes off without a hitch."

"Platinum perfection, that's what Jay delivers. Best blonde 'do I've ever seen, like silk. If I had the means, I'd fly him out to LA every six weeks for a touch-up. Go see Jay, tell him Laura sent you."
"Breakfast was good. Eggs, sunny side up, French toast, four sausages. Just right."

"The room was a palace, a real gem. Spacious, modern, and clean, with a big bathroom and all the amenities you could want. The furniture was top-notch, classic but with a modern twist. It was the nicest room I'd ever been in, made me feel like royalty. The bathroom was huge, with a great shower and tub, and the mini fridge was stocked with fancy stuff. It was a real treat, made me feel like I was living large."

"Burgers? Great. Apps? Great. Beer? Great. Service? Fast. What more do you need? They got rare brews too. Had Dog Fish Head 120 Min IPA last time. Always a good combo. Been here for lunch and dinner. Same bartender most times. Guy's on top of it. Drinks and grub, ready when you are. Lunch menu's got a burger with guac and bacon. Don't usually order it. But now it's all I want."

"Met the owners of this joint. Cute couple, knew their stuff. Fixed my watch while I waited. Been in the game 20+ years. Ask 'em anything about watches, they'll know. All work's done in-house, no shipping needed. Had a swell time chattin' with 'em. Recommend 'em to anyone. Location's convenient - NE corner of Warner & McClintock."
"This joint's off the chain. Vegans, you gotta try it. Donuts are on point, especially the glazed. Top two rows are vegan, so go wild. If you're in Vegas, don't miss it."

"BBQ in Texas-style. Wife and I tried a bit of everything. Sausage, pulled pork, ribs, brisket, beans, jalapeño cheddar grits, potato salad, and pecan pie. Pulled pork needed more flavor, but it was tender. Sausage? Amazing. Brisket's charred rub? Speechless. Ribs? Great seasoning. Recommend it to anyone looking for good BBQ in Arizona."

"Walked through Old Town Scottsdale, everything blended together. Then, found Chantelle's Collection. Blew me away. Owner, friendly, shared stories of Iran. Kept me entertained while I browsed unique, beautiful jewelry. Prices marked, a rarity in Old Town. Bought a handcrafted necklace, got the owner's card, and I'll return for sure. Chantelle's Collection, top-notch."

"This outfit was top-notch. If you're in the market for a quality window supplier at a fair price and total satisfaction, give 'em a look. No sales pitch necessary. Cody, the big cheese, was cordial and knew his stuff. Chris, the head honcho, came by to measure up four windows. Final cost from Cody was more than reasonable, especially since they had their own crew and we'd be dealin' direct with any issues or warranty biz. Installation day, Chris and Tim showed up on time, got the job done quick and clean, and left the place spotless. We gave 'em the once-over and they passed with flyin' colors. We got more windows that need swapin' out down the line and we'll be usin' these boys again."

"Hark! What service doth await us here? Swift and immediate, 'tis a wondrous sight indeed! And lo, the ice tea doth please mine taste, a true delight that doth make all else worthwhile. Forsooth, I seek a culinary adventure, not a deadly snare.

"Aye, we didst order lobster, both steamed and grilled, and my fair wife, a feast fit for a queen, the Jack Daniel's Sesame Chicken. Our aim, to revel in joy and satisfaction.

"Jessica, our guide, didst attend to us with grace and skill, offering wise counsel which we didst embrace with gratitude. The victuals, verily, didst please our palates, and I, a novice, didst discover a fondness for steamed lobster, its shell a vital component, and grilled, a delightful contrast. A bounty of vegetables, a salad besides, didst complete this gastronomic journey.

"In conclusion, Jessica and TGIFridays didst surpass our expectations, a true triumph!"

"Reynolds Hall, we've seen some shows there. Also, that cozy Cabaret Jazz joint. Beautiful buildings, beautiful grounds. A real gem for the city and its people. Always catch a show when we're in town. Never been let down. Last time we saw the Wizard of Song. It was a hit off Broadway for a year and a half. Local boy George Bugati starred."

"East Coaster that I am, finding genuine NY pizza in AZ's a challenge. Brooklyn V's? Fantastic! Transports me back home. Crust, perfect. Cheese, just enough. Been here a few times, only had pizza. Other reviews say try the Stromboli. Give it a shot, won't regret it."
"Off-strip Italian joint. Killer grub, top-notch entertainment. Bread and cannoli, worth dyin' for. Check it out."

"Hark! Let it be known, good sirs and madams,
That Paul, a man of skill and honest fame,
Did fix the issue, which Whirlpool could not,
And saved me coin, by charging less, no doubt.

A pleasant fellow, too, with friendly ways,
He shared some tips, to help me in my days.
So here's a hearty thanks, to Paul, I say,
For his great work, and kindness, come what may."
"Sterling, I love it. Bagels, good but overpriced at $0.95. Not New York, but close."

"Verily, the service at Serrano's didst excel,
The victuals, too, didst please mine appetite so well.
The ambiance, cozy and inviting, didst make me feel at home.
I didst partake of their delectable bean dip and salsa,
With chips, a most satisfying repast, I must confess.
A two-item combo, a tamale and enchilada, didst I choose,
And, by the stars, 'twas a feast most wondrous and fair.
In sooth, I didst enjoy my visit to Serrano's,
And shall, anon, return to savor more of their delights."
"Friendly folks runnin' this joint. Local, too. They'll shoot ya a text when yer scrip's ready. Had good times here, that's for sure."

Trader Joe's, a one-stop-shop if they had a better meat selection. Quality store brand, knowledgeable and friendly staff, and affordable prices. Plus, the beautiful flowers and herbs, and the delicious food samples. Always clean, even when crowded. Friendly patrons, too. Helpful employees, including a sommelier for wine advice. Some of my favorites: Salsa Authentica, Cowboy Cavier, vegan trail mix cookies, all-in-one facial cleanser, cruciferous crunch, coconut cashews, TJ's almond milk, spinach and fontina chicken sausage, spicy peanut vinaigrette, roasted red pepper soup.
"Friendly bouncers, laid-back vibe, drink specials galore. Shame it's closing."

"We holed up in the Elara's master suite for three nights, with a full kitchen, bath, projection screen, couches, dining room, bar counter, another bedroom, and another bath. Two other rooms on the 33rd floor were connected to ours, and our pals snagged 'em. We had a blast, man. Great view, too, just a stone's throw from the Miracle Mile Shops. Planet Hollywood Casino, Bellagio, Cosmopolitan, and The Paris were all within spittin' distance. And all the grub spots, too. Cheap, man. Real cheap. \n\nThe joint was decked out in modern/contemporary style, all red, white, and black. Young crowd, mostly, but who cares? We paid about $150 for three nights, and that was with one of our buddy's discounts. Sweet deal, dude. We partied hard in the suite and on the strip. You get the full Vegas experience at the Elara, no need to shell out big bucks for some fancy-schmancy hotel."

"Ciao Ciao's, straight up, it's the real deal. Pizza joint's got it all - atmosphere's fun, service is top-notch, and the grub? Absolutely divine. Earned my loyalty, that's for sure. Only pizza joint I'll be eating at from now on, and I live 13 miles away, so that says something. Can't even begin to describe their brick oven-fired masterpiece. Ricotta cheese, pepperoni, sausage, meatballs - it's like a party in your mouth. Words can't do it justice. You gotta try it for yourself. Drop what you're doing and get to Ciao Ciao's, stat. Best pizza in Las Vegas, period."

"This joint's got it all - modern vibes, friendly staff, and grub that's always on point. Sure, it's a bit pricey, but you get what you pay for. Their homemade chips and potato salad? Crazy good. And don't even get me started on the posole and Reuben sandwich. Breakfast is top-notch too. Worth the splurge, but if you're on a tight budget, stick to the ala carte menu and you can still score a good meal for under $10."

"We tried this new joint after our first choice was shut down. Glad we did. I had the corned-beef hash wrap, damn good. Came with a nice side of fruit too. My buddies had the blue cheese bacon burger and roast beef baguette. Only gripe is they didn't have iced tea. But overall, no issues and we'll be back."

"Tastiest Mexican grub I've ever had, and that's sayin' somethin' comin' from a New Yorker. Tacos run two bucks apiece, loaded with meat, guac, salsa, onions, cilantro, and more. Had six of 'em, each one better than the last. Tripe was the real MVP, crispy and chewy, just like I like 'em. Carne asada quesadilla was a game-changer too. Never had one quite like it before. Sides were on point too - grilled peppers, scallions, radishes, and lime wedges. Even had some Mexican fountain drinks, but they didn't quite hit the spot. Next time I'm in Vegas, this place is gettin' another visit from yours truly."

"If you're ever in Phx, you gotta try this joint. Two locations: downtown and Scottsdale. Great spot after a night out or when you're hankerin' for somethin' sweet 'n' salty. They make their own Kool-Aid, and the flavors are top-notch. Their Mac N Cheese? To die for. Cornbread? Same. Had the breakfast sandwich, catfish, wings, chicken strips, breast, and waffles. All excellent."
"Lived in Thailand. Now in Phoenix. This place has the real deal Thai food. People are friendly too."
"Cheeseburgers, real meat. No fillers. Hotcakes, maple syrup. Best bacon. Wait, but worth it."
"Beer, awesome. First-timers, do the flight sampler. Never had a bad meal. No AC, but still packed in summer."
"Hot dogs, damn fine. Chicago dog, my pick. Wife, chili cheese. Fries, crispy. Service, quick. Clean joint."

The Barrymore served up a top-notch dining experience. We started with killer cocktails - the Cherry Picker was off the charts - then hit the patio before our reservation. The hostess was prompt and led us to our swanky booth in the dining area, which felt like we were on the set of Mad Men. Their wine list was impressive, with a broad selection. The grub? Absolutely divine. Great apps, and the steaks and sides were out of this world. The chocolate raspberry tart was the perfect way to cap off the meal, paired with a glass of cabernet sauvignon. And the best part? It wasn't Vegas Strip expensive.

"Unexpected joys doth sometimes grace our way,
And Herbs and Rye, a place most wondrous, did play
A part in changing course of our day's tide,
With friends, I chanced upon this haven inside.

Las Vegas, a city bright and bold,
Didst offer many choices, stories untold,
But we, three friends, didst seek a place apart,
Where drinks and merriment could fill our heart.

Herbs and Rye, a name that didst entice,
Didst welcome us with open arms and nice,
No reservation needed, we didst find
A cozy booth, where we couldst unwind.

The service, oh, how swift and kind,
Didst make our night most pleasant and divine,
The drinks, a delight, both rare and fine,
Didst quench our thirst and lift our spirits high.

Compared to others, prices fair and just,
Didst leave us feeling merry, not distraught,
And friends, who ventured to the strip, didst say,
'Twere folly to miss Herbs and Rye's display.

Clean, well-kept, a crowd of gentle folk,
Easy parking, ambiance, didst evoke
A sense of peace, a haven from the fray,
Herbs and Rye, a place to visit, come what may.

I shall return, and urge my friends to do,
For in this place, joy doth await, 'tis true,
So if thou art in Las Vegas, take a stroll,
To Herbs and Rye, where memories doth unfold."

"Hark! The Tech hath left, and in its stead,
I shall pen a few words of praise, forsooth.
Their service and craftsmanship, I do confess,
Hath ever been of highest quality, in truth.

Three units have I bought from them, my friends,
And twice hath their skillful hands repaired.
This last call, it was to ensure all was well,
They came forthwith, and with diligence did till.

Over an hour did they spend, with care and art,
To make certain all readings were in order, by my heart.
And lo, the thermostat, they did program with ease,
Which brought a marked improvement, as if by a breeze.

So here's to Scottsdale Air, my thanks I do extend,
For their excellent work, and their loyal friendship, which doth never end."

"Canopy Club, incredible place. Went for my birthday, saw some DJs, expected nothing special. But they treated me like royalty, backstage during soundcheck, in the Green Room for free drinks. All thanks to Positive Vibr8ions, but everyone there was kind and cool. Best 72 hours of my life, Wednesday and Friday night concerts. Those who complained, either didn't have enough E or couldn't take someone home. #ShutupAndDance"

You'll pull over when the GPS tells you to, double-checking the address. "This can't be it," you'll think, expecting a wine cellar but finding a small liquor store instead. But don't let appearances deceive you. Stay true, and you'll discover a hidden staircase leading down. It may seem sketchy, but trust me, it's worth it. Downstairs, you'll find a cozy wine bar that feels like a real-life Narnia. And that's not all - there's a lounge area with live music, though I've yet to catch a performance myself. Their wine selection is impressive, and the beer menu, though limited, offers some unique choices. I can't speak for the crowd, but the atmosphere is top-notch. Despite my initial hesitation, I now see the entrance through the liquor store as a charming speakeasy touch. Give it a try, and you might just find your new favorite spot.

"Phoenix got some damn good pizza. Been here thrice, and each time, they step up their game. Authentic as hell, from the ingredients to the flavors. Chill atmosphere, too. Feels like Italy, what with the decor, waiters speaking Italian, and Italian booze. Don't forget to try the tiramisu. Mind-blowing stuff."

"Convenient spot, this Starbucks. Close to work, saves me time. Cute English lass, too. Adorable accent, makes me smile. She takes my order, always a pleasure. Occasionally, they mess up my drink, but they fix it quick and offer a freebie for next time. Friendly, clean, and top-notch service. Can't beat that with satellite."

"Del Frisco's changed the game. Best steak and wine list in town? Now it's a close call. Friendly, knowledgeable staff. Steaks are massive, so go easy on the apps. Wine list has something for everyone, from affordable to high-end. Great spot for happy hour and people watching."

"First time in Phoenix, read the reviews on Yelp. Glad I picked this place, employees are friendly, Deaf Friendly too. Veronica, my stylist, did a great job with my hair. She nailed the undercut and quiff style. Recommend her, she's nice and cute too. Works Tuesday through Saturday. Salon's got a cute, rock look. Relaxing spot. Spent $35 for cut, shampoo, conditioner, and a tip. Price is right, felt it's worth it."

"This joint was top-notch, let me tell you. After a long day at Red Rocks, we were hungry as hell. But this place, it hit the spot. Fresh, flavorful grub, and the service was quick and friendly. Wish they had a place like this back in Houston. My only regret? Not having a bigger belly."
"Years of visits. Friendly staff, tidy store, no issues. Love 'em."

"Miso soup, mermaid, baked lobster roll - our top picks. Take the kids here regular, they love it. Atmosphere's pleasant, they dig watchin' 'em roll out the grub. Lunch deals are a steal, service is A-okay, place is spotless."

"Best find in a while. Went today, Sunday, around 10:30. Short wait, just five minutes. Good for a Sunday. Ordered, got our grub quick. Food was top-notch, portions too. Would recommend this joint to anyone. Ordered different dishes, all were solid. Drinks a bit pricey, but not bad for a first-timer."
"Plants diverse as hell here. They got Christmas trees too, this time a year. Definitely comin' back to explore more. Staff's friendly, helped us tie the tree on the car's roof."

"Better than expected. Three floors of conspiracy, blood and bootlegging. Graphic content, so be warned. Perfectly placed in Vegas. Scored $2 off with Yelp check-in. A nice break from the casino grind."
"Best show I've seen. Loved it. Great performance. Can't say enough good things. Not exactly a Beatles fanatic, but enjoyed every minute. Don't want to spoil it for you. You won't be disappointed."
"I got a thing for dive bars, and this one's a real gem. Friendly, good-lookin' bartenders pourin' stiff drinks at a decent price. Off the beaten path, but worth the trip. I'll be back."
"Efficiency in ordering and service. Hiccup on arrival, swiftly fixed. Good grub and view."

"La Stalla, a fine place for a happy hour. Wife and I, we go there often, early dinner, less than twenty bucks. Happy hour, every evening, four to six, cheap beer, two bucks a pop. Pizza, authentic Italian, five bucks a pie. Full dinner, always great. Desserts, fantastic. Give La Stalla a try."

"Cosmo's where it's at, friend. Terrace studio, fountain view, can't be beat. No resort fee, decent eats, and a sweet comp for long stays. Clean, modern digs too. Check out my other reviews at nextstopdc.blogspot.com."

"Ladies, you're in luck. Free entry and champagne all night, courtesy of the house. Huka, dance, and two bars to keep things interesting. Rooms are dim, sensual. Can't ask for more. But, be warned, two well drinks will set you back $26. Ouch."

"Soda fountain at the delicatessen on the Grand Canal level? Free refills, my friend. Self Park's the way to go, too. Closer to the guest room elevators and you don't gotta walk through the casino like a fool. Just a couple stores 'fore you hit the elevators. That's the ticket."
"Vincent's. Valentine's Day, '99. Top-notch grub, slick service. Southwest charm, but not too much. Worth the cash, despite the rich folks."

"Walked into Rigatony's, used to be a bank, but you wouldn't know it. Feels like a restaurant in Italy, almost. Service was top-notch, friendly and knowledgeable staff. One server spilled a tray of drinks, but the customers were cool about it. Co-workers pitched in to help. Food was excellent, had the veal with lemon and artichoke, sister had the Cataloni, both delicious. Will post pics later, definitely going back for dinner. Way to go, Rigatony's!"
"Wedding anniversary celebrated here, last night. Delicious meal. Tender steak. Outstanding service."
"Pot roast, damn good. Service, top-notch, busy as hell. One of the best joints in Lawrenceville."

"Fern? Amazing. Been a veggie girl near ten years, and this place tops 'em all. Service? Top-notch. Staff knew their stuff, subs no problem. Decor? Quaint, sophisticated, eye-pleasing. Food? Ahh, the food. Ordered a variety, and each dish? Delicious. Flavors popped, veggies crunched, pairings superb. Check it out. Meat-eater, veggie, vegan—you won't regret it."

"Went to Sears yesterday, had a real good time. Mission: get a treadmill. Guy named Randy helped me out, answered my questions, and I bought the one I wanted. He rung me up and sent me to the pick-up area. Not the greatest place, but they don't want you to wait. You scan your receipt, monitor shows the progress. Less than 50 seconds, Wes comes out with my new treadmill. Loaded it up, and I was gone. Whole thing took maybe 30 minutes. Great experience."

"Good folks, good shop. Best in the game workin' hard to deliver. Better than new service, that's their promise. Accessible, group rides aplenty. Highly recommend 'em. Selection's top-notch, parking ain't so bad neither."
"Weekend in town, wanted some local flavor. Heard The Dish was good, damn right it was. Fresh, homemade, real deal. Comin' back for sweet treats, you bet."

"Had a swell dinner at this joint. Felt like family by the time I left. Real deal neighborhood spot with a mix of oldies and country tunes (works like a charm!). Great staff, good grub. Prices are on point, not some inflated three-dollar nonsense. Like I said, neighborhood spot, good eats, fair prices, chill vibes. And hey, you can bust a move if you feel like it. I'll be back."

"Troy's worked on various jobs for me - painting, minor repairs. Each time, I think he won't be able to handle it. But he always delivers. Other tradesmen I've met are only concerned with making a quick buck and moving on to the next gig. Not Troy. He's fixated on customer satisfaction. After the job's done, he'll follow up multiple times to ensure you're completely happy."
"Came here on V-Day, and it was top-notch. Food was prime, service was A-one. Joon and co. made it a night to remember. Highly recommend."
"I frequent this place and their grub's top-notch. Atmosphere's swell too. Don't miss their freshly squeezed lemonade. Generous portions, you won't polish off a pastry by yourself."

"This joint's got everything. Chickens, food, and folks who know their stuff. Tempe Feed and Tack, it's just down the road from my digs. Helpful and friendly, they load up them 50-pounders like nobody's business. No waiting around for me."

"High-end. Pricey. But worth it for the grub and hospitality. Just a short walk from the Belk theater, perfect for a pre-show dinner or nightcap. Check out their site for the lowdown on their unique menu, featuring individual servings of prime cuts and seafood, like filet mignonette, ribeye, pork, scallops, shrimp, lamb, and bacon-wrapped chicken."

"Bacchanal Buffet, best in Vegas. No frills, no gimmicks. Just good grub. Seafood station hooks you in. Crab, shrimp, oysters, salmon, seabass - the works. Other stations offer variety, something for everyone. Fresh juice, including horchata. Dessert island, patisserie-worthy treats, gelato. Late lunch, lunch prices for dinner. Can't beat it."
"Rubicon Jeep, seven windows, strip up front. Limo tint in back, five MN 35s for driver and passenger. Total cost, one sixty. Friendly folk, tint looks sharp."
"Downtown Phoenix joint. Love their strawberry blueberry cashew salad, margaritas, spicy harissa fries, and hummus. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu."

"I phoned Haggard Chiropractic after getting no response from another chiropractor. Got everything sorted in 15 minutes and booked for the next day. Met Dr. Haggard, a real friendly guy. Chatted, took x-rays, and got to work. He called me the next day to check in and I went back for my next session. Reviewed the final x-rays and made a plan. Been happy with the treatment and service at Haggard. They stand out from the rest."
"Monica's been a godsend for my hair. Total trust. Cut or color, I always walk out grinning. Great vibe too. Never leaving."

"Southwest Airlines, love 'em. Free bags, cheap fares, great service. Cancelled a flight once, no hassle. Night before, called 'em up, confirmation right away. Used credits to rebook, low price, no fee. Good stuff."

"Indoor mall, all-in-one spot. Shops galore, kid-friendly too. Ladies, pack comfy shoes - you'll need 'em. Snag bargains in every store. Great workout spot for me, steps aplenty. Men, don't worry - there's plenty for you too: manly stores, athletic spots like Sports Authority. Kiddos, get ready for fun: arcade, IMAX, aquarium, Rain Forest Cafe, loads of grub options. Family-friendly haven."
"Never been here before. Don't know what you're missin'. Food's good, real good. Appetizers, meals, all of it. New flavors, nice change of pace. You should give it a shot."

"Needed some stuff moved, called a few joints, all booked.  Get Your Move On, too.  Roger said he'd do it tomorrow, meaning Sunday.  I said, 'Sunday?'  He said, 'Yeah.'  Gave me a specific time, too.  Showed up, got everything done quick and right.  Great service.  Use 'em again?"

"Place has a chick mechanic. Need more women in auto industry. Asked 'em to check clutch too, even though they ain't full service. Lucky my clutch works fine. Had troubles during summer, winter. Hot, clutch slips too much. Cold, grips like hell. Proved my car's good. Design flaw maybe, hydraulic self-adjusting clutch pedal. Talked to Adriana, mechanic, five minutes. They gave me back my ride, oil, filter, airbox filter changed. A bit pricier than Toyota dealership, but damn, appointments take two, three hours for oil change. Same thing as JiffyLube, but with 21-point inspection."

"Upon arriving at the establishment, thou ponderest if thou shouldst have brought thy bulletproof vest. Thou pullest in, observest that naught hath been disturbed since nineteen hundred and fifty, and falleth into profound contemplation of the magnificence that shall soon grace thy lips. Thou gazest upon the menu, with prices obscured by tape, and placest thy order through the original device of Alexander Graham Bell. Doth thou comprehend the lady's response? 'Tis of no consequence! All thou requirest is to command the BBQ Minced sandwich and a quarter BBQ chicken, breast meat. Some may assert that the sandwich could benefit from additional BBQ sauce, but such individuals should venture forth onto Wilkinson with eyes shut.

Thou shalt not discover a place similar to this anywhere else in the world, I assure thee...I have searched extensively. The employees who work there render this place particularly singular. The men are amusing, swift, and don garments with perforations. In conclusion, if thou art in Charlotte, thou must visit this location. Do not forget to bring cash, for credit cards are not accepted."
Vacation brought me here, curiosity led me to try it. Portions large, prices fair. Food, scratch-made, delicious. Recommended.

Sue's joint, east valley. Twenty-three years running. Good Chinese grub, nice atmosphere. Service top-notch. What's "standard" Chinese mean? Beats me. But this place trumps others, chains included. Moo Shu, roll the dice. Fried treats, Golden Gate shrimp. Support local, spend wisely.

"I've hit Central Bistro six times now - twice for brunch, four for dinner. Always trying something new. Open layout, high ceilings, marble tables. Hostesses are pros. Servers know their stuff, especially the Lemoncello Sour. Chef's prep is top-notch. Comes with Italian black cherries. Love their brunch menu. Eggs Benedict and Chicken n Waffles? To die for. Recommended."
"Rack of lamb, damn good. View, breathtaking. Fountains, sign, everything top-notch. Anniversary, perfect spot. Staff, attentive."

"Hot diggity dog! This joint had me hooked. Thought the dogs might break the bank, but nope, they were fair game. Choices galore, my friend. Fries? Nah, four bucks for a tiny serving? No thanks. Drinks? Pricey, but who needs 'em? I'll be back for them dogs, you bet your buns!"

"First timeshare experience, courtesy of a good friend. Peaceful alternative to the drunken chaos of the Strip. Families abounded. Room had AC, full kitchen, washer/dryer, fireplace, BBQ, and two TVs. Amenities included four pools, hot tubs, gym, rec room, DVD rentals, and a mini-market with Starbucks. Shuttle service ran hourly to Monte Carlo, then walk to MGM for faster transport down the Strip. Daily shuttle to Vons grocery store, where I grabbed Taco Bell and groceries. They even provided an airport shuttle number for $9, instead of a taxi."
"Appetizers, top-notch. Daily menu, fresh and quality. Salad, outstanding. Overall, damn good. Regular spot for me. Crowded, plan ahead."

"A most excellent bar, my dear friend,
Tis a tiki lounge, and thus it doth end.
Crowded it was, on Valentine's eve,
Yet, a seat I found, and my date did relieve.

Two bartenders worked, with haste and speed,
Their drinks they mixed, with skill and heed.
I asked for one, in a souvenir cup,
And the bartender, she didst not dup.

She shined a light, on samples galore,
And I chose one, with flavors anew.
Passion fruit and guava, a mix so fine,
In a drink, that was not too sweet, divine.

A tropical punch, it didst resemble,
But not too sweet, nor overly tremble.
A great mix, of flavors and liquor, indeed,
I wanted more, and my thirst to proceed.

When done, my cup and swizzle stick, they didst rinse,
And boxed them up, with a smile so winsome.
I wish to return, and collect them all,
Like Pokemon, my dear friend, standing tall."
"Prices low, staff friendly and knowledgeable. Like Tempe, they got everything. Called about a favorite wine, they got it, 43% cheaper than other store. Bought a case, woohoo!"
"Food's top-notch here. Had my fair share, and it's all good. Staff's friendly, regulars and newcomers alike make you feel welcome. Great spot to unwind and have a ball."

"Sold our hockey tix for dinner at Park Bruges, new joint near us. Not well marked, but tables in the window give it away. Service was top-notch, server knew her stuff. Split the classic poutine, fries were crispy, cheese curds squeaky. Had the chicken breast, hubby had fresh wild fish. Both dishes were perfect. Desserts were great too. Coffee was decent, but not the main draw. Saw some families with kids, seems like a casual spot. Will definitely go back, hoping for sidewalk tables come summer."

"First time at this joint, but I knew they were doing something right, 'cause they've been around since '63. Best Mexican food I've had in Phoenix, hands down. Homemade salsa, not that piddly shit they serve at other places. Chimichanga was off the chain, tortillas made fresh daily. Guac and sour cream, a bit too much, but that's just me. Spanish rice, spot on. Happy hour, half-priced drinks, big ass glasses for soda and tea. Little things matter, man. Coming back for more. Better than Serrano's. Decor's nothing special, but who gives a damn when the grub's this good?"
"Went to Jade Palace tonight. Place was packed, but service was top-notch. Food was damn good too. Egg rolls, especially. Refreshed my tea, cleared plates quick. Good eatery. Will be back."

"Ronald's Donuts had been on my list for three years, but I never made it there.  Recently, the stars aligned and we found ourselves in the neighborhood.  I was like a kid in a candy store, salivating over the vast selection.  I managed to compose myself and chose a half-dozen assortment.  They were delicious, fluffy pieces of dreaminess, unlike the skinny Krispy Kreme variety.  [see picture]  The best part?  It's locally owned, so the service is kind, warm, and inviting.  Goodbye Krispy Kreme, hello Ronald's Donuts!"
"Knowledgable, friendly staff gave great customer service. Not the cheapest, but worth it. High-quality tint and excellent service. Every penny spent was worth it. I highly recommend them."

"My friend brought me here after her NYC trip. I'd never been, figuring it for a ritzy joint. Inside, though, it was cozy. We started with drinks - I had a noon root beer, they had keg root beer, and it was damn good. I got the mozzarella, basil, tomato salad, which was great, but mislabeled as a salad. Traditional, delicious slab, though. Also had the plain pesto pizza. Could've eaten it all day. One of the best pizza spots in town, great location too."

"Phoenix's finest drinkery. Chris, the bartender, a magician with spirits. Tell him your poison, he'll conjure up something divine. Food, too, a work of art. Ask for the special, it's always a showstopper. I return often, it's my go-to spot in the city."

Two nights past, my love and I didst race In Boulder Dam, and one of the bar's menagers didst attend. We didst enjoy a most excellent night! They didst possess a grand collection of brews, and we didst tarry for hours. I didst once more savor the fried cheese curds, A-MAZING!

I know not what this soapish glass matter is That others didst complain of. Not a single one didst I espy.

'Tis a trek from the Strip, but by far the finest Beer selection in Vegas. And at fair prices, a good brew with flavor may be had For the cost of poor ones on the Strip.

"This joint is top-notch! The cuts are fantastic, the barbers are pros, and the atmosphere is straight up cool. Got there at noon and there were already eight guys waiting for cuts. The barbers greeted us and said it might be a bit of a wait, but to stick around and enjoy the banter. And boy, did we ever! Had six of us in for fresh cuts on my wedding day. The whole time, we felt like part of the crew, joking and laughing with the barbers. The tunes were bumpin', and the wait flew by. The cuts? Amazing. These guys are perfectionists, taking their time to ensure each cut is precise. My barber even gave me a wedding gift - a free cut! But that wasn't all. We had a big group, and we ended up running behind schedule. I had to get back to my hotel for wedding pics, but the cab was taking forever. One of the barbers stepped up and offered to give us a ride back to the hotel. Talk about saving the day! I was stress-free, my wedding day was perfect, and my wife loved her fresh cut. You guys are the real deal. Can't recommend you enough!"
Sarah, Makeup Forever counter, knew her stuff. Helped me look swell for a night out. Gonna come back for future events. Great service.

"Methinks 'twould be a wondrous feat,
To give this place four stars and three quarters,
For service good, and bartenders neat,
Did make our visit quite a treat.

A friend and I did dine here,
And though she came not till later,
I sat alone at bar, all dressed,
Ready for night's merriment and jest.

Now, mark thee well, fair maidens,
Eating solo at a bar, 'tis true,
Doth draw the attention of men,
Both good and ill, as thou dost view.

But fear not, for 'twill be an empowering sight,
To see them come, and hear their tales,
And when thy friend doth join thee,
All shall believe thee, and thy virtues hail.

Foie gras, most excellent, we didst enjoy,
Crab salad, decent, and duck, a delight,
Albarino, just passable, but desserts divine,
Two, methinks, we didst order, in the night.

So, grab a seat by the Lake of Dreams,
And watch the frogs dance, as ye sip thy drink,
And ladies, fear not to sit alone,
For 'tis a fun adventure, and a tale to be shown."

"I was new to vaping, so I sent my wife to the store to grab some juice. The staff was helpful, educating her on the product. Now, I'm a regular. I get my juice and hardware there. FlavorZ by Joe - CoolPort is my go-to. I've had bad experiences with online shops, so I prefer to support local. The advice is instant, free, and comes with a smile. Give them a try. It's a nice, clean shop in a safe neighborhood."
"Brunch, good. Sunrise sandwich, husband's Holy Puerco, both tasty. Homemade biscuit, light, fluffy, not dry. Staff, friendly, positive, relaxing. Recommend."
"Food, great. Must-try: onion rings, Buffalo wings, tacos, truffle mac 'n' cheese. Chicken tortilla soup? Meh. Good value, great grub. Haven't dined in, all takeout. Worth every cent."
"Pizza and sandwich at this joint? Top-notch. Best white pizza I've had, period. Freshness ain't a problem neither. Breakfast, you say? Gonna have to give it a shot."

"Five, five, FIVE. Love this joint, despite the nostalgia. Eat here once a week, tried four other pizza factories in my travels, but this is the best. Small, but worth it. Hubby loves the sandwiches and pizza too. Bring everyone here, locals and visitors, always pleased. Owner and family are friendly. Try the garlic breadsticks, delicious. Worth the 15-minute drive from Goodyear. That's how good it is."
"Good grub, good price, good folk. Helpful staff, spoke well. Big menu, but not too big. Clean joint."

"Costco, I love it. Great return policy, excellent selection of grub, perfect for throwin' them parties. Prices? Can't beat 'em. Flowers? Fresh as hell. Hors d'oeuvres? Best in town, especially on the weekends. Membership? Worth every penny, especially when you need to upgrade your tech."

"Best guys for the job. Know their stuff cold. Kind, informative, fair. Let 'em handle it. I've had my share of Mercs, but these boys know their shit. Trust 'em with your baby. MB Motors, solid choice."

"Hype? Real. Tony? Friendly. Greets everyone, shakes hands, asks names. Felt comfy, solo female. Thick and thin slices, both tasty. NY deep dish, favorite. Tony, always mingling. Homey feel. Suggestion? Order taker at tables. Pickiness? Going to cash register."

"This joint serves up solid eats, no frills. Sandwiches, salads, soups—they’ve got ‘em all. And don’t forget the spuds, loaded with tasty toppings. Service is top-notch, too. Their menu’s got some creative options, like the ORANGE CRANBERRY CLUB. Smoked turkey, ham, bacon, cheddar, Swiss, and a hint of mayo, all on harvest wheat bread. It’s a new one, ain’t tried nothing like it before. Place is Wi-Fi enabled, too."

"Been studyin' with Sifu Baugh since '03. Only gripe is I didn't find him sooner. Been at it since the 80's, had some sketchy teachers. Sifu teaches Chen Tai Chi, Yang Tai Chi, Northern and Southern Kung Fu, Praying Mantis, Xing Yi, Ba Qua, traditional Kung Fu. Unlike other schools, Sifu's down-to-earth, humble. He leads most classes, wants to help you improve. Respected by other martial arts teachers, even teaches some of 'em. If you want a traditional Kung Fu school with experience, reasonable fees, no contracts, diverse styles, no attitude, and a lifelong training spot, this is it."

"Good grub, nice joint. Can't beat the price. Eat out a lot, but this place stands out. Get the Pho and Mong. Top-notch, maybe the best in town. 

Service is solid too. 

I'll be back."
"Good spot for Middle Eastern groceries. Fresh flat bread, must-have at my place."

"Tiffany at Peridot Sweets whipped up a damn fine wedding cake for us. Two years later, folks still rave about its beauty and taste. She tailored it to our style and colors, even threw in a dessert bar with some killer shortbread and brownie pops. Guests couldn't get enough."

"Plenty of grub at this joint. Mongolian BBQ, sushi, all the usual Chinese buffet suspects. Food was fresh, hot, and damn good. Tried a bit of everything, didn't disappoint. Beef was tender, chicken was juicy, shrimp was cooked right. Veggies were fresh, not too oily. Service was top-notch. Kept our drinks full, plates cleared quick, had plenty of napkins. Even brought a knife to the table when I forgot. Not totally authentic, but damn good. Lunch buffet for $7.95, can't beat it."
"Went to this joint today. They showed us a good time, sat us down quick. Nice atmosphere, live Persian tunes. Took a bit to get our grub, but it was worth it. Damn good food. Recommended."

"This joint was top-notch. Pancakes, hash browns, all good. And the price? Unbeatable. But what really made it special was the owner. Guy was on it, asking questions, making you feel like family. Felt like I was at his house, not his restaurant. I'll be back next time I'm in Vegas, that's for sure. Thanks, Mr. Mamas."

"Ticoz, I love the place. Been goin' there for years, tried a lot, never disappointed. Street Tacos, my favorite, get the shrimp. Entrée comes with beans and rice, worth it, or just the tacos in the bar for half price during happy hour. Calamari, awesome, especially with the spicy jalapeño lime sauce. Sunday brunch, excellent, mimosas, great. Modern decor, nice patio out back. Introduced a lot of people, they all loved it too. Never had a bad time."

"Sushi Kame's downtown Champaign spot's surrounded by pricier joints like Jim Gould, Escobar, and Kofusion. But don't let that fool you - their menu's got reasonable prices. Food's simple, no gimmicks like those trendy spots in town. Polite folks too. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Udon soup's a good choice, comes with tempura shrimp for a couple bucks. Bento box has a bit of everything - meat, California tempura roll, salad, rice. And damn, their sushi's top-notch. They never run out of fish."

"Wife and I hit the spot last night, anniversary celebration. Service top-notch, friendly and attentive without being pushy or snooty. Food? Delish. Starters, mains, desserts, all good. Maybe a pinch too much salt here and there, but overall, fresh, tasty, and visually pleasing. Decor? Tasteful, understated. View? Stellar. Not a bad table in the joint, upstairs or down. Pricing? Fair, considering the quality. Definitely going back."

"In Arizona, there be a place called Paradise,
Where Hawaiian BBQ doth reign supreme, by grace.
A taste so true, it doth evoke memories,
Of local Korean BBQ spots in Hawaii's breeze.

Their meats, so juicy and flavorful, doth impress,
And leave thee wanting more, with each success.
But alas, dear friends, a request I make,
For cucumber Kimchi, on a more regular basis, take.

I tell the owners this, with hopeful heart,
For it would make their dishes, a work of art.
Paradise, a name that suits them well,
For in their food, a piece of heaven doth dwell.

And though they lack a spot in Chandler's land,
Their Meat Jun, a staple of Hawaiian Korean hand,
Doth make up for it, with its savory delight,
A taste that doth transport thee, to the islands bright."
"Went out with some pals. Server had a snotty attitude, messed up our orders, didn't give a damn. Sent an email to the bosses, they actually gave a crap. Good grub, worth another visit."

"Spent a night here and loved every minute of it. Room was clean, view was great, and the bed was heavenly. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Had a blast at C4, drinks were strong and reasonably priced. Ordered room service, it took a bit longer than expected, but they apologized and gave it to us free. Sandwich was delicious. Will definitely stay here again next time we're in Phoenix."
"Met friends at cozy joint for birthday sweets. Attentive service, quaint vibes. Sampled Strawberry Kiss, Chocolate Brownie, profiteroles. Damn tasty."

"Airport grub, typically a disappointment. Not here. Cold beer, decent salad, hot pizza. Service? Top-notch. Seat yourself, but they hustle food out quick, with a smile. I'm a Ceasar snob, but this place won me over. Fresh lettuce, good dressing, plenty of Parmesan, croutons made fresh. Entree-sized salad for six bucks? Impressive. Thin-crust pizza, eight bucks, fresh basil. I'd fly my family out just to eat here."

"Finished up our latest Vegas escapade with a bite at Bouchon. No line on a Monday arvo. Our server, Riley, was top-notch - funny, honest, and accommodating. We asked for a table switch and some menu tweaks, and he handled it all with a smile. The grub was drool-worthy, and my corned beef hash with spud croquettes and a bloody mary hit the spot. The portions were generous, making it a nice breakfast for the next day's journey. Dining in scored us a 15% discount at the strip bakeries."
"Cozy joint. Good grub, unique drinks. Classy bar, comfy couches. Recently spruced up. Saw a flick there this week. Holidays, y'know? More movies, more reasons to return."
"Solid diner in Henderson, Nevada. Big breakfast plates, quick service. Eggs done right, crispy potatoes, killer pumpkin bread. We'll be back. Bring your own Stevia if you're a health nut."
"New Living Pools, run with integrity and efficiency. Chris, a top-notch pro, knows his stuff when it comes to pools. Highly recommend 'em, won't regret it."

"Went to this joint with a buddy. Had the spaghetti, it was top-notch. Service was A-1 too. Prices were fair, not too steep. Can's say enough good things 'bout this place. Be back for sure, and you should give it a shot too. Went around 5:30, nice and quiet."
"IMAX theaters abound. Popcorn, top-notch. Latest flicks, always showing. Strip's madness, slightly removed."

"Sephora's new digs in Downtown Summerlin get my blood pumpin'. VIB Rouge event in November, I felt like royalty. Staff treated me like I was the only one in the joint, hooked me up with some top-notch swag. They were slammed, but still gave me the royal treatment. Shout out to Wendy, Destiny, Moriah, Carol, Toni - they're always lookin' out for me, hookin' me up with samples and dishin' out skincare advice like pros. Big ups to the whole crew for makin' me feel like a king. Check out The PodBrother Show: http://youtu.be/S0Lusii7Tl0"

"Verily, I say unto thee, this show didst captivate my attention from start to finish. 'Twas a wondrous spectacle, full of delightful interpretations, symbols, movements, music, costumes, and comedic relief. Zumanity, the production's name, didst showcase the many facets and angles of that most basic of human desires, sex. I do confess, I am eager to attend once more, and next time, I shall sit in the front row, nay, a booth, that I may fully immerse myself in this theatrical experience."

"Ventanto's got a killer view and top-notch service. Food's always fresh and the portions are generous. Never leave without a doggie bag. 

Shrimp on a Stone and the greens salad are solid starters. Can't choose between the Lasagna, chicken Piccata, and Ventano Spendini for entree. 

Don't forget dessert - their cannoli's a winner. Been there plenty of times, never had a bad meal. Last time we went, it was business as usual...and we'll be back."

"Joe hung our new 65" TV like a pro. He knew his stuff, but still listened to my worries about the height. He even saved us some cash by suggesting a better wall mount. The TV looks great on the wall, no wires in sight. People keep telling us how nice it looks. And get this - Joe took care of that clunky old 32" TV too. Top-notch work. We're big fans."
"Went to the one in D.C. Liked it. Been to others too. Go, won't regret it."
"Good joint to work at. Solid vibe and people. Old Town's rockstars. Talk to Albie, mention Yelp. Twenty percent off, whether you're a regular or not."
"Galileo's, it's a real treat. Food's top-notch, service is impeccable. Owners, they're swell, make you feel like family."

"Week?  'Bout that long to hit all the stores in this joint.  Went on a Fri night, place was jumpin'.  Got every damn store imaginable, 'n some you ain't.  Load up quick, feet hurt like hell by the time I made it from Nordy's to Dillard's.  Gave up, headed back to the hotel."

"Halo's got pros. Had a bad piercing experience in Cali, needed two surgeries. Thought my ears were done for. Went to Halo, talked to Jeremiah. He put my mind at ease, said they could pierce 'em when the scars healed. Went in last week, quick and precise. Lookin' good, feelin' good. No more hidin' my ears. Also had a dermal removed, solid work. Great spot for jewelry too. Thanks, I'll be back."

"Shake Shack's open for business! Nice joint, good eatin'. Park at NYNY, easier that way. Best burger this side of the Mississippi, Shake Stack's the ticket. Cheese oozes out, it's a real treat. Staff's on point too, keep it up!"

"Sababa's got the best hummus and falafel in town. No contest. Had 'em all over the place, but this joint's the real deal. Only other thing I've tried is the beef kabobs. Pricey, but damn good. Worth every penny. \n\nOnly gripe is the ordering system. Counter gets chaotic, especially when it's busy. Then you gotta find a table and pay at the register. Kinda clunky, but not enough to knock off a star. Been going there four years straight. Five stars, easy."

"Queen Nails, 7/25/2013. 1819 Matthews Township Pkwy Ste 300, Matthews, NC 28105. Been going here for over a decade. Clean, sanitary, and detailed. Friendly too. Get my pedicure, gel nails, and custom artwork done here. Taylor, Rachel, Kathy, Annie, and Lana are great. Annie does top-notch brow shaping for a steal at $8."
"Burrata cheese, killer. Pizza, amazing. Patio seating, nice. Parking, easy."
"Picked us up, friendly instructors, learned tricks, changed speeds, rode varied terrain. Amazing! Better than expected. Definitely coming back."
"Amazing joint. Top-notch grub. Lobster quesadilla, a game-changer. Flank steak torta, damn fine. Can't wait to come back for more."

"Vegas, baby! Surprised the boyfriend for his 30th with a crew of our closest pals. Las Vegas Custom Cakes delivered. Their staff walked me through every step, calming my nerves like a pro. The cake? Stunning. Just how I imagined. And let me tell you, it tasted damn good too. Give 'em a shot, folks."
"Clean rooms, updated tunes, and a good time with pals. Karaoke joint's got it all. Snacks and drinks? A bit pricey, but hey, free Chex Mix and big-ass platters make up for it."

"Took my '04 Ranger to this joint after scopin' out some Yelp reviews. Five stars, no lie. Got an oil change, tire rotation, and they checked out my spark plugs, all for $27. Didn't have the scratch to replace 'em, but they snapped some pics and showed me why I needed to. Family-owned spot, mom runs the show up front, dad and son workin' magic in the back. Be back for sure."
"Got my locks fixed, right on schedule and for a fair price. Tech didn't push any extra services on me. All good."
"Five-star grub, top-notch service. Calamari and house bread, a tasty start. Seafood risotto and Chilean sea bass, damn good. Lookin' forward to more."

"Tuesday night, SOHO stunned me. Quality ingredients, top-notch service, good company. Why don't I come here more often? Been here multiple times, always amazing. 

Tonight, we went for the Omakase, chef's choice in Japanese, at a steal. Less than half what I paid at another joint recently. Freshest prix fixe menu, food came in courses. Cold apps, hot ones, grilled, rolls, frozen dessert...the works. One friend had a garlic allergy, chef accommodated her well. 

Try SOHO happy hour, 4-6 PM daily, and you'll be hooked. Then, come back for dinner or a special occasion."
"Never had anything like it. Impressed with the twist on shaved ice. Variety abounds. Swanky joint. Date night perfection. We'll return."
"Best spot for maxi dresses. Pricier, sure, but quality and fit, top-notch. Worth the investment. I grab one each summer, and they're always my go-to. Compliments galore. Unique, just like me."

"C7, where everyone's welcome. Break free from the mundane and join the unique crowd. Fridays, 10:30 PM, drag shows hosted by the graceful Daveena Ross. Support their education or makeup fund with a buck. Clones need not apply. Humans, come one, come all."

"Came here for the Coca-Cola Sampler, tried 'em all. Some were damn good, others not so much. Wished they sold 'em in bottles, would've made for a nice souvenir or a drink on the go. Next time I'm in Vegas, gonna try their Float Variety Platter. Always stick to bottled Coke when I'm in town."
"Burgers. San Diego. Beach House. Phoenix."

"Coffee, my dear friend. Can't get enough of that sweet nectar. Daily dose, you say? Well, who am I to judge? Atmosphere, you ask? It's like a warm hug on a cold day. And Amber, oh boy, she's a real gem. Makes a mean cup of joe, that one. You'll be back, I reckon. Hell, I'll join you."

"A helluva show, folks! Those Jabbawockeez kids know how to put on a damn good performance. They got the crowd involved from the get-go, makin' 'em feel like they're part of the act. They're all over the place, dancin' and carryin' on like a bunch of wild animals. The music and lights are top-notch, like watchin' a two-hour episode of America's Best Dance Crew with nonstop action. These kids got some serious skills, man. They're gonna leave you grinnin' ear to ear. Guaranteed."
"This joint's the real deal. Been here ten times with my girl, always ask for Carl. He's a pro, never lets us down. Food's on point, service is A-one. My go-to steakhouse in Vegas."
"Love that Thanksgiving sandwich. Obsessed, actually. Wish we had 'em in SCV. Don't matter if I'm full or there's one close by. Gonna grab one and bring it home anyways."

"Found 'em on Yelp. Good reviews. Happy I looked 'em up. Great outfit. Price, service, job - all top-notch. Carpet looked fantastic. Charles, the cleaner, real personable. Did a swell job. Highly recommend J2."
"Green tea, best. Tuna, garlicked and raw. Yellowtail, ponzu-drenched and peppered. Salmon, wild. Spicy tuna rolls, top-notch. Asakusa roll, a joke. Dessert, sublime."

"Rodeo Finals brought me to Vegas. Cowboys everywhere. Real ones, not just wannabes. Tight jeans, plaid shirts, big buckles, boots, and hats. Block parties with Crown Royal, country music, and a mechanical bull. Vegas strip transformed for the rodeo. Fascinating. Growing up in SoCal, I hadn't seen many real cowboys. This was a treat. Now I can cross meeting real cowboys off my list. Thanks, Rodeo Finals. Yippee ki yay."

"Molly Malone's, great place. Hubby and I, few dinners there. Last time, tried beer. Waitress, top-notch, brought a sample. Glad she did, didn't like it. Food, outstanding. Pretzel bread, best ever. Sell my left arm for it. Pricey, yes, but worth it. Service and grub, five stars. Relaxed, not like other Irish joints."

"First time we stayed here, it just opened in '08. Everything was fresh. Had this place bookmarked for years, finally getting around to the review. Service top-notch, rooms outta sight! Tram takes you to the action on the Strip. Been hitting Vegas annually since '06, this joint's one of the best. Older hotels give you that classic Vegas feel, but this place? Spotless."

"Love this joint. Huge menu, usually a turnoff, but everything looked too damn good. Staff's friendly, attentive. Server Jocelyn, great. Food came quick, yummy. Had the almond crusted French toast. Oh man, so good. Be back plenty more times."

"Thanks, Toy Box. Took my ride in, needed a second opinion on some work. Another mechanic wanted $800 for strut replacement. Turns out, nothing wrong with 'em. Saved me $800. Honest bunch, those Toy Box folks. They've earned a customer for life. Cheers, Phill and crew. You're the real deal."
"Bertha's Cafe, new spot, 32nd and Indian School. Been jonesin' for their grub, glad they're back in business."

"Marcel doth keep my pool in fair fettle,
For many a year hath he tended it with care,
And when the green hue of oleander and jacaranda doth threaten to spoil,
He doth arrive with haste to banish the discolor.
A new pump and filter doth he install,
And procureth for me a goodly deal on vacuums,
Besides, his conversation doth please mine ear,
So here's a hearty recommendation, without a fear."

"Vegas-bound, I read up on the eats. Denny's, a no-go, according to the reviews. But, I relented, and we gave it a shot. Best damn breakfast we had in Vegas, and cheap too. If you're in a hurry, keep movin', they're slammed. But, if you're lookin' to chill, it's perfect. We hit it up three out of four days, never payin' more than seventeen bucks. One mornin', they took so long to bring my boyfriend's grub, they gave it to us for free and threw in a coupon for next time. We'll be back."

"Sunflower Market, a breath of fresh air amidst the sea of Fry's supermarkets. Cheap eats, hippie style, and just a stone's throw from ASU. Trader Joe's may be a haul, but Sunflower's got you covered. Weekend BBQs? You bet. Snagged two burgers for a couple of bucks yesterday. Not bad, not bad at all."

"Sonora's got nothin' special goin' on. But that's what makes it great. You know what you're gettin' - a solid meal, no frills. Beer's cold, wings are hot, salads are fresh. They cook it right, every time. Love their local brews too. It ain't no fancy place, but it's where I wanna be."

"Otto's Pizza in Tempe, Arizona is my go-to spot for a perfect pie. Their pizza is top-notch, and their other dishes are just as tasty. The prices are fair, and the atmosphere is cozy with a small, intimate setting. The staff is friendly, and the patio seating is great for enjoying a meal outside. I'd give them an extra star for the beautiful women who work there. If I could, I'd sign a contract to only eat their pizza. Too bad they're closed on Sundays."

"The Red Rock's got a secret weapon - Jean Marc, the man behind the scissors at their spa. Moved to Vegas, needed a haircut, found the guy. One look, and he knew what I needed. Cut my hair, made me look five years younger. Next time, color - balayage, natural, rich. Hooked, told all my pals. If you're in Vegas, see Jean Marc. He don't just cut hair, he makes it perfect."

"Wash-dry-fold. Pick-up and delivery. Dress shirts. Dry cleaning. They do it all, for a fair price. 

Take credit cards, too. Easy to reach, if plans change. 

Can't say enough good things. Been to the laundromat, but haven't used it. Clean, pleasant, and hip, in a Pittsburgh kind of way."

"Good service. Polite staff. Saw Dr. Hill. Kind, funny guy. Recommend."

This rewritten text has a more concise and direct style, similar to how Ernest Hemingway would write. It uses shorter sentences and avoids unnecessary words, while still conveying the same message as the original text.

"Cool joint, great event. Thanks, Lindsey and YELP. 

Started with a flick—name kept hush till it began, Raising Arizona. Ate a killer brat from The Short Leash Dog Food Truck, courtesy of YELP. Goodie bag full of rad stuff too. 

Sweet theatre: comfy seats, solid projection and sound. Top-notch YELPERS. 

One helluva night."

"Mary Ann Martin's set up shop at Luxe Salon Studios. She's got three decades of Vidal Sassoon training under her belt and offers top-notch hair styling services at a fair price. Gents, if you're looking to ditch the clippers and get a real haircut, Mary Ann's your gal. My missus swears by her, and I reckon you will too."

"Best buffet my husband and I have ever had. Every dish was delicious. Got a two-for-one deal through their Identity membership program, so it was affordable. Loved the fig and bacon salad, and the dessert bar was top-notch. Went for brunch and had a wide variety of high-end breakfast and lunch dishes. Definitely worth checking out while you're in Vegas." (497 tokens)

"Fili-B's serves up authentic Mexican grub, no frills or fuss. First-timers may feel uneasy, but trust me, it's worth the risk. Some folks can't stomach it, but I'll take that chance any day. My go-to order? A monster carne asada burrito and a large horchata. Not for the faint of heart, but a gem for those who dare. And at a great price, perfect for broke college kids. Give it a shot."
"Freshest grub in town. Pre-made, but not frozen crap. My roomie turned me onto 'em. Organic stuff too. Not always on sale, but they got coupons for $3-$6 off. Friendly staff too."

"No way, hell no! Red Velvet Pancake? Nuh-uh."

I looked at the menu and saw that damn thing. I just had to let out a loud shout and make a scene. The owner was there with her family, too. What an ass I must've looked like.

But then I calmed down and ordered the full stack. Six red slices with chocolate chips, whipped cream, and cream cheese syrup. Damn, it was worth it. One hour outside of Vegas, but worth it. Never had a pancake that good. The whipped cream, man...and that cream cheese syrup. Unique, and it added something special.

Only open for breakfast and lunch, and it's west of the medical facility. But hell yeah, I'd go again. Try the other flavors, maybe some Filipino or American food. Yeah, definitely worth it.

"Good grub and service. Friendly folk, too. Definitely coming back. Food's tasty, service top-notch. Wi-Fi's free, perfect for business lunch. Got some work done, enjoyed a killer brownie. Bringing pals next time."

"Friday night, I stopped by AMC AZ Ctr. for dinner before catching a flick. They recognized me, asked about my bacon tat, and remembered I wanted to try the lamb. It was a phenomenal experience. The lamb was rubbed with Dijon mustard, topped with fresh herbs, and baked rare. The manchego and chorizo risotto complemented it perfectly. The cheddar basil waffle was a surprise - a Belgian waffle instead of what I imagined. But it all worked well. \n\nIt was a splurge, sure. But for $27, I got a generous rack of lamb and a hearty portion of risotto. I had leftovers for days, feeling satisfied and content. Centurion is a great restaurant."

"New fave restaurant. Simple setting, busy atmosphere. Perfect for dates or special occasions. Wife had the 4-course tasting menu ($50) with wine pairings ($20 each). I had the filet ($30) and nibbled off her plate. Risotto was the star - best I've ever had. Excellent service, despite 35-minute wait. Manager showed up with complimentary drinks. $110 tab, worth every penny."

"Late workday, needed food fast. Found Yovi's on the Pittsburgh site. Thought it'd be worth a shot. Damn good choice. Had the Chicago dog combo with fries and a Coke. Fresh toppings, great buns. Dogs were top-notch. But the fries, man...the fries. Never expected a hot dog joint to have 'em so good. They got that Potato Patch taste, ya know? Best fries downtown, no question."

"Subs, real good. Corned beef, pastrami, ham, all quality meat. Staff, friendly, helpful. Price, right. Place, clean. Hot sauces, plenty, rated 1-10. Tried the '100% Pain,' name fit. Back again, sure thing."
"Cool joint, great grub. Staff's on point, knowledgeable and friendly. Food's top-notch, big portions, fair prices. Definitely going back. Chef Tony's a kitchen wizard."

"I rang Chris, a man of reputation, to mend the mess left by my pup on my rugs. His work, like his word, was top-notch. He arrived promptly, did a bang-up job, and charged a fair price. I'd hire him again in a heartbeat."

"Methinks I do enjoy this place with great delight,
In manner of Adam Carolla's pizza-eating plight.
That is, when pizza doth beckon, I do crave
To feast upon it heartily, without reserve or cave.

Thick crust, I say, doth weigh me down and fill
My belly prematurely, leaving me no will.
But fear not, fair Verrazano doth provide
A thin crust, doughy and light, a wondrous guide.

Pepperoni, my dearest topping, doth please
My taste buds, and other choices they do tease.
Alas, the sausage, once I didst try,
Didst leave me feeling underwhelmed, I do confess.

The sauce, a sweet and tangy delight,
Doth complement the cheese, a bountiful sight.
Specials, they do offer, varied and grand,
And the men who work there, friendly and bland.

A toddler, mine own, doth take great joy
In watching them prepare the pies, a boy.
So, if thou dost desire a taste of New York,
Give Verrazano a chance, 'twill not disappoint, I do aver."
"Chris mixed up one hell of a mule, best I've ever had. They don't have much in the way of supplies, but what they do have, they use to full effect."
"Good place to start the day. Orange juice, freshly squeezed. Recommended, but be prepared to wait. They're always busy."
"Late night, great night. Dive bar, best kind. Molly, awesome. Bras on bar, beautiful bartender. Unwind, needed."

"Colectivo, a coffee shop that's a must-visit for me. I'm not a morning person, but for this place, I'll rise early. Two days in a row, I woke at 5 AM to grab a single or double espresso as soon as they open. The atmosphere's perfect - just the right amount of seats, great ambiance. 

The internet's top-notch, better than most coffee shops in town. No limits for two hours, YouTube loads quickly. Great for working in the morning.
